Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, fun pool, great food.”
Reviews.Author: Sharimck
Reviews.Content: We would stay here again whenever we return to Florida. The staff were excellent, consistently -great service at the Harvest Bistro restaurant, the front desk clerk was very helpful in splitting up our bill, and our room was upgraded at check-in to a view of the pool. The security team responded immediately when our room safe malfunctioned and promptly fixed it, courteously giving us a few breakfast comps for the trouble. A light was repaired when we asked, and all of our transportation needs were taken care of by the valet staff. The rooms were nice and very clean, nothing spectacular in the decorating but very comfortable and well sized for 4 people staying in two queen beds. Food was very good quality in the Harvest Bistro, both for breakfast buffet (fresh fruit and lots of healthy options, although my daughter chose to put sprinkles and marshmallows on top of her watermelon) and delicious dinners (try the mushroom pasta!). The coffee shop was prompt and had some to-go options for breakfast. The pool was excellent, especially movie night! And we loved looking at the messages the pool staff spelled out with the green towels on the pool deck each morning. Location was excellent and a quick shuttle or cab to the Disney parks. An excellent vacation and one of the best Hilton's I have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, clean and nice”
Reviews.Author: joekop74
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in Mid-March for a little golf. Got in close to mid and the check-in was a breeze. The young woman who checked me in was very efficient and easy to get along with. Has a very nice bar area and outdoor sitting area overlooking the pool and adjacent golf course. The Key West Sunset Ale was very good. The pool is very child friendly, little depth and zero entry at some points, the lazy river is also relaxing, just float around it with ease. You can also use the Waldorf’s amenities, and I ate lunch from their pool bar and used there pool; quieter with less kids around, and these pools had some depth too them. Only down side is the parking costs, but I knew that before I went and it would not impact my thinking of booking a stay there, especially since most big city hotels charge more than the $13/night to park. This was my third visit here and I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice grounds but TERRIBLE service”
Reviews.Author: hydster007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here using our Hilton Honors points. The valet area upon check in was a little crazy. The black Lincoln Town Cars race through the front parking lot so keep the little ones close by. Self parking is a multi level parking garage adjacent to the lobby but a bit of a walk. The pool area was nice but I did not see any life guards on duty in the morning or later in the day. The lazy river is nice. You have to rent tubes if you want them. The slide is only open during certain hours- we were there during spring break & they were open from 10-6. Other hotels offer much better slide hours. There is a height requirement and some kids may also need to wear a life jacket. The pool spills into a 3ft pool. I don't think the Hilton Staff monitors the slide sufficiently and 1 of the staff members was extremely rude to my 6 year old special needs son! First thing in the morning, there were 2 staff members monitoring the slide- 1 at the top telling the kids to go & 1 at the bottom checking height, giving life jackets, and monitoring the 3ft pool area. Around 11am, there was only 1 staff member working the entire slide area- life jackets, monitor pool area, and giving the kids at the top a of the slide a thumbs up when it was their turn to slide (the staff member was located at the very bottom of the slide). 1 staff member did not seem very safe to me. The biggest reason for my poor rating is because of the rude staff member we encountered in the slide area. When my autistic son, was getting out of the pool, me leaned down, grabbed him by his life vest, and got in his face to tell him not to turn around on the slide. My son had only done this once and did not even completely turn around. I was at the top of the slide as he needed assistance waiting in line & being told to go so as soon as I saw this, I immediately went down the stair to talk to this Hilton Staff Member. I explained to him that he was autistic & I would instruct him to slide properly. The staff member continued to be rude and said if he can't slide property then he would not be able to slide. My son enjoys water parks & other hotels with water slides & we have never had this issue. I thought this staff member was unprofessional. We also had a n issue with noise in our during bedtime. The on-site breakfast buffet was OK- nothing special. The service at the restaurant was not that great either.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice, almost on the boring side”
Reviews.Author: mercedes88
Reviews.Content: The Hilton has a great pool area with a lazy river that adults and children can both enjoy. Rooms are nice and clean, nothing spectacular. The grounds are pretty and it's a great spot if you have a large conference or wedding.

Reviews.Title: “A gem hotel that isn't totally "Disney-fied"”
Reviews.Author: Rivers2inFL
Reviews.Content: 1st class hotel in Orlando that focuses on a pleasant stay. This hotel is great for families because of its unique large pool with lazy river. The poolside grill has fantastic food and is bathing suit friendly but feels upscale. We found the lack of Disney "everything" refreshing and made for a very relaxed atmosphere. The hotel next door is the Waldorf- Astoria. It is a beautiful European style hotel that is rare in Orlando. I would recommend the W-A for a couples getaway and the Bonnet Creek for family time.

Reviews.Title: “MAJOR improvement in service, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: castmember
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd visit to this hotel and last time I thought the service was lacking .... not true anymore. Beautiful hotel, GREAT pool area and fantastic service. We stayed for 8 days with our 6 & 7 year olds and had an awesome time. Our room was on the 12th floor, "Disney view". It was fun to be able to look out at the Disney area and catch fireworks now and again. My kids loved running to the window every morning to see the message on the pool chairs (written in rolled up towels - fun). They had a family-friendly DJ at the pool who ran games and played some fun music which was great. The poolside movies (on a giant inflatable screen) were a huge hit with the kids. The fire pits were also fun/relaxing to sit by at night (where are the s'mores Hilton???). The room was large enough for the 4 of us and had a good sized refrigerator. Handy because we stopped at the store for some kid drinks, snacks and wine/beer. The only downside to the room is the lack of a balcony (there aren't any at the hotel). This will actually prevent us from staying here again. It's nice to have a balcony to sit on and read / have a glass of wine when the kids go to bed. We had quite a few meals at the hotel and the food was actually very good. La Luce is one of the best restaurants we've been to anywhere (do not miss the fried olives!). Don't underestimate the Harvest Bistro. It's the main breakfast restaurant (really good breakfast), but their dinners were very, very good. We didn't expect that and were pleasantly surprised. We had the grouper, veal shank, burger and a pasta dish which were all excellent. The pool menu is typical and fine. I was disappointed that they only offered a limited menu by the pool over the weekend. The server told me it was because it was "so busy" (it wasn't) that they limit the options. The only item they were offering for kids was chicken tenders .... strange. I have to make mention of the breakfast servers who were all awesome. They were upbeat, friendly and on the ball. They greeted my kids every morning like long lost relatives. It was my twins' birthday one morning and our server brought them a little toy from the gift shop. They were THRILLED and talked about that all day. The Disney shuttle service is lacking, take your own car if you have one. Too many stops, too much time between return shuttles later in the day. Just an all around pain, we ended up taking a cab back from the Magic Kingdom. Speaking of the car .... $13 a day to park???? C'mon Hilton! Ridiculous. All in all it's a great hotel and a nice respite from the Disney hub-bub.

Reviews.Title: “First class”
Reviews.Author: Wvuman
Reviews.Content: Outstanding Hilton property with something for everyone in the family. Lazy river around the pool was so relaxing and worth the stay

Reviews.Title: “Your not in HOT WATER here!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTrioOregon
Reviews.Content: Checked in to get some much needed R&R away from family after a business trip. I wasn't told when I booked explaining the reason for my respite that THIS was the hotel the NBA players and execs were staying in for the All Star Game. Not following sports, I wasn't aware and it was hard to find a QUIET place in the hotel or places that the media didn't have staked out or interview areas set up. Also the water was lukewarm for bathing at best, when I called to inquire about the lack of hot water, I was told the room I was in wasn't supposed to be used due to this issue, so I had to move rooms. The next room had a better view BUT the water wasn't much better. I resigned myself to not having those long soaking baths I wanted. The grounds were beautiful and the hotel and staff itself were very pleasant. Once all the stars left it was nice to just amble around. The cafe in the bottom had VERY SLOW service and then the sandwich I ordered was NOT supposed to be hot but the cook toasted it and when I asked the server she said "They toast them" but didn't offer to get me another when I pointed out the sandwish wasn't traditionally heated nor did the menu state it was, she just shrugged and walked away not coming back until presenting the bill. I left the sandwich uneaten behind. The only redeeming rating was the SUPER CLEAN hotel and very nice front desk staff. I also wasn't interested in Disney so the location was akward for me however it would fantastic for a family visisting any of the Disney attractions

Reviews.Title: “Business as usual, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: pmcolorado
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel for a conference, so let me say upfront that I did not get the opportunity to enjoy some of the hotel amenities or area attractions. The rooms are fine, typical for any Hilton, Hyatt or Marriott. Nothing special, not particularly spacious, but nicely appointed and comfortable. The bathroom could have been bigger.there were 2 of us in the 2Q room and I cannot imagine sharing that bathroom with a group or family of 3-4, yikes! The pool area looked nice, although I only sat outside briefly to eat by the pool twice. The lunch at Harvest Bistro was shockingly mediocre. My fish sandwich was dry and tasteless, as was the chicken sandwich I had the next day at Beech by the pool. Service was decent though. The meal we had at the big gala event at our convention was quite good however. Drinks at the bar are horribly expensive, like NYC prices! They don't sell any bottled iced tea at either of the convenience type places in the hotel, so i got one at the bar. An 8oz glass overflowing with ice and a few drops of iced tea was $4.85, before tip. Ridiculous! Our conference room rate was very reasonable but i have a feeling the regular rates are not quite so. Price for WiFi is also ridiculous and it was unreliable in the common areas. The maids and staff were certainly friendly and helpful. Overall nice stay, especially for a quick convention, but would not make it my destination for a Disney vacay or leisure trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, with long walks to some rooms”
Reviews.Author: Al-Sue-Maine
Reviews.Content: We stayed for just one night last week. We liked the hotel very much; nice people, great pool and other facilities. The only bad things were how far it was to walk to the room (and he asked us if we wanted to be close to or far from the elevator, so I can't really blame the hotel, I just didn't realize how far it would be), and the room key demagnatized very, very easily (don't put it close to your cell phone). Service in the Harvest Bistro was quite slow, but the staff was very nice and accomodating. The location was great, and the price wasn't unreasonable.

Reviews.Title: “In some ways, better than Disney deluxe properties!”
Reviews.Author: Disneynut1959
Reviews.Content: I am a DVC (Disney Vacation Club) member and yet I stayed at the HBC for 5 days recently for a convention. The hotel is indeed immaculate with an excellent pool and restaurants. In between meetings I would take a break at the pool or on a sunny bench - it was very relaxing. The location is so very quiet and peaceful. I have only one major complaint - the shuttles to the Disney parks ran so infrequently that I would not stay here again without a car. Also, parents of young children need to know that the pool has no lifeguards on duty. At any time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: taylorshepard
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice and quite close to all of the Disney attractions without all of the traffic of the actual Disney resorts. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. Food was very good. Could improve by adding running trails, but otherwise quite a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “OK , but not the Best!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rjo72223
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a Convention... It was a beautiful Hotel with many amenities and a very friendly staff... On the downside, they charged for parking and WiFi, the room was noisy at night, and the electronic keys malfunctioned, and the bathroom was small for the "large" shower...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hilton Resort”
Reviews.Author: bfchef
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference and really wished I would have brought my family. Very nice rooms, good dining, excellent very large pool, wonderful golf course and right on the Disney property. I'll try to come back with my family soon!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jcrew06
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at this hotel March 21 - March 23. The rooms were large and very clean. The rooms we stayed in had low voc paint and other special features for people with allergies. The pool area was beautiful and had a lazy river for the kids! We tried two of the restaurants on property and found both to be delicious, but expensive (pool side and the indoor sushi restaurant). We had two rooms and got 50% off the second room per night.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BallFamily_19461948
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at this hotel last June and couldn't wait to return which we did for 10 days in early March. On arrival, the front of house staff were very helpful, friendly and welcoming.. Our room had been upgraded to a Parlour suite which was fantastic - we had a view of the pool, golf course, Epcot, Everest, Hollywood Studios, it was great. The cleanliness and upkeep of the room was first class. We had breakfast every morning in the Harvest Bistro - highly recommended for its vast selection of excellent food. We were welcomed every morning by the lovely Chantelle and her colleagues (who are so friendly and made us feel very special) and Luis, the manager of the Harvest Bistro who always ensured he came to speak whenever he saw us. We had met the wonderful John-Paul on our first visit last June - he was our server and gave us first class service at breakfast - and we were lucky enough to have JP as our server on most mornings this visit. Rest assured that all the staff at the Harvest Bistro are led by example by Luis and they are all very friendly and helpful, ensuring your every need is taken care of. We visited the Concierge desk on a couple of occasions - again, the staff were excellent - particularly Vicky and Nicole. They both ensured our requests for assistance had been met by 'phoning our room to speak to us personally. All the staff, without exception, gave us excellent service, made us feel so special and went that extra mile to ensure that we enjoyed every minute of our stay. This hotel is in a wonderful location, has beautiful surroundings and facilities that are equal, if not better, than some of the more expensive Disney hotels. They surely have the best staff working there too! We have been visiting Orlando at least once a year since 1989, tried many hotels including the better Disney properties, but none can compare to the Hilton, Bonnet Creek. We can't wait to return - next visit already booked!

Reviews.Title: “Special thanks to the concierge”
Reviews.Author: Batty76
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 week family holiday at the hotel in Jan 2012 It met all expectations but I really wanted everyone to know how good the concierge team was: My daughter had her 3rd birthday while we at the hotel and we had booked a birthday meal for her and my family (11 of us) at Epcot but due to a mix up by disney (and a small mistake on my part) we were left birtday cake less! I approached the concierge team for help, they decided that would help us out by going to a local supermarket order a cake and put a special message on it for our daughter, they then arranged with disney to get the cake to the restaurant so that it would be ready for us. This is no mean feat and was done in less than 24 hours! If that was not good enough we then lost the same daughters soft toy (Goofy) which she has had since she was born and is a much a part of the family as a slightly smelly soft toy can be. She goes to sleep every night stroking Goofy's ear against her nose! We knew that we had lost him at Animal kingdom, again I asked the concierge for help believing all was lost. Amazingly they found him, they had contacted all the bus companies and had managed to find him! I cannot tell you how impressed I was with all the concierge staff I had contact with, they went above and beyond what i would expect from their department and have never experienced service like it. They also helped us out with all our other tourist requests booking cirque de soleil tickets etc. If you and your team get to see this Thankyou very much to Adam and the concierge team you help advert a couple of potential disasters. Iris says Hello!

Reviews.Title: “Easy to find if you know the way...and well worth searching for if you don't!”
Reviews.Author: Llennyfar
Reviews.Content: Easy to find if you know the way...and well worth searching for if you don't! Directions on hotel website are tricky. Try this instead: head for Walt Disney world. Then once through main gate, follow signs for Epcot resorts, then take the bonnet creek resort turn near the "Goofy Bus" Disney vacation club sign. Disney view accommodation means you see tower of terror, Everest and Epcot golfball. Really top class hotel, everything you'd expect from a Hilton. It does cost, and not much in the way of freebies for diamond members other than free breakfast. But a very clear front runner in our choices for future stays.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, clean rooms, incredible pool and location!”
Reviews.Author: blsoldfast
Reviews.Content: I have always been very happy with all hilton family hotels. The pool is awesome, the staff is very helpful and friendly. Great location! I only wish it qualified for extra magic hours like the LBV Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Manuhiri_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks whilst visiting the Orlando theme parks and attractions, we travel frequently worldwide and this is one of best hotels we have stayed in. The rooms are spacious and well equiped, and the whole hotel is immaculate and spotlessly clean. The staff are very friendly and helpful and the breakfast buffet is excellent. The hotel is very convenient for the Disney parks but is in a quiet location. I would definitely recommend the hotel to others and will stay here again whilst in Orlando

Reviews.Title: “Unless your stay is free or paid by your organization”
Reviews.Author: baseball2286
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff members were not helpful while I stayed there from March 18 through 21. The resturant in the lower level provided great services and food, especially for breakfast. You should try their breakfast buffet. Concierge staff members were helpful. If you are a runner, this is a bad news. The area is no good for us. You have to run on the side walk under the heat. By the way, I don't play golf. This resort might be great for people who play golf.

Reviews.Title: “Room was modern & spotless. Service was very good. Lazy river pool was excellent. Very good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Rickey_T
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Orlando Bonnet Creek is on the edge of the Disney World area. It is 21 miles from the city centre, 21 miles from the airport, 14 miles to Universal Studios, 7 miles to the carpark near Disney's Magic Kingdom (can take a shuttle), 5 miles to the Epcot centre and 2 miles to the I-4 on ramp. Service by all staff was very good at all times. The lobby is a busy but pleasant place. The Hotel was pretty busy during our stay but I never had to wait more than 2 minutes to speak with Reception or the Concierge. The hotel has pleasant views of a small lake and golf course in front of the hotel and views of trees into the distance. This is the west-facing view. You also overlook the swimming pool. I believe it is called the Disney view. Our room was a Disney view room with 2 Queen beds on the 12th floor. I could keep an eye on my children while they played in the pool. The pool is a lazy river pool and has a large shallow area with minimal current where you can sit in the pool and watch children's movies which are played every evening. The pool area is excellent. The room was modern and spotless. It was large enough and a comfortable place to be. The hotel has a few restaurants and cafes. Service was usually very good and sometimes outstanding. Coffee in the cafe was surprisingly good. The cheaper of the restaurants offers good food at very good prices. They often had deals going where a family could eat for an excellent price. The hotel is very well located for Disney World and the Epcot centre. Also, there is good shopping not far away. There were a couple different Premium Outlets about 8 miles up the road. If you are going shopping for a week or you want to be close to Universal Studios, other hotels are closer. My family and I had a great time staying at this hotel. My kids will never forget the pool. I wish I had spent more time in it. Our room was $180 per night which I thought was very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectation”
Reviews.Author: Bsareen
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review before, but after staying here felt the need to. This hotel far exceeded my expectation. The rooms looked exactly as the photos on their website (which rarely happen!) the staff were very hospital, the food was great and the pool was so much fun!!! My whole family loved staying here and will come back here next time we come to disneyworld.

Reviews.Title: “great service, great pool & golf - strong value”
Reviews.Author: chris b
Reviews.Content: We recently visited the Hilton BC for the 2nd year in a row and the property did not dissapoint - our rooms were large and clean with a fantastic view of the golf course and pool. The service was outstanding and in particular I would call out the service of Luis Francos and his staff at Harvest (especially Rocky - an amazing and fun waiter). Luis came to our table the first day and then every day thereafter to ensure our food was to our liking and that the service was good - while this is his job he knew our names after one meeting, took an interest in my family when my daughter became ill and simply was one of the best managers I have ever come across. The property is top notch and a great value in terms of price - it is also located about 1.5 miles from downtown disney and 6 miles or so from the Magic Kingdom making it very easy to get around but yet being secluded enough to relax - we will most certainly be back and hope that Luis and his staff will be there the next time we make our way through

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: methebee
Reviews.Content: Fantastic rooms, lovely pool, nice views and parking included which was nice. At at the Italian restaurant which was decent but semi overpriced for what it was. A bit hard to find but can't blame them as Disney does not really exist on GPS annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hilton”
Reviews.Author: dr_scorpio
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property (join location with Waldorf Astoria) during the weekend of the recent NBA All Star game in Orlando. Even without this national event, the hotel is excellent in many respect: location, facilities, service. With the NBA event at hand, the atmosphere was electrifying. Our family, three generation, share adjacent rooms and a great time was had by all. We can't wait to come back and visit the Hilton at Bonnet Creek again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hilton Complex”
Reviews.Author: Ron S
Reviews.Content: After attending a six day conference at the Disney Swan/Dolphin we decided to end our trip with a personal day and night at a proper hotel. We were delighted with what we discovered at the Hilton Bonnet Creek. The pool area is fantastic and a great place to wind down. The service at the hotel was exceptional. Weâ€™ll be back in Orlando for the same conference in 2015 and weâ€™ll be staying here. Iâ€™ve stayed in Hilton hotels around the world and this is indeed in my â€œTop 5â€� list of properties.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Bonnet Creek Orlando FL”
Reviews.Author: ttrippc750
Reviews.Content: The Hilton at Bonnet Creek was outstanding. Staff went the extra mile to make our first trip to Disney World great. Free transportation the any of the parks. It is co-located with Waldorf Astoria. Golf course on property was great, along with the pool, food and rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome property!”
Reviews.Author: IUHoosierFan
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Hilton Bonnet Creek in Orlando and it was among the nicest Hilton properties that I have stayed, such a nice surprise in Orlando! Room was spotless, food was excellent, service was perfect - it really was a great experience. I would recommend without reservation!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Hilton Bonnet Creek...”
Reviews.Author: michiganstategogreen
Reviews.Content: My wife and 2 year old son recently stayed here for 7 days. We enjoyed the amenities this property offered. The location near Disney World was nice, easy to get onto I-4 and avoid the Downtown Disney/Hotel area traffic which was a nightmare. The actual Bonnet Creek location is really off the beaten path, and easy to get in and out of. Parking was easy at the garage, $13 per day, and you use your room key card to get in and out. This is also a large convention area attached, which connects the Hilton and the adjacent Waldorf Astoria. There were numerous conferences going on while we were there, but it didn't feel too crowded or busy. The breakfast buffet was large with many food options and very tasty. If you are a Diamond Hilton Honors member you get the "cold" buffet free, and for $6 you can get eggs/omelets cooked to order and the other standard "hot" buffet items. It was worth the price to upgrade more than once. We also ate at the coffee shop off the lobby - very good (and large) pastries (you can choose this instead of the buffet as a Diamond amenity). The pool areas are superb. The lazy river, waterslide, zero entry, and hot tubs were very good. The entire pool area was not crowed at all during our stay, always plenty of chairs to be had. We also walked across the street to the Wyndham resort to check it out. They had many pools and a nice walking path/boardwalk area around their central lake. I wanted to point out there is a kiddie playground with swings and slides. We did take our son over there more than once and he enjoyed it. This was really the only thing the Hilton didn't have that we would have liked. I am giving 4 out of 5 stars based on not getting an upgrade to a better room based on my Diamond status (they told me none available), having to pay to upgrade the breakfast buffet, and the cable TV had spotty service during our stay - some channels always worked, others had the signal cutting in and out the whole time, and some never worked. I didn't complain because we weren't there to watch TV, but it was annoying when channel flipping at night. Overall - this hotel is a great place to stay if you want to spend some time at any of the Disney parks, but also want to spend days just relaxing at a large resort hotel with a pool and on-site restaurants and bars and away from the hustle and bustle of a Disney owned resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort + fab pool + super shuttle=no complaints”
Reviews.Author: joivie
Reviews.Content: We had a king suite, which was very spacious and well appointed. Everything was fresh and clean, as this is a fairly new hotel. Very cozy beds, great toiletries, plush towels and linens. The toilets have a silent flush. Even the fold out sofa was actually comfortable- it had a memory foam mattress. The disney shuttle is comfortable and has movies for the kids to watch. The pool with the lazy river was a hit with all. La Luce had fantastic food, but the service was not anywhere close to fine dining. We had several issues that were practically humorous (food served and we had no silverware after it was removed with a previous course). Sushi bar had one of the best dragon rolls I've tasted, but the menu was fairly limited otherwise. Harvest BIstro was overpriced for average food.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Family Get -Away”
Reviews.Author: cynthia b
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to take a "staycation" at The Hilton Bonnet Creek. Since we live in the Orlando area we always like to try a new resort. Our room was emaculate as was the whole resort. We spent most of our time out by the pool and drifting along their "lazy river". For dinner we decided to try La Luce, their Italian Restaurant. We hadn't made a reservation, so we had to come back later in the evening to get a table, but the wait was well worth it. Every thing we ordered was absoutely delicious. This resort is top notch!!!

Reviews.Title: “As a tourist hotel, good”
Reviews.Author: PedroSpiller
Reviews.Content: If one is expecting a full service hotel like Hilton Orlando near convention center, this is not for you. Misses the management details frequent travelers like. Do not sense the above and beyond mentality rather a let's make it fully good enough. And indeed it is, no real complaint there. Carpet in our room was wet, we hope from shampooing, anyhow no smell. Besides that room very nice, clean. Good view. Get a room on a high floor. Two very small bottles of water are all that is provided free for entire stay, even though a Hilton Diamond member. Larger size bottles (2) cost $10' so no thanks. Included breakfast is not full, one has to pay extra for that. Self parking (valet parking disclaims responsibility for things left in car) is about as inconveniemt as one can imagine. BUT the pool is amazing, and hotel is located very convenient to Disney parks. Setting is lush and manicured. Think good for family with children. There are better choices for people on business and couples looking for a bit of upscale luxury.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hiltons ever !!!”
Reviews.Author: glenshaw
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels we have ever stayed at. The entire staff was extremely kind and accomodating, from bell person to management whom was walking around asking if they can help in any way. We stayed during the NBA all star game weekend (which we were not aware of this event going on before coming to Olrando),but the hotel managed the crowd extremely well. There were never lines to wait in or attitudes from over stressed employees ! The rooms ,the pool, the grounds were immaculate. The food was very good and not overly priced like Disneyy. I have always stayed at a Disney owned resort because of the convenience to Disney world, but from now on I will stay at this Hilton...... Can't say enough good things about this Hilton !

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, convenient only if you have a car”
Reviews.Author: CampHiker
Reviews.Content: My husband and I did a golf vacation thru Golfpac ( wonderful company, golfed every day at the best courses) and this is the hotel that we stayed at. It is basically on the same grounds as the Waldorf so you get to use both resorts. We golfed at the Waldorf. The spa is at the Waldorf and the lazy river is at the Hilton. The two places are both very different which makes it really fun. We ate breakfast at the Hilton and had lunch at both the Hilton and Waldorf. However, for dinner we went across the street to the Wyndham. The restaurant there, Deep Blu was surprisingly fantastic and the wait staff were incredibly friendly. For what we wanted, a nice grown up time away, with only one day spent at Disney, this was perfect. However, if I had my family with me, I would have stayed at the Wyndham. The Wyndham has condos and our room was very small and cramped. (Also, very boxy and very generic) If you want to stay near many restaurants, shopping, or if you wanted to just take a walk this area would not be the best choice. The resorts at Bonnet creek sit by themselves on acres of land. You really need a car. I heard people who were waiting for the shuttles complaining about all of the wait time.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute amazing hotel and facilities!”
Reviews.Author: AJE-83
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner in September 2011 and it was a very pleasant stay. We were both Suprised when we arrived at how nice the hotel and grounds were. The hotel is new and very clean and the staff provide an excellent service. We are from the UK and the service is much better at this hotel than any UK hotel we have stayed at. The rooms are lovely and large and the lazy river is amazing. It was so relaxing floating around it in an afternoon. The restaurants are good too and we loved the location. No complaints and we will be going back this year.

Reviews.Title: “Average nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissLSeattle
Reviews.Content: I should start by saying that I have stayed at my share of nicer hotels... the Hilton Bonnet Creek was just a typical nice hotel with nothing special. The food was nothing great which was unfortunate. The pool was nice and had quite a bit of space but was still very crowded. They had a very loud DJ which was distracting if you wanted to have a relaxing afternoon at the pool. The rooms were clean and the location is great for getting to the amusement parks. I'm definitely glad my company paid for this and I didn't pay for this hotel myself.

Reviews.Title: “A new favorite!”
Reviews.Author: ecpotash
Reviews.Content: My wife and kids were worn out after four days at Disney so we decided to chill out for a couple of days. We heard about the pool at the Hilton Bonnett Creek and weren't disappointed! Rooms are good sized and there is plenty of activities for the kids. They loved the pool side movie at night. Kudos to the staff as well for locating my sneakers that I left at the pool as well as some clothes of my wife that accidentally were taken by housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem...”
Reviews.Author: Dreams008
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hilton Bonnet Creek this past weekend for a quick getaway to Disney. I had read the many positive reviews, so I was pretty excited to see if they were indeed true. The resort is very easy to find. It is on Disney grounds and very close to the Swan/Dolphin and Hollywood Studios. We arrived at 8:20am from Ft. Myers, as we wanted to take advantage of a whole day at the park. Knowing there was a possibility we would not be able to check in until 3:00pm, which is their advertised check-in time, I was surprised when I was told our room was ready and we could bring up our luggage. This was great, as we definitely would not have been in the mood for this after a long day/night at the park. As soon as you pull up there are bellmen and valet attendants waiting to help you out of your vehicle. I went straight to check in and the service was pleasant, welcoming, and prompt. We were checked in and in our room within 10 mins. You can choose to either self park ( $13 a day ) or valet. We chose to self park, in which you are directed to a large parking garage. There are elevators, however, in the garage that take you to a bridge to connect you to the hotel. Our room was on the 11th floor with a beautiful view of Downtown Disney in the distance. There are two queen-sized beds, a decent-sized bathroom, flat screen television, and a desk. Could be we were exhausted from our day at the Magic Kingdom that caused us to sleep so well, but we both agreed that the beds were super comfortable, with a faux down comforter and many pillows. It was hard to pull ourselves out of bed the next morning. The day we checked in, we decided to do Magic Kingdom. The hotel provides complimentary transportation to all parks and Downtown Disney and the bus used is wonderful. It is comparable to a travel bus, with comfy seats, movies playing for the children, and lights and a/c control above your head. The bus only makes one stop to its sister hotel, the Waldorf Astoria immediately next door, and then you're on your way to the park. Unlike Walt Disney World Resort buses and Dowtown Disney hotel buses which make many pit stops to pick up additional guests, this bus only caters to the Hilton and Waldork Astoria, so there are fewer people, much more quiet, and it gets you to where you want to go in a short period of time. It was also nice coming back from the park at night not having to drive our own cars and having a peaceful ride back to the hotel, unlike Disney Resort guests, who we saw crammed in the buses, with many standing. It's the little things that can really add enjoyment to your trip. The only thing to keep in mind if going to the Magic Kingdom, is that the bus does not take you straight to the park itself. It will take you the Ticket and Transportation Center, in which you must board a ferry or monorail to get to the Magic Kingdom. So, allow yourself a few extra minutes to do this in planning your Magic Kingdom day. You'll also have to return back to the Ticket and Transportation Center at the end of your park stay to get back on the bus. The Disney bus stop is directly in front of the hotel, so very little walking required and easy to find. The rooms are modernly decorated. You will not experience the Disney feel at this hotel, but I feel kids will still thoroughly enjoy it as there is a beautiful pool area with waterslide and lazy river. There are restaurants to choose from and a quick grab-and-go coffee shop next to the entrace for pastries/danish/bagels/ice cream. I wish we would have had more time to explore the hotel, but with a quick two day schedule, that wasn't the case. I definitely intend to stay here again on my next Disney visit and have already recommended it to others. The price is very comparable to a Disney resort, and actually cheaper, the rooms are twice the size, extremely clean, have queen beds, which many Disney resorts still use double, and an excellent view. All previous reviews I read are spot on with this hotel. This is my new Disney hotel. Can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing time”
Reviews.Author: junerob8
Reviews.Content: We had 2 nights here at the end of a family holiday. The hotel is very impressive and the rooms are spacious, clean and very comfortable. The pool and lazy river are beautiful, well kept and inviting - we loved it! The staff were very helpful and friendly. Service at the pool was a little slow and they messed our order up 2 days in a row but the food (and cocktails) were good. Breakfast was included in our rate and was excellent. Parking is not included and is $20 a day for valet - only 2 days for us but if you were here for longer that adds up. There is free wifi in the lobby and pool areas but not in the bedrooms - why? It should be standard these days. I would still highly recommend the resort.

Reviews.Title: “fun place”
Reviews.Author: jeff j
Reviews.Content: Nice clean room, good beds, excellent breakfast, and the location is terrific. We loved the lazy river pool and our son had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Time!!!”
Reviews.Author: Karen F
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with my two grandchildren ages 10 and 12. They had a fantastic time! The hotel staff made you feel like you were family going above and beyond in all circumstances. I had a hard time getting the boys and myself to leave the pool, they loved the lazy river and slide. Being so close to all the Disney attractions was a major plus. My grandsons told me they never want to stay anywhere else but here and I agree!! You will have a fantastic time!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Jay L
Reviews.Content: Great experience! The staff was super friendly and helpful. The iron in room was broken and a staff member was there to replace it in under 10min. The restaurant was fantastic, great food. There is a lazy river right on the resort!!! Also very close to Disney World. Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Best pool at Disney”
Reviews.Author: Watrbaby
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hilton Bonet Creek after our Disney cruise. The location is great and easy to get to HS, EPCOT and AK. A little far from MK. Check-in was fast and easy. Room was big and comfortable. Could use more draws/shelves. Only 3 draws for the 4 of us. Staff is very responsive and helpful. Loved the lazy river pool and 2 story slide - kids slept well! They show movies by the pool on some nights. Breakfast buffet was very good. Dinner buffet didn't look as good so we went with the ala carte menu. Kids eat free for breakfast and dinner. The Italian restaurant, La Luce is worthwhile to go to. You can use the facilities at the Waldorf Astoria, which is connected by the convention center. The Bull & Bear Steak House is fantastic. Its nice to be able to go back to your hotel and get a great dinner without having to go out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, cookie cutter, generic hotel”
Reviews.Author: gidget2
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a week for business, and although the accommodations were clean and comfortable, I was less than thrilled with the service. I'm not usually picky when it comes to hotels, but a few things that I had issues with: -when I arrived late at night (prior to the hotel becoming full for all star weekend) I called to request addtl hangers. That initially call was at 11:30 or so. Half hour later, still no hangers. I call, and they say that it should be up shortly. 12:45am still no hangers, so I call again, and tell them to forget it. The hotel employee tells me that it should be five minutes..I tell her to just have them bring me some the next day. At 1:30am there is a knock on my door, but I was already I n bed half asleep. And they never brought me those hangers the next day. -I left change in the bathroom and while I of course would've tipped housekeeping at the end ofmy stay,I was shocked to notice that the change was gone the next day! T me that's appalling - and finally, while the food at the pool bar area was very good, the service was horrible. I had to wait for awhile and ask for a waiter...and then two hours later, with the waiter checking in one, I had to ask twice for my waiter to come give me the check. Just minor things overall, but enough for me to think twice about a great review, or second stay at the property.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk”
Reviews.Author: Mhk1102
Reviews.Content: Gave us wrong times for shuttle service. Very unapologetic Sorry but there are vans outside that you need to pay for if you want to leave now, otherwise you can wait for the next shuttle. Gee thanks for nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Good Service”
Reviews.Author: ToddNewYork_NY
Reviews.Content: PROS: Stayed at the hotel for 2 nights. Hotel is clean, and very good customer service. Check-in was a breeze. Room was clean and affordable. Restaurant on lower level was perfect especially with kids. Self parking was quick and easy. And the outside lazy river and water slide added to the fun. The lobby is also very well appointed. This a top hotel for families who want to travel with class when going to Disney. CONS: beware of the shuttle bus schedule to the Disney Parks. While we were there, the schedule was not followed and ended up waiting a bit late at night to get back to the hotel. I brought this to management's attention and there response was exceptional. They gave my complaint the attention it needed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PhilParker12
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Some of the best service my wife and I have ever experienced around the world. Great pool. Excellent golf course. Connected to the Waldorf Astoria which is also a very nice hotel. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal!!!”
Reviews.Author: amandairene
Reviews.Content: ...for the lack of a better adjective that is different from other positive reviews about the hotel. The staff was very attentive and helpful in all areas we needed assistance, the food was amazing and the prices were reasonable compared to other hotels we've been to. Quiet, well decorated, clean, close to disney parks, universal studios etc with complimentary transportation to and from disney parks. We both agreed it was one of the best hotels and services thus far and wondered what hotels with higher ratings in the area possibly offer! Negative reviews seem to have been about a month ago so hopefully this is the path the hotel is now taking and it's up to it to keep it up. No complaints, just great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, lacks charm”
Reviews.Author: jcrawford
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Orlando Bonnet Creek for a family vacation over President's Day weekend. The hotel is nice - very clean, beds are comfortable, and staff is friendly and professional. However, it lacks charm or character; it feels very much like a business hotel. The building itself is slab-sided and monolithic, and is attached to a huge conference center that connects to the Waldorf Astoria on the other side. The rooms could be in any Hilton, nothing extraordinary one way or another. Bathrooms are small; two people can't fit at one time. Disney View gets you the Pop Century Resort and glimpses of Hollywood Studios; no fireworks, no castle, no Spaceship Earth. One annoyance is the $5/day they charge to rent tubes for the lazy river in the pool area. I can't believe it's a significant source of revenue; is it really necessary? With two or three kids and a several day stay, you could spend $50. Why not just a $5 deposit, or better yet, just hold my room key until I return your tube. Otherwise, it's a reasonable alternative to Disney resorts or other off-property hotels in the Disney area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Erica H
Reviews.Content: Our family had a great time at this hotel. The pool was awesome. I loved that we could take the bus to Disney everyday. The staff were so nice and helpful. I wish we could have stayed longer to just relax at the pool. We actually booked a room at the Disney property - Port Orleans Riverside and checked out immediately b/c it was so terrible. We checked in the Hilton Bonnet Creek and we were so happy with the move. This property is 100 times better than the Disney property. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Family fun + Disney = perfect stay!!”
Reviews.Author: mylestraveled
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a hidden gem ON DISNEY PROPERTY!! While Hilton Bonnet Creek is not a "Disney hotel", it is on Disney property and is right around the corner from all the parks. There is even a bus to and from all parks all day long. So, let's talk about the FAMILY pool area! My kids are only 1 and 3 years old, so the lazy river and the zero entry pool area was perfect for our family. I felt like this hotel and pool was made for us! This is also a newer hotel, so you can't go wrong with any room. Views are awesome, too. If you have a rental car, parking is quick and easy to self park. No need to valet. We will definitely go back to this hotel for our next family vacation!! It was such a great location. Also, it's right next to the Waldorf Astoria (major luxury if you have the $$ to spend). I would recommend staying at the Hilton and paying for an upgrade to a 1 bedroom suite. SO worth it!! I hope you enjoy this awesome hotel!! Service was outstanding and LOTS of attention for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Jlm52769
Reviews.Content: Happened upon it when we needed an extra night in Orlando. Amazing find. Better bed and bathroom than the 2 more expensive resorts we later stayed at, better pool too. Very clean, high end rooms. Great choice if you want a deluxe room at a moderate price. Golf course, river and walkway behind the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scw2k
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotel I have ever been at. Great location. Close to Disney. Convenient to be able to take the bus and not to have to worry about parking the car. Great hotel room. Comfortable beds, nice bathroom. Fantastic heated lazy pool. Nice to be able to enjoy that after a day at Disney. Fire pit, movie night. Good restaurants options. Nice to be able to enjoy the Waldorf amenities right next door. Convenient jogging path. Friendly staff. Frozen grapes by the pool was a nice touch. So festive at Christmas time.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: AndeeNYC
Reviews.Content: I need to start this off by saying that I am somewhat of a "hotel snob"....I am both a Hilton and Hyatt Diamond member and stay at luxury resorts 12 to 15 nights a month for month. I decided to try Hilton Bonnet Creek for a long, leisurely weekend at Disney and was enamored by the beautiful swimming pool complex on the website. I have to tell you that this resort did not disappoint!! Everything about it was top-notch, from the employees to the impeccable grounds to the gorgeous rooms...five star all the way! Check in was fast and to my absolute delight, I was given an incredible upgrade due to my Diamond status (thank you, Bill!!). The room was breathtaking, and so was the view of the pool. Ahhh.....the pool! It is beyond beautiful! The entire pool complex is just stunning and sparkling clean. The water is heated "just right", the jacuzzis are so inviting, and the attendants were wonderful and were frequently stopping by with complimentary goodies (frozen grapes, chocolates, etc.). The food at the poolside bar/restaurant was excellent...best chicken quesadilla's ever, and the portions are enormous for the price! And when it gets chilly, they even have fire-pits poolside. We just completely fell in love with the entire experience at the pool. It was a large enough area that families with kids could "do their thing", while those seeking tranquility had their own space. We even skipped going to the theme parks for 3 days to just spend the day by the pool! The room was meticulously clean upon our arrival, and housekeeping had it serviced upon our return every night with yummy chocolates waiting for us on the pillows! The rooms had all the great little "extra touches" of luxury...great bath products, comfy robes, large flat screen tvs with channel guides (so you didn't have to keep flipping and guessing!), fast wifi, refrigerators, and of course heavenly beds!! Every single employee we encountered was personable and courteous, from the valets to the housekeepers to the front desk attendants. Self-parking is plentiful and only a short walk to the lobby. We did utilize the free park shuttle one day and there were dozens of options for drop-off/pick-up times which saved money parking at the theme parks. We also used the fitness center every morning and it was sparkling clean and we even noted how the attendant did the most thorough wipe-down/disinfecting of the equipment that I have ever seen!! We did stroll over to the adjoining Waldorf Astoria property and considered using their pool one day but decided we liked the one at the Hilton much better! All in all, this was such a wonderful stay for us and I am thrilled to recommend this resort to anyone! If it's any testimony to how much we loved the resort, then you should know that we extended our stay TWICE and made a 3 day weekend a 5 day weekend!! We just couldn't pull ourselves away from that stunning pool complex!! I am so happy we "found" this stunning gem and it will be "our home" from now on whenever we visit Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “a lovely accomodation”
Reviews.Author: tomtom989
Reviews.Content: excellent service, the staff are extremly attentive and helpful. we ate in the two restraunts and found the food to be of excellent quality and great value. the rooms are spacious and the bathrooms are beaiutiful however the showers arnt very good at all also note that robes arnt provided as a standard in the hotel however we needed them for a cool evening at the pool and they accomodated us in providing them. breakfast was excellent fresh with lots of choice. an alround good experiance.

Reviews.Title: “Usual Excellent Hilton Experience”
Reviews.Author: Paul E
Reviews.Content: Great location, right beside the Disney Parks and 20 mins from Universal and 15 mins from Sea World. The staff are really helpful and made the week a really 'magic' one. There's even a Disney shop down one corridor. The food (especially the breakfast) was brilliant and kept us all going well in to the afternoon. Although we didn't use the pool and outside leisure area, it looked fantastic and others were using it. We went with Virgin and they provided a well used V Room on the 16th floor. Free internet on their computers, pool table and table football as well as sofa's and a TV to watch. The kids thought it was great. My only complaint (the usual Hilton whinge) is the lack of free WIFI in the rooms. Come on Hilton, you can make more people happier if you do.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, good location.”
Reviews.Author: Chowell1234
Reviews.Content: Great resort, very clean, excellent service. Only beef is the pool Bar and restaurant lose at irregular hours. We were there on 2 nights this week, both with 70+ degree weather, and on both occasions, at approx 7 pm, there no towels and they proceeded to tell us the bar was closing at 8 and the kitchen closes at 7:30, even when they are both advertised to stay open until 9. They made us feel guilty for wanting a drink and something to eat poolside in Florida on a Warm, balmy night.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: MrsT21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful stay here for a quick weekend at Disney World. We've stayed at the Waldorf Astoria next door before, but decided to try the Hilton for this stay -- we were not disappointed! Even though we arrived very late (nearly midnight), we were greeted by very friendly and helpful staff and were able to quickly and easily make our way up to our room. Really, the entire weekend was a great experience with the staff here. Everyone from the valet attendant to cashiers in the cafe and Disney store was wonderful to interact with. The room was very comfortable, and we had a nice view of the pool (where the staff would spell out words like "LAUGH" using bright green towels on the chairs) and Disney's property (thanks to its great location close to all the parks and Downtown Disney!) It was very quiet in the room and hallway; however, that could have been because we were a very long walk from the elevators. (I guess that's one word of warning -- it's a big hotel!) A great thing to keep in mind is that there is a Disney store there in the hotel on the way to the parking deck. They have lots of souvenirs, things you might have forgotten, as well as park tickets! My husband needed to get his park ticket, and it just took a couple of minutes to pick it up there (we were the only people in the store) rather than having to wait in a line at one of the parks. We will absolutely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel but delayed check-in”
Reviews.Author: Olivia V
Reviews.Content: It's a very beautiful hotel and it's high quality. The property is gorgeous and the restaurants are awesome. The best part is its proximity to the shopping malls and Disney world (actually it is in Disney world). The shuttle bus to the Disney parks work well, you park you car and never have to take it out. However, there were some problems in checking in. We went there for our honeymoon. When we went in to check in, they told us that we need to wait for about 30 mins. because the room is still being cleaned; they offered us a room on the 5th floor, but we said we want to wait for our room on the 18th floor. After waiting about 2.5 hours and paying 4 visits to the reception desk, we were told that our room still isn't ready! On top of that they hadn't even offer us anything for being a honeymoon couple. After 2.5 hours, we expressed our complaint at the front desk and they immediately apologized and gave us a room on the 18th floor and a gift card for dinner in one of their restaurants. That was good enough to make us happy, but when we got to our room at night, we found an envelope in our name and in it was coupons for free buffet breakfast throughout our stay! All in all, their check-in might be a little delayed, so you might want to get there a bit after the designated check-in hour. The cleaning delay also affects cleaning times during the stay, they have 1-2 people cleaning the whole floor so you might want to stay out till the evening if you want to find your room clean. But their compensation for the delay made our trip wonderful! We had a great honeymoon, it was a very comfortable room with a wonderful view of the Disney property- palm trees and everything! You can even see the fireworks in Disney parks from your room if your room faces that way. Also, the restaurant, harvest bistro, is highly recommended. Also they have refrigerators in the rooms, so you can keep small snacks and drinks there.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice property with a great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: rosebrien
Reviews.Content: We stayed recently for a weekend getaway to celebrate a tennager's birthday. While not opulent, this hotel has all the necessary bells and whistles to make it a very comfortable and accomodating property, and it is located literally within the Disney World property. it was little too cold on our trip to sample the pool, but it is a beautiful and well maintained area that features a lazy river, slide, lagoon style pool, and a poolside bar that are all maintained and staffed beautifully. Keep in mind, it is priced accordingly (still not sure why a hotel has a lazy river and then "rents" floats, and also charges $20/day for valet parking in the garage immediately adjacent to the hotel, and why can't I get free wireless in my room when it's free in the public areas? Why???). Bottom line, if you want an upscale property with all the amenities, and are willing to pay for the extras, this hotel fits the bill. The rooms are nice, the property is new, and above all, the staff were all professional and competent. Not a single glitch during our 2 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent escape!”
Reviews.Author: myspecialks
Reviews.Content: This hotel is immaculate! The location is wonderful. I went for a 2 night stay ..my intentions were relaxation & pampering. The Waldorf spa is right next door..just a gold f cart ride away. The staff were super friendly and efficient! I would definitely stay again...great for family, girls trip or solo. I am sure business folks love it too!!

Reviews.Title: “Swimsuits, Golf, and Relaxation....”
Reviews.Author: leorespy97
Reviews.Content: This resort is great everything you would want is at your fingertips. Great food, beautiful swimming pool, great golf, and beautiful surroundings. Breakast buffet is sensational, rooms are spotless, and the view is spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place”
Reviews.Author: tgl
Reviews.Content: I was there for two nights, Feb 8 and 9. Arriving by shuttle, I noticed that Bonnet Creek is about the only turn inside of Disney World that is not marked with a large sign like all of the other turns and hotel entrances--maybe because it is on property not owned by Disney. From the main road inside of Disney World, it is is another 5-10 minute drive alongside a golf course. The hotel itself has a grand driveway. Doormen jump to it to open your door and offer to take luggage. The check in desk was fully staffed with no one being served, so that everyone in my 3 person group checked in simultaneously. I never saw a line there despite going past several times each day. My room was 404. The hall was quiet and brightly lit as was the room. I never heard any of my neighbors except for occasional door-closing sounds from the hallway. The room door was solid and heavy, but not heavy enough to actually latch without an additional push. I just had to be careful arriving and leaving that it actually closed, a minor security problem. The room was spacious with a king bed, desk with pull out extra semi-oval table, office chair, lounge chair and ottoman, large flat screen TV, refrigerator, no mini-bar (a plus in my mind), coffee maker with 4 packets of coffee and 1 decaf and teabags. I carefully avoided touching the 1 liter bottles of water with prominent $5 price tags. The tap water was just fine for drinking. Lamps all had extra plugs at their bases for phone chargers or computer chargers. The bed was enormous and quite comfortable. The office chair was painfully hard and the lounge chair was so-so in comfort in odd contrast with the bed. There was a reasonable but unlighted closet with plenty of hangers for clothes. There was an ironing board and iron but no safe. The bathroom was average sized for an American hotel with bright lights. The counter was granite with a tile floor. The shower was about 6 feet long and 3-4 feet wide with a clear glass enclosure. The shower head was a broad one that normally delivers the equivalent of heavy rain. However, my room never got truly hot water. The toilet was a silent one that appeared to use a low volume flush. All the towels and linens were very high quality or luxurious. There were enormous high quality green towels at the pool and small white towels in the gym. The pool has a lazy river connecting three pools, one of them next to Beech, the poolside bar. The fireplaces were quite charming. There was also a water slide which seemed like lots of fun judging from the reaction of several kids. Water temperature was perfect, and the hot tubs were quite nice too. Signs warn that there is no lifeguard, but the deepest water was only 4 feet. Looks like parents do have to pay attention with small kids (but when don't we?). I think internet access was prepaid for my group. It was painless to sign in, and it worked well both as a hard wired connection and a wireless connection. Phone calls on my ATT cell phone were painfully noisy in my room and in the meeting rooms when the connections weren't dropped which seemed odd for a high-end resort hotel. Meeting rooms were as expected in furnishings but each participant had a bit more space than usual at meeting tables which was nice. Food for the meetings was outstanding. All the service people throughout the hotel were courteous and friendly. After check out, I had a long wait for my ride to the airport and was able to use the gym after they issued me a gym only key. There is a free shuttle to the Magic Kingdom and to Downtown Disney, but it takes a painful 40 minutes to get to Downtown Disney. A cab ride was 15 minutes due to traffic and about 10 dollars. We didn't try the half hourly Disney buses that go only to the Disney Transportation Center requiring transfers to anywhere else. Overall, it was very, very good as a hotel with just a few minor misses. I'd return for a business trip. For a family going on a vacation featuring Disney World though, I noticed that the Disney World Flavor was quite subdued, which might be a plus or a minus depending on your point of view.

Reviews.Title: “Looking for a hotel where money are stolen from the room?”
Reviews.Author: InessaK
Reviews.Content: They were looking through our staff and stole money. The administration refused to compensate.

Reviews.Title: “WOW Amazing Place”
Reviews.Author: DanielSz
Reviews.Content: We stayed there between Feb 5 and Feb 8, 2012 as part of Business Trip from Primerica Financial Services, Phase 2. The best description will be WOW, WOW, WOW !!! The lazy river was the best place to rest with my wife. The hotel have spacious room, huge beds, and is extremely clean. Just recommend to go there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful new hotel”
Reviews.Author: kittyreen
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights beginning of Febuary. Loved the Hotel, great room. Enjoyed the lazy river pool and hot tub. The fire pits surrounded by deep cushioned couches at the Beech pool bar are to die for. Used the shuttle buses provided by the hotel to go to Disney, they were new, comfortable,and always on time. Staff friendly and helpful. Dinner at La Luce was OK, Pizza I had was good, my husbands Lasagna was bland. We walked over to the Waldorf and checked out the Bull and Bear, but could not justify the $60+ price for a strip steak. We will here again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: jackid51
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week in January to visit Disney World. I found the staff to be friendly and unusually helpful. Adam at the concierge desk was exceptional, he and his staff were always ready with maps, directions, and dining recommendations. This hotel has an amazing pool. The rooms are what you would expect at a nice Hilton, perhaps a little bigger. We had Disney view room and could clearly see Disney Studios. As Hilton corporate seems to want to take away our Diamond benefits, it was nice to got to a hotel where an "upgrade" was offered and breakfast "coupons" did not have to be asked for. Would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: Delee J
Reviews.Content: We stayed here January 19th for 2 nights and wish we could have stayed longer. The lazy river was amazing, we watched a movie while swimming in the pool, ordered drinks and pizza by the poolside, even warmed up to a fire each evening. The hotel is extremely clean, spacious rooms, comfortable beds. Hotel staff was very informative as it was our first visit to Orlando. Conveniently located near the Disney parks. Dining was wonderful. They had some of the best tasting water as well, to some that might not matter, but from a picky water consumer, it ranked the highest on our trip. I would definately recommend this hotel and look forward to staying there again. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Facilities, hotel room is average”
Reviews.Author: ufrc75
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a last minute Disney getaway. The hotel itself is VERY pretty on the interior. I have stayed at the Waldorf next door and the lobby is about as pretty, just much bigger. I worked out at the gym facilities and for a hotel, they are really quite good. The pool area is amazing. Lazy river, brand new, well maintained. A lot of fun for the adults and kids alike. The rooms at the hotel are a bit small for my taste. The decorating was modern and nice enough. The bathroom was WAAAAYYYYY too small. One sink, no separate door to the toilet and pretty much impossible for 2 people to be in there at the same time. Overall, the lobby and hotel facilities exceeded my expectations, the room was slightly below what I was expecting.

Reviews.Title: “Once Again, and Amazing Stay at an Amazing Hotel (From a HHonors Loyalist)”
Reviews.Author: TXFinAdvisor
Reviews.Content: I stay here every year for a work conference, and every year it just keeps getting better and better. I wrote a review last year, and I had the same GREAT experience from beginning to end, but this year was even better!!!! This year the pool bar/cafe was open, the bartenders and drinks at La Luce were 100% better!!! (Their drinks are amazing!), and there was a Disney Store on the property now. Rooms are 10/10 I love this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: mrmet835
Reviews.Content: Hilton Bonnet Creek, My Girlfriend and I, along with another couple had the pleasure to stay a Hilton Bonnet Creek Last Summer, and I have to say it was simply outstanding! We decided to drive from New York to Orlando and while the ride was exhausting , our stay at this hotel made it all worthwhile. Everyone was courteous, professional and went out of their way make sure we were comfortable. Here is quick breakdown of the hotel- Lobby- Nice and clean with plenty of places to sit. There is a nice bar area off to the lobby area with generous seating both inside and out(the outside area has seating that overlooks the pool). Hotel Hallways and elevator- Pristine, clean with no odor. Rooms- beautiful, spacious and clean. My only complaint was that Wifi was not free. Restaurants- La Luce â€“ Really nice Italian Restaurant in the hotel, with great food and even greater service. (nice size meal portions as well) Harvest Bistro- The Buffet Style Breakfast was just outstanding, and although very crowded each morning we were seated promptly and the staff was extremely attentive to all the guests needs. The breakfast itself consisted of everything from cereal, Danishes, and bagels to waffles ,eggs and pancakes. Muse- good coffee shop, great for a late night cup or early morning jolt. (tip.. try their ice cream, its pretty good) FYI The hotel is connected to the Waldorf so if you want a different dining options, you can eat in a different hotel without having to go outside. The Fitness Area- Great for a hotel with plenty of elliptical and Treadmills (all high quality). Also there was a good assortment of other equipment for weight training. Even more impressive was that all the equipment was in perfect working condition, this area was really well maintained . My opinion, this gym is more than adequate for anyone who wants to keep up their fitness routine while on vacation. Pool- Aaah the lazy river- The pool was beautiful and the great thing about it was that no matter how many people were in it , the pool never felt over crowded(itâ€™s just that big). Tip- get a float and allow the lazy river to sweep you along the pool at a nice relaxing pace. In the pool area there are also some relaxing whirlpools that are a perfect escape from the regular pool. Tip- don't get bummed out if it rains a little(that's Florida) the Hilton crew did a great job of clearing the pool if there was impending lightning, and getting everyone back to the fun quickly when the all clear was given. The communication from the staff was a thing of perfection. Complimentary shuttle service- Leave your car in the lot at the hotel. Hilton Bonnet Creek shuttle service was perfect. They were on time courteous and ran all day and night (to every Disney park!) the shuttle service was just a few steps away from the main lobby. The hotel was no more than 15 mins to all Disney attractions by shuttle Concierge- Everything you can want in hotel customer service and then some. There was one night the four of us wanted to go eat somewhere outside of Disney, the concierge spent over 20 minutes with us going through different local dining options and calling up places for reservations, it was customer service at its best(and they seemed to do it all the time). I would recommend the Hilton Bonnet Creek to anyone who wants a great hotel and experience while down in Orlando Florida whether you are visiting Disney or not.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property”
Reviews.Author: Heidi S
Reviews.Content: I liked the property - self parking in attached garage is nice, a bit of a walk but not difficult and entirely covered if you happen to be here during rain! Our room overlooked the pool area, nice view- a bit of noise bleed into the room when there were games or activities at the pool but this only occurred during daytime so no difficulty sleeping. The room doors are heavy and there was no hallway noise in our room which is a good thing! Lobby gathering area is all bar seating but kids were very present during the day and seemed welcome. La Luce is the upscale dining option and was wonderful but pricey. The more casual dining option had a limited menu during our stay, a bit pricey but decent food. The hotel has shuttles to the various Disney parks which makes life easy. Th room was spacious - king bed desk area, one chair with ottomon. Bath was spacious, shower only if that is a concern. Small closet. Lots of outlets, and two on each side of the bed at the lamp base which is a great perk for me-- hate having to unplug things behind nightstands to recharge my various istuff! The week we were here they hosted a relatively large convention with a lot of turnover - thought they handled the process fairly smoothly. Staff were pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “6 Night Stay and Couldn't Fault Anything”
Reviews.Author: Jas0n03
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights as a family (kids aged 11 and 6) in January. The Hilton had run a deal for 50% off the second room which was excellent for us as a family especially as we requested connecting rooms. The rooms are new and very clean, and the general standard of the property was excellent. The hotel is located close by the Disney property and with the regular (and prompt) coach service, you are not really any further away from the parks as many Disney properties. The kids eat free at Harvest Bristo is a great comp and ensures most families eat there, leaving La Luce free of most families. We dined at the hotel in both restuarants 5 nights and enjoyed both very much. The service was great. The pool complex is wonderful and our only regret was not spending more than a morning there. The pool is huge and given a few chilly days is was great that it was heated. A recent review commented on Eric the life guard who was very friendly, and in a moment of poor parent supervision, pulled my daughter from a lazy river when she got into some difficulty. We had pool view rooms which provided a great view of that complex, the adjacent golf course and nightly Disney fireworks. My main piece of advice relates to the Town Cars servicing the hotel, and that is to make sure they check the company's price sheet when setting the fare. On our first day we were overcharged (we subsequently confirmed) $15 for a fare to the International Drive Premium Outlet. I would thoroughly recommend the Hilton-it deserves its high rating and we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice - Hilton Bonnet Creek”
Reviews.Author: sallie123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a four night stay at the Hilton Bonnet Creek with our grandchildren (ages 6 and 9) while we did Disney. It was wonderful and EASY !!!! This luxury property is located as close to Disney property as you can get and there were free shuttles running constantly to and from the various parks. We never had to wait longer than 10 minutes or so. The shuttles are new and have Disney movies playing for entertainment on the brief ride. The pool is huge with a lazy river, water slide, hot tubs, and firepits as well as attendants to assist in any way imaginable. We ate in the main restaurant for breakfast nearly everyday and for an evening meal, too (kids eat free with adult entree,) We also had room service one evening that was prompt (about 20 minutes) and delicious. Elizabeth

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: Brian K
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3 night visit to Orlando with my 6 year old son (January 28-30, 2012) and this hotel experience was fantastic! Fresh, clean, very recently built property only minutes away from Disney parks and Downtown Disney. This Hilton is beside the Waldorf Astoria a sister property, and reflects just a nice if you are staying with children. In fact, some of the guests I met by the pool were from the Waldorf and said they preferred the pool at the Hilton, which is a 700,000 gallon pool with a lazy river going around it, 2 hot tubs, and a waterslide! A no-brainer with kids, they have so much fun, and to my amazement, kids under 12 eat free! Love it. The staff were all very friendly, and attentive. My wife and I have stayed at several 5 plus star hotels on business (i.e. Four Seasons, St.Regis, and the Ritz Carleton), and in my humble opinion, dollar for dollar, you will be hard pressed to find a better hotel/value in Orlando than the Hilton Bonnet Creek. Absolutely no reservations recommending this hotel to you!

Reviews.Title: “Happy!”
Reviews.Author: mozyAlong
Reviews.Content: One common thing I noticed with our stay. The staff as a whole seemed happy. You don't normally see that. I was very happy with the Hotel and the ammenities. The room was nice. The lazy river was nice to pass time with. One of the best buffet breakfast I've had. Two cons mentioned already is parking is not free. The reader to enter and leave the hotel wasn't reading the card half the time. Wifi was free in the lobby and by the pool bar, but not in the room was the other con. We had a great time and would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Experience 2x”
Reviews.Author: Goose54
Reviews.Content: Was here in April with my family and just returned today from an event there. Perfect for both business and pleasure. Nice rooms, clean and same for lobby and the pool. The only problem if you do not have a car food is limited both nice restaurants were pretty much boooked and pricey. We went across to the seafood place at the Wyndham stay away bland food nothing special. I do highly recommend the Hilton one of the nice properties I have satyed in while in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: k1206p
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Hilton Bonnet Creek. We were only here for 2 nights and wished we were staying longer (we moved to another hotel where the rest of our family was staying). The kids had a great day at the pool and loved the lazy river. The food was great at the buffet. The room was spacious and clean. One night we had a great view of fireworks from our window. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: FunInTheSun8794
Reviews.Content: We came and felt right at home. First the room, Great beds, large bedroom, love how the beds were queen size. The bathroom was very big. The restaurants were great!!!!! Eat at La Luce. The Lazy river and pool is so big and so so great. You can spend the whole day at the pool. The shuttle was very convenient. You are staying on Disney, which is so cool. If you want to have a great vacation in Orlando, I recommend to STAY HERE!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KANDITO
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice. Let me start off by saying that I am hard to please when it comes to hotels, I normally will not even stay in a hotel unless it is 4 star.
