Cleanliness is #1 to me and Im one of those weirdos that must have white bedding. When we checked in it was quick and easy, the lobby is beautiful with chandeliers and a bar. I am a Hilton Honors member so we were given complimentary wi-fi in the room, a high floor and late check out which was nice since most hotels charge for that. The room was emaculate and very clean. The bed was AMAZINGLY comfortable. There was a flat screen television and even a fridge which you sometimes dont find in hotels. I really loved the walk in shower (I HATE tub/shower combos at hotels). We were on the 17th floor and had a view of downtown disney....gorge. We had the breakfast buffet at the Harvest something or other and it was your normal buffet, nothing spectacular. We didnt get in the pool, but did walk around the pool area which seems really nice. It has a water slide, lazy river and about 4 or 5 separate pools in all. Upon Checkout the girl was borderline rude. She told me how much we would be getting back on our credit card and when I asked what the charges were for she said, "you have to wait for me to print it out, I just told you that". I was charged for self parking (which I knew was the case) but they also taxed me on the self parking. Overall it was a good stay and I hope to go back and actually enjoy the pool

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel for a quick weekend trip to Orlando”
Reviews.Author: wweny
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the hotel and it was a wonderful experience. The hotel itself is lovely (the weather unfortunately was cooler than expected). The rooms are comfortable and the lobby spacious. They could do with replacing the shower heads with a stronger spray. The restaurants were good though the Harvest Bistro has a lot of children during meals and can be quite noisy. La Luce was a wonderful meal - even our 10 year old daughter enjoyed herself. One of the best perks is the shuttle bus to the Disney Parks - very frequent and very comfortable. They show a Disney movie during the ride so it goes by very quickly. Our room had a lovely view of the pool and the Disney parks. They show movies on a large screen by the pool at night but it was too cool to sit out and watch. There were a few conventions happening but they were kept apart from the regular guests. The staff was always gracious and friendly. Overall we would recommend this hotel over the Disney inside park hotels - price is more attractive and you're still right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Not deserving of 4 star status”
Reviews.Author: queenofspades95
Reviews.Content: To begin with, I don't appreciate the fee to park my own car at a hotel which I am staying at. To make matters worse, my credit card did not read the first time I tried to leave, so when I tried a second time, I was charged twice just to get out of the parking garage. Nice racket the hotel has going on. I called to express my concerns to Olivia at the main number and she spoke to me in a patronizing tone. To this date, my credit card has NOT been refunded. Another employee who would only reveal himself as "the operator" hung up on me twice. I could not get a live person on the phone past the main number. The valets burned rubber in the parking garage and almost hit me as a pedestrian as they rounded a corner. DO NOT let the valets park your car unless you want the body work altered or the paint scratched. The bellhops had the personality of a dial tone and expected a tip just for holding a door open for you with your hands full. I guess chivalry is dead entirely. Food was ridiculously expensive even for a Hilton hotel, but the price of a premium rum was the same for a Captain Morgan! ($9.59) My husband and I had the buffet at the Harvest Bistro and felt ill after wards. We spent the rest of the afternoon laying by the pool and saw staff in green shirts offering other people towels and such, but they stayed away from us as if we had the plague. Others in blue shirts were supposedly servers delivering food and drinks to other people in lounge chairs, but no one came by us with a menu. I guess not everyone is entitled to the Hilton experience. The AC duct in the room smelled like a swamp and made a rattling noise. The TV did not work as if the signal was bad, and the view was terrible because it was of a Disney hotel that was not yet finished. The beds were comfortable but so are the ones at a Hampton Inn which is a fraction of the cost. While my husband was trying to sleep, I decided to take a walk around the property. While at the Waldorf side, (the two hotels are connected) I went to the Aquamarine bar. I was approached by a rude man in a white turtleneck and black blazer who demanded to see my room key. I did not have it on me, but told him I was a guest at the Hilton side. I was told to leave the area, and that the pool was for Waldorf Astoria guests only. I did not know the hotel was like the South in the 60s, where certain people were not to mingle with others. I did not get this man's name, but he spoke with a Russian or Ukraine accent. This hotel did not do much for me as a traveler and I felt uncomfortable for most of the stay. If I were a white businessman spending hundreds of dollars maybe my husband and I would have been treated differently. I will never again return to this property. You should teach your staff not to be so judge mental just because someone is not of Anglo-Saxon or White background. Thanks for making me feel welcome Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional waitstaff”
Reviews.Author: bowmaster
Reviews.Content: I normally do not write reviews and I did not intend to write this one but after a recent call I need to make this known. Our stay at the Hilton Bonnet Creek was wonderful! Our room was great, the pool was soothing, and the spa at the WA was exceptional. There were some items that were lagging but they were small and did not constitute any complaint, except what I have to say; The staff was very polite up until the very end and it is this one instance that dropped this review from a 4 to a 1. We unfortunatley did not make reservations and La Luce could not seat us right away. No problem, we could only blame ourselves for that one. We decided to have a few drinks at the small Sena Bar in the lobby while we waited for our table. Not wanting to sit at the bar but in comfortable chairs, we waited for someone to come by. A cocktailer in her twenties was standing at the bar chatting with two other girls and the bartender. I got up and walked up to the bar but before I could say anything the one girl barked at me that she would be there in a minute. Excuse Me! She went back to her conversation and did not smile once while at our table. When my wife asked about the wine, the waitress rolled her eyes and answered questions as if we were a nuisance wasting her precious gossip time. She left the table to get our drinks. I wanted to see the scores of a game on the bottom of a television screen so I walked up to the bar and stood behind a chair. The bartender glared at me like I was taking up a seat even though the bar was empty. I did notice him pouring one bottle of wine into another to empty the one bottle, and it happened to be my wife's wine. I had him open another bottle because I did not want her drinking wine like that. He grunted but opened a fresh bottle. we realized going to that bar was a big mistake so we paid our tab and went to wait outside. I had talked to a front desk manager Miguel, a younger Hispanic gentleman about this incident and he apologized for it. He also would have his Manager Tracy Walker contact me. This lady never did and no one else has either. When I tried calling the hotel all they did was forward me to a voicemail on multiple occasions. The final time I made it clear I did not want to speak to a machine but a real person, but the girl sent me to another voicemail of the Assistant Director. Now I am taking this rude behavior to the corporate level and find out why no one has called me back to discuss this matter. This is proof-positive that hotel managers shy away from crisis and complaints and only want to show themselves when they want to look good. Other than the heinous incident in the lobby bar, the stay was wonderful. But it only takes one bad experience to ruin an entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as people make it sound...”
Reviews.Author: katiebel
Reviews.Content: After reading comments from other advisers like Beachboy2008 and Bforboy, I was hesitant to stay at this property, but it was the property the rest of our group was staying so we had no choice. Our first impression of the hotel was nice, great in fact. The lobby was clean and the front desk staff was polite. That unfortunately was the extent of good service. First, our room did not have any soap and the attending housekeeper had left her toilet brush in the bathroom! We called down to housekeeping and the lady who answered the phone was short with me, but would send someone up with soap and to re-clean the bathroom. We stayed during an unusual cold period so we needed the heater at night, but only cold air came out which made it colder inside than outside. Two days of trying to call someone to inspect this heater, and no one came. We had to resort to ordering extra sheets. Second, while out by the pool, something blew in my eye and I went to the small restroom next to the bar to take my contact out. Inside was a waitress from the Beech Bar and she walked right out without washing her hands! I guess Hilton employees do not have to wash their hands before returning to work. (Definitely were no signs posted indicating so) My husband had ordered a beer by the pool and the beer had expired back in November! I pointed this out to the bartender and he was very curt in the matter stating beer did not expire, but had a suggested best before date. Fine, that being said who would want to enjoy a beer after the "suggested best before date"? (Especially a beer that costs $8! It should be near fresh out of the brew kettle) Learn to rotate your beer people. Third and last came an erroneous item on our bill. The bill stated we bought items from the lounge using our room number. I refused to pay for the unknown items because anyone could have written any room number, and even challenged them to find the receipt that charged the item, while mentioning the it would not be either of our handwriting. The item was taken off, albeit reluctantly but removed nonetheless. I wanted to bring the above concerns to someone in authority so I had asked for the hotel manager and no one was around. They took down my information and allegedly gave it to a desk manager who said they would be in touch. Guess what? No one has returned my call. When I try to call the hotel manager they are always either too busy or have left for the day. Nice Hilton experience.

Reviews.Title: “One more happy family.”
Reviews.Author: tnantx
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week at this hotel. Mom, dad and pre-teen went down for a 3v3 soccer tournament and we had a great experience. First let me preface by saying we are Diamond members but most of the staff did not know this. We were upgraded to a great room with a Disney view and we were able to get full buffet breakfast for a minimal cost (due to Diamond status). Our daughter ate for free. The restaurant staff was great every single day and the food choices were awesome. Our soccer playing daughter was able to get very healthy food to fuel her body. It was honestly the only decent meals we had while we were in the area as we are not big hamburger, chicken fingers in the park type people. I don't normally eat the pre-made scrambled eggs at any restaurant and I ate them here nearly every day. I am a picky, picky eater so that says something right there. Only not so good thing in the breakfast was the coffee...a little tough. Oh yes, I forgot our meal at La Luce. It was also very good and well serviced, though we were so tired it is a bit of a fog. We saw people in the pool and we assumed they were from Canada, but then found out that it was heated to 81 farenheit which really surprised me given how large the pool is. That being said, we did not give it a try as we are from Dallas and expect the pool to be a bit warmer than that. We did enjoy looking out every morning to see what friendly little saying the pool towels spelled out for the day. They had a new word each day. We could also easily see the fireworks at Epcot each night which was a nice treat. I believe the odd numbered rooms have the Disney view. The only issue we had during our stay was with the bar in the lobby. Service was not good at all. When brought to the attention of the concierge that night we were sent a lovely bottle of red wine and cheese, crackers and fruit with an apology note. It was a nice gesture. I assure you (outside of this one situation) throughout our stay all the staff were beyond friendly. We plan to return in December with all the kids. We have stayed at many hotels in the Disney area and have chosen this one to return to due to the comfort of the beds, the morning breakfast (and it's value for Diamond members) and the friendliness of the staff...and the quiet in the rooms. That being said, if I were a first time visitor to Disney World or a parent with younger children I would probably stay at a Disney property only because there is not quite the "magic" to this resort that you would find at a Disney centric property. This hotel does seem more geared to adults and older children which is a big bonus for our family. I must give a big shout out to the front desk for taking care of the situation on the 14th floor (unattended young teens running wild). We couldn't hear the kids in our room, but it was still bad hotel behavior and we noticed on the way to the elevator. It was addressed immediately which is a nice thing to know if you want to have peace in your room. As previously mentioned some of the rooms are far from the elevators which to some is an annoyance but to our family a big bonus. I personally would prefer to walk a little further to and from our room in order to ensure peace.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Bonnet Creek, Orlando (Disney World)”
Reviews.Author: Windstorm_12
Reviews.Content: The bell men were out front dancing when we arrived on 1/10 and too busy looking at each other in the glass to see us pull in and get out of our taxi. Bags were on ground before they knew we were there at 12pm. Two bell men; a father and son team; originally from Puerto Rico, were impressively attentive on 1/16 and seemed to take their job seriously and with great smiles. After three different stays at this resort, several items of detail have come to our attention: Lovely resort; good amenities, very convenient to Epcot, Magic Kingdom, Downtown Disney, Hollywood Studios, Disney's Animal Kingdom and Orlando's Premium Outlet stores on Vineland. A well-rounded breakfast before 7am is only available via room service, sadly, and cafe items are very limited, however all restaurants on property are very good. Breakfast buffet can cost you a $50. for three. Kids club in sister-property (attached) was great. Pool and lazy river are a huge hit with kids but no life guards and a challenging pool for parents to keep an eye on their child due to large size and disjointed layout; but lovely to relax at. We like the happy messages written on lounge chairs with towels each day at poolside. Thanks to Erik Lewis, Pool staff on duty, saved a little girl from the swift current on 1/16 - which impressed all the parents around that witnessed this. Erik also has a breathe of knowledge on the area, hotel and sister property that were invaluable to our visit. He was professional, courteous, articulate and seemed to have a command of respect about him - to the point I thought he was the manager and frankly, we think he should be after what we saw that day. He was always moving and working, ever vigilant of parents, kids, duties and staff; which impressed us - clearly the hardest worker I've seen yet at this property. Hilton needs to keep him!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and entertainment”
Reviews.Author: soccerlang
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay here with a large group and the service never failed. The hotel staff went above and beyond and gave the extra degree for a terrific stay. I cannot say enough of the wait staff in the Harvest Bistro, there were 15 in my group and 8 of them were our 11 year old daughters. This hotel has it all, you can spend all day in their pool. Between the lazy river, water slide, hot tubs ,dive in movies and pool side service you will never want to leave. Everywhere we went we were greeted with friendly faces and a 'can do attitude'. This is the only hotel I recommend to people who are staying in the area, for all types and ages!!! Thank you Hilton Bonnet Creek!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful facilities, service beyond expected”
Reviews.Author: KarlS600
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel at the conclusion of our vacation in Florida over the Christmas/New Year Holidays. For a very reasonable price we got a higher-floor, Disneyworld-view room. The convenient departure and pick-up schedule of the free Disneyworld shuttle allowed us to enjoy a full day at Epcot center. The Harvest Bistro restaurant was easy on our budget, had good food and great service. We really enjoyed the facilities and the helpful staff during our stay, but the help from the staff did not stop there. At check-out the hotel's valet parking team helped us locate the self-parked rental car in the parking carage next door and took us to it - no charge. A great hotel for a retired couple that wants to spend a few care-free days in luxury surroundings for an easy-on-the-budget price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great service and value”
Reviews.Author: Florida_Family_Trip
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2nd time with 2 kids (6 & 3) who love this place. The pool / slide / lazy river is their favorite. The rooms are new, very clean and comfortable, even the soap and shampoo is nice (according to my wife). The staff is consistently friendly and helpful, even upgrading us to a room with a Disney view without prompting. I highly recommend this hotel to everyone I know. We have stayed at various Disney "deluxe" villas and hotels, and this place is much, much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Hilton during the Marathon weekend”
Reviews.Author: MaryandTodd
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is a beautiful hotel with fabulous service. We were at Disney for the marathon weekend. We were pleasantly surprised when we went to the lobby the morning of the run and were treated to coffee and breakfast items that were perfect for prerace food. The hotel also provided very comfortable and efficient transportation to and from the run. We also used the shuttles to the parks. Again, very efficient and comfortable. What a treat. We had room service one night for dinner and it was every bit as delcious as what we ate in the restaurants in the hotel. The beds were very comfortable and the daily cleaning services were excellent. We would definitely stay at this hotel again and would recommend it to friends and family! Oh-a bonus-coffee machines and refrigerators in the room!

Reviews.Title: “First class resort”
Reviews.Author: Morgan B
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Hilton Bonnet Creek. It is a beautiful resort with exceptional service. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a luxurious resort on the Disney property. The shuttle was quick and dependable, even during the busy Holiday season. Wonderful restaurants and a great pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: joscco
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 10 days as part of a family vacation to Orlando. The property is conveniently located within Disneyworld,it has an excellent bus shuttle service to the parks(our car didn't once leave the parking garage) and is very much geared to familys. The rooms are nicely appointed and the hotel layout is fairly straightforward.The food is as you would expect,decent breakfast and a choice of restraunts. Probably the hotels main "Wow factor" is the pool area which is superb. Our family had a quick vote and decided it was better than our other two Orlando favourites pools at the Hyatt Grand Cypress and Grand Floridian. Not much else to say ,if you book this hotel you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Awesome Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: litesprite
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for marathon weekend in January 2012 I highly recommend it, the runners were treated very well. All the staff were friendly and helpful, and the hotel is immaculate. The morning send-off was really fun, the staff was very encouraging and they had a free breakfast for runners so it was one less thing to worry about on race morning. I loved that they had the 'Where's Shadi' and 'Guess Your Time' contests, it made the events that much more fun, and I managed to find Shadi! The pool was a wonderful place to relax after running and the restaurants were awesome. Best steak I've ever had at La Luce!

Reviews.Title: “Great Non-Disney Hotel Close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: redshoegirl
Reviews.Content: There for conference but had extra day to play. Bought one-day pass for Disney/Epcot in gift shop. Same price as gate but didn't have to wait in line. Hotel has great shuttle to Disney (every 1/2 hr) and Epcot (every hour). It was great, Epcot pickup point is pretty close to park entrance. Hotel has great pool area. Showed dive-in movies first night we were there. Rooms are nice. Only issue I had was bathroom...low slow flush toilets, TP roll is located around and behind you (long awkward stretch to get it), and just shower (no tub). Not sure if all rooms are like this but would be hard to shower kids if you need to help them. Shower door constantly leaked between wall and first panel, pooling water on floor after every shower. It's ok, rooms are clean, but kind of a design flaw if you ask me. Bonus points for real containers of 1/2 and 1/2 instead of powdered stuff. :). And towels had kind of an almond scent to them. Very nice. Nice concierges, checkin staff.

Reviews.Title: “Family Celebrations”
Reviews.Author: bruce b
Reviews.Content: We visitied Orlando the week after New Years to celebrate my daughterâ€™s birthday, her graduation, and our anniversary. I chose the Hilton Bonnet Creek because of the positive experience I enjoyed on several other stays. This most recent trip exceeded my expectations and stands out as an excellent example that separates the Hilton Bonnet Creek from most of my other Hotel experiences. The Concierge staff made us feel quite special. Particulary commend Concierge Reagan Neel for her role in coordinating many of the efforts associated with our visit. Stop by the concierge's desk and say hello to Reagan or any of her peers if you need assistance.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge desk goes above and beyond!”
Reviews.Author: 1nanana
Reviews.Content: My husband, 2 young daughters and myself went for my birthday which is December 24. My husband arranged a surprise with the concierge and arranged for a babysitter on Christmas Eve at 6pm. He had the concierge go out and buy my souvenirs from the gift shop with my favorite princess on all of them. The concierge took it a step further and sent up sparkling wine and chocolate covered strawberries, complementary. The set up everything while the sitter was there in the room with our little ones. It truely was a miracle Christmas.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: Chrissy61
Reviews.Content: New, quiet, clean, great room service, comfy bed, strong shower, nice toiletries

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: JimBennett
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for GoDisney runners' weekend. Beautiful pool area, friendly staff, great restaurants. Very relaxing hotel near Disney. What a pleasure to it is to stay there. We travel to Disney a few times a year and Bonnet Creek Hilton is the only place we'll stay from now on!

Reviews.Title: “A good Hotel but not a great one...”
Reviews.Author: Captain_0veur
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 5 nights, overall I would say it is a nice Hotel but don't get the rave reviews here. Upside is that the room was spacious, very clean and new (as the whole Hotel) and the staff was very nice and helpful. But overall I expected a bit more considering the other reviews here. Some issues that prevent a higher rating from me: My room was right across the room where the housekeeping crew kept their stuff, there was quite some noise (e.g. people shouting to each other) because of that. Since I was hardly in the room this was not a big deal, otherwise I would probably have asked for a different room. In my opinion the "lazy river" pool is a joke, the deepest part is less than one meter deep and some other parts are ridiculously shallow. Furthermore the current which takes you around is just too strong, it really takes out all the fun of swimming (actually it is just floating). The restaurants all had a pretty one-dimensional menu and little variety, some of the food was quite greasy. Overall I think it is a nice Hotel if you want to take your family to Disney, otherwise the location is very inconvenient and the price is a bit on the high side.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay that keeps us coming back”
Reviews.Author: Live4animals
Reviews.Content: Our family has stayed there3 times now, it is our go to hotel when going to Disney. My family loves the lazy rivers and the closeness to the parks. The staff is lovely and the rooms are nice as well. It has many great restaurants and a Disney store where you can go and buy your tickets as early as 7:30 am. I would defiantly recommend staying there if you are visiting disney!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for letting me breathe!”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelingProf
Reviews.Content: When I travel, sometimes it is a miserable experience as I'm allergic to feathers - down pillows often give me headaches. This is the first time I've had the opportunity to stay in an allergy-free room. The room uses an air purifier and has all foam pillows. It was a great, pain-free experience for me. Thank you Hilton!!!! Lazy river is nice. Wish the lounge chairs at poolside were padded so that they are more comfy. Evening movies at the pool were a hit with the kids. Very friendly and helpful staff. Free shuttle bus to the Disney parks is a nice perk for staying here. Hope to go back...

Reviews.Title: “Treat Yourself”
Reviews.Author: hokumplus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel while our kids went to Disney. The hotel is new and spacious, and makes a great place to relax poolside for anyone that doesn't really want the Disney experience. Waiters circulate around the pool area taking drink and food orders. Rooms are spacious, with the usual coffee makers and small fridge. The health club is great, with about 20 different cardio machines, free weights, stretching area, towels and a water cooler (which I didn't see at first -- look behind the sign advertising yoga, near the entrance). The package we booked included the buffet breakfast, which was plentiful and varied, with lots of healthy options. Service at the hotel was uniformly upbeat and helpful, including the concierge desk staff. We had booked a Disney view room but never managed to see fireworks, unfortunately. We may not have known where to look, so if you want to see fireworks from your room, check with front desk staff to make sure you know when and where to be looking. The pool area is entirely devoted to the lazy river, with a few areas off to the side that are outside the 'river'. The water is shallow and if you are interested in lap swimming, this is probably not the pool for you. It is great for kids, however, with entry in some places that allows little ones to just walk into the water on a very gentle slope. Although we didn't investigate this option, we understood that the facilities at the adjacent property, the Waldorf Astoria, are available also to Hilton guests. The pool area at the Waldorf Astoria seems to be a better place for adult/lap swimming.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in the Disney Area”
Reviews.Author: DisneyFan51
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel many times and never have been disappointed. The hotel is a short distance from Disney. They have their own bus which takes you to the parks and they are far superior to Disneys buses and always ion time. The hotel itself is beautiful all the common areas and the rooms -- very modern and comfortable. The pool area with lazy river and hot tubs are great after a day at the parks. We skipped the parks several days just to enjoys the facilities at the hotel. There is also a nice gym and two great restaurants. Our favorite is the pizza at La Luce. Also the buffet breakfast is another favorite. Overall a great luxury hotel for about half the price of the Disney hotels. One negative self parking is $13 a day -- a little pricey and lazy river tubs are $5 a day to rent. Buy your own if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay at Disney - Staff goes above and beyond!”
Reviews.Author: Addison M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the WDW Marathon Weekend and could not have been happier. Both my husband and I were running and were surprised when the staff greeted us upon check-in with race goody-bags and informed us they would be providing a pre-race breakfast for all runners and transportation to the event. The mornings of the races the staff were out wishing the runners well and cheering us on. They were also there when we returned to take photos and congratulate us. The staff really went above and beyond for the runners staying at their hotel, it was really impressive. We stayed in a "Disney View" room with a king bed. The bed was very comfortable and the room has curtains that block most of the light making the rooms perfect for a good nights sleep. The bathrooms were nice, clean, and the hotel supplies Peter Thomas Roth shampoo, soap, and lotion. The rooms also have a coffee maker and Lavazza Coffee which is very good. We didn't make use of the gym, but it too looked very nice and clean with a good selection of workout equipment and cardio machines. The lazy river is a lot of fun and the Jacuzzi was very relaxing. Bottom line, this hotel has an excellent staff and provides a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Walt Disney World Marathon”
Reviews.Author: Chase B
Reviews.Content: The hotel was more than I expected, the food was delicious, the service superior and the staff was incredibly friendly. The hotel made us feel like rock stars. The resort was very clean and the pool atmosphere was sooo relaxing. When I saw our room, I thought we had been upgraded as it was beautiful and the beds - heavenly!! I would recommend the hotel as THE place to stay in the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Razystacy123
Reviews.Content: We chose this resort for our our stay. We didn't want to stay on property at any of the theme parks because we were visiting several different ones. We got a great price for 8 nights and it included an awesome buffet breakfast for the entire family. The hotel is VERY clean, service is great. I would have ditched the themed parks and just hung out by the pool for 7days if it weren't for the kids! We all loved the lazy river and the pool felt great considering it was the end of Dec beginning of Jan. I am very picky about the pl

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort; very accommodating staff”
Reviews.Author: ATLsoccerdad
Reviews.Content: We stayed there at Thanksgiving as a part of a large group (team) attending the Disney soccer tournament. The location is excellent, right around the corner/short drive to WWoS. Their shuttle service to the Disney properties is excellent also, with convenient times. They do a great job catering to the teams and while I know they can not accommodate all requests, the staff were very helpful for our team when needed. This is our second time at this property and would definitely stay there for any trip to Orlando. Lastly, the restaurants - incl La Luce - are very good and fairly reasonable. Like other reviewers, ask for or upgrade to a room with a view of the pool/golf course...it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay, cant wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: rymorse
Reviews.Content: This resort was incredible. It was a nice change of pace from the Disney Resorts or the hotels in the DownTown Disney area. The property is "in Disney" but is not a Disney Hotel. We booked for a quick weekend and got a great rate. Check In was nice and fast, very professional staff. I think it took us all of less then 5 minuets to check in and start walking to the room. I have read other reviews that complained about the "Disney View" not being of the Castle, or other major icons, but that is slightly impossible becasue the hotel is situated and where its located. The hotel is a little over 5 miles away from Magic Kingdom, so unless your superman your not going to be able to sit in your room and look at the castle. If thats what you are looking for, best to book the Disney Hotels around the lake by the park. Back to this amazing hotel. We alomost forgot we were in Disney expect for the one store at the far end of the loby by the Ball Rooms that sold disney merchandise. The room was very large, with all top of the line furnishings. Furnature was dark hard woods, bathroom was polished granet countertops, bathroom was a large glass stall shower. The bed was prefect, we fell asleep right away. The rooms black out blinds were thick, so thick that at 9am, if you didnt look at a clock or go pull the blinds aside you would not know it was daylight outside. The pool looked very nice, however with lows in the upper 40's and highs in the 60's we did not want to get in. It has a long lazy river with bridges and fountains all over. If I am able to go back I plan to utalize the area. The lounge chars were made of a nice mesh rather then plastic straps. We did have brekfast down at the Harvest Bistro. The buffet was nice, its was $20.00 per person, and concidering somewhere like "Chef Mickeys" that has 1/2 the slections cost 2x more it was well worth it. They had everything you would expect, and an omlet and beljan waffel station. Parking was the only downside to the entire resort/hotel. Parking is in an adjancened parking garrage, which is nice, you car is in shade (unless you park on the top), and its very secure with security cameras everythwere. However, the only blemish on an othersie perfect stay would be the valet drivers. They go flying through the lot, sometimes a bit recklessly. I am glad I chose to park myself and not let them take my car, I would be worryed of letting them drive it after I saw how they drove in the garrage.

Reviews.Title: “a great base for disney - best hilton i've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Crumbdog
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Sept 2011, the overall experience was great for a family that has kids, this is not to say it was over run with kids as we hardly saw any, and i believe this would also be a fantastic hotel for any type of traveller. The location I felt was spot on, nice quiet area slightly away from the main highways but simple and quick to get onto the I4 and also very simple to get to the Disney parks as well as restaurants and bars located one junction up off the I4. firstly, the hotel pool is a great time passer as it has a slid for the young ones and a gentle lazy river to go round on, on a inflatable tyre. The pool temperature is also warm enough to make it inviting. the location is top notch for the Disney parks, we used the hotel shuttle several times to Downtown Disney, Magic kingdom and Animal Kingdom, it was always on time, ran from 9am-11pm, the coach was clean, tidy and easily identifiable and showed Disney movies onboard to get you into the Disney spirit.... on to the rooms, we were allocated a standard twin room which we found large, had great comfy beds, flat screen TV with endless channels, fridge, the usual essentials and plenty of storage area. The bathroom was of high standard, however I enjoy highly pressurised showers and this one was a bit lame. The grounds of the hotel were accumulate, the dÃ©cor was smart and the inside of the hotel including the lobby and communal areas were spotless. There was a nice coffee shop and also an authorised Disney store within the hotel which could sell Disney tickets if you required them. I didnâ€™t unfortunately have chance to eat within the hotel as we were out most days at one of the numerous attractions however the bars looked like busy and popular hotspots on a Friday and Saturday night. If I had to point out a few negatives, firstly the parking cost feels like you are being robbed daily, $13 US to park within the hotel, over a week to get a near $100 bill feels like the hotel are just squeezing its clients. Secondly, there was no kettle, just a coffee maker within the room, admittedly it was fairly easy to make tea from this, but if you only have 2 plastic disposal cups a day, this is not enough for anything more than 1 round of drinks. So, in summary, if you have kids and are looking for a high standard hotel near Disney and the Lake Buena Vista area, this comes highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Marathon Weekend Champs!!!”
Reviews.Author: ZMTampaRunner
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for the Disney Marathon & Half Marathon weekend. This property went beyond the extra mile to cater to all the runners. I have never experienced so much pre-thought on how to cater to us as runners. The whole team, obviously lead by their GM, went out of their way to recognize what runners want and need. Special welcome gifts, early morning coffee and runner oriented pre-run breakfast. Cheer squad even welcomed all runners as the returned to the hotel on the property provided shuttler bus. Great job folks, we were truly impressed!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: mccala
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hilton Bonnet Creek because we didn't want to stay in the Disney hotels whilst on a short trip to Disneyworld. It's in a great quiet location, there are free buses that take you to any of the parks so its very easy to get around. We walked back from Downtown Disney one night which proved to be quite difficult with no paths (sidewalks), so I guess everyone drives in Orlando! Rooms are big, plenty of room and we had a nice view over the pool and Disney castle in the background. Breakfast was good, but not a lot of healthy choices, but the staff were fabulous and very friendly! Pool and gym were also very good. Great for families, couples.

Reviews.Title: “10th Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: S G
Reviews.Content: We just spent 5 nights at this property. We expected good service and nice accommodations, but both exceeded our expectations - which is why i am taking the time to write this. I recommend this hotel on the basis of great service, a wonderful room, beautiful amenities and a great location. If you enjoy Disney parks you'll appreciate the bus shuttle which runs very often - very convenient. Service in the restaurants was stellar along with the food. Be sure to take a nice walk around the property which includes the Waldorf Astoria next door. We are anxious to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Rating would be excellent if ...”
Reviews.Author: wakingdragonink
Reviews.Content: Very Good because its great looking hotel. Close to everything. Superb amenities. Wonderful Staff all of whom called me "Mr. ...." instead of saying "you guys" or worse using my first name. Fabulous La Luce restaurant where we dined almost every night. Would be excellent if only the muzak in the pool area was not so loud. I'm certain that many guests would enjoy a quieter area without speakers in the bushes so that they can relax. The Waldorf Astoria next door has a far more relaxing ambience.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: Tami216
Reviews.Content: This was our first vacation in about 12 years and I wanted it to be memorable for my children as my son is in his senior year of high school and will be joining the military soon. We drove from Virginia and arrived at the hotel about 11am, knowing check in was not for several hours. My husband came back with us not only checked in, but checked into a suite for an OUTSTANDING price. The hotel as I walked in was immaculate and beautifully decorated for Christmas. Our room was too die for!! We travel quit a bit for soccer and I have NEVER seen a hotel so beautiful, with such amazing views. The pool was fantastic, especially with the movies every night. Every staff member that we came in contact with were friendly, knowledgeable and so helpful. We had an incredible Christmas Vacation at the Bonnet Creek and recommend it to anyone for any type of vacation. Thank you to Alyssa Stephan, a manager at the hotel, for helping to make a beautiful memory for our family.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: Fraulein1020
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference. Comfortable rooms, great pool area, self-parking and great staff made for an easy & enjoyable stay. Great fitness room too.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Orlando Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sue10627
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd time staying at this fabulous hotel! The hotel,pool area and restaurants are amazing. We were upgraded to the most beautiful suite I have ever stayed in. One of the perks of staying here is that they have their own bus for transporting you to the Disney Parks. The staff is warm and welcoming. We will be back this summer with the grandkids. Can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay in the Orlando area! From yardman12.”
Reviews.Author: William E
Reviews.Content: My wife and I first stayed at HBC very shortly after it opened. You would have thought the hotel had been open for a long,long time. Absolutely no problems at all. Tracy Walker, GM, and her great staff had a flawless start and it has continued and gotten even better. The staff can't seem to do enough for you to make your stay a memorable occasion. Solo, couple, or family, this hotel has everything you need. Transportation to and from the airport to free transportation to and from Disney World. Food? Plenty of restaurants to cover you from breakfast to dinner. Our favorite is La Luce. And of course, a beautiful pool area. Do your self a favor and book a stay for a great get away. Our thanks to all of the staff for a job always well done and making our stays memorable. And also our thanks to the management for setting such high standards and providing the training and encouragement to your staff to do the wonderful job that they do. From the moment you arrive until the time you leave, you will have a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf luxury at Hilton Prices”
Reviews.Author: Gsandnyc
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Hilton Bonnet Creek and I would highly recommend it for families or for business. The property is very clean and very well run. The room rates were very reasonable both times we stayed there but beware of the hidden charges. Parking and wifi are extra. There are many restaurants on both the Hilton and Waldorf properties. We went out for dinner but breakfast and lunch at any of the restaurants was very good. Don't miss out on walking over to the Waldorf for lunch. The buffet breakfast did get pretty crowded and it's can be too much food. If you order off the menu the portions are more than sufficient. Look for the crazy Italian waiter. He's a lot of fun, great with kids. You'll know him when you see/hear him. The pool with it's lazy river, water slide, and outdoor movies is great for kids. Pretty nice for adults too. We were there for three weekdays before Christmas 2011 and the pool wasn't crowded. Either we picked the right days for our stay or everyone was at Disney. But you could easily keep the family there for the day and let the kids run wild in the pool. I will say that even though 95% of the pool is only 3' deep, I felt there was a lack of lifeguards so I would be careful with smaller children trying to navigate the current and traffic of older kids on the lazy river. You have to rent the inner tubes each day. Pick up a few inflatable pool-style inflatable rafts (Short ones. long won't fit down the river.) and stuff them in your suitcase. The hot tub was only slightly warmer than the pool. Wifi was weak by the pool, which works out if you're trying to kick your internet addiction while on vacation. But I did notice a few people occupying the lobby chairs where they could get better reception. Wifi in the room worked just fine. Typical size hotel gym but all the equipment was new, clean, and worked so well that it made me realize how bad the equipment is at my home gym. The property is connected to the Waldorf via a sizable conference/ballroom center and while I wasn't there on a business trip, I've certainly spent enough time at conferences to be able to size up the place. It's a very nice property for a conference. The Spa at the Waldorf is a little smaller than I was expecting but the massage therapists are very good. Our only real complaint is the music. They've got music piped into every corner of the property from the pool to the parking lot and it's just too much. If I want to listen to music I'll put my headphones on. We felt that we couldn't escape it. A great property and definitely worth looking into. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel with Great Facilities”
Reviews.Author: jboy88
Reviews.Content: This Hilton Bonnet Creek is a fantastic hotel complex in a great location. The resort is massive. Huge lobby area, great restaurants and bars, all very new and clean. It is joined to the Waldorf Astoria next door which is also very luxurious. The Hotel is in a great location. Just slightly away from the theme parks on a quiet private strip overlooking the river and golf course. They have fantastic shuttles to the theme parks throughout the day to get you where you need to go. The rooms are clean, spacious and new. The breakfast in the morning was fantastic. Special mention has to go to John-Paul in the restaurant who really made our stay extra special, serving us each morning and being very entertaining! La Luce was our favourite place to eat in the hotel. Good food! The Gym and Pool area is fantastic! So much so the last day we decided to relax by the pool instead of going to Disney. A great hotel. A great option for those that want to avoid the tacky 'themed' hotels in Disney and enjoy a fantastic new, modern resort with great facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience!”
Reviews.Author: jcthekid
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Honors Diamond (846727921) member from Port Charlotte FL. My family; 5 year-old , 8 year old, my wife and I stayed at the Bonnet Creek hotel for my daughters 5th birthday and to visit Disney. They were kind enough to upgrade us to a parlor suite with a connecting bedroom. Boy, were we blown away by the accommodations! The rooms were some of the nicest I have ever stayed in in family trips to Orlando, or any of my many â€œHilton Adventuresâ€�! There were amazing treats waiting for us when we checked in, including a nice birthday card for Haley, and a carafe of milk, and cookies. It was not only decadent, but very, very thoughtful. While the property (water slide and lazy river) and accommodations were nothing short of excellent, we all agreed that it was your staff that really made the stay what it was; Nicole at the front desk was very friendly, and she even brought up a handmade birthday card for Haley signed by the entire front desk and colored inâ€¦handmade!....then there was Ryan the bellman, who was extremely helpful and very kind and funny to my young children. It really made us feel welcome. Then there was Daniel from housekeeping who was a big help on a couple of occasions. These were just the names I got. The pool staff, and restaurant hostesses, and coffee shop staff were all exceptional. We felt at home away from home. A VERY big, and VERY sincere â€œthank youâ€� from myself and my family to you and your staff for going out of your way to make sure our stay was so memorable (although I donâ€™t think anyone could leave your hotel without thinking they were VIPs!). Please let me know if thereâ€™s anything I can ever do by way of reference, etc. I would appreciate you forwarding this letter on to Hilton corporate. Count on seeing us again at Bonnet Creek!

Reviews.Title: “The only hotel we stay at in Orlando!!!”
Reviews.Author: Renrupp328
Reviews.Content: I can't wait to return again on Friday. We visit the HBC about 6-8 x's a year since we are Disney Season passholders. My kids LOVE the lazy river and pool activities. We loved all the recent holiday decorations for Halloween and the gingerbread house was great. The staff is always wonderful and we are always amazed that they greet us by name and with hugs and open arms. Erika has made it so easy to make my reservations and my stay so comfortable. We love the staff at Harvest Bistro especially Jean Paul and Rocky.. My kids love the napkin surprises they make. The bell staff is very quick especially Joe! We Loved making S'mores at the fire pit after along day in the parks. I recommended HBC to friends who also only stay there now and are returning with us again this weekend. Overall the staff is great and the hotel is beautiful and very clean!!!! Very close to all the Disney Parks. Also the valet staff always leaves us ice cold bottles of water in our car ... A nice surprise!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hilton Property”
Reviews.Author: sanmarc1
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed here December 28 - 31, 2011. It was as close to perfect as it can get. We were booked in a double queen room on the 15th floor overlooking their amazing pool area. Off in the distance were the Disney parks. The room was spacious, comfortable and impeccably clean. I can only find one fault with the room and that is the shower nozzle. My preference is one that allows me to adjust how the water streams and this one did not. The maid service was timely and turn down in the evening happened seamlessly. We valeted the car for $20 a day. The car stayed in the garage our entire visit because we used the shuttle service to go to the Magic Kingdom one day and the Animal Kingdom the next. The shuttle driver warned us that because the parks were so crowded that they had not been permitted into the A.K. for pick ups the previous day and that it was possible we would need to take the Disney shuttle to the transfer center where the Hilton/Waldorf shuttle would definitely be able to pick up. We did not have this issue, but it was nice to be warned of the possibility. The shuttle picked up and dropped off at the times stated, making it easy to plan accordingly. One afternoon we took advantage of the pool and hot tub. The pool is zero-entry making it easy for young children and older people to enter. There is a lazy river wrapping around the pool complex. The depth is no more than 3 feet. A tube for the river can be rented for $5 a day. The beach towels are plentiful so take two in order to cover the lounge chair completely. Each evening we could see people down in the pool enjoying a movie on a huge screen. Around the entire complex of the Hilton and Waldorf is a nice walking/jogging trail. It is about a mile in total and it's a nice way to unwind or get a little exercise. Each morning we ate the Harvest Bistro. We were there fairly early around 7am and never had issue with waiting. We opted to eat from the menu rather than the buffet. They have a delicious smoothie and zucchini muffin combo. They also serve the most delicious arugula (drizzled with a touch of olive oil and sprinkling of salt) alongside their omelets. I never would have thought to have arugula with breakfast, but I will now! My brother ordered toast with his omelet and said it was very good bread. It looked rustic and homemade. One of the evenings we popped into Zeta to have a cocktail because it was quieter than the lobby bar. We ended up having an excellent sushi dinner there in addition to the cocktail we went in to have. I'm wondering if this restaurant recently opened because the staff still seemed to be getting their bearings and tweaking their service a little. No matter, they were attentive and wanted to make certain we were enjoying everything we tried. There is also a Disney Store near Zeta at the end of the lobby. While it's not huge like the Disney Store in Downtown Disney, it did have a nice assortment of last minute gift items that we were able to purchase for family members. The store also has the normal hotel store sundries. On the evening of the 30th the Hilton treated guests to fireworks over the golf course. I don't know if this was done because of year end or if they periodically have fireworks to entertain the guests. Regardless, it was a nice surprise. Would I stay here again? Absolutely! It is a lovely hotel and a wonderful alternative to staying in one of the Disney properties when you are planning a Disney trip.

Reviews.Title: “New Hilton, great rooms and close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: MtlFire
Reviews.Content: I was here for a business trip. The conference was actually located at the Downtown Disney Hilton but considering that the rates were the same and this hotel was new I decided to stay here and deal with a 5 minute drive. The hotel offers self parking (for a fee), but I used the valet for my entire stay. The car was always quickly available and I was greeted by name each time I called down. I arrived late so checkin was a breeze. The front desk staff were friendly and very welcoming. As a hhonors Diamond I was upgraded to Disney view room on a upper floor and provided with certificates to eat the continental breakfast in the Harvest Bistro restaurant. The certificates were also accepted in the coffee lounge (not the bar) off the main lobby. In the restaurant they could be upgraded for 6$ to the full buffet. The room was your typical modern Hilton decor. It had a walk-in shower (no tub). I personally love a large shower so this was a great plus. You would be surprised how many Hilton's haven't even upgraded to a curved shower rod yet. There's always some sort of conference going on so there's always activity in the lobby level bar area. There's a more dance style club a little farther down (towards the Waldorf) that plays TOP40 music with a DJ. Both were quiet busy during my entire stay. I don't have any kids but the pool area if a kids paradise. The whole pool complex is surrounded by a lazy river (you have to rent tubes if you want) and offers several beach entries. There's a slide as well as at least two hot tubs located around. Unfortunately as the pool area is fenced in it gets locked down -- which prevents late hot tub use. The hotel had a great Gym area with a ton of cardio equipment. Oddly enough I couldn't find any steam/sauna/locker area?! Hard to believe you'd neglect this in a new construction. The Waldorf and Hilton share bus service to the parks which runs about ever 30 mins. Or you could do some "shopping" at downtown Disney and leave your car there and use the Disney transportation system. Although I'm sure Disney doesn't appreciate this, so don't tell them I suggested it. (That's the downside of this Hilton, as the other ones at Downtown Disney you can easily walk over). With the new construction, great pool complex, I'd stay back at this Hilton before any of the other ones at Downtown Disney if the rates were acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Our happy holidays at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Lee4Vaca
Reviews.Content: From December 24-31, 2011, we enjoyed our second stay at HOBC. As much as I have enjoyed our stays at various Disney deluxe resorts, it's going to be really hard to justify paying more than twice as much for a Disney hotel when we know how great the Hilton is. We had stayed for three nights during Spring Break for less than $190/night. This time, I booked a 2-queen room with HHonors points and selected e-upgrades for a high floor and a suite. When the e-upgrades came though ($135 per night), we were absolutely blown away by the size of the "parlor"; it is equal to two rooms. You can see an example floor plan at http://www.hilton.com/en/hotels/content/ORLHHHH/media/pdf/en_ORLHHHH_Hilton_Deluxe_Suite.pdf. 1,200+ square feet were more than our family of 4 knew what to do with. The leather couch was comfortable enough for one to sleep on as-is, though it is a queen-size foldout. In addition to all the extra furniture, it was nice to have that huge open space by the wet bar where we could leave all out luggage, still easily accessible but completely out of the way. Service was nearly impeccable throughout our stay. Staff knew my name in just about every instance when they could reasonably be expected to find out. Little extra touches make me suspect that they were also aware of my Diamond status. The only miss was one time (out of seven) that I requested my car from the valet and it took nearly 30 minutes (with two additional asks) before I had it. The quick valet service every other time enables me to recommend wholeheartedly that you choose the $20/day (plus tips) valet over $13 self-parking. The housekeepers were unobtrusively efficient in both daily cleaning and nightly turndown. On Christmas day, Rosa fashioned a few towels into a lovely basket of flowers. Regrettably our plans took us away from the hotel for most meals, except one lunch at the poolside restaurant Beech, a light dinner from room service, and most breakfasts at the Harvest Bistro. The breakfast buffet exceeds expectations in this family-oriented market where hotels can easily get away with less. In particular, the omelet station works much faster than I am used to seeing at either standalone restaurants or hotels like Embassy Suites. During busy holiday periods like Christmas week, get down to the Bistro before 8:30 to avoid waits of 45 minutes or more for a table. Because I have free theme park parking with my WDW annual pass, I used the theme park bus service only once, to go to Animal Kingdom. The bus makes two pickups, one at the Hilton and one at the Waldor, then goes to Magic Kingdom, and finally to AK. A second bus line goes to Hollywood Studios, Epcot, and Downtown Disney. Since DD is only about 5 miles away, I recommend a taxi instead of the 45-minute bus ride. The buses are luxury coaches with reclining seats. Other reviewers have made clear the very high level of HOBC's facilities. I would just point out that the lazy river is unmatched by any Disney hotel pool, including Stormalong Bay. The holiday decorations, while perhaps not Disney-quality, were certainly superior by any other standard. Our seven nights at HOBC flew by and my family is looking forward to our next visit. Next time, we'll make more of an effort to try all the restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Disney View=ZERO! Customer Service=Zero!!! Shame, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sparkii
Reviews.Content: As a HHonors member this was the worst experience ever at any hotel. Our Disney View (?) room overlooked the convention center roof and the UNDEVELOPED disney property, requested a move, checked back 4 HOURS LATER as they never called us as promised, and they tried to give us the same room and said there was "no note on the file we were waiting for a move" - thanks Front Desk - great job! Next they tried to put us in a handicapped room without telling us it was one - found out when we got to the room. We are not handicapped and having relatives that are found it appalling they don't hold these rooms for such. Next the front desk manager offered us a NON-Disney View for the SAME PRICE! Really!!!!! Word to the wise - when booking, ask them what a Disney View really is and don't pay in advance!

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: Chris P
Reviews.Content: Despite being a regular traveller I have never felt compelled to write a review on trip advisor until now. As a family with children 5 and 4 visiting Disney over the busy Christmas period this hotel was perfect for our needs from start to finish and the hotel should be very proud of the service they provide at a fairly reasonable price too. The pool set up is outstanding for young children with a depth of no greater than 3 feet, a lazy river and a slide which they loved. The pool attendants were friendly and attentive to my kids and the facilities spotlessly clean. Even though the hotel is very close to the action at Disney you would not know this due to the quiet setting overlooking the golf course to the rear. The breakfast at the Harvest restaurant was high quality and good value as the kids eat for free. This hotel is top notch and I would highly recommend to anyone looking for a high class hotel in the Disney area.

Reviews.Title: “perfect!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: julie012200
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at many 5 star resorts and this hotel rivals many of those. What a delight to have such a superb hotel in the land of Disney. The service, rooms, restaurants, pool, overall cleanliness of the property, value, etc is spectacular. This was our 3rd stay and yet again, we were not disappointed. As a testament to the hotels superior service...during our latest stay in December, I checked out and was at the airport when I realized that I left my jewelry in the room safe. I called the hotel and told them my flight left in 30 mins and would they please check the safe and let me know if they recovered the jewelry, so that I wouldn't be sick to my stomach the whole flight home. Within 20 minutes, they called to tell me they had my jewelry and were sending it right out. I received it less than 24 hours later! ALL of it!! And...they told me to consider the fedex charges my Christmas present!!! This is something you would expect from a Four Seasons or Ritz Carlton...but the Hilton Bonnet Creek is definitely on the same level in my opinion. The pool for my 6 and 8 year old boys was awesome...music perfect, layout perfect, lazy river awesome. Meal plan for free breakfast and dinner for kids under 12 was a great value included with your rate. Overall, really impressed with the hotel, service, and staff. Can't say enough great things!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at beautiful place!”
Reviews.Author: girlstar28
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the stay here. The grounds are beautiful and the rooms are of a good size and very comfortable. Pool is great and beautiful to look at. Really loved it here!

Reviews.Title: “High Class, Brilliant Hotel *****”
Reviews.Author: Jack J
Reviews.Content: The hilton bonnet creek orlando is placed inside Disney World. The hotel offers a bus service to and from all Disney World Parks. All the staff in the hilton bonnet creek are all very friendly and will bend over backwards for any guest. The hotel is very clean and they take their cleanliness very seriously. The restaurants inside the hotel are to very high standards and offer the best food, even the pool bar serves brilliant and tasty food. The pool area is the best i have ever seen. The pool is divided into two main pools which connect via lazy river, which you may hop on and off whenever. There are multiple jacuzzis around the pool. Every night the hotel brings a huge projector screen out where they play classic disney films for all guests to watch whilst floating in the pool. The hotel layout is amazing and breath taking, very single thing is to the highest of standards. The hotel is maintained very well, and if you stay there you will notice that there are staff watering and cutting plants and grass all day long. The hotel add little touches everyday example of this is everyday staff will arrange towels on sun loungers to spell different words like, "good morning", "good day", "enjoy life", "be happy" and so on. This hotel is truly an amazing hotel and if you stay in orlando you must stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Stevesyr1
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean, modern and very nice. We had a couple issues with the water in the sink not working right and the fridge had to be plugged in (not as obvious as it seems), but they fixed those items quickly. The pool and lazy river are spectacular. The zero entry to the pool was perfect for our almost 4 year old. They arranged towels every morning to spell out a cool saying - this could be seen from our room. The food everywhere was excellent. Lunch and dinner poolside were very reasonable price-wise but breakfast at the restaurant was very expensive. It was a great buffet though. Very close to all in Disney. While free transportation is offered, it can take a lot of time out of your day. The bus makes all the rounds and coming back from Magic Kingdom took about 45 minutes. After that, we just used our car. The parking garage was a bit of a pain as the key swipe didn't always work and we had to press the button for assistance. But, bottom line from the 3 year old to the 70 year old, the place was loved by all of us. We checked out the Waldorf while we were there, and for a family, we thought the Hilton won hands down.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort Style Hotel with Great activities for kids and Awesome Restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Cabinfever2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awesome; the hotel is first class from check in to check out. Rooms very nice updated and clean. Pool is amazing with the lazy river!! Plenty of chairs for all guests. There are fireplaces that are on at night (nice touch) we sat by them one evening. There is a pool side lunch/snack area that has a great menu - the drinks are sooo good. There is a separate small pool with a slide next to the larger pool. There was an activity menu put out each evening for the following day that also had shuttle times for Disney. We had dinner at the Italian Restaurant (La Luce) that was simply out of this world. There were 11 other eating places to dine as this hotel is attached to the Waldor Astoria - both hotels are beautiful!!! We had breakfast (buffet) at Harvest Bistro - also very good. Service from main desk, restaurants and the concierge desk was first class. So helpful. The concierge desk made our car arrangements to return to the airport. Close by Disney - right next to the Waldorf Astoria Golf Club course....stunning grounds!!! Price was exceptional.......book early as it seems to be a busy and hot hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Adrienne K
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Hilton Bonnet Creek hotel numerous times during the last two years and we keep coming back. Perfect for families (Waldorf is also on the property and beautiful but Hilton is much better for families). The hotel is new, clean and well-kept, staff is friendly and courteous and eager to please. We haven't even gone to the Disney parks this year because my almost 4-year-old has too much fun in the amazing pool and lazy river and with all the planned activities for kids. We have celebrated Easter, Thanksgiving and Christmas here and it's like being with family. We love it! All the friends we have brought with us also have great things to say about this hotel. I highly recommend it: great value (all sorts of package deals to please everyone), it is on the Disney property, nice courtesy shuttle bus to the 4 Disney parks, Disney Store on site and kids eat for free. And the beds are so comfortable, we get the best rest! From the valets (Jose and his amazing team), to bellmen to front desk receptionists, restaurant servers (ask for Omar, Rocky or John-Paul in Harvest Bistro, they are great with children) to the housekeeping staff, everyone has been consistently wonderful to us. We will not go to another hotel, we prefer to keep returning to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: NY2theWorld
Reviews.Content: My sis and I surprised my Mom with a Mother's Day trip to this resort and it was all we imagined and then some! The pool was great, the lazy river was so relaxing, the pool slide was super fun, the poolside bar has great food/drinks at great prices, the room was super nice and comfie and the staff was very courteous. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: PedroFll
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 3 nights at this hotel and it was more than I expected been close to the Waldorf and not not been it. Staff worked really hard no make our stay outstanding. Hotel is completely new, lazy river was great and breakfast at the bistro very convinient and complete. If you stay definately enjoy the facilities! Worth every $$$.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely flawless”
Reviews.Author: ickle_jay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel just prior to Christmas, whilst spending a week in Orlando, and could not fault it in any way. We were made to feel extremely welcome the entire time we were there (special thanks to Brenda in the Harvest Bistro, who took the time to show us around the buffet on our first morning), and as I was celebrating my birthday during our stay we were given a complimentary dessert in La Luce on our first night, and a massive slice of chocolate fudge cake on my birthday itself! The concierge also made sure that the restaurant in the hotel next door, where we ate on my birthday, was aware of the date and we were given seats by the window with views of the Epcot fireworks, together with another complimentary dessert! Our room was spacious with two large and very comfortable beds, and we had a view out over the pool and over towards one of the Disney hotels. The soundproofing was excellent - we didn't hear anything from the nearby lifts, other guests or anyone in the corridor. As we were with Virgin, we also had the use of the concierge lounge, together with free Internet, up on the 16th floor, which was extremely handy. The pool is lovely, although if you're wanting to do some serious swimming it would be better to head to the Waldorf next door (guests of either hotel can use the facilities at both), as the pool at the Hilton is very shallow and dominated by the lazy river. There is also a water slide and two hot tubs, which were the perfect way to relax after a busy day at the Disney parks! They do "dive in movies" each night as well - an inflatable cinema screen pops up and popular movies are aired for people to watch whilst sitting around the pool. The hotel runs free shuttles to the Disney parks - the timetable seems to change from week to week so ask at reception for the most up to date one. They also run town cars to Downtown Disney, which were very reasonable. As we also wanted to go to Universal, Sea World and Discovery Cove, we booked shuttle passes through Virgin with Mears - the times aren't wonderfully flexible but at a $19 per person return journey, you save a lot on taxis! The hotel has two main restaurants - the Harvest Bistro, where we had breakfast each morning, and La Luce. There is also a pool bar, where we had lunch one day. All of the restaurants were excellent, as was the Bull and Bear at the Waldorf, but I found the choices at La Luce a tad restricted, and the wine at the Bull and Bear was VERY expensive! I can highly recommend the omelettes for breakfast and also the quattro formaggi pizza in La Luce (although not if you're a vegetarian as it's topped with ham!). The only note of caution I would sound is that if you're waiting to use the poolside restrooms (which are incredibly clean), beware of the bitey ants. A few of them got my foot a week ago and I still have the bite marks!

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay at Hilton Bonnet Creek”
Reviews.Author: kitkatdaisy
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Hilton Bonnet Creek. We stayed last year right after it opened. I can confidently say that the hotel was just as great this time as the last. This visit we stayed from the Wed before Christmas until Christmas Eve day. Check in was a breeze, it took less than five minutes. We asked for a room overlooking the pool and were given just that. We even were allowed to check in at 11 am. We booked the amazing Florida resident rate of $111/ night, which included free breakfast every day. The room was immaculately clean and the beds were very comfortable. The only complaint is that the air conditioner could have cooled the room a little faster. After dropping our bags off we took the shuttle bus that takes you to all the parks on Disney property. The bus is a full sized coach and the driver furnished us with all the necessary information about when pick up was and also what time each park closed. One morning we ordered room service which arrived very quickly and was followed up by a phone call from in room dining inquiring if the meal was to our liking. The other mornings we ate at the buffet in the Harvest restaurant. We never had to wait more than 5 minutes for a table. The breakfast buffet was very good including fresh baked pastries, bagels, lox, made to order omelets, cereals both hot and cold, fresh fruit and many other items. On our last evening we returned from Epcot to find that our room had not been cleaned. I called the front desk, not to complain, but to simply let them be aware that our room was missed. They apologized. The next morning I received a phone call from housekeeping who apologized again, and was offered compensation that more than made up for the oversight. I was so pleasantly surprised by this. We checked out on Christmas Eve day, gave our bags to the bellman, and spent most of the afternoon by the wonderful resort pool before driving home. The pool area is large but not massive. It includes a zero entry area for kids, and also a lovely lazy river. My son loved that this year he was tall enough to do the water slide. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. For a short family trip to Disney, the Hilton Bonnet Creek is an excellent choice. The price point for Florida residents cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience - My Letter to Hilton Corporate”
Reviews.Author: sam e
Reviews.Content: It's not usual that i will take a moment to write a letter regarding my experience with a company. In most cases, if i do, it's usually to comment on the poor service i've received. Imagine my joy to finally get to write a letter that commends a company for living up to its marketing and service. Over Thanksgiving week my family (wife & son, age 9) stayed at the Bonnet Creek Hilton. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left, our stay was nothing short of excellent. From the check-in, valet, cleaning crew, etc. everyone made us feel at home, were attentive and very courteous. The food was excellent, service impeccable and all amenities were of the highest standards. While everyone should be noted for their excellence, one person in particular deserves mention. Ashley, at the Harvest Bistro, went above and beyond to help our situation. First their was confusion about our Thanksgiving dinner reservation. Without hesitation she made sure that their was seating for us. Then, as my son usually does, made friends with another couple's children. They had not made reservation for Thanksgiving and again, without hesitation, Ashley made sure they would be included at our table. At no time did she consider no an option and made sure that every detail was attended to, She is without a doubt, someone is destined to higher capabilities within your organization. The only low point was the Beach Cafe, and this issue has been addressed with the GM through an email he initiated to me. Again, a good example of following up on a customer's comment and trying to remedy a potential problem. My wife and I run our own small business, and are very conscious of giving our customers high quality, value for their dollar and the upmost customer service. So, it is not uncommon for us to expect the same high standards we give our customers when we are customers ourselves. We are happy to report that your hotel far exceeded those expectations and we have already told many of our friends & customers (several who are headed your way this winter) of our experience at your hotel. Thanks again and we look forward to visiting again in the near future as our son has already asked on several occasions when we might be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Orlando Getaway”
Reviews.Author: mjr-too
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for two nights while at the Epcot Food & Wine festival. The hotel check-in was simple & quick, not pushy, & very helpful with all my questions. The room was clean, nicely decorated and most important, the bed was comfortable! I prefer a softer mattress & my significant other prefers firm. We were both comfortable. The hotel offers bar choicces as well as restaurant choices. It is also ajacent to the Waldorf Astoria & as a guest, you can use their facilities. The lazy man river, & pool selection were something to see & enjoy. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! Best Hilton property I've ever been to - 100% Kid Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Jeff_Cantrell
Reviews.Content: My family stayed on Friday, December 19, 2011 after attending the Mickey's Very Merry Christmas Party at the Magic Kingdom. While the property is on "Disney" land I don't know for sure that they are serviced by Disney Busses. I believe the Hotel has Shuttle service. This is a swanky place, so I can't imagine them not offering this service. We drove, ate and parked at Contemporary Hotel - took us about 10 minutes door to door. Now the lobby is very nice, huge ceilings, several lounges to chose from and a friendly staff awaited us. We had the kids with us, so we were a party of four. We we arrived we found out they upgraded us to a high level room with DIsney Park View. I was already pleased with the visit at this point. The front desk person explained the property and showed us which way to go ( you do have to pay attention...the high level rooms have seperate elevators - not a huge deal, just good to be aware of). We got to our room and I was quite impressed. We stay at a LOT of resorts and this one really gets super points from me on being a "standard" room. The size of the rooms rival the contemporary's very sizable rooms. The bedding, furniture and such were very tasteful and modern. The HUGE windows floor to ceiling lent a great view of Disney Studios and even some of the Caribbean Beach resort. I think the high level rooms get you a much better view of the properties. The bathroom was nice for as expected for a 4* hotel. Granite counters, powerful shower heads and plenty of room. My wife also noted the had a very good hair dryer too... We were only there overnight, so we didn't get to enjoy the pool we did get a fantastic view. It has a big lazy river, bars, several pools, lots of hot tubs. Nicely laid out, quality outdoor equipment like loungers, chairs & umbrellas looked really tempting. Now let's talk about my FAVORITE thing is this hotel is AMAZING for families. Recreation has events every hour for the kids outside and inside. The hotels are totally set up for families. There are other families there and you don't feel like you want to shove a sock in your kids mouth when they jibber jabber too loud. Others are dealing with the same thing, so it's no big deal. Let me also note that it's not super loud - especially the breakfast buffet (which was awesome & kids eat free).
