Instant gratification for kids via the bountiful breakfast buffet keeps the kids eating the sound reasonable for the amount of families dinning there. Overall, I gotta tell you....This is really probably going to become one of my favorite disney property hotels. It will take a longer visit to 2-3 night minimums to really get a feel for it. The bottom line is the staff was great, the rooms were spectacular ad the property is down right amazing. Bottom line....if you're traveling with kids and can get a favorable rate on this Hilton Hotel, then grab it. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it more than the last time!”
Reviews.Author: IntoTheAirwaves
Reviews.Content: I judge hotels on the second and third stays based on improvements and progress (if any). My last stay was in January 2011. I stayed this past weekend with my best friend as a staycation and this hotel was absolutely perfect! And, the service was noticeably enhanced. It was great last time, but it's just become more personalized since my last stay. Each employee ended their interaction with a SINCERE "is there anythin else I can assist you with". I was very impressed by their phone operator when I called down just for toothpaste, her name was Pamela I believe. And then the attendant who delivered it, she was just so sweet. All that for toothpaste. We upgraded to a suite and if you have the ability to do so, DO IT! they're beautifully appointed and it just adds so much to the experience. I loved their holiday decor. The fact that they let children decorate their own bricks for the gingerbread house in the lobby says a lot. The idea is so unique and much more original than your normal Christmas tree. And it was so cute! Well done Bonnet Creek! Keep it going!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel as you can expect by Hilton”
Reviews.Author: PeterOdgaard
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference at the adjacent Conference center located between the Hilton and the Waldorf Astoria. The hotel it self was nice, especially the pool area was nice.Our room was as well nice, a bit small, but had a view over the pool area, and we could se the fireworks from Magic Kingdom at nights. Its location in Disney World is good if you are visiting the Disney Parks but a car is needed if you want to dine outside the hotel. A problem in general at the hotel and conference center is that that it is very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for families!!”
Reviews.Author: camefromfairfield
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Bonnet creek during a baseball tournament week at Disney's Wide World of Sports during the summer of 2011.It was perfect!Close enough to go back and forth for the games,and also close to theme parks too!From our room,we could see the fireworks every night and the beautiful pool and golf course.The pool was fantastic with a lazy river and water slide.We stayed in a high floor 1 bedroom suite,which was perfect for our family of four.It was so much larger and better than what our teammmates got in a regular room.Do not hesitate to get the suite if they are available (I think it was only 4100 more per night,and so worth it).The hotel is very clean and has a great restaurant named La Luce which is a not miss for excellent Italian food.Kids under 12 eat free at breakfast..another HUGE bonus..the buffet had everything you could want each morning.all and all,I wouldnt hesitate to stay there again!Only negative that I can think of is that they do not have laundry facilities on premises.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Property with exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: ParisonthePlains
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Bonnet Creek is a new hotel that I visited as part of a mid size group meeting. The staff provides friendly and attentive service at every turn from the front desk, bell services and housekeeping. My room was well appointed and had plenty of room to work and relax. Everything is new and tastefully decorated. At the conclusion of my visit, I was offered a complimentary ride to the airport which was a delightful touch for the conclusion of my visit. I would highly recommend this location and property. I did not have time to check out the restaurants or fitness center, but the Center looked well equipped.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: GHCAMPMAR
Reviews.Content: I was at the Orlando Hilton Bonnet Creek for a conference for AVID from 12/7-12/10. The property is beautiful. The rooms were very clean. Check-in was very quick even though there was a major conference going on. The staff was courteous and friendly. While I was unable to use the pool facility I did see that it was beautiful and well maintained. I ate at three restaurants on the property. The food was very good and the prices weren't too bad except for at the Italian Restuarant which was quite pricey. A glass of wine was $12. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would stay there again myself. We were served a banquet luncheon which was very good. The banquet breakfast that was served was not very good.

Reviews.Title: “Unsanitary conditions and staff!”
Reviews.Author: BeachBoy2008
Reviews.Content: How on earth does this place pass Health Inspections?! The restrooms were poorly maintained, the hygiene of the staff was beyond approachable, and the garbage around the property was ignored. For the large sums of $$$ my wife and I forked over we should expect a certain level of cleanliness (call me old-fashioned). Here is a run-down of what we saw; The restrooms by the pool were completely disgusting with the toilets obviously not being cleaned. There was no soap or paper towels for the sinks. Plates with leftover food littered the pool deck and attracted birds (Twice we had to move around the pool). We mentioned this to the bartender and he seemed indifferent to the sanitary conditions. Inside the Harvest Bistro we had the buffet and felt ill afterwards. It would not surprise me a bit if the temperature conditions were compromised and the food went bad due to the restaurant's ignorance. I also saw a server wipe her nose with her hands and continued to carry drinks to another table without washing them. We left immediately to avoid catching something worse. Glasses were scattered throughout the lobby and wine glasses were stained as if they had been there all night. Room service trays had not been picked up and in some instances the odor could be smelled down the hall! Very, very gross. I attempted to tell the front desk about these concerns and I was met with simple "pass it alongs". When I asked for the hotel manager, they were apparrently too busy to talk at the moment and I would be contacted. No one ever contacted me. One of two things may have happened;either manager was never informed, or management plain does not care. I would think the hotel these people are representing would have taken these issues to heart and have something done immediately. The hotel may be four-star but has the sterility of a landfill. I've been to 2-Star motels that were better looking than this place. This is a huge disappointment to the Hilton Brand, and I will be taking a copy of this review to the Public Health Department for a suggested surprise inspection.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and tidy confrence, not holiday hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ferris5632
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 10 days with my family from the UK in December. The hotel is clean, comfortable and large,Service was polite. Free buffet breakfast every morning included. As a hotel its great, but not for a family Disney holiday. It has no atmosphere, you could be staying anywhere in the world as it caters mostly for the conference/business guest. If this is your first Disney holiday I would say stay elsewhere to soak up that special magic.

Reviews.Title: “watch your data”
Reviews.Author: Debbiekeat
Reviews.Content: Love the hotel and the location but they pirate your data on your phone. Had paid for a data plan before I left Canada and when I went to use my internet I was asked to pay by the hotel and from that point on I was blocked from doing anything not just in the hotel but everywhere in Orlando. They claimed they didn't know what had happened but was advised by the business centre it happens all of the time. Truly a cash grab and am surprised at a hotel with this standing. Shame on you,k truly tainted my experience. I had stayed there 2 years before and had had none of this kind of PIRATING.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT FAMILY FUN”
Reviews.Author: Dbailly
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing hotel. Accommodations were great! We are a family of 6, so you can imagine room and comfort are key. Great things for the whole family to enjoy. Best lazy river pool ever. All hotel members very attentive and courteous. Would stay here again in a minute

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: princessfiona81
Reviews.Content: To start I would warn anyone who is a family of four trying to stay in one room. The rooms are small, there is one tiny cupboard available, no where to store your suitcases and a small bathroom. The pool was nice and the food for lunch at the pool bar was good. We got a free breakfast as Hilton Honors guests but I wouldnt wanted to have paid for it as it was pretty basic. Good location for Downtown Disney and the Disney Parks. The hotel is a bit soulless. I have stayed at numerous hotels in Orlando and think that the Renaissance at Sea World and Disney Swan are better options.

Reviews.Title: “Disney and Hilton”
Reviews.Author: AML848
Reviews.Content: This was an enjoyable vacation hotel. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The rooms attractive, neat and clean. The weather was to cool for pool time but the hot tub was perfect. This hotel provides transportation to the Disney parks and the buses are very nice. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel , good staff , good location , a lttle expensive”
Reviews.Author: paddypete
Reviews.Content: First the positives, Great staff , very friendly, nice rooms , great views of pool , golf course, disney etc. The restaurant standard was quite good while the room rate was resonable the resaurant was quite expensive. Other than that its really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: magicbear
Reviews.Content: Having travelled to the Orlando area about a dozen times over the past 15 years or so, I have yet to find a hotel which is anywhere near the standard of this one. As I don't want to drive on holiday, I had a concern over the location prior to arrival. This was unfounded as they had a high service level of transfers to disney and taxis available to travel to shopping etc. The rooms are spacious, extremely clean and tidy and water in bathroom is always piping hot when required. Pool area is excellent, lots of sunbeds, pool is a good size and lazy river is brilliant. Ate in both restaurants, found the harvest bistro to be better. All in all a great find, can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: Felicity_ssimo
Reviews.Content: I just finished a 4-night stay at Hilton Bonnet Creek and I thouroughly enjoy my time there. This hotel is perfect for people on business or couple without kids. i got an odd number room, which gives me a great view of the pool, the golf course, and even the Disney World. The view is absolutely stunning and I can see firework from my hotel room every night. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. I made several requests and they were able to accomodate and addressed my concern immediately. Also, the dining experience at the hotel was terrific. I had dinner twice at La Luce, pasta for the first time, and their famous burger (apparently it's one of the top 20 burgers in the States) for the 2nd time. Both were excellent. During my 2nd visit to the restaurant, because of a small misunderstanding at the beginning, I was moved from the main dining room to the bar, which wasn't really a big deal for me. But after the restaurant manager found out about the situation, he was being very apologetic and gave me complimentary martini and apetizer. I really appreciate that they are making the effort to ensure that we have the best experience. I also had ice cream couple of times at Muse and it was amazing! The only disadvantage I can think of is that you probably need a car for your stay here. The hotel only provides shuttles to the theme park. Compared to a lot of the other hotels in Orlando, this hotel is quite far from the shops and restaurants. In addition, there is no public transit so it will be quite costly to get around by taxi. All in all, I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and would definitely come back if I am in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nkapfer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for business mid October for a business trip and couldn't be more satisfied. Friendly staff, clean rooms, great pool, and one of the best golf courses in the Orlando area. I didn't try any of the restaurants on site, but there are more than one option.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the cost”
Reviews.Author: M D
Reviews.Content: We stayed there twice over 2010 and 2011 Thanks giving week ends. 2010 we arrived late and were given a room that already had a guest in it. The bell man apologized and handed us a 50.00 coupon. First of all 50.00 will buy you two eggs in the bistro and secondly I did not spend 4-5 thousand on airfare, Disney tickets, hotel, etc to get put in an already occupied room at 1:00 am . 2011 again arrived late in the evening early morning. I had paid in advance for a Disney view, 2 queen beds with breakfast. (More appropriate to call it pool-golf course view, Disney is a speck from the hotel rooms). Asked the front desk about the Disney view and he said see if you like the view and if you donâ€™t I will give you another room. Get up to the room and I see Wyndhamâ€™s parking lot, where is the Disney view. Sent the bell man downstairs with the bug that was crawling around with the print out from Hilton showing room type of Disney view. Front desk guy with missing buttons, just thread hanging where the buttons should be on his suit (Hilton, if he has to buy his own suit give him a raise, if this is hotel owned suit get a button put on for this poor guy) kept apologizing but refused to give me a room with Disney view. Night manager now starts to fumble around and says they will give me 100.00 credit. I donâ€™t want the credit I want the view I paid for. They only had a 1 bed deluxe they could give me. Next day I am given a Disney view room that is on the other end from the elevators, it is pretty far to walk after spending a day at Disney. The designers of this hotel must be college drop outs to not realize that you put the elevators in the middle of the hotel not on one end of it. There was also a Ginger bread house decoration going on in the lobby while were there. They were promising the kids that there decorations will be put on the house that was built in the lobby. Next day the kids run to find there decorations and they are not there. The person standing by the front door to greet new check ins was clue less and said she had been on vacation for last 5 days and knew nothing about the decorations. Housekeeping kept knocking on our door everyday with last warning to let them clean or they have to go to a different floor and will not be able to make the room for the day. The bistro is crowded for breakfast on busy days, again not designed to handle 1000 room hotel but more like 100. Pool is very nice except be prepared to pay for floaters etc. Bottom line the staff is trained to be polite and quickly apologize for everything in a very animated scripted fashion; they lack common sense to resolve simple issues. The front desk is filled with people 9-10 at a time but all of them are clueless other than to give out scripted answers and offer apologies. What a waste of millions of dollars building this place just to screw it all up by failing to execute on very basic and simple things. Not worth spend 200+ per night at this place

Reviews.Title: “Rip-off alert”
Reviews.Author: Dean B
Reviews.Content: A nice, clean hotel, and that is where it ends. You will get "fee'd to death" in this place. Be ready to start paying the second you get there...$13 per day to simply park your car; $5 to rent a tube if you want to float along the "included" pool's lazy river, you can not bring you own snacks or drinks into the pool area (they have a bar there so its not food or drink issue - its a revenue issue). I saw 3 people asked to leave the pool deck and drink thier drinks outside of the fence because they didnt purchase them from the pool bar! The "kids eat free" requires an adult to spend $20 on the breakfast buffet per child and the only way to know this is to have ESP, or find out the hard way after you sit down with your hungry kids, ....and what really got me was on the way out one morning I decided to grab a milk (I decided against the "kids eat free" that day). The bottles in stock were only nestle chocolate, so I asked the onsite restaurant if I could buy a glass of white milk. They poured a small glass of milk into plastic cup and charged me $4. I guess they were upset that I didnt do the buffet... WiFi is free in the lobby, but not free in your room. Never again....Hilton just lost an Honors Rewards member....

Reviews.Title: “This top floor suite was amazing. Spacious enough for a couple families and gorgeous decor.”
Reviews.Author: Tammy G
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. Staying at Bonnets Creek gave us amazing views of the fire works. We were within walking distance to the couple gorgeous pools they have. We were so close to the attractions;once we got there,everything was so comfortable and a trip that we actually went home happy and rested. Speaking of rested,the beds were some of the most comfortable I've slept in! Give Bonnets Creek a try,you'll love it! Great job hotel staff!

Reviews.Title: “Most Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Toemoss22
Reviews.Content: The family has stayed here a few times now and it keeps getting better each visit. The long trip from CA is worth it when the Hotel, accommodations and staff make it a great stay! Although we are not there for the Disney "thing" anymore, we find this hotel (and Hilton Conv Center) are the two best hotels in the Orlando market. I frequent the Orlando area for business about 5 times a year and I try to coordinate a stay at this property due to the awesome setting and the quality of the hotel. This third stay for the family was the best by far! The hotel is more kid friendly (great meal program) and has all the "bugs" worked out from being new. The "poolground" is a great place to play in the water and the pool staff is professional and friendly. I continue to recommend this location to anyone visiting Orlando. It is very convenient for Legoland (great place) and other theme parks. They offer a great product at a fair price.......you will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, great staff,definitely will be back .”
Reviews.Author: Sapp99
Reviews.Content: Clean and very nice. If you stay there walk over to the aquamarine bar at the waldorf Astoria and have a drink with an awesome bar staff. Andrew the bartender was totally awesome. Ryan was a waiter there when we were at the bar and he was great also. In fact the entire staff at aquamarine was fantastic. Thanks for making our trip memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Orlando/Disney World option”
Reviews.Author: rsmacdon
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with good services and an outstanding pool. We stayed for a convention, but the hotel staff were excellent. Relatively new hotel so rooms were excellent and very clean, good TV selection of channels, good room service. You can vallet part or self-park. Must try the golf course next time back there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Craiger862
Reviews.Content: Good restauants, nice beds, beautiful pool area. Nice if you don't want to stay at a Disney property but still,very close and has shuttle service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, close to disney”
Reviews.Author: RRMaheen
Reviews.Content: Great hotel close to disney. The hotel has a private bus service that runs every 1/2 - 1 hour and is very convenient. The pool was a huge hit with our 6 year old sun (both the lazy river and the slide). The only thing that sucks is the food, although to be fair we only tried room service and the bistro.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay in the middle of Disney”
Reviews.Author: jennysch
Reviews.Content: This hotel isn't part of the Disney family. I have been with my family and without. When I went without, you didn't get the Disney hype that you get with other hotels on property. It felt elegant and they have terrific food available in a number of restaurants. The buffet breakfast in the morning was excellent...great omlets! You are close to so many attractions and shopping and yet while at the hotel you feel like you are away from all the hustle and bustle. Rooms are clean and the pool is awesome with a lazy river that just melts everything away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: travelincritic
Reviews.Content: This was a great choice for Orlando. It's a beautiful hotel, nice service, convenient to the parks with nice pool area. The negatives might be that there's quite a bit of traffic, there's no safe in the rooms, the water pressure wasn't great and food, etc if quite pricey inside. There is a fridge in the rooms so I would recommend buying a few snacks, drinks, etc and keeping them in your room, and buying an inner tube type raft for use as they charge you $5 per use. It's next door to the Waldorf and we walked over there and were not impressed at all by the hotel nor the pool area and feel the Hilton is a much better option. Out last Orlando stay was the JW Marriott and it's a bit much luxurious that this Hilton but for the price difference we would probably return here first.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a great resort!”
Reviews.Author: SmishBish
Reviews.Content: My family, including boys ages 6 and 9 had a blast at this resort. We checked in Friday and rushed off to Mickey's Christmas Party for the night. We slept in the next day and went to the Harvest Bistro for breakfast where kids eat free with a paying adult. We had the buffet and it was delicious. The total bill was around $40. That afternoon we went to Hollywood studios. The next day we asked for a late checkout and had a wonderful morning at the pool. It was heated and the weather was sunny and warm. We enjoyed the lazy river and waterslide. It wasn't crowded at all. We had a wonderful day. For both parks we used the shuttle service which was great. It is a large comfortable tour bus with disney movies showing on flat screens. It picks up in front of the hotel hourly. The only issue we had with them was that there schedule was a little confusing. It list the departure times for all of the parks but if you go simlply by that and don't look at the other chart on the bottom for final pick up times you might get stranded like we did after Mickeys party at midnight on Friday. Apparently the shuttle doesn't pickup at the scheduled departure time every night, only after regular business hours. If regular business hours are until 7 like the Friday we went and you stay for a special party such as Christmas or Halloween, you would have to arrange your own transportation. Luckily a shuttle coordinator stopped by on his way home and saw us sitting there alone and asked us where we were going. He took us back to the hotel. We gave him a nice tip. Crisis averted. Back to the resort. It is fabulous and reasonbly priced. Trip advisor even compared the prices from all of the major websites. We booked with priceline at a discount. The beds were extremely comfortable and the rooms were as clean as if they were brand new. There was no resort fee but you do have to pay for $13 for self parking or $20 for valet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent alternative to staying at Disney proper”
Reviews.Author: nealwBoston
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a bunch of different Disney properties over the years in connection with industry trade shows that I've attended. There's a big difference betwen staying in a real hotel (i.e. Hilton Orlando Bonnet Creek) and a Disney property like Port Orleans or Caribbean Beach, where the check-in lines are long, the distance from check-in to your unit could be a 20-minute hike through winding and poorly marked sidewalks, and where the dining options are limited and sometimes totally booked for the evening. This Hilton is new, well-designed, efficient and basically a pleasure to stay in. Unfortunately, it was cold and cloudy the few days I was there, so nobody was outside, but the whole pool area looked wonderful. The room itself was modern and upscale. The Hilton is right next to the Waldorf Astoria. The two hotels share a conference center, parking lot, and a golf course. My only quibble is that the Web indicates a variety of dining options, but if you're looking for a nice dinner, there's really only one viable option at each hotel. The Hilton has La Luce, which is an excellent Italian restaurant, but it's a relatively small place. For example, the bar looks like it has about 8 seats. So, with a captive audience of hotel guests tired from a long day at the Disney parks or at a business conference, it's always extremely crowded and one night I was told there was a 90-minute wait for a table. So, I trucked up to the Waldorf, where the situation was exactly the same. One decent restaurant, Bull and Bear. Long wait. I was able to grab a table in the bar area, where the menu was limited. I have to say I was pleasantly surprised by the Bull and Bear. It looks like one of those stuffy old-school, steak-and-mashed-potatoes places. But my meal was wonderful and inventive -- I think I ordered fillet of bass (the waitress called it rock fish) but it was a delicious cube of fish with sea foam on top. For dessert I ordered an apple torte -- which turned out to be an interesting combination of warm and cold -- a flat, pancake-shaped pastry with a cold scoop of apple filling on top. It was all nicely done, the waitress was fast and efficient and the whole place had a modern, friendly vibe, despite the very traditional decor. Anyway, back to the Hilton. Highly recommended, especially if you have car and can get around and enjoy some of Orlando's other, less crowded dining options.

Reviews.Title: “Best Breaskfast along with Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: smkylink
Reviews.Content: we got the breakfast included package and was WAY worth it. After you had your fill, Snag an apple or banana for the park later on. The staff was great too. Very friendly to our kids and the food at the Poolside resturant was fabulous!!!

Reviews.Title: “Your Place To Stay In the Magic Kingdom”
Reviews.Author: Latitudes_Dancer
Reviews.Content: Don't bother checking rates, reviews, etc for other properties. This hotel is an excellent selection if you are looking for a new property with lots of amenities and close to the theme parks all at a competitive price. This is a solid Hilton property- good rooms, good service, great pool. I received a resort credit and so I also took advantage of the restaurants on property; I thought La Scala was very very good and the others well above average for standard fare. Also, the hotel shuttle to the Disney theme parks really makes all the difference. I have stayed at Disney properties before and dollar for dollar and perk for perk this hotel is as good as any and far better than most. You won't go wrong if you elect to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Off Disney Resort”
Reviews.Author: southernstu
Reviews.Content: Hilton Bonnet Creek was excellet choice for off disney stay. The hotel very close to all attractions and downtown disney area. The hotel offers a bus to each of the disney attractions, and is exclusively for the Hilton and next door Waldorf property so you don't have to wait while they make several stops. Very convenient! The hotel is beautiful and well maintained. Pool is fabulous, with a great lazy river circling the entire heated pool, and a zero entry main pool area. Perfect for kids, although the $5.00 inner tube rental is annoying when you just want to make a quick stop with the kids. Rooms are spacious and clean. We ate most of our meals off site at Disney, but the buffet, coffee shop, and higher end restaurant were all excellent. I would absolutely recommend this hotel for business stays and family visits to Disney area. There is also a beautiful golf course staring at you, but I did not get the opportunity to use it. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel for our visit to Mickey”
Reviews.Author: 4FromIndy
Reviews.Content: Simply amazing property. Service was fabulous, the rooms were excellent, the breakfast buffet superb. Great shuttle to all the parks. They considered my hhonors request and we were upgraded to a nice view of Epcot and Hollywood. The pool and lazy river was awesome. Wish we would have had more time to spend there. My only beef is that it seemed a little chincy to charge $5 to rent a tube for the lazy river. We are not Mickey crazy and knew we wanted to stay off property. This was our first visit to Orlando with kids, and are so, so glad we chose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better view in odd numbered room”
Reviews.Author: Seattlebiz
Reviews.Content: I was in room 1001 which overlooked the pools, golf course and if you looked hard to the right you could see the Disney fireworks at 9pm. I did the self parking in their garage and glad I did. No problem finding a space and I was out faster than those waiting for Valet. A little hard to find since Bonnet Creek signs are not on the "main" Disney signs. Bonnet creek are small separate signs less than 6ft. in height on the gound. I took exit 67 to Epcot Center Dr. and then took the first Disney resort sign (which was the 2nd right side exit from EC dr. and looped back under EC dr onto E. Buena Vista Dr. then "immediately got into far left lane to turn left at that next light. After left the Hilton (which shares the property with Waldorf Astoria) is down the road on right (after the golf course). The Bar is good, especially if there is sport event you want to watch...they get the games and you're room tv probably doesn't. The Italian restaurant was good food, service, price. The Waldorf's fine dine (the Bull something or other) was overpriced average food with terrible service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with fantastic facilities”
Reviews.Author: keeno9712
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in early october for a week. What a great hotel and I could write for ages about the positives. Lovely spacious rooms, always cleaned to a very high standard. Everything you needed was in the room. Big bathroom with large shower area. I guess some could moan that there was not a bath tub, but this was not an issue for us. The facilities in the complex are second to none. The gym was large with a good selection of cardio and weight machines. The pool area is massive with several pools, a long lazy river and a waterside. You have to pay $5 for a ring to float round on which is a bit unnecessary but only a minor fault. The hotel has several bars and restaurants to suit most tastes. There are many cheaper options around Orlando obviously but it is very convenient. There is also an excellent coffee shop available. The hotel is joined with the waldorf by a large conference centre which host numerous conventions. Our only gripe was that on one of the nights there was some form of hairdressers convention on and the room next door was incredibly noisy into the early hours. Reception were contacted and to their credit the guests were spoken to within minutes. We had a round of golf at the waldorf course. This was a lovely, well manicured resort course. However, being a regular golfer in Orlando there are certainly cheaper courses with more character around. However, it is convenient and the facilities top drawer. The hotel is situated in a great location. Five minutes to Disney parks (it's actually within the Disney area) 15 mins to international drive and literally 2 mins to downtown Disney. Overall I cannot speak to highly of this hotel. Everything was great and we had a great holiday. Would we return? Too right we would and I would highly recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Great for Couples or Families”
Reviews.Author: Jazzy310
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and has alot to offer for couples or families. I purchased a Disney view room and the views were spectacular, especially at night. The hotel is a short walk to the Waldorf but we much preferred the Hilton. Didn't seam as dark & stuffy. The pool at the Hilton is wonderful but didn't like the fact that you had to pay for a float each day. Have stayed at other properties that have a lazy river & never have paid to use a tube. It seems like many of the guest don't want to pay for them so remember your float number because you might have to chase down your float after someone takes it. Happened to us twice in one day & to many other guest we spoke to as well. I selected this hotel because it was close to Disney & they offer transportation to all the parks. The bus ride to Disney isn't bad but if you have young kids be prepared to sit on the bus 30 to 40 mins for the other parks. They do offer a Disney movie on the ride which is entertaining for all. The breakfast in Harvest was very good. They offer anything & everything you could want in a breakfast buffet. The only downfall was the dirty glassware. We have breakfast there 3 mornings & every morning the juice glass was dirty & you could see mouth prints on the rim of the glass. When we called attention to this the restaurant manager came to our table promptly and offered his apologies & compted our breakfast which was very nice! The beds were quite firm, maybe a little to firm for my liking. I wanted a foam pillow & it took 2 calls and close to an hour to bring one to the room. However,the staff is very accommodating and friendly. We will be back again! Thanks Hilton Bonnet Creek for a wonderful vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the whole family”
Reviews.Author: Keekeeseetah1
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Bonnet Creek is a perfect base to explore Orlando and the adventure parks - but at the same time it is located in a secluded area which gives you the opportunity to rest and enjoy other activities, such as golf - it has a beautiful golf course. It has six different restaurantes, we olny tried the Harvest Resort and they have a wonderful breakfast! I was travelling with my husband and my nephews so we got two adjoining rooms. The beds are VERY comfortable and the resort is very new so everything is cleam and crisp. Next time we go to Orlando we will difinetely stay at the Bonnet Creek. The kids can enjoy Disney and we can relax. I wish we had stayed longer... The only con is getting there by car at night - it was a bit confusing, it took us 30 minutes to find it from a 5 mile distance. If you are going to get there by car after a long day at a park call the hotel for driving directions.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel that's both business and family friendly”
Reviews.Author: yeequon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for business meetings and a tradeshow. I would recommended it to anyone. First and foremost the location is great. Sitting right next to a beautiful golf course and just outside of Disney World. The hotel offers a great pool that is perfect for families. It is very clean and has all of the normal amenities that one would expect from a Hilton. Only complaints: The restaurants in the hotel itself aren't that great... and their menus don't offer much as far as options. Also - the music in the gym sucked. Can't get pumped up with Josh Groban in the background. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, horrible valet”
Reviews.Author: salesrepIndiana
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth or fifth visit since this hotel opened. You can read my first vist to see it was my favorite hotel in this area. I extended almost every business trip to the area to stay a day or two here. No longer. I called for 3 a night stay and they only had 2 of the 3 nights available. No problem, I found a GREAT rate at the new hotel accross the street. WOW, you have options now when you stay in this area. When I moved over to the Hilton I experenced a night and day difference between the two hotels. At the other hotel I was greeted by a hugh smile and respect. They do not allow for hire cars in the welcoming area, they are parked down the street, out of the view of arriving guest. My car was not moved during check in. I arrived at the Hilton knowing the entire check in area would be cluttered with for hire cars. They cater to them instead of the arriving guest. I was verbally threated by the valet. I travel with business equipment in my car, so I do not valet my car. I arrived 30 minutes before normal check-in and wanted to make sure I could check in early before I unloaded my car. Not an option my car was moved within 30 seconds with my business equipment in it. It was 2pm, I was the only person checking in. After having such a positive morning at the other hotel, it made this arrival that much worse. They lazy river is hard to beat however I can get use to the multiple pools and a lagoon across the street and better eating options. I don't know that I will be back, with the new Hilton opening, by the convention center, with a lazy river and the new hotel (other brand) across the street. This hotel is starting to show the wear and tear. My shower had mold and the ref either doesn't cool at all or freezes everything. This happened on my last visit as well. It is still a great hotel, but not worth the torment from valet for me.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place!!”
Reviews.Author: beachluvr300
Reviews.Content: I love Bonnet Creek. It had a great italian resteraunt, a bistro, and a great breakfast place. It had wonderful rooms, and a great pool.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: heluvsmeonly
Reviews.Content: As a family we were very pleased with our stay at the Hilton Bonnet Creek. One of the things we didn't like was how far our room was from the elevator, but the rooms were beautiful, the beds were very comfortable and the bathrooms were very clean. Maybe next time we will request one closer to the elevator. There were two nights in a row that the hotel's houskeeping did not leave clean glasses in our room, and after we used our ice bucket once, they never replaced the liner. The extra blanket in our closet smelled like throw up! The shuttle service to and from the parks was exceptional! The front desk staff was very nice as was the muse staff. We did not eat at the restaurant because our family is gluten and dairy free and there was not very much choices, but a lady at the muse said that they were working on it. Our kids really enjoyed the lazy river and the pool but it sucks that you have to pay to rent a tube. Overall, we loved the hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “First Orlando hotel stay on a non-Disney property - can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: bean_nj
Reviews.Content: As a family we have been to Orlando a number of times (almost always for Disney). We love the Disney properties and have been reluctant to try elsewhere. All I can say is I don't know why we were ever worried. This hotel is lovely. We stayed there for 4 nights over this past weekend. Our room was on the 7th floor (I think there are 18, it's a large property) with a WDW view. Our view of the hotel's pool area and golf course was great, as far as Disney . . . well not so much. We could see the tops of the buildings at Hollywood Studios (not a great firework view as I was hoping) and a bit of the Epcot fireworks if we craned our necks around to the right. So really in terms of seeing anything Disney, not so much. We still enjoyed the view we did have. Our room was very clean and well maintained. We inadvertently left the do not disturb sign on the door one day and housekeeping did not disturb our empty room. The bathroom was very well appointed and decorated. I also appreciated the many accessible outlets located throughout the room. The staff was courteous and helpful. The woman at the front desk who checked us in was great. The bellman was very courteous and provided my husband with ample brochures and information on the area parks as we arrived. The conceriege was helpful as well. We ate at the Harvest Bistro for breakfast most days. They have a breakfast buffet which makes it easy for an on the go family. Kids 12 and under eat free for breakfast and dinner as well, so that was a pleasant surprise. The food was very good, not exceptional, but good and consistent. My one complaint was that they do not have gluten-free cereal. In terms of transport to the parks, there is a courtesy shuttle from the hotel to each of the Disney parks. It was a nice charter type bus which is much more comfortable than the basic Disney transport buses so they were very, very nice. The schedule to the Magic Kingdom was great with buses running every 1/2 hour to the Ticket & Transportation Center, while buses to the other parks ran mostly every hour. The one down side is you do need a little extra travel time because you go to a few parks for both pick-up and drop-off. It's not enough to be a big deal. We fully intend to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families, great serivce”
Reviews.Author: alan947
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at many hotels in the Disney area, and the Hilton Bonnet Creek was the best yet. It's close to the parks, new, clean, has bigger rooms than usual (not as big as the Doubletree Suites, but we stopped staying there due to cleanliness issues with the rooms), and our experience with the staff was fantastic for several reasons, the main one being that Michelle at the front desk kindly noted it was our twins' birthday, and to our surprise, she sent cupcakes and a sweet bday card to our room. It was a nice, warm touch. We also enjoyed the breakfast buffet. I know some people think $19 is pricey for breakfast, which it is, but we've stayed at other area hotels were breakfast cost $30 a person for the same food and selection.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hilton with Stunning Views”
Reviews.Author: Dejais
Reviews.Content: I stayed here this past weekend while friends and I were enjoying Epcot's Food & Wine Fest. Being a Hilton Gold member, I was upgraded to a Disney view which also included views of the Hilton view and golf course. It was picture perfect. The hotel itself is large and beautifully appointed. The lobby bar was nice as was the bar down the hall which offered Karaoke at night. (Karaoke would have been a lot better however if the same person did not sing every song. Sit down, honey and let someone else have a turn.) The parking garage is located between the Hilton and the Waldorf and brightly lit at night. There is a shuttle that runs often to Disney properties which is why we booked this hotel. It was nice to be able to enjoy the Food & Wine Fest without having to designate one person the DD. We were very impressed and would definitely book this Hilton next time we are in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel...”
Reviews.Author: marco37
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in October having previously stayed at the Hilton Orlando,International Drive last year. Hotel is lovely and clean and new.Rooms were a generous size and plenty big enough for a family,but lacks storage space if staying for any length of time.Bathrooms were lovely. Breakfast was expensive $19 per adult although plenty of choice and good quality. Drinks were expensive..really expensive! Pool area fabulous although we did not use much as spent most of our time out of hotel. Service was excellent in all areas and all members of staff were friendly. Hotel is in a great location for Disney ,would stay again but slightly prefer the sister hotel on International Drive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but VERY EXPENSIVE!!!”
Reviews.Author: MTfan
Reviews.Content: We attended a conference at this hotel. For the costs we did not find much of value! Made the mistake of ordering room service due to time and location and no time to go our for it. For 2 omelets, hashbrowns, toast and 2 teas - $75!!!!!!! Could not believe it. Was a little better than Denny's BUT CERTAINLY NOT $75. Room was nice decoration but quite small for cost. We will not return. Other times in Orlando we have had suites at other nice hotels for less money. Pool and river was nice. Staff was good. Food was good. Parkign was expensive. Rooms were clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Juddy1964
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 12 nights at the Bonnet Creek - overall we really enjoyed the stay. We travelled with Virgin, but never again, and as a result we received complimentary buffet breakfast and parking - this makes a big saving as breakfest buffet was $19 each and parking was $13/day if you had too pay. The pool area is great and the food served by the pool was excellent, we also ate 3 nights in La Luce and really enjoyed the food, - we got a 20% discount on all food and drinks due to being with Virgin and this makes a big difference at the end of the week. Location was excellent close to all Disney parks and the free bus service was good but you need to watch the timings - it is only about 2 miles from Hollywood studios. We had a room on the 16th floor with views across the golf course and onto Hollywood Studios Tower of Terror. Overall I would recommned this as a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Jose_Coelho
Reviews.Content: Was there for a conference in the summer, and has the best rooms i had ever experienced in a hotel. And i would not even start talking about being in the pool at 11 p.m. with warm water. Very very good.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RevDoc2014
Reviews.Content: Great breakfast - and it was served until noon! The hotel is very nice and accomadations and views are great. Be prepared to pay parking though = only complaint

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool - Mediocre Rooms - Horrible Food”
Reviews.Author: HereHere
Reviews.Content: We planned this stay around a trip to Downtown Disney and Sea World. We chose this Hilton because it was new, big, had a cool looking pool and I've never been disappointed with the brand (until this trip). I'll list the pros and cons: The good: Pool is awesome. A lazy river takes you around the pool in a tube (you have to pay $$ to rent the tubes, however..) There's a slide for kids, and my daughter loved it. The pool is heated, and that's a big plus to me as many hotel pools feel like ice baths, especially in late October as the Florida nights start to cool a little. The two hot tubs were also a plus. There are two unique little fire pits by the pool, where for substantial $$ you can get marshmallows to roast over the pit. The hotel is new and very clean. This would be a good place for a business conference. The parking garage attached to the hotel is neat too, but again you have to pay $$ to park there. The mediocre: The rooms are new and clean, but nothing special. A 30 year old Days Inn probably has the same room layout. Though the counter was big in the bathroom, there was only one sink. The low water pressure in the shower was horrible. There are no balconies, which in my opinion is a shame in any Florida hotel.. The horrible: Plan on eating elsewhere. The $$ they charge for the very mediocre fare is outrageous. For breakfast I went to the little grab and go store in the lobby area (as we didn't want to pay a mint for the breakfast in the restaurant). The cinnamon rolls were extremely greasy and doughy. The bagels hadn't arrived yet, as they were late that day (!!), so not much choice unless you wanted an artery bomb chocolate pastry or something similar. Nothing healthy, I don't think there were any bannanas, either. Very limited choice for dinner as well. The small cafe by the pool was high-priced for low level food. That goes for the other one or two formal dining options they had. My advice: Downtown Disney is very close-by. Go there for all your lunch and dinner options. Superb food at Wolfgang Puck express- and reasonable. Great atmosphere for kids and great food at the Rainforest Cafe- or T-Rex. Downtown Disney is the place for eating and shopping in the immediate area, no contest. In conclusion, the hotel is new and clean with a great pool. Those are the only good points in my opinion if you're going on a non-business trip with family. If you want to stay at a Hilton in the area, stay at the "Hilton Orlando Lake Buena Vista" instead. It's literally right across the street from Downtown Disney, you can walk there no problem- even with strollers, etc.. can't be beat for an Orlando Hilton. I would not return to the Hilton Bonnet Creek unless on a business trip and had no choice. Sorry, this is my first negative Hilton review!

Reviews.Title: “Some problems but overally enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: Woodai
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned our first trip to Orlando, FL. We decided to stay at the Hilton Orlando because the rates were less expensive than the on-site Disney hotels, the hotel was pretty new, and it was located right next to the Waldorf-Astoria and we could use the spa there. I thought that the lazy river pool downstairs was a nice touch, you don't have to go to the water parks to experience that. The spa at the Waldorf Astoria was also very good, top notch quality service. Unfortunately, the bell hops weren't very focused on their jobs (they did more chit-chatting). When I checked in all by myself (husband arrived on the next day) and had 2 very big suitcases, although the bell hops helped me get my suitcases out of the car none of them offered to help carry them. I had even planned on giving them a big tip! I had to carry my suitcases to a far away part of my floor. Luckily one of the housekeeping staff helped me with my suitcases when she saw how much stuff I had. On my second day there, they were testing the fire alarm but when I returned to the hotel at 5pm the fire alarm was still ringing and they asked us all to go downstairs to the lobby. There seemed to be an electrical fault and that was triggering the fire alarm on our side of the building. I was jetlagged (still on HK time) and really tired. After I complained they moved me to another room and gave me complimentary parking for my stay (4 nights). Finally, I thought the shower pressure was really weak and would have appreciated just a little bit more pressure. Overall we enjoyed our stay at the Hilton Orlando Bonnet Creek and recommend it to couples and families.

Reviews.Title: “Practically perfect”
Reviews.Author: ScholarGentleman
Reviews.Content: Was trying to decide whether to stay at a Disney property or here. Glad we ended up here. The hotel is clean and comfortable, and the pool is spectacular. We were shocked at how empty it was, and it's really one of the nicest pool areas we've seen. Great for kids and for adults. The service was outstanding from every employee we interacted with, from the moment we set foot on the property. Clearly someone is doing something very right in recruiting and training on this front. The rooms are at the top of the Hilton standard: clean and comfortable. Was nice to come to an empty (bar) fridge that could be filled with drinks. The bus to Disney Parks was comfortable and convenient, though this is really where you feel the distance from the parks. You need to build in some extra time to get there and back, and be aware of the bus schedule. For one day we just took the car, and that was more convenient, despite the small parking fee. The breakfast (included in our room rate) was exceptional. Ate there every morning and was pleased each time. Could see the fireworks from all three parks, and some of them while lying in bed :). They have some kids programs. Ours were too small for them this time, but we'll certainly give them a try next time around. I guess if there was anything I could even begin to be critical about, the room service menu is a bit on the light side, and our dinner was less than spectacular, though it was fine. Would be really nice if they just made it easy to order pizza in from one of the local delivery places. I suppose I could have tracked it down and done this (I doubt they would have stopped the delivery at the door?) but especially when travelling with the family, sometimes being able to get at something simple like a pizza makes things easier. Overall, though, would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: condobill
Reviews.Content: We stayed there with a convention.The grounds,hotel and staff were awesome.The pool outside with it's lazy river was great.Even had 2 ducks swimming around in it wonder if they realized it wasn't the lake that is by the place.View from the room was great.We could see Disney MGM hat!Nice that they have bus service to the Disney parks, drop you off and pick you up.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Goldfish_44
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel for a stay near Disney. The pool area is a great attraction for the kids. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pool is awesome - bus to Disney - close to Hollywood Studios - HHonors helps”
Reviews.Author: munchman
Reviews.Content: First off - MarkBuick76 wrote a great review about five days ago in October 2011 that you should read - we will solely try to add on to it - as we loved this hotel and will go back. As a Hilton Hhonors Gold member the breakfast buffet (called a continental breakfast on the coupon) was a freebie for all four of us in the room - and it is a good one - valued by the hotel at $25 a person - custom omelettes (spinach was a highlight), custom pancakes (marshmallows, chocolate chip, sprinkles, fruit toppings), very fresh fruit (pineapple, strawberries, honeydew, cantaloupe), lots of bakery items, hot plates of taters / eggs / sausage / bacon, and orange juice / coffee / tea included, and surprises (salmon/lox with capers and onions available) - the wait staff at the buffet were attentive and friendly. Google maps worked to get us to the hotel - Sprint GPS did not. The bus / shuttle schedule to disney is available online at www.bonnetshuttle.com - be aware that in the morning, the bus goes first to Magic Kingdom (20 minutes later), then EPCOT, and last Hollywood Studios (arrives 40 minutes after leaving) - so if you want to get to Hollywood Studios first thing, drive there yourself or take a cab - we were frustrated since we wanted to get to Hollywood at opening and the bus driver did not give us that key info (just said "yes we go to Hollywood"). The pool is one of the best we have been at, including all of the Disney hotels - the lazy river moves nicely and is 3.5 feet to 4 feet deep throughout and goes under a few bridges that each have water spouts hitting you - the water slide was better than any of the Disney ones we have been at including better than Beach Club and Boardwalk, although the day we were there it was cold until about 1pm - a zero entry middle area was great for little kids (and grandmothers) and is both non-moving water and gives easy access to the lazy river. Tons of lay out in the sun chaises (the nice ones with sunbrella fabric) and a little store rents tubes and sells toys / sunblock / etc. The bar folks were fantastic for my daughter - she had a grilled cheese (which came in a nice paper box) - and when she wanted a refill they were both very friendly and gave her a plastic pumpkin glass with straw (which is now getting used at home). The adult frozen drinks were yummy and plentiful, and they have a very large choice of special rums (I did not partake, but recognized many of them). The very huge and tall ceiling lobby was decorated in Halloween theme with pumpkins, and all was very clean (saw people cleaning discreetly every time I was downstairs). Covered parking is next door for a fee, and I would not recommend valet since it is maybe 1000 feet from your car to the lobby. Exercise room was large and updated with nice equipment - and was being used about 20% each day. Since it is a newer hotel most of the foliage / palm trees are small and don't provide much shade.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Leftthedog
Reviews.Content: This is a truely great hotel right next to Disney, We stayed here 4 nights pre cruise out of Port Canaveral. Athough we don't have small kids anymore it would be a great place to stay with children because of their pools and lazy river. (Average depth is 3 feet so not so great for adults to really jump in and swim.) However we still really enjoyed the pool area, pool bar, DJ by the pool, movie by the pool, hot tubs and free bus to Disney and back, Food is pricey and self parking is expensive but that is what we have come to expect at resorts like this. Breakfast at the Harvest Bistro (3 mornings) was a great buffet. Fridge in the room is a nice extra. I do miss not having a bath tub but not a deal breaker. We will be back and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Night at Hilton Bonnet Creek”
Reviews.Author: Erica B
Reviews.Content: This hilton is great. Kin took great care of us and at the Zeta bar, Denise and Marco were awesome all night. Couldn't have asked for better service. Marco made great drinks too! Will definitely come back for the service. Thanks guys.

Reviews.Title: “Best in the neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: Gordon W
Reviews.Content: This one is really new as our GPS definitely needs an update about the new street name. We could not be happier choosing it for our first family vacation in Disney World. Facility condition is second to none, dinning options are plenty and all excellent, plus all the great services. Pizza from La Luce tastes like from heaven. Above all personnels are so great and wonderful. Brenda working at Harvest Bistro treated us like her own family. Angel (I hope I got his name right) offered great touring tips let alone the delicious pancakes he cooked for us. We won't hesitate to stay there again next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff in a crisis”
Reviews.Author: LeeVHR
Reviews.Content: Fortunately, the rooms are very comfortable, as I spent two days sick in bed. Unfortunately I ended up needing a quick flight home. Anita, who had helped solve my internet access issue when I checked in, arranged for my ride to the airport. I was especially appreciative that she checked on me while I was packing. She also tried to get my rental car returned for me. Everyone on the staff was very understanding and helpful in a crisis. I also want to compliment the tech staff at the conference who were very professional and accommodating in providing assistance to all the conference speakers.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Awesome but need to get rid of the resort fees”
Reviews.Author: viewsonic321
Reviews.Content: really is a great hotel drinks way overpriced ( hotel needs to drop the prices) everythink else is great and the pools are the best the hotel needs to drop the parking fees and the highly priced resort fees (hopefully the hotel will take note)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in quiet corner of Disney”
Reviews.Author: leroyk
Reviews.Content: The Hilton could not be closer to Disney, Hollywood Studios, etc. but it is a world away. Nice. Quiet. Great service. Incredible gym and spa. Would stay anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Carefully review your bill”
Reviews.Author: Djtroxell
Reviews.Content: Had an incorrect bar bill charged to my room. Staff said they would remove when they determined where to charge it. Poor customer service before it was finally removed.

Reviews.Title: “The bit of sophistication that WDW needed.”
Reviews.Author: baskoner
Reviews.Content: I don't have much to say that hasn't been said already, but this hotel is why I continue to choose Hilton above all others. My only gripe would be the $5 I had to pay to rent a tube at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Not Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Scottie074
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in September and had a delightful stay. I am thinking about coming again and bringing my Grandaughter and was reading the current reviews. When I read "Dissapointing" (spelled wrong) I could hardly believe it. I stayed in the least expensive room on the property in probably the worst location and was impressed with every aspect of the hotel. From the pool staff to the check in staff (kudos to Kevin Stabile) everything was perfect. It was clean, comfortable, well-decorated, and in short---perfect. I have traveled the world and count this stay as one of my best. You will not be "Disappointed."

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, pool is amazing,”
Reviews.Author: froggy922
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for four days while attending a conference. The hotel is beautiful and the staff is great--very attentive and polite. Rooms were clean and very beautiful. The bed was comfy and I slept great. The pool area is amazing! There is a lazy river, zero entry pool, huge whirlpool, and tons of lounge chairs, tables and umbrellas. Plenty of food options and the hotel offers a free shuttle to the the four Disney parks plus downtown disney. The only thing I didn't like was that the hotel's conference area was huge and and quite a walk from the hotel rooms and lobby. It's hard to make a quick trip back to the room while attending a conference. The business center offerd free boarding pass printing (which was nice). As a business traveler and/or confrenece attendee, this is a wonderful hotel. Also, although my family couldn't tag along, my husband and kids would have loved it here so if you are traveling for business or a conference certainly bring your family along.

Reviews.Title: “When you get a good deal...”
Reviews.Author: HONkiev
Reviews.Content: When visiting WDW we're normally staying at the Ritz-Carton and love it for its style, its service & its breakfast... but this time we got such a fabulous deal at the Hilton Bonnet Creek that we couldn't refuse. At â‚¬ 94/night incl. taxes (approx. US$ 130), not staying too much in the room/hotel anyway we gave it a try. The hotel is new, a typical chain-hotel with normal rooms (entrance, bathroom to the left, bedroom with ear-chair & working station) and normal services, nothing spectacular, nothing luxurious, good at the price, okay for a WDW stay with free & fast WDW transportations. What I didn't like: a) the breakfast is very, very standard and most of the items very tasteless. At US 18++ I would expect slightly more in selection and style b) Wi-Fi internet US$ 9.99 PER DEVICE!!! So in case you want to connect your notebook, your and your wifeâ€™s iPad and BackBerry (for foreigners because of expensive data roaming) you're on another 50 $/day! With such a good deal the Hilton Bonnet Creek is a good choice. If I would have to pay above US$ 200++ I would prefer to spend more and go to the Ritz-Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Very welcome”
Reviews.Author: Rz72801
Reviews.Content: From the lightning fast check-in to the ultra quick elevators, this hotel does an excellent job of making guests comfortable. The room on the 10th floor was very attractively furnished. Looked new and everything was super clean. Tile in the bath and coffee maker were nice touches. Special gold star for the night light feature on the bathroom mirror-someone was thinking of the guest's needs. The hotel is a destination. Along with the Waldorf next door it is not near anything to walk. However there is a everything a guest needs, from a gift/convenience store on site to several restaurants. The prices are very reasonable in the Luce for a pizza and its much better quality than delivery, plus the staff were very welcoming even for a takeout order. The breakfast buffet is great, and highly recommended. Everything from smoked salmon, made to order omelettes and small mountains of pastries to healthy options (oatmeal and fresh fruit). The best value is to order the $20 buffet (coffee and juice included) but you can also get a continental breakfast for less. If you're in a hurry you can get goumet sandwiches, desserts and beverages at their coffee bar. The shuttle bus to Downtown Disney, Epcot and the Parks is on a set schedule. The ride is in deluxe tour buses and you can even watch Finding Nemo on the ride. Didn't have time to use the pool but it looked terrific, and the exercise room has a bright view looking outside. I would recommend it for adults as well as families. The shuttle bus ride frees you from needing a car and its very spacious and beautifully landscaped.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great service”
Reviews.Author: PT155
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just stayed for a week and the hotel was a great place to stay to both chill out and to use as a base for going places. The rooms were very clean,the pool area was great. The area was nice and quiet but just 5 mins from downtown Disney and easy reach of the i4. Would go there again

Reviews.Title: “Best of all worlds in Disney”
Reviews.Author: WildcatGuy
Reviews.Content: Our family has always been big Disney fans and have always stayed in the park in the past. We have stayed in all levels of accommodations in Disney and have always been pleased. This time with no kids (conference), my wife and I spent 4 days at this relatively new Hilton. Although if you have small kids I'd recommend you stay in a Disney property for full Disney ambiance, with teens or adults only this place rocks. It is modern, clean and new, and the location is amazingly close to Epcot, Downtown Disney and Hollywood Studios. It is inside the World although not officially. There is a Waldorf that is a connecting sister property and the two share the massive conf centre and bus service to the parks. There are two of the best restaurants in Orlando in the hotels - bull n bear and La Luce. The pool is fantastic with a lazy river, several hot tubs, etc. I'd definitely return. One of the best Hilton's I've stayed in anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel and staff Hilton Bonnet Creek!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dnabot
Reviews.Content: Friends of ours told us of their stay at the Hilton Bonnet Creek next to the Waldorf Astoria. They couldn't say enough wonderful things. So we took their advise and went this past week. The minute we pulled up we were treated like royalty! The hotel isn't your regular Hilton. This Hilton is a 6 star hotel. When we checked in we met the manager (Bill) who couldn't have been more kind to my family. Letting us know if we needed anything just ask. The hotel is located on Disney property and has transportation to and from the parks. The lazy river pool and slide my kids could have stayed in all day long. The GOLF my husband just loved. The entire hotel is clean and so beautifully done. Our room had a parlor connected to a two queen room. The parlor as they call it has an extra bathroom, table to serve 8, couch with another TV and a kitchen. It's like having a house. We ate at the Italian restaurant and had a fabulous meal. We have stayed in Disney's top hotels and this blew them away! The price is affordable and with our size family it was just what we needed.LOVE THIS HOTEL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding customer service, very nice property”
Reviews.Author: triptroll
Reviews.Content: After having been to several properties in the Orlando area this is a keeper. I would come back and highly recommend for trips to the Orlando area and Disney. Easy to take bus to and from Disney property, easy access to airport and many options for food and drink. Great option for business conference or family vacation. Rooms very nice, beds comfortable, clean and quiet! Staff was exceptionally friendly and accommodating at front desk, bell staff, housekeeping, restaurants and just about anywhere. Remarkable really. Great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Business & Family”
Reviews.Author: riceland
Reviews.Content: It's a business type hotel with a very nice pool and golf course so that the family can enjoy things while you do business. Hotel has free shuttle to Disney which works well and is a 5 minute ride to downtown Disney . However, a car is needed to get to downtown Disney and to get from the airport (21 miles) to the hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful except at the pool as you had to fetch your own drinks/ food from a very nice outside dining area. Where are the cabana boys when you need them!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and luxurious!!”
Reviews.Author: Silverjunkie2011
Reviews.Content: First time in 15 years since visiting WDW and Orlando. Couldn't decide on what hotel to stay at. Very very glad that my friend and I chose The Hilton Orlando Bonnet Creek. This hotel had exceptional service from time of check-in to check-out. The ladies working behind the counter were terrific. Almost instantly had a room upgrade to a pool and Disney view. The 9th floor was perfect. The room was in excellent condition and reminded me of staying at home. Housekeeping looked after everything and provided enough towels. The pool was great!! Loved the lazy river and water slide. Anywhere you sat was very relaxing. On the weekends they show a poolside movie - very cool. The Harvest Bistro buffet should not be missed. Brenda looked after our needs. Will definitely return! Thank you Hilton for the amazing service and memorable trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, Nice Staff, Great Golf”
Reviews.Author: snowboardingfool
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference. Very large hotel. I had a pretty good walk to my room. The rooms were nice. The beds were great. The bars were not very exciting but they served their purpose. The free shuttle to the parks was great and it saved us some cash (plan ahead they don't run every 5 minutes but the staff with give you all in the info you need). - Save time for the Pool it is big and has a large lazy river. - The running track is so short just run on the tread mill or take a left when you hit the road and run on the side walk across the street. - The room service was great (tips are included)

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: LassiComeHome
Reviews.Content: Not my first choice destination for a holiday - but had to come here for a conference and compared to other hotels I have stayed at in Orlando this is one of the best. Very modern, good sized room, well fitted out, good restaurants, and a very good gym and swimming pool. Very close to Disney World if that's your thing. Orlando downtown is about 10-15 min drive and you really need a car or you have to rely on taxi's. It is a very big hotel - like most in Orlando. But service was friendly and helpful. Would stay here again and despite being a business oriented hotel, it is also great for families.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and pool!”
Reviews.Author: gala62
Reviews.Content: We chose this property as my husband is Hilton Honors. Great choice. Everyone at this property (ok, everyone I've met!) is exceptionally pleasant, helpful and cheerful. The kind of people you want to have around you while on vacation. The property itself is new and lovely with a fantastic pool area - one of our deciding factors in coming here. A lazy river connects 2 pools along with a small waterslide off to the side, jacuzzi, and more. There's also a nice outdoor lounge with restaurant/bar. Try the white sangria..yummmm. Lots of lounge chairs all around and big towels to dry off with. A great spot to cool off, chill out and watch the sunset. The rooms are fine. Flat screen tv, comfy bed and chair. We had a great view of the pool. Bathroom is really nice with a large walk in shower with stylish tile work.Everything very clean. Prices in the cafe are reasonable and food is good. They run a complimentary shuttle to all Disney parks and Downtown Disney throughout the day. These are not rinky-dink shuttles, these are beautiful buses showing Disney movies. Be on time to your shuttle stop, they leave promptly! We would come back to Hilton Bonnet Creek in a heartbeat. It's wonderful to be so close to Disney, but away from the craziness.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort right on Disney”
Reviews.Author: PinaColada02
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights to attend a work conference being held there and was impressed by the resort. I didn't see much of the resort itself but my room was very nice. It was spacious, the bed was really comfortable and the room was well appointed in terms of furnishings. The bathroom was a good size with modern fixtures. I liked the glass enclosed shower (vs. bathtub with shower curtain) and the bathroom had plenty of counter space which is sometimes an issue with hotel bathrooms. I had a problem the first night with my shower in that the stripping on the shower door was bent so the door would not close all the way and water leaked out of the shower. I reported it to the front desk and it was fixed by the time I came back to my room later that day. I ate in two of the hotel's restaurants -- the Italian restaurant was really good. The Bistro was ok, just average. Unfortunately I did not get the chance to enjoy any of the leisure areas of the resort (e.g. pool, grounds, etc.) but from what I could see it looked really nice. I definitely would come back with my family if I were planning a Disney trip.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the reviews. This is the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: angelambudd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights over the Columbus weekend. We were on the 12th floor with a Disney view room., actually not a bad walk to the elevators but not too close. We had a Disney view but could not see the fireworks from our room. This is not guaranteed with a Disney view as it will depend on what part of the building you are in. We did overlook disney and it was amazing (just couldn;t see the fireworks). We overlooked the beautiful pool area and ponds and golf courses and it is well worth it for the view. Our little one watched the pool like a hawk to see what was going on! The rooms are very good sized but not huge, as is the bathroom not huge, but everything is brand new and completely spotless. This is the cleanest hotel I have ever stayed in and I stay in a lot of hotels. Amazing job by housekeeping and we hardly saw them. The pool area is the main attraction. It is so great. The lazy river is warm and keeps the kids occupied all day. My husband and I would take turns floating with our son and this was well deserved after a long day at the parks (we just stayed at the pool our last day, as everyone was tired and this is what our son wanted to do the most!) At the waterslide (which is fun for kids and adults), there are two staff members supervising, so we were able to let our son go down the slide without worrying about watching him. This pool is spectacular and should not be missed. The resort is beautiful and we walked over to the WA but didn't spend time over there. It looks very upscale. The dining is a mixture. Harvest Bistro for breakfast was pretty good. La Luce was absolutely fabulous. One of the best Italian meals I have had. Fantastic! Muse is a coffeeshop (think Starbucks) and was great for breakfast. They have bagels, muffins, pastry and donuts (plus icecream and dessert) We would grab a bagel before heading to the parks as to not waste time. Big plus! Took the shuttle once to the parks and it worked great. We travelled with family that had a car so we only used the shuttle once. I would recommend a car for at least some of the days of a trip. Just to run to the store and buy water and snacks and a change in the dinner availability. This is a great place and we will be back next year! One other tip: I booked the room 4 months in advance and then checked back online with Hilton and the price dropped twice. I called Hilton each time and they lowered our rate each time. This saved us over $300 ($50/night) on the rate and really made a huge difference. I will try this everytime now.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in central location to Disney parks”
Reviews.Author: JDawgTravels
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Hilton Bonnet Creek for a conference and all in all had a great stay. The room was clean and comfortable, with a window that looked out in the direction of the Disney parks. I even saw fireworks one of the nights I was there. The staff was very friendly, and the facility was expansive, as it connects with a conference center and the Waldorf hotel next door. The fitness room was pretty big and clean, so I was able to get in a few workouts during my stay. The pool looked like a lot of fun, but sadly I didn't make it outside too much. Would recommend this hotel for business travelers and anyone who wants to be close to the Disney parks.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Resort”
Reviews.Author: tomkat95
Reviews.Content: This resort is excellent! We went to Downtown Disney for dinner and upon returning this resort was 5 minutes away but seemed like it was light years away - no hustle, serene atmosphere with exceptional pool and views of Disney in the distance. Won't stay anywhere else at Disney ever again. Free frequent shuttles to all Disney locations along with a self park covered parking garage. Can't say enough about how wonderful this Disney vacation was because of this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, pity about the music around the pool”
Reviews.Author: RandKDoncaster
Reviews.Content: We were a party of 6 adults and 5 children who stayed at the hotel for 9 nights while visiting Orlando. We had a dual purpose for the visit, these being to visit the theme parks and some sun and relaxation by the pool. The Hotel. We found the rooms to be very clean and comfortable with the staff being as helpful and friendly as in any hotel we have stayed at. It could become a bit manic at the weekend with the convention centre but it was of very little inconvenience to us. The free Internet access was very useful in the reception area with the printer. We were able to check in on line before we set off for the airport and printed our boarding passes. I was also able to check the UK football results and reports. The quality of food and drink was good but as in all Hilton Hotels, a bit on the expensive side. It is easy enough to have a take away brought in to the hotel if you want to eat cheaply and not go out. The hotel staff has menus from different food outlets that they will give you to choose from. A plus side of eating in the hotel when you have young children is that they have kids eat free. This is good value if you have a young family with you Parking is in a multi storey car park costing 13$ per day self park and 20$ per day valet park. We used the self-park and only had problems at the weekend with the number of cars for the conventions. The car park is about 500 yards from the hotel entrance Hotel Location. We thought that the location was ideal. Downtown Disney and most of the theme parks are only a short drive away with a free shuttle bus for Downtown Disney and some of the theme parks. The pick up point was near the Hilton multi story car park, it then picks up at the nearby Waldorf Hotel. Swimming Pool and Pool Bar The swimming pool was of the best we have used and is very child friendly with easy access for even the youngest child. We thought the pool bar was good with a good standard of food.
