The only, and major complaint we had about the hotel, and it is not just the Hilton, is that I would ask all hotel managers, WHY O WHY in this day and age of personal listening equipment such as i pods are we expected to put up with music that we donâ€™t like, being played around the swimming pool when all we want to do is relax and read a book or magazine. The volume was just bearable in the week but at the weekend there was a DJ playing, what was to me awful music at such a volume that I managed until 3 pm on the Sunday, I then had to go to the room with a headache. You may say why not go to a quieter area around the pool but all week the piped music is from speakers positioned all around the pool. At the weekend, even though it is a large pool, the DJ positioned himself in the middle of the pool area so no escape from the noise was possible. Summary. Very good comfortable hotel, well positioned with good staff, good swimming pool but please cut down the music volume. Would we stay here again? Most definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!!”
Reviews.Author: Windylady1004
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night to hang out and go to Wet and Wild. We hung out at the pool for a few hours and the service was excellent! The bar manager with the blonde hair and the bartender (I can't remember his name...) were both beyond friendly and helpful. The lobby area was ultra chic and amazing. Great mojitos too! The hotel is very close to everything you could need and I don't think I'd stay anywhere else but this hotel from now on. Thanks everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: gmr13
Reviews.Content: Chose the Hilton Orlando Bonnet Creek for an Epcot Wine and Food Festival trip. Booked a three night stay mainly due to the wonderful TripAdvisor reviews. We were not disappointed. The hotel is very close to Downtown Disney and Epcot, but not walking distance; no problem - free prompt shuttle service every hour. The hotel itself is new, clean and beautiful. The lazy river is amazing and we loved how the jets propel you around the perimeter of the pool. We were in a standard room on the 18th floor which had a coffeemaker and mini refrigerator. The bathroom was ample (only one sink, but plenty of counter space). Good shower pressure and the towels are very soft and plush. They give you robes which usually only resorts and 5-star luxury hotels provide, a very nice amenity considering the price. The service was wonderful and the Harvest Bistro had a delicious breakfast. I usually do not do buffets, but this one was clean, well supervised and wonderfully stocked; well worth the price. There is no "resort fee" however Internet is $9.95 per day and self parking is $13.00 per day. Overall an very good hotel for the price, just wish there was no self parking fee.

Reviews.Title: “Lazzzzzzzzzzy River”
Reviews.Author: Hollydaze57
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently for 2 weeks with our son and daughter in law and must say it is a well maintained as well as spotlessly clean hotel. The foyer - that houses the reception, concierge & a bar area is huge! But then, when you think they have numerous conference facilities it can fill up and get rather noisy as there is nothing to absorb the noise. The lifts (elevators) are excellent and the corridors are kept nice and clean/clear. On arrival at reception they had us all booked in the same room, but this was rectified straight away without problem. There is no assistance given or offered with luggage, so you have to manage this yourself. On to our room. As we were part of a package deal with Virgin we were not given a choice of room/view. After reading some of the reports on Trip Advisor I can only assume that there are rooms larger than ours was. Having said that, it was more than adequate for our stay. Not a lot of wardrobe space, but plenty of drawer space. The fridge and safe are a bonus. We were on the 16th floor so did have a good view of the countryside, but not of the pool or Disney. Downside was that we were near the Grande Vista Room and that was used a few evenings during our stay as a 'hospitality' room. This made it very noisy, especially when people drifted out onto the floor area by the lifts to chat! We spent the whole holiday dreading the next event. I will say we did not complain to management as it did not start until after the weekend that we arrived (we got there on a Thursday) and so we had unpacked all our luggage and it would have meant repacking etc if they moved us.....we were just hoping it did not happen every night. The Virgin Room is also on this floor and my son was near that, but did not have any problems (This room is excellent for Virgin guests). The tea/coffee/milk provided is very frugal, so we asked for extra every day and this was provided by our housekeeper. Also you are only supplied with 2 polystyrene cups - but about 4 lids?!?! Once again we asked for extra cups. We don't watch television much on holiday, but do like to keep up with the news. However the picture kept pixulating and freezing, so we didn't get to see much at all. The bathroom is quite small, but with ample towels which is excellent. It is the first hotel we've stayed in that doesn't supply shower gel. There are 2 different soaps, shampoo, conditioner and mouthwash, but no gel. The soap (and anything else that has been used, albeit even once) is renewed every day! Methinks I would prefer one bar of soap for the sink and some shower gel for use in the shower. The bed is very, very comfy and so are the pillows. But as comfy as it was, I can't agree that it is the best bed I've ever slept in. Included in our holiday was breakfast (at $19 per person per day it was good to have this included in our holiday), this is served in the Harvest Bistro. They do a brill job of seating people and waiting on them. Everyone was efficient, from the cheerful people that met you at the door and seated you, to the waiting staff. Greg in particular was a delight. The food at breakfast was good, and so was the selection. We only had one evening meal there as there is not a lot of choice. It would have been nice if they did a weekly menu so you had a different choice the 2nd week, but it stays the same. We didn't eat at La Luce. We hired a car and included in our package was parking - and at $13 a day this too was a bargain for us. We never had any problems self parking. The lazy river is a wonderful asset for the hotel, we really enjoyed it. Towels are supplied in the pool area and they come round with frozen grapes! Although we didn't use the rings I would suggest that the grapes are kicked into touch in favour of a 'no charge' for the rings, as $5 per time this must work out expensive for families. I have to add that I do think that the hire charge for these and the cost of parking should both be absorbed into the cost of the holiday and not an extra. The hotel is rather out of the way, and although there is a complimentary shuttle bus to all the Disney attractions it is still on a timetable so you have to work around it, so it is best to hire a car. Maybe what they charge for parking covers the cost of the shuttle? If you want a choice of place to eat then you definitely need transport. All in all, the hotel is very nice and very good. We weren't there when there were many families as it was after school holidays, but I think from what I've seen that this is definitely more geared to conferences and the guests that attend them, rather than people like us who were there for 2 weeks and families. The standard is certainly no better or worse than I would expect from a hotel from the Hilton range or a 4/5* star hotel. Yes the service is good (although one of the guys at the concierge desk was quite 'terse' with us), yes the rooms are clean and well attended, yes the public area's are clean and tidy and the maintenance of the hotel is good. Yes the lazy river is brilliant. It is expensive (but it is a Hilton hotel so it really is to be expected, so do not be surprised) but no more so than lots of other hotels of the same calibre, somewhat noisy at times, very noisy at others in the main areas and, as stated, on floor 16. Every hotel has noisy areas, but you couldn't get away from the noise for a quiet drink when conference people were staying in the hotel. First and foremost it IS a conference hotel. Having said all this I would certainly recommend the hotel, and if you've read this and have seen what I consider to be the good and (not so) bad aspects, then you will know what to expect. You may agree with some and disagree with other points, but at least you will have an idea. And yes, I would definitely go back there - with a car again and on a different floor.

Reviews.Title: “Disney wine and dine stay”
Reviews.Author: bpepp22
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last weekend dor the Disney Wine and Dine Half Marathon. I was so impressed with all the extras the hotel did for all participants. From a hand written congratulation note to a bottle of wine to a automatic late checkout, free bus ride , snacks , spa discount, pasta dinner Totally amazing for anyone coming to the Disney marathon in Jan or the Princess in Feb. We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: LSB538
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through lowcostusa.com and it blew us away! From the moment we arrived the staff were friendly, professional, polite and extremely attentive. The lobby was opulent and absolutely enormous!! We felt rather underdressed walking around in shorts and t shirts when everyone else was in suits and dresses. The coffee shop was most welcome and serves the most delicious cinnamon rolls!! We didn't eat at any of the restaurants so can't comment on those. The rooms were immaculately clean and easily big enough for two people for a week. We were on the 10th floor and the view over towards Disney was spectacular. The bed was the most comfortable bed I have EVER slept in! The pool was very clean and the lazy river so relaxing. Again the pool staff were attentive and friendly. We got so much for the money that we spent staying here and would definately return. Only think to be aware of is that the car park is $13 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Nickel and Dime”
Reviews.Author: Sirenia13
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because we really like Hilton properties and had never stayed at this one. The rates were quite high, but it was a girls only Birthday celebration, so we decided to go ahead and splurge. Little did we know we would be nickel and dimed for everything. $13 SELF parking fee, $5 tube rental (they didn't even have enough tubes to rent us 1), and 5 different fees added to room service. At $200 a night, self parking and tube rental should be included. The pool closed at 10pm and the 2 small hot tubs were filled with children. We had a very hard time finding parking (due to the HUGE convention center being used) or for that matter any helpful or friendly people. If you choose to self park, be warned...there are NO bell carts...You will be carrying all your luggage a LONG way through the entire hotel. The hallways are endless and confusing. The beds were absolutely the most comfortable hotel beds I have ever slept on. The bathrooms were quite small and very usual.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel everyone should experience!”
Reviews.Author: Vicki1405
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for 14 nights and do not know where to begin explaining how impressed I was with the service! I am 21 years old and went on a family vacation to Disney, Universal etc and decided to choose the Hilton hotel as it was still inside the Disney resort area but would not be packed with young children. My family and I often visit Florida and stay in Disney Deluxe Resorts and this hotel beats them all! After a flight delay and very long 10 hour journey the staff at the hotel were very helpful showed us to our suite which was HUGE! We chose to have a suite rather than just one room as the Disney hotel rooms have often been a little bit too small for comfort in the past however the rooms in the Hilton are much bigger and there really wasn't much need for the extra room. My family had notified the hotel staff that I had recently graduated from university and I found throughout the two weeks random staff congratulating me which was a lovely touch. Wine and a cheese platter was also sent to my room as a gift from the staff. The restaurant staff are all very helpful and the food was delicious in all three places, all waiters and waitresses go out of their way to make sure you are enjoying your food and are more than happy to help with absolutely anything from food related queries to what are the best new shows in Magic Kingdom. The free Disney shuttle bus service is brilliant the coach is huge with comfortable seats and very punctual. In the mornings they often play a film on the coach to keep you entertained whilst on your journey, we saw Rio, Toy Story 3 and Robots. The pool area can get busy at weekends as many families come with their children as a weekend break however there were always sun loungers available and friendly staff bringing round frozen grapes. The lazy river is great especially when you are in the sun for long periods of time. There are also pool movies every Friday and Saturday night. Overall I could not fault this hotel the staff cannot do more for you and are so friendly. If you want a vacation in Florida and want a more 'grown up' hotel this is the place! A special thanks to Brianne, Ilia, Kevin S, Jennifer and the Harvest Bistro breakfast staff for making my graduation vacation amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!”
Reviews.Author: NY_NJer
Reviews.Content: This is our third time staying at this resort. The first time was just my husband and myself. The last two times were with my 4 years old twin boys. The boys loved the lazy river. They didn't appreciated the first time (when they were 3 years old) but this time, they didn't want to leave the pool area. There was never a wait at Harvest Cafe for breakfast. The room was very clean and the beds were comfortable. Since we are Hilton Gold Members, we were always upgraded to Disney view rooms. Also you get free internet access. We can't wait to go back next July.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hilton ever!”
Reviews.Author: Topolino_Alex
Reviews.Content: This is definitively the best Hilton I have ever stayed at. The rooms are pretty and clean, the hotel staff is very friendly and the pool area is great. As there is not much infrastructure in the surrounding area it is necessary to have a car. However, this is not unusual in the States and especially in Orlando. Theme parks (especially Disney Downtown & Disney's waterparks) are only a short ride.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for Disney”
Reviews.Author: IainP2
Reviews.Content: I found the Bonnet Creek Hilton on Tripadvisor and as it was new thought I'd give it a try on my first trip to Orlando. What an amazing hotel. While it's an enormous property (like most hotels in the area), the staff remember who you are and treat you like a guest, not a number. The range of restaurants between the Hilton and the Waldorf Astoria is amazing (I didn't get to them all) and the free shuttle to Walt Disney World was a real bonus. I would certainly recommend this hotel to people who didn't want to stay in a 'Disney themed' hotel, but still wanted the convenience of being close to the park.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cluedotom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 11 nights staff at reception need to attend customer service school waited until 3pm for room told will call when my room was ready never replied, never given any details about the hotel at reception very poor ! Hotel has a great pool area but sadly children's entertainment is non existent for hotel this size, food and drinks are expensive , golf course and hotel adjacent the waldorf superb , the Bonnet Creek is a hotel which caters for conferences so if you don't like conferences stay clear better hotels in Orlando .

Reviews.Title: “LUXURY AT a AFFORABLE PRICE!!”
Reviews.Author: Onargaboy
Reviews.Content: From the time we checked in till we left everyone was so kind and courteous.. with a touch of Fun! We were upgraded to the 18th floor and saw the fireworks everynight. They also included a unbelievable free breakfast. It was like a Sunday brunch. The Hilton at Bonnet Creek was OUSTANDING!! Great lazy river. stay here its well worth your $$$ Thanks Hilton!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Latonia S
Reviews.Content: Stay at the Hilton Bonnet Creek while attending an conference. Best hotel I've stayed at in a long time. All of the staff I interacted with was professional and courteous. Lives up to the Hilton's brand name. Can be a bit pricey but because of conference attendance I only paid the group special rate (which was an excellent rate for a hotel like this). Room was great, beds comfy, and bathroom clean. Everything you need (lounge, restaurants, cafe, gift shop, health club, spa, golf, walking trails, and pools) are right there on the hotel property. Hotel property has beautiful landscaping.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: davidisdabest
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel with my family, and it is probably the best ive stayed at! The staff are very friendly, the grounds are immaculate, the lazy river is fantastic and the hotel was very clean. The hotel is linked to the Waldorf Astoria via a Conference Hall/Centre, the hotel is probably set up more for conferences than families, but we all still had a great time. Somedays by the pool there was a DJ playing games with the kids and at night they played a movie in the pool which was great. The price of food and drink is a bit expensive, but nothing you wouldnt expect to pay at a great resort like this. When sitting round the pool staff come round with frozen grapes and ice cold towels during the day, and it is touches like this that make this hotel so fantastic. The rooms are pretty standard, the only downfall was the TV, it kept freezing and losing signal throughout the holiday, and one night it lost complete signal so we was without digital TV all night. It didnt affect our stay because we was not there to sit in the room and watch TV, but of a night it sometimes did get annoying. All in all, great hotel, good location but youll need a car, good for families too but not the ideal family hotel for people with little kids!

Reviews.Title: “Will go back!”
Reviews.Author: Butski
Reviews.Content: We wanted a quick getaway at a nice resort and this fit the bill. The hotel is relatively new and very well appointed. Amazing lobby and lazy river pool with beach entry area. Great fun for the kids. Harvest Bistro was great and kids eat free with paying adult for breakfast and dinner. Room and bathroom were very nice and spacious. Will definitely return for a longer visit. The only negative was the overnight parking fee of $13. Staff was very courteous. Great rate of $143 thru AAA.

Reviews.Title: “What a meeting site!”
Reviews.Author: Accounting Professor
Reviews.Content: Oh lucky me; a college educators' conference at this Hilton. My spouse and I were very pleased with our room on the 15th floor with EPCOT view. The price was more than reasonable at $152 + taxes a night. The 41" HDTV was the perfect size for the room. I had a good work space at the desk. The bathroom had a good amount of counter space for 2 people. Our hallway was quiet. Noise was never an issue. The staff has been well trained and there are many of them. I have never experienced such a professional banquet staff at the hundreds of conferences I have attended over the years! The quality of the meeting food was stunning. Dim sum at a meeting? A Chinese colleague was gushing over the choices at the oriental themed lunch. If one has to attend a professional meeting, The Hilton at Bonnet Creek makes the process as painless as possible. My husband was thrilled with the workout facility. It was a large, spacious facility with a wide variety and quantity of equipment. Should one find a crowd in the facility, one can gain access to the similar sized facilty at the Waldorf Astoria as the hotels are connected. Hilton key cards work there and vice versa. All the restaurants and bars permit guests of either hotel to sign for their purchases. We have stayed at many hilton properties over the years and this property is the nicest to carry the Hilton name.

Reviews.Title: “3 Day, nonDisney, getaway.”
Reviews.Author: tampafitz
Reviews.Content: Spent a nice 3 day weekend at the hotel. Initially our rooms weren't ready for over 2 hours and the manager refused to speak with us; however, being Hilton Honors members, we received a $50 resort credit. Rooms were very clean, comfortable with nice views of lazyriver and golfcourse. Pool area was great; zero entry pool, long winding lazy river, and Disney movies in pool each night. Harvest Bistro had excellent breakfast and dinner buffets; kids eat free! Lunches poolside were very good, but expectedly pricey. Highly recommend for a Disneyclose escape. We have stayed twice more since, too.

Reviews.Title: “Just What I Needed”
Reviews.Author: DemandingGuest
Reviews.Content: This hotel is set back from the busy steet which connects Downtown Disney to EPCOT and the Magic Kingdom beyond. Being so close to everything, you'd expect it to be noisy and hustling but it isn't. It was quiet at night, with no noisy newspaper drop off or invoice delivery at 3 am. The mornings were slow and relaxed. Staff was pleasant and helpful. There is a big lounge/bar area in the spacious lobby which overlooks the pool and golf course. It was the perfect place for an evening cocktail and people watching. The guests were more the adult/golfer and business crowd than the family vacation set. Plenty of kids of course, but not at all like the feel of an on-campus resort at Disney. The Bonnet Creek Resort area is only a few minutes from either EPCOT, MK or Hollywood Studios. It means you have to use a car rather than the Disney bus line, but that can be good because you aren't on someone else's schedule. My one criticism is the shower door. The design allows water to go all over the bathroom floor. And the shower head was one of those low-flow heads that makes getting shampoo out a chore. I really enjoyed dinner at La Luce. Although the menu seemed limited, the kitchen was fine accommodating my special request.

Reviews.Title: “Upscalish but a bit far from anything not connected to Disney.”
Reviews.Author: DarkAges
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night, business. Everything is new, staff is very friendly and helpful. Great welcoming and check in process, very comfortable and quiet room, seventh floor, not facing the pool (read the other reviews !). Asked for late check out, since my flight was not leaving until late afternoon. No problem, granted with a smile and without any surcharge or anything else (4 P.M. check-out). Actual check was as fast and pleasant as the check in. Be aware however that even though the hotel has several bars and restaurants, you will find in themthe typical convention crowd, besides familes with children, and if you wish to wonder out, you are a bit far from any mall or strip. Your only option will be a taxi (no public transportation available, this is not NY or Boston, or Chicago). The pool is great and the lazy river is quite long. There is a nice bar at one of the ends of the pool, and at the other end, there is a screen for film showing. It is like a drive in, but pool like (pool-in ? Swim-in?). They show disney films for children, which I find marvelous. And clever. The only downside of the pool is that there is not a single area deeper than 5 feet. You can literally walk/stand everywhere, so if you really want a pool where you can swim laps, this is not it. Choice of food is O.K., with an upscale Italian restaurant (did not get to try it), and a more middle of the road one at the pool level (I ordered a special burger which was nothing memorable, but again, I just needed to eat something and I was by myself). Another thing you absolutely need to be aware of is the surcharges you will be slammed with if you order breakfast to eat in your room. I was so astonished and knew my friends would not believe it that I took a picture of the proposed breakfast menu. The food itself is nothing out of the ordinary, and the pricing is in accordance to what you can expect in a Hilton. HOWEVER, a fine print at the bottom says : "22% of the food and beverage total plus applicable state/local tax will be added to your account as a service charge, of which 17% will be fully distributed to servers and 5% will be reatained by the hotel as administrative fee. This fee is not a gratuity and is the property of the hotel to cover discretionary costs. An additional $3 in room dining charge, plus any tax, will be added to your account". Finally, trip to and from the airport if you tale a taxi is between 60 and 70 USD. Overall, great hotel, super location if you are Disneying, very pleasant staff, perfect for one or two night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: sbmorg01
Reviews.Content: Very nice and beautiful hotel. Loved the lazy river. Room service quick and very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Location, and Value!”
Reviews.Author: RoColorado
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in mid-September for a conference and found the bed luxurious, the room comfortable for working and relaxing. I had a room on a high floor with a Disney view, so got to see fireworks at 9:00 p.m. The breakfast buffet was very good and service in the Harvest restaurant was excellent. The homemade pastas at La Luce restaurant were amazingly light and flavorful. The pool with lazy river and water slide were fun. It was a good value in a great location with transportation around Disney. The conference facilities were comfortable and spacious. The service throughout the hotel was exceptional, a great staff! I'd recommend the hotel without reservation and only wish I had more time to spend there for play, not work. A good hotel for tourists, families, and business people.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, nice place”
Reviews.Author: Susana114
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, newer hotel with a huge, fun pool and lazy river on property. I stayed here for a conference and liked the facilities with access to natural light and fresh air. I would definitely return with my family, mostly due to the great pool, kidsâ€™ activities and proximity to Disney. I also liked the restaurant, La Luce, and ate there twice. The homemade pastas are fresh and tasty. I went to Disney one evening and had some difficulty returning to the hotel. The free shuttle bus service ended early in the evening and I had to take a taxi back. Another downside at this hotel was loud guests in the hallways (a loud family at 2:58 am??), but thatâ€™s not the hotelâ€™s fault. Overall, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “UPMARKET”
Reviews.Author: KATRINA H
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice. The pool was fab with a amazing lazy river. Breakfast was great. we had booked to stay at hilton international drive, but they overbooked so this was not our first choice as we wanted to stay on int drive. overall it was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Graeme1551
Reviews.Content: We have been to florida a few time and this hotel is the best by far, the pool area is grate (heated) rooms very we would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel-loved it!”
Reviews.Author: lw0
Reviews.Content: We have been to florida 3 times and this by far was the best. We have done it on a budget and 5 star and this was the best! This hotel is perfect location, staff,food,rooms,decor. Could not fault anything during our stay. Buffet breakfast was delicious and so much choice for $15pp. Location is perfect for all parks- in Disney area without the high price tag of a similar quality hotel. The pool is great with the lazy river-dont hire the rubber rings $5 each time-just buy one from Walmart. Snack food by the pool was delicious without being too expensive. Room was huge, beds were signature hilton beds, hotel provided cot, fridge which was great as we had our son with us. Views over the golf courses were very pretty and some rooms could see Epcot firewaorks at night. Car Parking was free in the hotel car park if staying there. Complimentary shuttles if you don't drive but recommend a car! Lobby area was always buzzing and elegant with staff everywhere if you needed anything. Definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: kelley_11
Reviews.Content: Almost everything was perfect. We stayed here for 2 nights in July for a football tournament my son was in at the sports complex. This place is awesome and would consider coming here for our next vacation and never leave the resort. We have 2 boys ages 8 & 9 and they were competely entertained at the lazy river and pool. They have a slide and break out the big screen at night for the kids with a movie. The room was kept clean and being a diamond member they really took good care of us. Complimentary chocolates at night, 2 free breakfast certificates each day and kids eat free. They also gave us vouchers for free ice cream for the kids each day. The property is beautiful and the breakfast buffett was awesome. The Harvest Bistro is where the kids eat free but you have to buy at least one entree to get this. I got a burger for $13.00, which was the cheapest item on the menu. It was good but not $13.00 good. They had an Italian buffet on Friday night which was excellent and worth the money. Self parking is $10.00 per day and you should consider buying a float at walmart instead of renting one from the hotel for $5.00 per day. If you like mountain dew, I suggest you bring it with you. Disney has a contract with coke and you can't find Pepsi products within 5 miles of this place. Of all the Hiltons we have stayed in around Florida, this one tops the list by far. Super clean and the beds and bedding were comfortable as usual. The only complaint I have is that the wait staff in the Harvest Bistro were not very friendly and slow to check back with you. If you come to see the attractions...beware you might not ever want to leave the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: walshwku
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Bonnet Creek is a fabulous place to stay. We recently had a convention type show. Andrea, our event coordinator did a wonderful job. She accomadated our every need. The food at both the show and at the restaurants were great. My kids fell in love with the lazy river and the water slide. Pooside service was great from Angel. Only downside of the whole 3 days there was the distance from the elevator to our room. It was quite a walk back and forth.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Djohnson14
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot. Been a lot of places. I have been here three times since it has opened. Absolutely great. Don't even need to leave the hotel. We live two hrs away in Sarasota and LOVE to come here for long weekends #1 in orlando

Reviews.Title: “Better than any Disney resort!”
Reviews.Author: marathon-m0m
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Bonnet Creek in August 2011. Awesome experience. Previously we have always stayed at Disney resorts (Yacht/Beach Club, AK Lodge, Wilderness Lodge) but never again...this Hilton was great. Location is perfect, right by Epcot. You do have to drive to the parks but it beats sitting on the bus. Bathrooms here are bigger and nicer...towels are plush and soft. Beds were super-comfy. Pool is great with a nice long lazy river that the kids really enjoyed. They also liked the slide but seemed to enjoy the river more. Tubes to float down the river can be rented for $5 or bought for $10 so we bought one for each kid. In addition to the lazy river and slide there were staff members at the poolside who organized games for the kids in the pool (football, make your own treasure chest) and they were really good with the kids. Meals...KIDS EAT FREE for breakfast and dinner at Harvest. And this is no ordinary (crummy) cereal and bagels breakfast...it's a full buffet every day with an omelette station, pancake/waffle station, cereals, granola, lots of fresh fruit, etc. I highly recommend the package that includes the breakfast (otherwise it's $20 per adult). Kids do not eat free at the Italian restaurant but we went anyway one night and it was delicious. Oh and I had a lot of cappuccinos from the coffee bar in the lobby and they were great. Fabulous hotel- you really can't go wrong. Will be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hilton with attentive service”
Reviews.Author: scbaks
Reviews.Content: This is the third time in the last year we have stayed at this hotel. The previous times were just a couple of nights each prior to boarding a Disney cruise. This time we stayed four nights and visited Disney parks. We received a great rate on Ideeli.com. Hotel is very well maintained withnlarge rooms and beds that are super comfortable. As this is a resort location they seem to go out of their way to provide extra service touches such as a greeter mid lobby to provide answers and directions. This property shares some common spaces with the Waldorf sister hotel. As a Hilton honors member we were offered free daily continental breakfast. We ended up using the coffee shop option, Muse. Good coffee and wonderful hot fresh cinnamon rolls.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing”
Reviews.Author: C_David_N
Reviews.Content: With so many choices in the Orlando area to stay, it is hard to discern where to stay for a vacation. Living in Florida for more than 25 years, we have spent many vacations in the Orlando area at various hotels. Our last trip was at the Hilton Orlando Bonnet Creek. This hotel, or should I say resort, is a gem located in the perfect location right near Disney World and Downtown Disney. Everything at the Hilton Orlando Bonnet Creek far exceeded all of our expectations. We stayed 3 nights for a get-a-way from South Florida and to re-visit some of the parks. Check-in went flawlessly, Lauren met us at the front desk with a smile and the most pleasant attitude, we could tell she enjoyed her job and right away we felt at home. While checking in, Kevin, one of the hotel managers, came out and introduced himself and made sure that we were being taken care of. We were very impressed with the attention to detail, the dÃ©cor and the cleanliness of the lobby. You could tell that the employees took pride in the pace as well as in their own appearance. Upon arriving to the room we were surprised at how spacious it was, it had a refrigerator and other amenities useful for families. The room was clean, well kept and spotless! We looked out the window at a wonderful view of Disney World. But the best view seen from the window was the Lazy River and pool slide below. That evening we went to a show at Downtown Disney, which is very close to the hotel and no traffic. Came back to a quiet hotel and fell asleep in the lush bed with many choices of pillows. The next morning, we went downstairs to have a quick breakfast before going to the park. We were greeted at our table by Greg to ask if we would like to order from the menu or have the buffet. The logical choice was the buffet due to the enormity of food on it. The highlight of the breakfast was the fresh egg omelet made to order by the cook and the bread pudding. This buffet had so much, from pancakes, waffles, eggs, bacon, different breads, donuts, it would be hard not to find more items to try than you have room for in your stomach. Greg went well beyond what was expected to make out breakfast experience pleasurable. We spent more time at the buffet trying new food items than we had planned and got a late start to the park. While at the park, we really thought that the Lazy River at the resort would feel much better than the heat radiating from the walkways and people in line. So we left after a couple of hours and went back to enjoy the resort. Back the resort we went to Beeches, the bar located next to the Lazy River, Brittany help us with the drinks and Daniel came by to greet us and make sure everything was going well. The drinks at Beeches were wonderful and the atmosphere was great. We spent the rest of the time at the hotel with a couple of shopping trips to the close by outlet mall. One of the nicer things about this resort is that it is connected to the Waldorf Astoria. So when we felt like we needed an escape to a more adult location, we just walked to the Waldorf pools and stay there for a while. The Hotel has so many restaurants to choose from and you also have access to those in the Waldorf Astoria along with the spa. We spent our last night at the Sena Bar, located in the lobby of the Hilton where Cassy took very good care of us. This resort far exceeded our expectations and we are looking forward to our next trip to the Hilton Orlando Bonnet Creek and taking a ride on the Lazy River!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, awesome pool”
Reviews.Author: Wrightbythesand
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity to spend 7 nights at this hotel recently and we were absolutely blown away with all the accommodations and amenities. Our well appointed room was on the 18th floor and overlooked the pool and Pop Century hotel. ("Well appointed" is code for very nice but not excessively spacious.) There are several restaurants and fast service food places on site; a little pricier than I expected but after all it is a four star Hilton Hotel. We stocked the frig in our room with breakfast items and beverages so that helped to defray the costs. The Hilton pool is totally awesome! It is a giant lazy river with several areas that open to wider mini pool areas. There is a zero depth pool area where they show movies at night. If you want a regular pool, go next door to the Waldorf Astoria. The staff was certainly helpful enough. Now for the down side....the free transportation to the Disney Parks can't compare to the Disney Hotels. The shuttle times are very limited and the shuttle company does not do a good job of providing adequate transportation in peak times. We ended up taking several more taxis than planned. If you stay at this hotel you canâ€™t take advantage of the Disney Magic hours or the Disney meal plan. All things being equal, I would stay at a Disney property next time but this was a really really nice alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Great Facility.. great Breakfast..Minor Issues.. We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: pyrsandplanes
Reviews.Content: First time stayer at Hilton Bonnet Creek. Usually J.W. Marriott Grande lakes stayer or ritz carlton in orlando. Beautiful 2 year old facility. Lazy river almost as good as the j.w. marriott one.. would have been as good, except it seemed that Hilton didnt vaccum or clean leaves, sand, debris from the giant pool and lazy river once during hte 4 day stay. Junkon the pool bottom was still there 4 days later. Kind of like the room housekeeping. Dirty glasses sat for 2 days without replacement until placed in the sink for attention. Empty ice bucket with water in nit survived 2 days housekeeping too. Chuck iof candy on floor lasted through three supposed vacuming of the carpet till it went. Room air conditioning is quiet, but like all properties cheap or expensive, you're not going to get A/C from around 1-4:30AM.. you know the drill... wake upo stifling hot in the middle of the night... cost saver for the property, I get it.. same drill here... Low flow toilet in the room clogged twice with normal use. Once required a maintenance visit to correct. I get it, super low flow toilets, save the earth, save some cash for the property/Hilton.. Initially assigned a room that had crpet cleaning blowers, extension cords and mildew stink when I opened the door. Story goes that the last resident fell asleep while filling the top and even a day later carpet was still stinky and satured. Front desk claimed room showed as ready for guests in his inventory system. Provided a free in room movie and 4 drinks coupons to make up for the schlep back to the desk ( we didnt use any of them so cannot tell you how the bars or in room moives are...) Kids enjoyed the weekend nightly outdoor movies at the zero entry pool area. Giant blow up screen , disney flicks... fun for everyone.. during summer its nightly, off season weekend only. Breakfast buffett was awaesome, service was variable mornings great, 2 not so attentive. BUT.. even the worst was still better than the average jw marriott buffet employee. Omeltee makers were super friendly.. maybe it something about sweltering over 3 hot flames sucking in the non stick spray fumes that makes you friendly, but these folks will NOT disappoint!! Valet parking was average.. average wait times for the car... Property was overall fairly well maintained, but at 2 years old., its starting to show in subtle ways... 24/7 little market selling overpriced drinks/snacks/coffee etc is a nice touch. Expensive, but you've paid more elsewhere at 1AM. Some complain the property is hard to find via GPS, we just popped in the Waldorf-Astoria Orlando (adjoining and connected property) and Tom-Tom took us there.without issue. You get reciprocal use of the Waldorf facilities (pool, spa, etc) staying at the hilton, but my kids preferred the lazy river pool over the decadent and quiet adult pool at the Waldorf next store. A few minor glitches, but overall a good time, and certainly a good value for money using the "say for breakfast rate that included 2 adult buffet breakfast as part of the room rate, and kids eat for free anyway in teh harvest restaurant. So, gorge up at buffett breakfast ( i might have gills now form all the salmon I ate..) , stuff the kids and head off to the parks....

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: lorena o
Reviews.Content: Best hotel in orlando, way better than Disney resorts! service is A+, rooms are beautiful and pool is amazing, lots of activities for the kids. My 3 year old had a blast in the lazy river. Restaurants are very good and the breakfast buffet is very nice, lots of choices and high quality. we got a Disney view room and saw the fireworks from our window. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: flsunandfun
Reviews.Content: Well appointed rooms, lots of on-site activities. You can float in the lazy river, play golf or go to Disney. This hotel is in an ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: SAR1C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Bonnet Creek last year and will not hesitate to return next year. Lovely hotel, great service particularly ,thanks to Frank in the Harvest for rustling up the biggest piece of chocolate cake with candles for our daughters 12th birthday on the day we arrived, and then remembering her and checking that she had a great time. Lovely pool area and bar, delicious cinammon rolls in Muse. The shuttle bus service was great, always on time and saved us a packet on Disney parking which is now $14 a day. What more can I say. Hilton Bonnet Creek we love you , See you next year.x

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel next To Disney”
Reviews.Author: SarniaWaywardson
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hilton just after Christmas and it was top notch. Great pool area complete with a "lazy river" and a very convenient patio bar/restaurant. Rooms were spacious and super clean along with a great staff. You will have to drive to go to a convenience store or other restaurant as there is nothing within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Best Mix of Business and Fun in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: bouldertraveller
Reviews.Content: My husband was speaking at a conference and I was along for relaxation. Beautiful grounds, easy parking, our room was on the third floor looking towards Downtown Disney, nice city lights. Room was spa-like, great connectivity (a must for me) and the Lazy River and Pool music were festive and fun. Lunch poolside was nice, drinks in the lobby area bar were great for mingling. And the coffee shops were just right.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort, great service, can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: FLMom2boys
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friends for a girl's getaway. It is a lovely property, with a very nice pool area, good views, and great service. I imagine during the summer the pool might be overrun with kids, but was not crowded when we were there. They have a lovely bar area with fire pits and comfortable seating where we relaxed with yummy drinks and surprisingly good appetizers given that it was a pool bar. Service was great. There were nice touches like having ice water and cups set out so you could help yourself. Towels rolled up and ready on the tables between lounge chairs. Lots of umbrellas. Rooms are nice, clean, comfortable - what you would expect for a new Hilton. We overlooked the pool and golf course - great view. We weren't in during the evening but imagine you might be able to see some Disney fireworks. Service was lovely. Everyone was friendly, helpful and attentive from the valet the moment we pulled in and including the front desk staff, concierge, servers at pool bar and inside bar. We arrived a bit early and rooms weren't ready so they took our cell number to call. One room became ready and realizing we were still in lobby deciding what to do the gentleman at the front desk came over and got us. Later we were called promptly as the other rooms were ready. It's a very nice hotel and the great service makes this a truly wonderful place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable but crowded”
Reviews.Author: nolegirl811
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay here, but it was very crowded. The dive in movie and pool area was a lot of fun, but finding a seat difficult. Unlike other area Hilton's they do charge a rental fee for the rafts on the lazy river, so stop at Walmart and pick one up!! Wish we had known this since we had several pool floats at home we could have packed. I did not like how the lazy river emptied into the pool as people would just stand around and you would have to go around them and lose the current. The pool area was also very spread out which made watching smaller children difficult. The rooms were very comfortable and if you upgrade to the Disney view, you are able to see their fireworks from your room. Overall, it was a very enjoyable trip!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: Ohiotraveler24
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hilton over Labor Day weekend. The hotel is new and located next to Downtown Disney. It is a gorgeous property with all the amenities. The lobby is modern and chic and the rooms are lovely as well -- beds and pillows were super comfortable! The pool area includes a lazy river, slide and a bar area. The setting is absolutely gorgeous! We did find it strange that the slide dumps into a tiny separate pool which is not connected to the lazy rive or the other pools. The kids didn't mind, but it was harder to keep an eye on them with that set-up. We stayed in a Disney resort for the following week, but I have to say that if the kids had not been along we would have preferred to stay at this property for the entire visit. Excellent hotel - we will be back for another visit!

Reviews.Title: “New hotel is A+ find”
Reviews.Author: Prof01
Reviews.Content: Checked in early (11am) no problem. Didnâ€™t have a king bed available but would provide one but couldnâ€™t promise one before 3pm so stayed with two queens. Room on 8th floor with good view (as in not overlooking a parking lot or AC units). Comfy beds. Large screen LCD TV. Coffee maker that makes two separate cups at a time. Smallish bathroom with decent size shower (could be wider), no tub. One large window with one piece room darkening shade that actually covers entire window with no annoying cracks that allow in morning sun. Internet access is $10/day. Fairly new hotel (only two years old) with large conference facilities shared with Waldorf Astoria hotel on other side of conference center. Large, beautiful pool area with slow moving tub river. Central location to Disney parks, etc. Late check-out granted. Dinner at the hotelâ€™s Italian restaurant, La Luce, was great (super sauce, good service, inexpensive, great view facing west overlooking pool area). Had problem with lights in bathroomâ€¦ Light went out in bathroom (other one had had intermittent problems) at 8pm. Called guest services who said someone would be up to fix it â€œas soon as possible.â€� Waited two hours and called again. This time someone came and fixed the problem in short order. Self-parking is $13/day (connected to hotel), valet parking is $20/day. Got a late check-out (1pm) with no problem. We would most definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some average”
Reviews.Author: happyf0ur
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four, children ages 10 and 7, who spent 13 nights at the Hilton Bonnet Creek. We chose the hotel based on the positive reviews on trip advisor. I am from Europe, currently live in NY, and have travelled extensively. Over the years I have stayed in many reputable hotels around the world. Let's start with the positive. As described by many, the hotel is fairly new and in very good shape. As one reviewer posted, the building itself looks like a hospital, but inside the decor is quite warm with attention to detail. The rooms are very clean and beds comfortable. The outdoor area of the hotel, including the lazy river and golf courts, are well-maintained. The average: FOOD. Anyone who has high standards in this department will be dissapointed. The Harves Bistro has an average breakfust buffet and equally average lunch and dinner menu. We tried almost everything on the menu, including dishes that came highly recommended by the servers, and were not impressed. The Italian restaurant, La Luce, is generally regarded by staff and visitors as the better restaurant. The most positive comment I can give it, is that their pizza is very good. We were not impressed with any of the other meals we had there. My husband usually orders meat and I tend to prefer salads and seafood so we usually get a variety from the menu. We tried Oscar's for brunch one morning. There were a few items of higher quality at this buffet than the Harvest Bistro, but certainly not worth it for what they charge. The Beech cafe (outdoor pool restaurant) offers your typical unhealthy child menu. Our children did not love any of the choices and they tried them all (chicken fingers, cheese hamburger, grilled cheese sandwich, peanut butter and jelly sandwich). The chopped chicken salad and turkey wrap are the only decent choices on the regular menu. The nachos are a blend of soggy chips and toppings. Everything is very overpriced considering the quality. Since this hotel was built on a nature preserve, it is a bit of an undertaking to leave the hotel and seek out other restaurants in Orlando. Thankfully, we had a rental car during our stay, which allowed us to dine at two excellent restaurants off the hotel property. Next category is service which was mixed. Almost every server at Harvest Bistro was very gracious, friendly, and tried their best. Brenda and Rocky stood out. The manager (forgot his name) is a charming, charismatic, and very professional man. Housekeeping was great. Service outside: worst in the hotel. This is where a supervisor or manager is needed most, but was not visible. Most servers appear very young. None are to be found when they are needed. When guests give up and decide to get their own food and drinks, the servers are found standing around the bar area socializing. Many young people would do this without a supervisor to monitor them. As many previous reviewers mentioned, the lazy river is fun. Our children enjoyed it. The downright bad: $5 for a botlle of water in the room. Hilton management, as a courtesy to your guests, make cold filtered water available and accessible to your guests at no charge. We had initially planned to stay at the Waldorf, but ended up at the Hilton because we thought it would be more child friendly. We did visit the Waldorf and it is definitely more geared towards an adult business type crowd, so we did not regret our choice. I used the fitness center and found it very good (thanks for the complimentary cold water). I would not return to this hotel because the quality of the food was not good enough and the service in the pool area left a lot to be desired. Also, it rained almost every day we were in Orlando (no big deal), but be aware that the policy at this hotel is that the entire pool area gets cleared when it rains. Fellow mothers I'm speaking to you now. This means that after you get your children ready to go in the pool (sunblock, bathing suits, etc), select your pool chairs, pick up your towels, get comfortable in your chair while your children get in the pool, you can finally relax and get out your book, right? Not exactly. The shrill "weather alert" alarm goes off and you are expected to pack up your stuff and leave the pool area for however long it rains (or appears overcast). Then, you can do it all over again in 2 hours. There were days that they opened and closed the pool area 2 to 4 times. I am sure this is just another policy in place to protect the hotel from litigation, but it got really annoying at times. Hope this review was helpful and thank you to the staff members at the Hilton who tried to make our stay a positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “What a great family resort!!”
Reviews.Author: AWS2010
Reviews.Content: My family and I visited the resort in August. We had an amazing time! My 7-year old had so much fun on property that we had trouble getting him to the theme parks. The service was wonderful. Servers used the phrase, 'certainly, my lady' when you asked them for something...what a nice touch. The lazy river was fun for all ages. And the Dive-In movies at night were a hit too. Making s'mores poolside and watching a movie from your inner tube...what could be more fun! The restauarant had something nice for families...kids eat free!!! We happened to be staying there over a BBQ weekend. It was a blast...baked bean contest, celebrity BBQ chefs, poolside BBQ's. They also had Radio Disney there with activities for the kids too. I work in a hotel in a resort town and consider myself picky when it comes to customer service. This hotel didn't miss a beat. From the friendly staff to daily 'words in towels' on the pooldeck, my family and I felt like everyone was happy to have us there. We thank the Hilton Bonnet Creek for such a great week and have already booked our return trip in August 2012! Vacations are precious to families and this hotel gave us many great memories - thanks for everything!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: candy96
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from the Hilton Bonnet Creek. This hotel is an amazing alternative to a Disney hotel. Our room was beautiful, cleaned to a high standard everyday. A quiet spot after the hustle and bustle of the Parks plus the hotel itself is spotless! The food is delicious I could recommend every dish on the menu in the Harvest Bistro where two kids eat free with each paying adult for breakfast and evening meal. The only problem we encountered at the restaurant was regarding the childrens evening meals maybe it was the time of year but they only held a dinner buffet at weekends so the children were required to choose from the lunch menu, if they ate lunch at the hotel having same menu in the evening was less than appetizing! The house water in the harvest Bistro is triple filtered and free its not worth paying for bottled! Also the small shop in the Harvest Bistro sells a selection of wine which can be purchased from about $10 a better alternative to the $40 bottle if room service is used. If you require water for your room buying from the Harvest Bistro is a cheaper alternative to either the water supplied in your room or even water bought at the Disney parks! We also ate at La Luce the italian restaurant in the Hilton and were less than impressed the service was good but the food poor. The Muse cafe sells sandwiches cakes and coffee which are delicious but unfortunately on the downside the coffee is served in paper cups! There is also a microwave in the Muse cafe for heating bottles or toddlers food. The Beech restaurant and bar by the pool are excellent, after purchasing adult and childrens drinks children then get free fill ups all day! This offer also includes the Lobby Bar. There is also free iced water by the hotel pool. The lazy river is brilliant a float ring is a must they can be hired for $5 a day or bought for $10 if staying for any length of time this is the best option as they will be well used, this hotel is the best kept secret in the disney area, we often had the pool to ourselves, the most busy time being weekends! The movies under the stars by the pool are fun for the kids to, but take plenty of bug spray I was badly bitten one night. The complimentory bus service to Disney Parks works really well the drivers are very informative and helpful. If your going to Universal the hotel will arrange a cab for you parties of four will cost $30 per cab each way. Parties of 5 or more $42 per shuttle each way. We used this service three times it worked really well the drivers were reliable and always returned at the time required. There is also a complimentory shuttle from the hotel each day at 12.55 to Lake Buna Vista shopping Mall with timetable returns, stores include Nine West (lovely handbags and shoes ladies) also Ashworth Reebok and Many others. Other premium outlets require a taxi at a cost of $36 or $21 each way depending on the length of the journey(.A little hint If you are going to the parks with young children don't book Askershus the food is abismal, The Polynesian Dinner show at disney is well worth the money a fun night out. Bongo's Cafe in downtown disney is good, and so is Portobello's.) Remember though if you hire a car the parking charges for guests at the Hilton are pretty steep and there is no alternative parking! So to sum up if you are thinking of booking the Hilton don't hesitate we stayed there with four children the staff were kind and helpful and it is very child friendly we had an amazing time Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for our 1st family Disney trip”
Reviews.Author: NEMMom
Reviews.Content: I went there recently as a single Mom with my 3 children. The location is perfect for me, who enjoyed getting away from the parks at the end of the day but has kids that could keep the party going. I debated staying at a Disney Hotel for their 1st trip but I personally couldn't handle 24/7 Disney. I don't feel that they missed out on anything because there was plenty to do at this hotel after our park days. Game room one night, get an ice cream @ Muse another night - Beautiful pool which was open till midnight-the kids loved that! and the store open 24/7 just inside was perfect for our late night munchies. The kids relaxed in tubes in the pool while I sat on a lounge chair with a much deserved glass of wine while we watched the movie another night. The staff ALL super nice helpful and friendly- from the front desk, waiters at Harvest- Omar..I think, & the shuttle bus driver Jim K., and the day we were leaving housekeeping came in and cleaned just our bathroom while we were at breakfast left fresh towels and a note wishing us a nice trip home- so sweet! The only 2 things I noticed was when I was walking in the hallways I could hear people talking in their rooms...so I am sure my kids were heard...and right inside the door from the pool area the tile floor gets super slippery- Kids took a couple spills should remedy that. Rooms, nice, clean, comfy beds, stays dark in the a.m. even despite the Florida sun. Would definitely go back. I read tons of trip-advisor reviews before I travel but 1st time I wrote one!

Reviews.Title: “This must be one of the best hotels in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Mike1946
Reviews.Content: One of the very best and well run hotels we have stayed in. From the time we arrived when the receptionist offered us a choice of two different rooms as we had asked for a room with a view, to the time we left the service from ALL the staff was superb. This hotel is so good in everything. We had a very large room on the 15 th floor and a lovely viw over the Disney Resort area. All the facilities offered by the hotel are excellent and their complimentary shuttle by coach to and from the Resorts is just right and very frequent. You do not need a car. You can also use the Waldorf Hotel facilities which is the adjacent hotel, but I think the Hilton is the best choice,especially for families. I cannot find any fault in this hotel and the Management should be complimented on having such excellent satt who are so efficient and make you so welcome. I do not think you will find a better hotel in Orlando. The main restaurants are very good but not cheap. The coffee shop Muse is excellent and very good value, especially with their coffee refills! The main bar also provides good lunches. The fitness centre is one of the very best we have used in any hotel. Everything is spotlessly clean. I think free wifi should be offered to every guest by giving them a simple coding and this should be complimentary in the room as well. Again Reception staff were very cooperative and helpful here

Reviews.Title: “The nicest people and greatest service!”
Reviews.Author: esh89
Reviews.Content: Before anything, I would like to shout out Racheal at the front desk. She was absolutely unbelievable! She helped us check right as we walked through the door, and she upgraded our room for us and was such a wonderful personality to deal with. Thanks so much Rach! But this great welcoming feeling didnt stop there, everyone that walked by smiled and asked how we were doing and if we needed anything, even the housekeeping girls which are nothing short of excellent! The location of the hotel was perfect, it wasnt in the hustle and bustle of international drive, but it was only 20 min drive from the aiport. Everything was in arms reach as we rented a car for our trip as well. The hotel room was just great and clean and perfectly sized. The bed was one that the second you got into it, you were fast asleep. The down side was the walk from the elevator to the room! Two long hallways! The restaurants in the hotel were alright. The beech has a drink called strawberry shortcake which is to die for! La Luce had amazing food! And our complimentary breakfast buffet at harvest bistro was great as well. All in all, this is probably the best hotel I have stayed at in years. Sherry, from the pool area, was GREAT! She spent a lot of time talking to us and we felt very comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Sooo comfortable and very convenient to the area”
Reviews.Author: marley35
Reviews.Content: One morning we opened our curtains and from the 11th floor, a staff member had written out SERENE in lime green towels on lounge chairs. EXACTLY, it is serene, relaxing and comfortable. Service was fantastic and everyone was so friendly. Its located right in the middle of all the Disney area action but you can get away from it all when you get back to your hotel. My husband and I walked down to the Waldorf and then we were in another world at the Bull and Bear. Fine dining like in New York but no plane fare required.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hiltons we've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: fisherguy8888
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Aug. 28 to Sept 3. After a rough and rocky three day cruise past Hurricane Irene, we were relieved to check in to this fabulous hotel. The hotel is beautiful, new and very clean. We ate at the Harvest Bistro the first night and was served by a friendly Waitress named Brenda. The hotel itself was not very busy (probably the reason why we were able to get such a good rate with breakfast). They gave us an upgrade to a higher floor with Disney views so that was a pleasant surprise. The view was terrific and our room overlooked the golf course and the pool area. You could see the fireworks every night off in the Distance. The shuttle service was great. Always on time and never too crowded. The buses were new and very fancy. You felt special when it pulled up to pick you up while people from the disney hotels were in older buses. Our stay was very relaxing. Even when we had to leave to go to the airport, the taxis were all executive vehicles. I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “YOUR OASIS - BETTER THAN DISNEY PROPERTIES!”
Reviews.Author: Bella12
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel after much research, and we were not disappointed. This hotel over exceeded our expectations. The pros: The staff were very accomodating and most of them very friendly. The rooms were well appointed extremely clean, very nice linens and bathrooms accessories and nice big vanity, beds perfect with excellent pillows, great temperature control as well; the housecleaning did an excellent job every day, 100% hat's off to them! The Havest Bistro was excellent for breakfast, good choices from buffet. The view from our room was so beautiful. My daughters used both the pool, lazy river and exercise facilities, which were clean and well kept. Always clean warm pool towels, The concierge's desk was excellent with directions around the area. Parking worth the $13.00 a day, security, covered and in close proximity to the hotel. The shuttle to Disney is a beautiful bus, not just a regular city bus, very nice drivers, and good returns. The only con's I had were that it would have been nice to have a "laundry facility" on site. I found the cost of the laundry service available very high so we didn't do any laundry, which would have been nice to do. The other issue we had was when a large conference came in during our stay the people from the conference were drinking and smoking "IN" in the pool and hot tub. This was brought to the attention of the staff and I believe this was taken care of. They definitely were not respectful of other paying guests by their behaviour My last con was that when booking this hotel we pre-paid, and in doing this you not only get an excellent rate, but it included breakfast for the adults and kids. When we arrived we were advised that kids meant 12 and under. When booking on line, kids is considered 18 and under. The wording is as follows: "Hilton guests may also dine at Harvest Bistro, where kids eat free for breakfast and dinner." I note that in other places on the web site it says 12 and under, but in this particular special it does not indicate that. The front desk advised me that they could not pay for my 13 and 15 year old's breakfast, but their did give me a $50 voucher to use in lieu of the misunderstanding. Just ensure if anyone books with this rate, that your kids are 12 and under to receive the free breakfast. As mentioned in other reviews, you should have a car if you plan to go anywhere other than Downtown Disney and the Parks, unless you don't mind paying for cabs. This amenity if off the beaten track, but it is a peaceful and beautiful place. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel, and we would come back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, simply excellent.”
Reviews.Author: cheshiremac72
Reviews.Content: We are just sitting on the balcony overlooking the lazy river, awaiting our coach pick up, so it's review time. We have had 2 weeks here, 2 adults and our 6 year old. We got a excellent price on a package deal from the UK. Hotel is fabulous, pools excellent, food and service A1. The hotel itself including the rooms are spotless. We only ate at the harvester bistro. Nice and informal, great when with kids. We didn't try the other restaurants, they looked a bit formal for dinner with a tired 6 year old. The dive in movie last night was great, aimed at kids. The thing I liked about this hotel most was the informality. This is a conference venue, however also a family hotel. Yes it is a Hilton, but there is no need to feel uncomfortable walking through the lobby with bags of shopping, dressed in shorts and t-shirts. Or even wrapped in a towel after spending a few hours at the pool. Breakfast was great. A buffet and kids eat free at breakfast and dinner. This has all the class of the Hilton brand with a fantastic relaxed atmosphere. Only negative, beware the drink prices, they are definitely Hilton. would I stay again? Yes, without doubt.

Reviews.Title: “I'll stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Chris T
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, clean, and VERY family friendly. The location is excellent. We had a rental car and was able to get to all of our desired locations in 20 minutes or less. The shuttle to Disney World was very convenient. We have a 1 year old and a 3 year old, and this place was perfect for the kids. The zero depth pool is a MUST for kids. Nightly movies pool side was also very nice and gave our family a feeling of a true vacation because of the relaxing atmosphere. The rooms were very clean and quiet. There was also plenty of parking available in the ramp. My only complaint would be $13/day parking, but oh well. I won't hesitate staying here again in the future. I will also recommend this hotel to all of my friends and relatives who will be visiting Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice instead of staying at Disney”
Reviews.Author: TimBushell
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel primarily as it was cheaper than staying at a Disney Moderate hotel and as we missed free dining this year Disney was looking expensive! Its location is excellent (sort of behind the Caribbean Beach resort) and no further to the parks. It's on it's own development with the Waldorf Astoria and a VERY large Wyndham Timeshare. The Good: The pool is superb a great lazy river (although quite powerful maybe not that lazy). The rooms were very clean and well equipped. The bed was so good my father is looking a buying the same one! The less good: Took two attempts to fix an overly cold fridge (frozen soda cans exploded!) Conceige not overly friendly Parking at $13 per night! A large conference (in our case Red Lobster) can dominate the bar in the lobby We ate at the Harvest Bistro a few times for breakfast (not cheap - $100 for 5 of us) but the food was very good. Initially I thought the parking garage was going to be an issue - it's a multi storey next to the hotel - BUT when you come home during a 'Florida type' thunderstorm its nice being undercover from the car to your room! and in fact turned out to be no real issue. We did not plump for the Disney view - initially was concerned about seeing the I4 - but you cant! You are surrounded by trees and we had a sort of Disnet view (downtown Disney that is!) Was also worried about the conference centre, but had not real effect apart from the comments on the lobby bar. One thing we did not realise they only do interconnecting rooms between Kings & Queens. We were in two queens so could not get it. Overall would not hesitate to stay there and as I mentioned cheaper (for us) than staying at the Caribbean Beach resort which is nothing like as nice

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place, I'd love to go back!”
Reviews.Author: HunterMom
Reviews.Content: Went for a business convention in February -- first impression, walking up to the door, beautiful lit water fountains. The foyer is lovely. What a wonderful room! Best I've ever stayed in. The king bed was so comfortable, I confess I never wanted to go home again (dont' tell my husband!!) The room was clean and beautiful. And the bath!! The shower was a walk in, with beautiful coral colored stone walls on three sides and a wall of glass where you walked in. The shower itself was one of those gigantic heads that is like standing in a downpour. The restaurant on the bottom floor made a wonderful crab salad. Good coffee in the coffee shop. Everything was just the best. Only downside: The temperature outside in February. I live to swim and had to try the mile long lazy river pool which, though heated, was still uncomfortable because the air temp was so cold. That's it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: jlin7
Reviews.Content: I was upgraded to an, gulp, executive room. What else can I say:) The front desk lady was so friendly to give me this surprise. The room was great, fresh, nicely decorated. And the pool was absolutely amazing. A great attraction by itself. This was a business trip, so I did not visit Disney or any other local attractions. Instead, I went to the pool twice, and I do not consider this a waste trip. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the pool area”
Reviews.Author: Samsrobin
Reviews.Content: We stayed with out 2 grandsons and the room was spacious, comfortable, well laid out and clean. We all loved the lazy river pool area, but if you can, bring your own tube to float as there is a charge to rent. The hotel always seems to smell really good, which is very welcoming! The rooms are comfy and the bathrooms are super clean & modern. I do wish parking was not so expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hilton Orlando”
Reviews.Author: BoopdBoop-88
Reviews.Content: My 1st review and thought i shld post one after using Tripadvisor for most of my trips. Loved this property! The price was the same as a budget Disneyland Resort property. I booked this through Costco 6 months in advance and it was sold out in a few weeks. A great deal through Costco! Reading the reviews, i was worried about shuttle service. No worries, it's so convenient. Every 1/2 hour or 1 hour (depending on where u r going), there's a A/C private shuttle. The drivers were so friendly; and there's t.v. for the kids to watch. never full. We rode the Disney shuttle 1x in between parks (it's free) and wasn't as comfy as the Hilton shuttle. Lazy river and movie nights were awesome for the kids. Kids eat free @ 1 site restaurant. Meal prices weren't too bad. We thought our 1st disneworld trip wld be exhausting; hitting 1 park/day but wasn't too bad..this hotel was absolutely wonderful! We even went back to Animal Kingdom 2x (u only pay $10 extra to go an extra day if you buy the several day passes) Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Two nights at Hilton Bonnet Creek”
Reviews.Author: 4Girls1WearyDad
Reviews.Content: We really loved this hotel. We stayed here in August for two nights and visited Disney World for one day. Our daughter loved the pool area. Check in was very quick and we had a partial view of Disney fireworks at night. We ate at the Harvest Bistro breakfast buffet on the morning before going to Disney. We had a discount coupon for the restaurant, and our daughter ate for free (12 and under is free).The buffet was huge and the food was fair to good. We took the resort shuttle to Disney which was very prompt. Just be sure to remember the parking area number for the return trip. At night,the Magic Kingdom bus parking numbers were not very well marked and it was a little difficult to find. We hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic resort for families”
Reviews.Author: C1arkz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we wanted a clean and family friendly hotel and this was a fantastic stay. Rooms were clean and nice. we received good service throughout the entire stay. Parking is good and just a short 1 minute walk attached to hotel. Location is great for Disney and you can be at the I4 within a few minutes in order to get to places like Seaworld and Universal. We had a teenager and a toddler and it worked a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: barryhousehotel
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. We got a good rate with some Disney Tickets included and a 20% coupon off dining. All the staff we dealt with were great. It's a relatively new building and so is thoroughly modern. Although had one little gripe that the shower was not very powerful. It was a large rainfall type of showerhead, but lacked pressure. Apart from that the room was well equipped and had many useful features. Slightly annoyed that I paid for WiFi access in our room but this was only good for 1 device, so could not use the ipad etc. We only used the pool on our last night and wished we had been there before, but were too busy with the Theme Parks!. Watched a "Dive In Movie" which was great and loved the lazy river.

Reviews.Title: “The Lazy RIver Was Just The Icing On The Cake”
Reviews.Author: southmiamijill
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights and cried when it was check-out time. There were four of us in our traveling party so we got adjacent rooms (buy one get one half off deal online) and that worked out very well. In addition to being on Disney property which is a huge convenience, the hotel itself was completely top notch. The bedding, the furniture, the marble bathrooms, the amazing views (and you can see fireworks from your room!)...and then you have the hotel itself - with its onsite restaurants - Harvest Bistro serves a breakfast buffet and KIDS EAT FREE with a paying adult - great deal! The Italian restaurant La Luce, is bueno! (Try the appetizer of fried green olives and almonds - sounds strange, tastes fantastic). I am an avid traveler, both on my own and with my kids, and this hotel will become one of our go-to hotels, time and again. Now, about that Lazy River - WOW! You can rent a tube for $5 a day or purchase one for $7. We purchased and used the heck of out them. Who needs a theme park when you have an entertainment complex that includes a lazy river, dive-in movies, a pool bar and grille, a waterslide, firepit, and plenty of lounge chairs right outside your hotel door! And the pool is open till midnight. And trust me, at midnight, you still won't want to go to your room. There is piped in music as you float - very Disney-ish - we were floating along listening to the original version of Moon River under a full moon. I just don't think life can get any better than that. Do yourself a favor and book this resort, whether on business (ultra fast wireless in room!) or with family

Reviews.Title: “The best stay-cation ever”
Reviews.Author: Jenniferlo03
Reviews.Content: All I could afford this year was a vacation in my backyard. The Hilton had the best crowd and the best service. It was well worth taking a trip just down the road. The best part was the outdoor bar-b-q party! Loved it all!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and would vacation here”
Reviews.Author: crash330
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a work convention, but were able to take in some of the hotel's amenities as well. The decor is very modern and minimalist, but still very comfortable. Although it was in the Disney Resort complex, it wasn't really geared for children, which I liked since we don't have any yet. The pool was really nice with a lazy river, two jacuzzis and an outdoor restaurant. Very nicely decorated with lots of lounge chairs and umbrellas. This particular hotel is connected to the new Waldorf Astoria, so with a short walk, your choice of restaurants and bars expands. Inside the Hilton, we ate at La Luce, which was amazing. My husband had the veal chop and I ate the wood-fired pizza. So good and a great wine list. We ate food in the lobby bar, but it was just ok. La Luce is definitely worth the price, $20-$40 for an entree. The staff was very helpful and friendly, right on par with other Hiltons I have stayed at.
