Our room was adequate, with a king-size bed and a chair. Flat screen LCD TV with ok cable. The bathroom was nice because it only had a stand-up shower. The bed was really comfortable. The hotel had a really nice gym with more equipment than you usually see at a hotel gym. The Waldorf Astoria had a spa, but we didn't have time to check it out. Overall, this was a very nice hotel for the price. We would stay here again if we ventured to Orlando for play simply because there weren't a lot of kids.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: Nick240
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 weeks at this hotel as a base for exploring Disney. The hotel is clean and spacious the shuttle service is excellent. No complaints at all, well maybe the price of meals, but im sure its no more than most would expect. Rocky at breakfast was always fun and upbeat, he stood out for his customer service, but all the other staff were excellent too.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for teenagers”
Reviews.Author: swimmy4
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I just returned from a quick one night trip to this hotel. I was there on business. Don't let the outside appearance of the building throw you off. It looks a bit like a large hospital or something on the outside, but inside it is comfortably modern. The girls were thrilled with the lazy river pool and our Disney view (especially getting to see the 9:00 EPCOT fireworks). The food in the first floor bistro was great. We had both the dinner and breakfast buffets, and they were excellent. This was a great property.

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem!”
Reviews.Author: jjf59
Reviews.Content: if you want to get away from it all and be treated like royalty, this is the place! The staff and service is amazing from the moment you arrive on property. The rooms are high tech and the beds are very comfortable. I was able to enjoy 9 holes at the Rees Jones golf course attached on the Waldorf Astoria, with a friend of mine. The golf carts are equipped with GPS, ice, water, and cold towels soaked in a fresh pineapple scent! We ate at La Luce and enjoyed the fried olives, and signature butterscoch pudding. This resort has something for everyone, from couples to family reunions. Please all AAA members out there use your membership to have special rates quoted for you.....I am glad I did!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel with great service, fairly new”
Reviews.Author: calalb
Reviews.Content: On a golf course and attached to the Waldorf Astoria. You can eat in either hotel. Very good conference facilities. Golf in June and off season. This is brand new course, and it's a beaut, all elevated greens. Staff are very friendly. Great service is the norm. On Disney property but it's a bit of a taxi ride downtown Disney. Great pool with lazy river. Food and beverage facilities great.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for our honeymoon, had a great time, but be prepared for pricey food and drink.”
Reviews.Author: laura_helen_86
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from a week long honeymoon at the Hilton Bonnet Creek and we had a lovely time. I thought I would put a few points under headings based on our experience at the hotel. Transport from the Airport We booked an American Coach as neither of us fancied driving on right hand side of the road plus I believe you have to pay each day for car parking. It took about 35-40 minutes to reach the hotel so this was very quick and easy. Checking in We were very impressed with check in. When we arrived at the hotel we were greeting by a very friendly lady floor walking in the lobby with a clipboard. She showed us to the main desk and when she realised we had waited about 30 seconds she immediately went and fetched an additional member of staff from the back to assist us. Check in was smooth and we were offered 2 key cards and a spare if we wanted it. Rooms- First impression WOW! The first thing we noticed was the huge window and the lovely view across a wooded area and downtown Disney in the background. The room was equipped with a hairdryer, flat screen TV, iron, ironing board, bath products, plenty of electrical sockets. There was some sort of coffee making facility but we were unsure how to use this and as tea drinkers a kettle would have really been better for us as we had to go down and buy tea each morning from the coffee shop. The room was very clean, nice bedding and towels. The only water provided in the room was $5 a bottle so we left this, it would have been nice to have a bottle of the house bottled water on arrival, as they give this out freely in the pool bar and restaurants. The bath products are lovely and are topped up as often as you need them. Breakfast The all you can eat $19 breakfast was really good although we only had this one day as $40 for breakfast each day would soon mount up. Most days we had a cup of tea and a croissant from the coffee shop for about $5 each. Dinner We ate at La Luce a couple of times and the Harvest bistro once. We were pleased with both. The food at La Luce is amazing we ate there 3 times in a week; the wine is quite pricey though. We found that our service varied quite a lot, we were served by a man in Harvest who was very friendly and attentive, at La Luce we had waiters two of the days and the service was average, but then we were served on the third day by Stephanie and she was fantastic and made our experience really special. Pool Side Bar A fairly good selection of drinks we had some cocktails which were really tasty again the service varied here depending on who served you, but there were a lot of flies at the bar which is a bit off-putting. Pool We loved the pool. The lazy river is so much fun even for two adults, the spa pool is lovely and warm- great in the evenings. You can always get a bed and clean towels are always available. You can hire a ring from the pool shop for $5 a day or buy one for $10. Transportation The buses to Disney are great. You get a timetable which is very easy to understand the drivers are entertaining and very knowledgeable, the buses run until at least 8pm-11pm depending on which park you are at so you will have plenty of time to watch the fireworks. The hotel is right on Disney which is great for the Disney parks but you will have to arrange your own transport to Universal and other attractions. Our rep booked us a shuttle to Universal and back which was $38 dollars for a round trip. There are town cars outside owned by Mears Transportation they charged us $13 to go from the hotel to downtown Disney and when we flagged a taxi down for the way back it was only $8 with another company. The hotel is in the middle of nowhere as far as walking goes. So you will need to allocate enough money for taxis. Guest Information Folder This was extremely frustrating. Upon arriving at a hotel I like to relax, have a drink and read the guest info file and get to know my way around. The file doesnâ€™t provide enough information and you have to find a lot out for yourself, we were constantly asking the concierge and reception questions. Room Service We ordered a bottle of wine one night to our room as there are no shops around to buy any- or so we thought. After spending $40 (and waiting 20 minutes) for our wine we discovered on the last day there is a section in the Harvest Bistro that sells wine starting at about $12, so I would recommend doing this. Notes for English travellers: A few points for people travelling from England about Florida in general. 1. TIPPING: It is now expected that you will tip between 18%-20%, which does increase your food and drink bill considerably. It is a bit of a shock at first coming from a generally non-tipping nation. 2. USA CUSTOMS: It will probably take ages to get through immigration/customs and they donâ€™t think twice about shouting at you. 3. ID: We are 26 and got asked for ID everywhere when buying alcohol; except the hotel who are much better at using their own common sense and judgment. Overall we would definitely stay at the Hilton Bonnet Creek again- but take more spending money.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: darreno4848
Reviews.Content: Excellent resort in Disney area, but there's so many activities and things to do you can stay at the resort and not even know you're right next to Disney. The staff is very courteous and accommodating, there's a huge pool/waterpark area with a lazy river and slides. The restaurants are excellent and not over priced, the rooms are very spacious and clean, there's no resort fee, and the rates are very reasonable. I highly recommend this hotel for families visiting or even just a couple thats looking for a romantic get away, this property can work both ways.

Reviews.Title: “INCREDIBLE”
Reviews.Author: lkoff
Reviews.Content: We are staying at Bonnet Creek right now, but I couldnâ€™t wait to write the review! I am here for my sonâ€™s birthday and only staying for one night, but what a wonderful day it has been. The front desk and lobby staff are very professional, courteous, and accommodating. The rooms are impeccably clean and well laid out. Now for the fun stuff!! We came to the Hilton especially for the pool and amenities. What I didnâ€™t except was the service provided. Letâ€™s start with BEECH, the pool bar & grill. Tuan, and Angel AWESOME servers..also a really big Thank you to Brittany and Daniel for their wonderful hospitality. Caribbean Coladaâ€™s rock! The poolside â€œpamperingsâ€� frozen grapes and cold towels all delivered just when you think you canâ€™t take the heat anymore! The pool staff is impeccable, these people work extremely hard in the blazing heat all with a smile on their faces and still have time to stop to say hello, and see if we were taken care of. Then there were the activities going on, there is no way anyone could be bored, you just have to involve yourself, and the enjoyment follows. First a Thank you to Maritza and Chris for singing Happy Birthday to my son., and the entire â€œRecreationâ€� team for signing a birthday card for him. Stephanie, Corri, Reagan, Sherry, Megahn, Matt, Jessica, and Jeanneâ€¦(Sure there are others) We watched you work, get yelled at by â€œsomeâ€� guests, but still you prevailed..Thank you. Also the girls in the hut where you rent tubes were very nice. One other thing that impressed me was while one of the staff members was getting yelled at another manager (Jeanne) came to assist, I guess the lady wasnâ€™t satisfied so a little later, I saw 2 managers clearly from a different department came to assist her, the teamwork that I saw at Bonnet Creek was like I have never seen before and is in need of recognition. Do not think twice about coming to this hotel, it is above and beyond any other location in the vicinity. Thank you Bonnet Creekâ€¦we will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent pool area and location great too”
Reviews.Author: Nwhi
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in disney area but without the Disney being thrust at you. Rooms very good and clean. Shuttle bus to Disney good but have to go to other Disney parks via Magic Kingdom so can take a while to get there and/or back. Breakfast got a bit monotonous but we were there for 2 weeks so I suppose that is normal. Had to queue for it second week too! The pool was great. Lazy river a great way to wind down. The pool is open to midnight weather permitting and had an outdoor movie on at 9 that you could watch from in the pool. Went with Virgin and they have a Virgin lounge in the hotel that is great for the kids if it rains!! Wii and Internet, pool and table football and some relaxing chairs for the adults!! All in all an excellent choice

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but customer service lacking”
Reviews.Author: Wiggins34112
Reviews.Content: Hotel beautiful, but no housekeeping one day! And we were gone from 8 to 4 pm and no one came to clean our room! Keys did not work every time we came back to our room, and we had to go down to lobby every time! Great pool and bus service to Disney was great. Best ice cream ever in Muse!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Allison S
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels, mainly Hilton's, but this one blows the rest away. This Hilton is attached to the Waldorf Astoria Orlando, so you get the ameneties of both hotels. From the moment you arrive the service is impecable. The rooms are awesome, a serious upgrade from most Hiltons. The pools are incredible, and so inviting, especially the lazy river. My friends and I all decided to treat ourselves to a spa treatment, all I can say is WOW.. We were all at a loss for words after our massages. For dinner we all met a La Luce, and everything was excellent, the veal chop seemed to be the most popular out of our group, but a few of us got the pasta dishes and they were also outstanding. Needless to say, if you are in Orlando and are a fan of Italian food, you have to go!! If you are coming to Orlando, you need to check out these hotels. We had our rooms booked through AAA and the rates were surprisingly reasonable. One of the ladies in our group stayed at the Waldorf, and the difference in the price between the Hilton and there was around 40.00. Whichever you pick, you will be thrilled. I can't wait to go back and check out the steak restaurant at the Waldorf, the Bear and Bull, I heard that it is "to die for."

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Wayne G
Reviews.Content: I travel on business a lot and enjoy Hilton's & Hampton's because they always have comfortable beds. This Hilton Orlando Bonnet Creek, was well staffed and had very good amenities. But the people were the best I've encountered in all of my travels. They were very positive, upbeat, genuine and enjoyable to be around. When you're away from home as much as I am, it's great to make friends in various places and kudos to the Hilton team in Orlando. I've never enjoyed a business trip as much and the time spent with business associates and the people at the Hilton was excellent. Next time I'm in Orlando, this is where I'll stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool, Rooms and Service = An AMAZING Experience”
Reviews.Author: Heide C
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Hilton Orlando Bonnet Creek during Barbeque weekends and had a fantastic time! The staff was so welcoming and speedy with requests. Check-in was a breeze and we even got to try free chili samples from the hotel chef's. We went straight to the pool where, although busy, the staff was accomodating and even brought my mother an umbrella for our seats by the pool. I highly recommend grabbing a cocktail from The Beech (the poolside restaurant). The frozen drinks were delicious. Overall, we had a wonderful experience and will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms good rate”
Reviews.Author: MarenOC
Reviews.Content: I attended a 500+ person meeting. We had an amazing room rate of $125.The fridge in the room was a nice addition to the typical spacious Hilton resort room I expected-granite counters, desk with pull out writing/keyboard surface, lounge chair. I appreciated the lighted make up mirror in the BR too. Being Hilton Gold, I had a nice view of the pool. When it got dark they showed children's movies which looked fun- a float in movie. The property looks pretty new and everything was clean and lovely. if you are on a budget, be aware that when the hotel gets you a taxi, it will be a high priced town car instead. $63 to MCO! The onsite restaurant was Mediocre and a taxi to restaurant row was $27 .

Reviews.Title: “Most amazing hotel - will be back in two weeks!”
Reviews.Author: 914newyork
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest hotels we have ever visited - even amongst Ritz Carltons, Waldorfs, and Marriotts. Although it is a newer hotel which gives it an advantage, it is a very high-end Hilton. From the moment we checked in the service was outstanding. The valet was nice, and Rachel at the Front Desk was beyond amazing! She went out of her way to make sure our HHonors was attached to our reservation, and even sent an amenity up to our room at night, wishing us a pleasant stay. We checked in early and was accommodated for. The pool was outstanding - hard to find a chair, but plently of towels, and the cabana inflated our floats for the lazy river complimentary. They were having a barbeque outside by the pool which was delicious and affordable. Buses ran to Disney and back - the only thing I would reccommend is that on the schedule, they clarify the difference between Magic Kingdom and the Ticket & Transportation Center. We went all the way to MK to get the bus just to find out we were in the wrong place and had to go all the way back to Ticket & Transportation. Bus was clean, well air conditioned (which is so important after a long day out in the sun) and driver was friendly. Breakfast buffet in the morning is exceptional! Delicious food and even homemade pop tarts! Great selection and service - always a wait but well worth it. Tamer in Harvest Bistro was friendly and provided excellent service - we will ask for him again the next time we dine there. Rooms were immaculate - everything was clean which is my biggest pet peeve. We needed toiletries such as shaving cream, razors, toothbrushes and extra shampoo - they were delivered right away. The views are great and you can see different disney icons from the pool view rooms. Phones are touch screen and modern, bathrooms are chic. The beds are the most comfortable I have ever slept in! My boyfriend and I are looking in to purchasing one for our home! If the price is right, we are looking to be back on the weekend of the 19th - cant wait!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay when visiting Disney”
Reviews.Author: Time2G0
Reviews.Content: This is the second time that we have stayed at this hotel. Overall, it is a great place to stay when visiting Disney. The Hilton and Waldorf hotels at Bonnet Creek are connected by shared conference facilities. The good thing about this is that you can use the pools and other amenities of both hotels no matter at which one you stay. The rooms, lobby and facilities are all clean. The rooms are well appointed and comfortable. The prices are good when compared to the nearby Disney owned hotels. The staff is very friendly. The Hilton has a lazy river pool that is very inviting. If you get bored with that pool there are two pools at the Waldorf that you can also use. The property is surrounded on three sides by Disney property so there are views of Disney and the location is very convenient for visiting the parks. There is a free shuttle bus service to the parks that is very reliable and convenient. The hotel staff offers activites for children for times when they are not at the parks. While we were there, each night at 9PM a disney movie was shown poolside. There are only two complaints about this hotel. The first is the price of the food. A mediocre tasting hamburger from the grill near the pool is $14. Even factoring in the convenience, it is nowhere near worth that much money. It is less expensive to eat and drink in the Disney parks. Yikes!! The second complaint is about the parking facilities. This is a warning to watch out for the valets in the parking garage. The hotel offers valet parking and the valets tend to think the parking garage is a racetrack when they are parking cars. Be very careful or you will get run over. Additionally, the parking garage has several spaces reserved for hybrid cars. However, on the many trips to the garage to get the car so we could go and get food for the family, those spaces reserved for hybrid cars were practically always full of non-hybrid gas guzzlers. What is the use of having reserved spaces for â€œgreenâ€� cars if they are always full of other cars? Food prices and parking garage issues aside, this hotel is a much better value than the nearby Disney hotels and is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “How I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SLCGirl22
Reviews.Content: What can you not love about this place???? It's beautiful, clean, the pool is fantastic and huge, even the poolside food, which is normally the extent of wings & a burger at most places, was amazing. Stay here or the sister Hilton on International Drive, which is similar. We always love going back!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular. A few caveats. Rent a car!”
Reviews.Author: mpls/stpaul
Reviews.Content: Took my 11 yr old for a week-long Disney trip mid May. I'm a Disney veteran with literally dozens of trips to the park since it opened in 1971. Upgraded to one of their allergy-free Pure rooms for $20/night. Well worth the $ for us allergy sufferers!!!! I used to travel for a living and have stayed everywhere. This was by far the easiest breathing room I've seen - better than home. That sounds weird. To make such a big deal over the room environment - and I was initially reluctant to spend the money. But what a difference it made in terms of sound sleeps and waking up without even the slightest sniff of musty air conditioners or dust. No balconies for any of the rooms, if that's important to you. Other pros: Property and physical plant were gorgeous. Easily on par with some of the better hotels I've enjoyed. Rooms are beautiful, lobby is wonderful, and pool was impeccably clean. Breakfast buffet was definitely worth the $20. Unfortunately, 11 year old was always too anxious to get on the Disney road each morning and never really enjoyed it. Staff was friendly and efficient. Some of the newer Concierge staff could have been a lot more knowledgeable, even not sure of shuttle schedules while looking at the printed paper. Location: gorgeous. In the middle of a surprising nature reserve. But see the transportation concerns below. Cons: Location. Rent a car. Rent a car. Rent a car. Can't say it enough. Cabs will cost you minimum $20 each way if you get cabin fever and have the urge for even a fast food joint at the end of the driveway/entrance, which is much too far to walk with an 11 year old. This place really is in the middle of a nature reserve and it's not a quick walk out. Cabs: Hotel has an arrangement with the nice but higher priced Mears town cars. These are the only vehicles you'll find waiting at the front door. You can phone a 'regular' less expensive cab from off property to come to get you (also most owned by the Mears empire), but it' s a wait and inconvenient We really did feel like prisoners after a few days. Shuttles to Disney: Don't get me started. Somewhat convenient because they do keep to the schedule, but lengthy trips to anywhere but Epcot. IMPORTANT! Last shuttles leave the parks just before the nightly fireworks shows begin. Bring your wallet for an expensive cab back to the hotel. Even if a later shuttle might be scheduled at some point, the massive crowds leaving the parks at the same time will most likely make shuttle impossible to catch. Discussion with Hotel Manager was frustrating: he told me the shuttles are geared to the typical Disney tourist and leave when the parks close. This is disingenuous: Yes, the parks do 'officially' close before the fireworks, but it's a real stretch to believe the typical visitor, who might come to Disney once or twice in their lifetime, would leave before the wonderful nightly fireworks spectacles. Thousands and thousands of people remaining in the park, eating and buying souvenirs, enjoying the Disney fireworks shows.....and the hotel thinks the Disney day is over? Give me a break. There are lots of cabs, but this could be a very unpleasant unanticipated extra cost after draining your bank account during the day at the park. Hotel Food: Kids eat fee with adult purchase downstairs at the Bistro. As above, breakfast buffet was wonderful with incredible assortment, live chefs, and pleasant room. Do NOT do the dinner. Kids eat off a special kids' menu. Very limited and quality is not anywhere near the adult menu items, which are not great in their own right. The 2nd night, I finally listened to the 11 yr old and tried a bite of his burger. I've had better cardboard. Kitchen was not busy (very slow period) so that was not the problem. Adult entrees were at best so-so the 3 nights we ate there. Not worth the money. Room service food: Comes from the same Bistro kitchen reviewed above. Need I say more? Avoid it and get a nice pizza from the upscale and friendly Luce in the lobby, purportedly run by a totally different operation. That's why they can't deliver the Luce food to your room, but they are very happy to make it to go. And it's a quick elevator ride upstairs. No excuse, avoid the Bistro at lunch or dinner, even with the free kids deal. Pool: Wonderfully clean and nice 'lazy river' for floating. Pool: No deeper area to keep 11 yr old happy and lazy river gets very old after 1 or 2 times around. Money saving tip: buy a cheap tube at the pool house for $10 if you plan on using the pool several days. Rentals are at least $5/day. Bring your own if you like. People with cars were running out to the discount stores to get the same tubes for just a couple $. Water slide is for much younger kids. Boring fir an 11 year old. Pool food: Come out of the same Bistro kitchen reviewed above. Need I say more? Appetizers are passable, Service slow. Avoid the entrees. Hilton Honors points: My mistake. We booked a package through Sun Country airlines from Minneapolis. Then I spent an additional fortune at the Hilton beyond the basic rooms, (the least was the $20/night upgrade for the 'Pure' room). Hilton absolutely refused to give me any points for the additional $1000 I spent, because I did not book directly and had gone through a 'wholesaler.' Even for the monies I spent outside the wholesaler. This is a stated part of the fine print for HiltonHonors. Again, my mistake. Read your fine print carefully if points are important. Bottom line: I'd return but with a rental car. I've stayed in at least a dozen properties in the Disney area over the years and this had to be one of the most enjoyable at any price I've paid. You should easily be able to avoid the few pitfalls I mentioned above and have an absolutely wonderful time at this property. It strikes me as much more of a business/convention hotel than a family place, but I liked it.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: eboateng2
Reviews.Content: I don't know why this hotel isn't number 1 in Orlando. The Hotel website picture does not do it justice. The place is spotless, clean and modern, staff are friendly and very helpful. Their lazy river pool is like none other that I've seen. At 9 pm they show movies on a giant screen for the kids, they absolutely love it. My kids could eat for free [12 and under] at breakfast and dinner. The atmosphere is just serene and relaxing. Their shuttle service to disney world is very efficient, they have a nice clean bus going every half hour, only down side was if you intend to go to Universal you have to take a taxi both ways if you don't have a car which could get quite expensive. I would advise Management to look into Shuttle service to Universal, I am planning on returning next year but might have to stay elsewhere that provides shuttle to Universal. This was definitely the right pick for me, very family friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a family in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: nolemomma
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here. The rooms are very clean and modern. The pool was fantastic as was the water slide. Our boys are 6 and 4 and they loved every second of it. My only complaint about the pool would be the current near the lazy river. My 4 yr old is an average swimmer and I did worry about him getting pulled under near each entrance to the lazy river. They loved the water slide and spent tons of time there, allowing my husband and I to relax with a drink from the bar. We ordered lunch at the pool a few times and the food and options were great and kid friendly. The only Disney park we visited was the Magic Kingdom. We did not use the hotel shuttle and drove our own car down and back. The hotel is very close to the Magic Kingdom so we left the park around lunch time and went back to the hotel for a few hours. Then, drove back for the evening. Very convenient. Loved this place and will return next year.

Reviews.Title: “prescription sunglasses and medication disappeared from our room”
Reviews.Author: enzas829
Reviews.Content: stayed @ the Hilton Bonnet Creek in Orlando 4 days for a business convention/conference in May2010 , reported to security and front desk missing prescription rayban and 4 prescription medications from our room, we were never contacted after filing the report.

Reviews.Title: “The Very Best Hilton I've Stayed at........”
Reviews.Author: anunes_11
Reviews.Content: I work for a global high tech company and my job takes me all over the world and have I have stayed at many many Hilton properties. They should all take a lesson from how this hotel is run. The Hotel is first rate; the facilities, location, but especially the staff..they couldn't do enough to make you feel welcome and become your friends by the end of the stay! I must call out one staff member in particular, Nicole Sell, who went above and beyond every night we were there. I plan on staying there again and will absolutely recommend this hotel to everyone in my company. BRAVO!!! AMN, Rhode Island

Reviews.Title: “High End Ambiance for Low End Price”
Reviews.Author: JohhnyTram
Reviews.Content: This is likely the best value you will find in the Disney area. We scored this room on a bid web site and WOW what a deal. This property is connected to the Waldorf Astoria property by a large conference area, and the ambiance is high end through out. It is a tower building and all rooms are interior entrance (which for this price in the Downtown Disney area is abnormal). Our room is worth up to $200 a night EASY, but it can be had for below $100 if you know where to look. The pool has an enormous lazy river that takes about 15 minutes to traverse via tube you can rent for $5 a day. The rooms are spacious and freshly appointed, with modern decor and flat screen TVs. The staff is friendly and the visitors to the property all seem to be of a higher class then at your typical sub-$100 properties. They do hit you for a parking charge if you have a vehicle with you, but because the room is such a good value I can't complain about that. (Really they should charge an extra $13 a night and not say it's for parking, as it bothers me that hotels are charging for parking now a days.) The location is 3 minutes away from Downtown Disney and we took a Yellow Cab from Epcot back to the hotel for about 8 bucks (we like to drink around the world, so car stays in the hotel garage). The hotel property itself is gorgeous, with a golf course as the back drop to well manicured landscapes. I will be staying at this property as long as I can afford to, and hope they always offer specials like the one we took advantage of.

Reviews.Title: “great facility for conference”
Reviews.Author: aircanada777
Reviews.Content: this golf course was great, between the Hilton Hotel and Waldor. friendy staff. facilities for conference was great. this is a fairly new hotel and others are being built closeby. on disney property. cab ride can be expensive to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT SERVICES”
Reviews.Author: JecaMendez
Reviews.Content: While we were there for a family vacation the Hilton Orlando Bonnet Creek made us felt welcome and at home from day one. Special mention to Silvia Mendez-Soto who showed excellent customer services skills towards myself and my family... We are going to be back this year for Xmas and New Years!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lali317
Reviews.Content: Was at a business conference at Bonnet Creek. The amenities were great, staff very helpful not to mention the lazy river pool. Would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “fun day with the grandkilddies”
Reviews.Author: patofmiami
Reviews.Content: Great resort. Lazy river will keep kids of all ages, (even ancient) happily engaged day and night. Go prepared to just stay at the pools (maybe bring your own favorite floats) . Breakfast is very crowded so eat light at the delicious bakery and bigger lunch later. Very close to Downtown Disney which is always fun, even when crowded. Self-park garage for hotel is easy and convient. All the staff are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: DRLMM
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 10 DAYS! This was a long trip.... We booked the Hotel through Costco, so we were able to stay here for a very good price. It is worth asking them directly for other "specials" that might be available, because we were able to add a second room at a cheaper price this way also. The rooms were really very quiet - even though there was a LOT of outside activity and the hotel was really full, I felt like our room was quiet and our kids could sleep without any problem. The rooms were clean and new. The beds comfortable. The pools with lazy river were excellent. Super crowded for the Holiday Weekend, but the other days were more manageable. Food at the pool was pretty good overall. Service was good. They added extra touches like cleaning my sunglasses for me, or offering a cold towel on a hot day. They were available to serve when needed, but made us comfortable not ordering when we didn't want to order. Food at La Luce was excellent. The breakfast buffet at the Harvest Bar was really quite good - although we only ate their once. The staff were friendly, helpful, available for anything we needed, but unobtrusive. So you can get all of the upscale amenities and assistance here, but you can also behave more in a "self-serve" fashion and fit right in. A really nice balance, because we like to have both options. Access to all of the Disney Parks was great - a nice location, really close by. We did not take advantage of the shuttles, so I can't speak to that.

Reviews.Title: “Good conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: antshe
Reviews.Content: We had our annual conference at this location. The hotel did a great job in supporting the conference. The hotel itself is very nice. Comfortable rooms, helpful staff and a great pool. The lazy river is very relaxing and the restaurant at the pool (as well as others) has good food and attentive staff. Internet access was expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a Second Stay”
Reviews.Author: Delmar72
Reviews.Content: I spent approximately a week at the Hilton Orlando Bonnet Creek in mid-June 2011. I was there for a conference and truly enjoyed my stay and the accomodations. The hotel shares a conference center with the adjoining Wyndham Bonnet Creek Resort. There were many different groups at the time my conference was there. I did not experience any problems with the confluence of these groups. The days were hot (its Florida and it is June); but the A/C throughout the facilities was comfortable. The Hilton has a pool complex (a lazy river, walking areas, pool and waterfalls and people from the very young to to opposite end were there enjoying the facilities. There was no airport shuttle, something that I could not get confirmed until the last minute. There are various alternative ways to get from the airport to the hotel. There are transportation companies, taxis, rental cars and the like. The taxi ride would be more expensive than a transportation company except for a large party. The hotel does have complimentary transportation to various Walt Disney World sites and there is a published schedule of times. The rooms were comfortable. I'm sure you can request a room with a specific view. However my conference started early and ran til evening. The time I spent in the room was for resting/sleeping and a view does not increase the sleeping atmosphere. It was a sleeping room. Maid service was excellent. Overall, I would rate the experience "excellent".

Reviews.Title: “Great quick stay at Hilton”
Reviews.Author: lmsiegel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I only have 2 quick nights in Orlando and spent one in Disney (went to all 3 parks!) and one in Universal. This hotel was great to get in and out and then come back to a clean and nice hotel. These was more geared for adults than kids, but if you jsut want a nice place, close to all parks, and EASY, this is a great place. Although its not 'in the parks' like the disney hotels, its pretty much right there. Highly recco if you are OK with staying at a non disney hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mndoc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a package deal from expedia. The rate was amazing so I assumed it was a ways away from Mickey's house - I was wrong. It is, essentially, an onsite property with a shuttle service but none of the Disney "stuff" that goes on in their hotels (but it does have a Disney store to purchase tickets at). A very upscale, comfortable Hilton with an excellent pool and very nice rooms - I wanted to bring the bed home. Be sure to book the "breakfast rate" deal as the buffett is very nice and worth the upcharge. Our typical day was amusement park in the late morning til midafternoon then lunch by the pool and back to the park in the evening. My kids (14,17,19) thought is was a perfect way to survive the chaos of the parks.

Reviews.Title: “No worries”
Reviews.Author: Chompers_11
Reviews.Content: Great hotel that has a professional friendly staff and excellent facilities. The location was good, the shuttle buses were well run and the restaurants were what you would expect. The food was decent and not over priced. The pool area and lazy river were both excellent. I would highly recommend this property as long as you aren't bringing poorly behaved kids. It isn't geared towards the screaming kid crowd and is frequently busy with conventions and business travelers. For some reason they don't have free Wi-Fi? That and the fact that the elevators were lined up with the conference crowd were the only draw backs.

Reviews.Title: “hotel was overbooked and we got bumped to another hotel”
Reviews.Author: FLJAXDAD
Reviews.Content: They over booked the hotel and so we check in at 5pm tired and hungry and they tell us there are no more rooms but that "THEY UPGRADED" us to the Waldorf next door and it's a much nicer hotel and there would not be any additional charge..... yeah well guess what I didn't want the waldorf or else I would have booked that when I made the reservation... at no time did they offer to shuttle us next door, or any apology, the way the news was delivered was terrible... with two 6 yr olds we made the best of it... we walked over to check in... and then back and fourth to the hilton for the restaurant where kids eat free at hilton and also the hilton-pool which has the slide and lazy river .... but trust me when I say there's nothing "better" about the waldorf for family's it has no slide and no lazy river.... This review would have been complete opposite if they had treated me better about the ordeal... Even when we got to the waldorf the lady was just as indifferent about our situation.... like they expected me to be thanking them at the front desk for this "upgrade"... instead I wasn't even offered an apology or free parking, breakfast coupon, nothing for our inconvenience .... so in an industry where customer service is everything, they dropped the ball on this vacationer .... Otherwise both properties are new and clean and five stars... just wish they trained the staff better on first impressions and customer service...

Reviews.Title: “Love it! Would come back again.”
Reviews.Author: kriscad
Reviews.Content: I took my wife, 2 kids and mother-n-law! We got the suite room, that had two queen beds, with a huge living room. Tons of space. Linens were very very nice! No complaints with the room! Very clean. We loved the lazy river and pool area. We spent most of our time down there. Food was great! Kids loved the activities. Also... the Water Slide Rocks!!! Cons: We paid extra $ to face the pool which they say you could watch the fireworks. The fireworks are wayyyyyyyyyyy to the right side of the direction we were facing and you could barley see them. No biggie, but not worth the extra money.

Reviews.Title: “One Night Stay... On The Floor”
Reviews.Author: LuitaChris
Reviews.Content: Well we stayed at the Hilton Bonnet Creek for one night on July 23. It was my wife and I and my best friend and his pregnant girlfriend. We booked a 2 Queen room with 4 adults. We went to check in at around 12:30. I was told that there aren't any Queen rooms available and she can only give us a room with 1 King bed due to a conference being held there. I am not one to cause a scene so I asked her if she is positive and she said yes. She said she could have a roll a way bed sent up and some extra bedding for someone to sleep on the floor. I wanted to blow my lid but I kept my cool and just wanted to have a good weekend. She said we can use the pool and they will call us in an hour when the room is ready. The pool was great, we just all wished there was a deep end where you could actually swim. We got a "Blush Breeze" from the pool bar and that made us all feel better =) (Except the pregnant one of course) WE got a call that our room was ready so we went up and called the front desk to have a roll a way sent up. When I called the front desk said "I'll put a request in but I can't guarantee anything". That is the point I got a little mad and said "listen we were told the room we booked isn't available and we have 4 adults, one being pregnant, and have one bed. I need this up here". It was up in 5 minutes lol. The hotel is nice but this inconvenience really aggravated me. There must be confusion there b/c when we left the next day, it took 20 minutes to get out of the parking lot. It looked like another conference was showing up b/c they had people parking everywhere. All hotel staff was out directing traffic and it was a cluster. Again, the hotel is beautiful but this instance really rubbed me the wrong way.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a Disney trip - wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: SBNP
Reviews.Content: We were unsure of whether to go with a Disney hotel or not. In the end we chose Hilton Bonnet Creek and decided to use the savings as spending money for the kids while in the parks. We booked for 5 nights. We requested a room with a Disney view. The room was lovely, clean and appealing. We could see the fireworks from the room but it is not directly in front of you - you have to look to the side! The view of the pool area from our room was lovely. The transport to the Parks was good - we used it for 3 days and one evening to go to Down Town Disney. We found the service was excellent. Nothing was too much trouble. The mark of good service I feel is how things are sorted out when problems arise - for us any small problems were sorted immediately and we were very happy. The weekend we arrived the hotel had a "cupcake theme" we loved it and were sorry we didn't have time to take part in more of the activities. It was a great idea. The pool and lazy swim and slide were fab - great for relaxing after a day at Disney. We would highly recommend this hotel and would love to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShellyBNyc
Reviews.Content: Fun hotel. Great Pool. Amazing spa next door. Only issue: buses were infrequent so we ended up using cabs to go to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: Tinkerbell47_11
Reviews.Content: The no.1 hotel for me. From the moment u step at the front door, from customer service to housekeeping, restaurants, pool, personnel, coffee shop, how clean the hotel is, the way housekeeping cleans those rooms. I was impressed with the hotel. The closeness to the Disney parks, the shuttle buses and the wonderful bus drivers, so helpful. I was on vacation with my grandson and he loved it. To anyone out there who reads my review - This is the place to Stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with superb pool”
Reviews.Author: kebabster1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five nights as my husband was attending a conference. Not the usual hotel I would choose to stay in by choice though. Bedroom and bathroom were large and very well equipped. Liked having an iron and ironing board in the room. Buffet breakfast was superb and it was nice being able to eat outside in the mornings. Loved the pool area. Ample supply of beach towels, umbrellas and sun loungers (although they were a little too close to each other for my liking!). The highlight was the lazy river. Spent a lot of time going round and round and round! Bought a couple of rings for a few dollars which were pumped up by the shop. Not great if you want to do some serious laps though but the Waldorf next door has a large rectangular pool that can be used by Hilton guests which looked good. One downside for me was the location - if you didn't want to do the Disney thing (which I'm sure most people are there for) there's nothing to do nearby and I felt a bit trapped in the hotel. Really enjoyed the food at La Luce although the air conditioning was too high so felt chilly and not very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hilton Bonnet Creek.”
Reviews.Author: Ossitraveller
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel, as new and such great value. We used the MVP rate, US127.40 per night plus tax. What a bargain! Rooms were huge, clean and very comfortable. Self parking was great-undercover, secure and an easy walk with luggage back to the lobby. Check in was efficient, staff were welcoming. We had dinner at the Harvest restaurant-enjoyed the food and a glass of wine- it was a reasonable price and excellent service. The pool was amazing. Our son really loved the waterslide and you can hire rubber rings and just float around all day for $5.00. It was the best pool out of all the hotels we went to all over America. They also show movies so you can be in the pool and catch a flick. Had a Disney view room and could see the fireworks every night. The hotel shuttle bus to Magic Kingdom worked well, although it was very crowded at 930am and we had to stand. It was also convenient returning home in the afternoon. There is a Disney shop in the hotel and we bought our tickets here. We really enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “WILL BE BACK SOON!!!”
Reviews.Author: iveynole
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a short stay at this wonderful property and let me tell you, we did not wanna leave. Front desk personnel were outstanding and went out of their way to make us happy. The pool area, consisting of a lazy river, two hot tubs & a water slide were fabulous. Sure, the drinks were pricey at the pool bar and you gotta pay a $5 tube rental fee (unless you bring your own), but this a 4-star resort; not the Holiday Inn. Spend a few extra bucks & treat the fam...

Reviews.Title: “Pool and lazy river are worth it”
Reviews.Author: Toddsr
Reviews.Content: We checked in after a half day at Animal Kingdom theme park. We immediately went to the pool with our own floats. We floated for hours just enjoying the relaxation and scenery. We were then treated to a dive in movie. The pool was peaceful and not too crowded. The rest of the hotel was impressive. It is a newer hotel and kept very clean. The staff was very friendly, courteous and quick with all requests. I also got the opportunity to play golf at the Waldorf Golf club which is on property. They treat you like royalty. Overall, we enjoyed our stay very much and would recommend the hotel to anyone that wants a to unwind and relax in a fantastic pool. **Only thing keeping this from 5 stars was because of an unfortunate, isolated experience that I had with valet. I contacted the hotel and valet within 30 mins of leaving the property and was told that they would look in to the matter and get back with me. I never heard back. I called the next morning and spoke to the front desk supervisor. I made her aware of the problem. She assured me she would talk with valet and call me within 30 minutes. It has now been a week and I have heard back from no one. I have corrected the issue myself and it was fairly minor in nature, but an upscale hotel should have better customer service than this.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, beware of the upselling”
Reviews.Author: trugex
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice resort that opened within the last two years. There are a lot of things to like here, but all the extra fees and constant upselling is off-putting. We were told even before getting out of our car that valet parking ($20) was required. We later discover that valet parking is an â€œoptionâ€�. The check-in process involves â€œupgradingâ€� your room to a better view, floor, etc. The extras continue with other fees such as for room wi-fi as well as a rental for a float to use at their lazy river. Ironically, not more than just a few months ago, we stayed at the almost identical Hilton Orlando attached to the convention center and had an extremely pleasant experience. We would recommend the Hilton Orlando, but not the Hilton Bonnet Creek.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, fun, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: Ilovenc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is absolutely lovely and the rooms are terrific. We were on the 18th floor and could see Downtown Disney from our room. The pool is great and our girls (ages 6 and 8) had a ball. The exercise room is terrific. We would definitely stay there again, but it is very pricey! Room service for two milks, one kid's meal of spaghetti and one kid's meal of mac and cheese was $34. Beer runs about $9/glass and mixed drinks are in excess of $10 each. Parking was $13/day. The hotel is very clean. The Harvest Bistro restaurant is very good and 2 children can eat free with the purchase of one adult meal from the main menu at breakfast and dinner (NOT lunch). We did not eat at the other restaurants in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels! You will have FUN!”
Reviews.Author: TriciaTNT
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had heard that this hotel was a favorite among friends. We were very impressed with our stay at the Hilton Bonnet Creek. Here are a few reasons why: 1. The lazy river is fun for couples and for families. Yes, it can get crowded but it wasn't that bad and we were there over the 4th of July weekend. I suggest you buy a small raft before you arrive. If not, you can buy or rent them at the pool. Rentals are $5 a day and the prices to buy their rafts range from $6-$13. If you are there for more than one day, buy the raft. If you are concerned that you will not have room in your suite case when you leave to take it home there are tons of families that would be so happy to have your raft when you are done with it. At night the hotel shows a movie (Shrek, etc.) on a big screen next to the pool for your family to enjoy. Also, I don't know if it was because it was a holiday weekend or not but the hotel had blow up giant slides for you to play on. My husband and I didn't ... but it looked fun for the kids. 2. There are many choices for places to eat. While we were at the pool area on a Saturday we had the small of ribs, chicken and burgers on an open grill to temp us. In addition there is a small cafe type next to the pool as well as an inside/ outside restaurant to dine at if you wish. 3. Our room was fantastic. We asked to have a view of the pool area and to our delight we could see fireworks at night from the nearby parks. We could see into a room next to us that was being cleaned (as we walked by) and they had a small kitchen. If I had kids I would go this route because breakfast was expensive on property. 4. The Hilton Bonnet Creek is very close to Disney. We were minutes away from Downtown Disney and the parks. There were busses available to take you to the parks if you wanted to take that route. 5. We ate at La Luce on the property for dinner one night and the food was good. Not amazing... but pretty good. The atmosphere was excellent and they had a great wine selection. The service was so so... the waiter was very nice but just slow. We chose to eat there because it was two minutes from our room and we were tired from the Disney parks that day... we were happy with that dinner choice because of the convenience. 6. Every morning we had breakfast at the hotel. We are Hilton Gold members so it was free for a continental breakfast or $6 for hot... we did the hot every morning. If you had to pay full price it was $20 per person. Is it worth $20 per person? The convenience of a filling breakfast before a day at the parks makes the $20 a person well worth it. 7. The staff was wonderful. We did not run into one person who wasn't a pleasure to be around and happy to be working at this hotel. 8. We had free high speed internet. I am not sure if this was free to everyone or if it was free to us because we are Hilton Gold members. Either way, being connected was nice. Some of the downfalls: 1. The parking garage is $13 a night... not too bad and reasonable for this area. Park on the 2nd level... that level will take you over to the hotel without needing a elevator or stairs. 2. Hopefully you love kids because there are A Lot of them. We didn't mind them and enjoyed seeing them have so much fun. If you are looking for a quiet romantic weekend away without kids floating past you with water guns... maybe you would want to pick another resort. Maybe the Waldorf Astoria next door? That is all that I can think of. as far as downfalls. I loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: ZsaZsa
Reviews.Content: Last year we stayed at the Doubltree for our long July 4th wknd at Disney World. This year we thought we would try the Hilton Bonnet Creek (both stays were wtih Hilton point). We were very impressed. Location - we preferred this location to the Doubletree. We felt closer to all the parks and the dedicated shuttle was nice. The Doubltree wasn't a problem, but the shuttle did make a lot of stops. The shuttle was always on time, and the drivers were very professional and courteous. Property - the rooms are typical hotel rooms. The hotel is new enough so nothing is run down. We found the beds to be firm but extremely comfortable. We slept like babies. Of course, we were so tired after the long hot days at the parks. The hotel lobby is huge with a nice lobby bar. There was another bar (Zeta) off to the side with a very nice, contemporary design. We enjoyed a drink after the parks one night, but was disappointed that they allowed 10 yr old kids to sing karaoke. Around 11:15 they finally asked the kids to leave. Sorry, as an adult I enjoy an adult beverage in an adult establishment with other adults. Parking - we chose the self park at $13 a day, you use your room key to get in and out of the ramp and the charges get billed to your room. As Diamond members we were given free wifi access. Honestly, I can't figure out why it isn't free to everyone these days. Food - since we were out and about each day, our only experience with the food was a late night room service of chicken wings and chicken fingers. I will give them a 7 out of 10. Pool area - looked gorgeous and many were using it, however, we were there for a wknd only and spent our time at the Disney parks. Overall, we were very pleased with our choice and will definately consider this hotel again for our trip next year!

Reviews.Title: “Professional service, fantastic pool”
Reviews.Author: Dottybug
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week for our big trip to Disney and Universal. It's a very beautiful new hotel so everything felt clean and fresh. All staff members are friendly and extremely professional. This hotel is just off I-4 so it's easy to get to Universal and SeaWorld if you rent a car. The free hotel shuttle service to Disney were always right on time so get to the shuttle stop at the scheduled time or you will miss it. Odd numbered rooms have a Disney view, very nice view overlooking the pool and golf course. At first glance I thought the room small, but once we spread out we realized there was plenty enough room for our 3 suitcases, and the 4 of us didn't feel crammed in. We really liked that there was an extra table in the room on wheels, it came in handy for times we ate in the room or just to put the suitcase on. The big negative of this hotel for us was that there were no coin operated washers and dryers. We were there for a week so it would have been nice to be able to wash while we were there and pack less. The pool is way cool. There are fun activities every day for kids like movies at night. We brought tube floats from home to save money since you have to rent them at the pool. When we made our reservations, there was a package for a few dollars more per night that included breakfast for two at the Harvest Bistro - well worth the extra cost! Just about anything you could want for breakfast, they have it. It can get crowded but we never had to wait longer than 15 minutes to get seated. Empty trays of food are replaced very quickly so if something runs out, come back in a couple of minutes and it will be full. It can get expensive eating at the theme parks so we usually opted to eat near the hotel for dinner. A good area to find many places to eat is along 535. Follow the signs to Downtown Disney (E. Buena Vista Road). Stay on the road past Downtown Disney until it intersects with 535 (S. Apopka Vineland Rd). The CrossRoads Shopping Center at this intersection has many places to eat, plus a cool mini golf course. Or if you turn left (north) onto 535 there are other options. Also on 535 is a Winn Dixie about a block north of the Steak and Shake. We bought bottled water and ponchos at Winn Dixie, which was a great investment since it rained at about 2:30 every afternoon while we were there - that's very normal summer weather apparently, so be prepared! Ponchos at Universal are $8, just so you know, probably the same at Disney. We really enjoyed our stay and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. If you are a Hilton Honors member, there are perks so ask about them. There are other options besides earning points for your stay, so find out what deals are offered at the time. Just FYI if you rent a car: when you head back to the airport take the 417 highway (via 536) instead of I-4/528 because you can fill up at the 7-11 or Hess station along the way. Both are about 2 miles from the hotel on World Center Drive (Hwy 536), just before getting on the 417. From what I understand, gas stations closer to the airport are way more expensive and hard to find. The few miles you drive to the airport will not affect the full tank meter on the rental car enough for them to charge you.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful & great fun for the kids but expensive”
Reviews.Author: jennv21
Reviews.Content: My family (2 adults, 2 kids) traveled to Orlando recently for my children's first trip to Disney. We stayed at this hotel which is very new and amazing. We stayed in a standard room with two queen beds with no extras and it was still very lovely. My kids loved the pool with the lazy river and slide (for kids taller than 40"). They also had a nightly movie that was set up by the pool so that the kids could swim and enjoy the movie after a long hot day at Disney. I do recommend that you stop at Walmart and stock up on drinks, snacks, and a tube for the pool. The hotel does offer to sell or rent you a tube, but the price is excessive. They do provide plenty of pool seating and towels. This is one of those hotels that has a lot of extras that cost a lot extra. Self parking is $13 per day, but the bus to Disney is part of the pkg and it is very nice but you do need to plan your return times. The shuttle offers a website accessible from your mobile phone that eases the scheduling for departures/returns. Wireless internet is also an extra that requires additional charges and they have bottled water in your room that cost $5 per bottle. We did not eat at any of the hotel restaurants, the menus didn't seem to kid friendly and the prices were scary. Our room was very far away from the elevators and the clerk that checked us in asked us if we wanted to change but I was worried about the noise. Don't worry about the noise, the walls are very thick and the doors are heavy so I would opt for a shorter walk. Overall this hotel was very nice and added to our Disney experience, I think if you plan it right and expect certain additional costs it is definitely worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “"family" restaurant needs lower prices and a decent menu”
Reviews.Author: jbelfield
Reviews.Content: this is a typical hilton..great rooms, comfortable beds but the hotel only offers shuttles to Disney and not any other popular destinations.. Bring food because the food in the advertised family restaurant is disgusting and rediculously expensive. also, bring your car because you can't get ANYWHERE from here for less than 40$ round trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jinx1971
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, great service, fab pool. We chose a room away room the elevators, you get used to the walk, but it is quiet. Bull and Bear restaurant in the Waldorf is top class for a nice night out. Parking is next to hotel, 200 yards walk back unless you you valet park. Good size fridge in room and v. comfy beds. We stocked up with food from 'Publix' supermarket (cereals, yoghurts, fruit, drinks) nearest one was by Orlando Prem. Outlet Mall just up over the I4 by downtown disney. Close to all the parks, 15 mins is the furthest drive to Universal.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: SouthMississippian
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very new when we stayed there. The room was large, clean and the beds were comfortable. We were on the 8th floor and had a good view. We ate at the small outdoor restaurant/bar near the pool and the food was good. The cost was about normal for the area. The pool is large but not as large as the pictures make it out to be. This is a large hotel. It has a large parking garage and 3 restaurants. We stayed one night so I did not have time to see the whole hotel but it looked like it had several places for meetings. Good: Large, clean comfortable room and beds Near Disney World and Down Town Disney Nice staff Pool/lazy river Bad: No life guards for the pool Parents with young children will have a difficult time watching their children in the pool unless they are swimming with them. The lazy river takes then out of sight for several minutes. The gift shop floating toys cost a lot. Bring your own floating toys. The hotel parking fee was $13 per day beyond the room cost.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsJeffcott
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at this hotel for the last 3 days. I had my two kids (7 and 5) while my husband was attending a work conference here. The hotel was very, very nice. Professional and spacious. Clean and comfortable. The hotel has a great pool with a gentle slope into the pool and also a lazy river that keeps the water moving around the pool area. Really relaxing and the kids loved it. You can rent a raft tube for $5/day or buy a colorful one for $7 to keep for your stay (or you can bring one from home or a new one from the store to blow up). They also have a nice bar (covered) with nice seating and kind of a south-beachy feel. Also really fun for the kids is a windy water slide that the kids REALLY loved. It has an attendant that stands watching over the children. The Harvest restaurant downstairs can provide for breakfast and lunch. They do have a fancy restaurant called La Luce (I think). They also have a coffee shop upstairs (no Starbucks here... not even in the room. Lavazza coffee served). My only gripe in the room was the shower was a rain-type shower that seemed to take me forever to get my hair soaked! Definitely probably not my favorite type. They need to improve the shower curtain situation too as water would get all over the floor in the bathroom. I tried everything to prevent but could only to an extent prevent this from happening. $13 per day self-parking garage next door. They will valet park your car, but not sure of this price. Overall, we had a nice stay and my husband says the conference facilities were very adequate. It also has it's own bus stop with a resort bus that goes to Magic Kingdom, Epcot, Hollywood Studios and somewhere else (I forgot already!). Runs late. 11:20 last pickup from Magic Kingdom. Very close to Downtown Disney (but not walking distance). They do have towncar cabs for hire to take you wherever you want to go. No charge for the bus. Very nice. Enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “To Disney or not to Disney...”
Reviews.Author: nybeachbumm
Reviews.Content: I will start out by saying that if this hotel was anywhere other than Disney, I would give it an almost perfect review. However since I have stayed at so many of the Disney World resorts I had to compare it to that the entire time. This hotel is newer and beautiful. It has a huge pool and plenty of chairs. We paid extra for a "theme park" view, and I don't recommend you pay the money for that because you could only see Hollywood studios from our room, and it was very far away. Not worth the extra money. The hotel provides a shuttle bus to all the parks, but it was no comparison to how frequently the Disney shuttle bus system runs. The hotel shuttle only ran at specific times and getting home later at night we found ourselves waiting. But I will say we were on a not very crowded coach bus, where the Disney shuttles tend to be standing room only. I missed the "Disney feel" at this hotel. There is nothing like staying at a Disney brand hotel, and even though this hotel is right in the heart of Disney, it still felt worlds away. The prices here were excellent, and you are getting a much nicer hotel for the money than you would at a Disney resort. The price of this hotel compares with a "moderate" hotel on Disney property. We've stayed at a "moderate" resort, and will not be going back to one! This hotel blows a Disney moderate hotel out of the water. Another down side is you have to pay for parking. If you stay at a Disney resort the "Magical Express" will take you to and from the airport to your hotel free of charge. We wound up renting a car and paying for parking everyday. I'm not sure how much a cab ride from the airport to hotel would be, but that might be a cheaper option. And when you don't stay at a Disney hotel you cannot get the meal plan, which I highly recommend. So if you are thinking about staying here and you've never stayed on Disney property, I think you will love it! If you have stayed at the finer Disney resorts, you may find yourself missing something. Tough decision! It is a great hotel, but I will be staying on Disney property for now on.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a solid stay”
Reviews.Author: Jin_Jiang
Reviews.Content: Spent about 6 nights at this hotel during May and left with an overall positive experience. Specifics... - Rooms were clean and comfortable; housekeeping was flawless during my stay. As a light sleeper (noise sensitive) I especially appreciated was the fact that rooms were soundproofed (doors were a bit heavy and hard to open at times but were great soundproofing doors); - Pool area was enormous (augmented by the fact that guest can use the facilities of the adjacent Waldorf Astoria). Towels and chairs were plentiful, poolside restaurant food was great, lazy pool was a nice touch -- kudos to the design of this facility. - Well-managed hotel. I had some hiccups at check in and at one of the restaurants - in both instances I received a follow up phone call from management which made me feel that I had been treated as a welcomed guest. Further, all staff were friendly and greeted guests with a smile; well-done. - Food was overall good. I think when you go to a place like Orlando you have to re-align your expectations (forget michelin star fare). In this context, I was satisfied with food in all outlets within the hotel. - Special mention must be given to the hotel lobby lounge. This place offered fantastic service (patrons always greeted cheerfully by the staff). Even more appreciated was the fact that they served draft beer, ice cold and served in a pilsner glass. I have never had a glass of draft beer so cold and refreshing in my life! I am not even a real beer drinker but could easily become one staying here, ha!

Reviews.Title: “Love it! Great Hotel on its own... the fact that it is so close to Disney is a BONUS!”
Reviews.Author: AXO1010
Reviews.Content: Great, clean, new hotel. We stayed at this hotel soon after it opened, and have been going back a few times a year ever since. Great restaurant selections (attached to a Waldorf Astoria, so you can go to restaurants at either hotels) and fabulous pool. Very close to Disney - but nothing Disney about the property. For us, it is great to do the parks during the day with the kids, but then return to a nice, clean hotel, where we can have a break from Mickey for a bit. :) They have nice shuttles that take you to Downtown Disney and all of the parks... park at the hotel, and then take advantage of the free shuttles. My only complaint (and I hate to say this as I really do love the hotel) is that the walls are paper thin. I've been up many a night listening to the baby "down the hall" cry. (But being a mom myself, I can kind of tune it out.) Maybe when you check in - ask for a "quiet room". Great Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Convenient for Disney”
Reviews.Author: pandabear6
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference at this hotel and it was a good choice. The rooms are large and comfortable, the staff was friendly when needed but not obtrusive, the concierge desk was very helpful and the pool was fun. The pool is one big lazy river which was perfect after 8 hours of classes but my daughter found a bit boring after a while. But in the evenings they do have movies (weather permitting) and that was really fun for my son. The fitness center was simply fantastic with a lot of different machines and several of them so I don't think you'd ever have to wait. There is a complimentary shuttle to the Disney parks and Downtown Disney. The one thing I didn't like is that they charge for parking. Why? It's not downtown Chicago, it's a hotel in Orlando. It's not like a bunch of people are coming there to park. Plus being a Hilton they do nickel and dime you. Be prepared to spend $20 per person for breakfast and pay for internet. The catering at our seminar was okay some days and very good others. I didn't like how they didn't let us put our own salad dressing and that took time. But it was overall good.

Reviews.Title: “Just all around Awesome”
Reviews.Author: MichaelLB
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend at Disney. Great location. Prices were reasonable for on Disney. Staff was great. Great view. From our room on the 15th floor we could see all 4 Disney parks. Usually we wear ourselves out at the parks when we go to Disney. The hotel is usually just place to crash when we are exhausted. But this time we spent half a day just laying around the pool and floating around it's lazy river. I am sure we will stay here again. If I had a complaint, it would be having to pay for internet. I was lucky and able to get around that. But it took some work. Parking is also stupid. You either pay to valet, or you pay to park it yourself. Where am I supposed to park if I don't want to pay to park in the hotel I am staying in? Stupid.

Reviews.Title: “Summer Blast is Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Dvs410
Reviews.Content: Lazy river and waterside kept grandchildren so busy grandma is totally thrilled! Saturday's poolside activities and cook-out was more than anyone needs for a day of family fun.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but frustrating.”
Reviews.Author: dkraven76
Reviews.Content: Was there for a conference and while the hotel has a nice ambiance inside and out, it was way understaffed. The wave pool with the lazy river is very nice and relaxing, and I really enjoyed the evening movie dive-in. However the service at the pool was incredibly slow and we didn't get change when paying with cash. Also, we waited half an hour and couldn't get a drink at the extremely overpriced bar and it took 20 minutes to get a morning coffee at Muse. Also, several little things around the hotel didn't work, i.e. most of the TV channels in the room, the refrigerator, and the card swipe to exit the hotel garage. Overall it was a nice experience, but also a frustrating one.

Reviews.Title: “Newer Hotel”
Reviews.Author: michigantraveler70
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is a nice Hotel, being new rooms are clean and fresh, and grounds are great in appearance . Most of the employees are friendly and helpful. Everything is at a extra cost,parking, internet,so on. as is the case at most Disney area Hotels. Food is going to cost you,$14 for a burger and up from there.The bus service is the best next to the Disney hotels transportion, but you need to plan your timing carefully, they do not wait for late comers. One thing this resort complex is very,very focus to is the business traveler. During our week there the Hotel was busy with business events. Most days the walkway and pool area behind the Waldorf was closed off and set up for private affairs. So using its pools or walking by there was not a option, which would have been nice, because the Hilton's pool while being large is way too shallow , 3 feet at best makes it very hard to swim in. One thing to point out, if you do not like walking the hallways to the last rooms on each floor is a very long hike. Though it was very quiet down there. Also the one thing I missed was a laundry room that other disney area hotels offer.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Clean "Disney" Destination Hotel; However, Skip the Food!”
Reviews.Author: NewEachYear
Reviews.Content: The GOOD: - Friendly Front Desk, and Room Service - Great Location for Disney Parks with Shuttle Services - Well- Kept and Attractive Grounds - Spacious Rooms with Good Cleaning Services and Not Too Pricey - Clean Pool Area - Lazy River, Small Pool, and Shallow Main Pool areas Great for Children = also Daily Activities - Spa at the Waldorf was Clean and Inviting....had a Good Massage there...but NOT cheap (of course - it is the Waldorf)!!! Areas NEEDING IMPROVEMENT: - King Bed Rooms have Stand-Up Shower Only - Hotel Isolated - You are NOT Allowed to use a Trolley UNLESS a Porter "assists" You with your Luggage - in fact, they Took (because it was on the trolley and they thought it was the Hotel's I suppose) or "Lost" an Expensive Hypo-Allergetic/Asthma Pillow we brought from Home and have NOT bothered to Get back to us about it NOR reimburse us for the Cost - Online Booking System needs Updating - Parking and Internet are EXTRA! The BAD: - The Food and Service at the Hotel AND the Waldorf is, in a word, TERRIBLE (and I am not talking about the Buffet alone, but the a-la-carte fare primarily) - Flavourless and Overpriced Food with Slow, Sometimes Arrogant Servers!!!! This is Particularly True of the Buffet (which to be fair I do not like much on a good day) in the Main Restaurant (the one where Kids can eat Free....you'll know why they offer that once you taste the food...) - Automatic Gratuity and Service Charge added to Bill for Room Service...and Room Service Menu is Pretty Limited (especially if you are a Vegetarian) - Customer Service at the Pool is Hit Or Miss depending on Who you are and Who your Server is.....I found a HAIR in my drink and they did NOT even OFFER me a Free drink!

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Place to Relax After a Day at Disney”
Reviews.Author: Saluga
Reviews.Content: This is a very modern and new looking resort located in a secluded area. There arenâ€™t any shops or restaurants nearby, but there are several (mostly expensive) restaurants right in the hotel. We did find one fairly inexpensive (for a hotel) place, called Muse, that sold pastries, pre-packaged sandwiches, and hot and cold drinks. We bought breakfast here each morning and ate it outside on the terrace overlooking the pools, which were set up like a mini water park. There was a lagoon style pool, a lazy river, a water slide and a kiddie pool. While we were lounging by the pools one day, a staff member came by and offered complimentary frozen grapes and cold towels. Every hotel employee that we encountered was friendly and helpful. Because we are Hilton Honors Gold members, we were upgraded to a Disney view room. Unfortunately, we couldnâ€™t see too much of Disney, but we did have a nice view of the golf course and pools. Our room was large with a big picture window, which gave it an open and airy feel. There was a mini fridge, but no microwave, and a flat screen TV with a good selection of channels. The bathroom had a large vanity with plenty of countertop space and a tub/shower combo. The fitness room was very large and had plenty of machines to work out on. Two computers and a printer were located in the lobby and could be used to print out boarding passes. Free Shuttle busses to and from the Disney parks and downtown Disney run every half hour from early morning until park closing. The hotel does charge for parking - $13 for self parking and $20 for valet. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “so relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: ajslcsw
Reviews.Content: Aside from the great experience of having a "leisure" river and multiple pools (share with the Waldorf next door) the staff was friendly and helpful. We were surprised to find a frig in the room. My teenage daughter and I agreed that we felt like we were on a cruise! There are activities scheduled and plenty of bars and restaurants. We just went back and forth between the two hotels. There is food service at the pool as well. No complaints here! Will stay again. FYI, there is a daily $13.00 fee for parking in the garage.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC RESORT!!!”
Reviews.Author: sylvi97
Reviews.Content: If you are planning to visit Orlando as a family or couple this is the place to stay. Previous visits to Orlando we have stayed at various hotels, BUT, I have to say this one was our favorite. The hotel is beautiful. It has 2 large pools connected by a lazy river. If you go as a family there seemed to be plenty of kids activities poolside,with a daily event schedule. If you plan to visit any of the Disney Parks they have complimentary shuttles,(to and from), several times a day The staff was very attentive to our needs poolside and through out the hotel. We found restaurants reasonably priced, as well. The hotel is connected through expansive halls and conference facilities to the Waldorf Astoria. We dined one night at The Bull and Bear. It was absolutely wonderful. If you are a guest at the Hilton you can use the alot of the amenities at the Waldorf too. We will definitely go back to the Hilton Orlando Bonnet Creek next time we return to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: BrownSt13
Reviews.Content: My family: 3 adults and a pre-teen boy stayed at this hotel for 5 days. My father attended conference here and the rest of the family visited the Disney parks. Here's a simple run down of pros, cons, and comments: Pros: -Excellent customer service -Very quiet rooms because of thick walls, doors, and curtains.
