If we didn't have a clock, we would have thought it was still night. -The pool has a lazy river, my brother loved it! -Game room (We played some pool and guitar Hero...not free btw.) -Excellent food: I recommend the Buffet at Harvest Bistro, La Luce for dinner, poolside grill for drinks, the pastries at Harvest Bistro (Delicious brownies!). -Free transportation to the Disney Parks; the bus is really comfy and they have departure and pick up times throughout the day. Cons: -Our toilet was near broken: really really slow -The shower head was a little too gentle -When you ask for a taxi, you don't get the regular yellow taxi...you get a classy-looking, 2x more expensive ride. -The elevators could have been better placed, our room was quite away from it Further Recommendations: -Remember the Concierge can be a great help -The strawberry shortcake drink, pina colada, strawberry smoothie, and kid's chicken fingers from the poolside grill is excellent. But the chicken salad was disappointing. Also there's normally a staff member who will walk around the pool and take your order. -La Luce is a bit more pricey, but the food is absolutely delicious. My veal chop was spiced and cooked perfectly. The butterscotch pudding and the cantaloupe vodka drink were excellent as well. -From Muse (the main coffee and pastry shop), I recommend the almond croissant. -Remember that not all the shuttle buses go to the same Disney parks. -Certain medicine are available for purchase at Harvest Bistro's grab and go -You can pay an extra $10 per night to get a view of Disneyland

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place if this is what you want”
Reviews.Author: SebagoGuy
Reviews.Content: I was here at a business convention in March, with no rental car I had no real alternative, with the exception of the Waldorf attached to the other side of the convention center. The Hilton is a large property, very well maintained, very close to the Disney properties and probably a choice for families who can afford an upscale hotel with shuttle service to the Disney venues. I don't like being in resorts hotels that are too far from anything but on-property shops, restaurants, etc. so not the type of place I would choose (especially if I was paying out of pocket). However the lobby, room, and service were very nice. There was a beautiful pool with a "river" circulating around it for the youngsters, and movies were shown outside by the pool one evening. I had a terrific meal in the Italian restaurant off the lobby, and an overpriced buffet in the family restaurant in the lower level. There are a few coffee shop/sandwich options, and you could walk to the Waldorf for other choices. You can get a drink poolside and grab a shuttle to several local attractions, but there are generally no cabs lurking nearby, just more expensive town cars. My room had a great view and nice amenities (free WiFi only because I was with a group) If you're on business in the area and expensing it off, and need some quite place to stay this is nice. Few kids and overall a very nice, though pricey, place.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: MSNM
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Comfortable rooms and friendly staff. Loved the pool and lazy river (and the large green pool towels). Had problems with wifi but the issue was resolved. $18 parking per night is more than i'd care for but I guess that's how it is with the newer hotels. Great dining options and beautiful decor throughout. Walked over to the Waldorf-Astoria to check it out. Really nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with friendly staff in most areas.”
Reviews.Author: blairlucy
Reviews.Content: Very enjoyable stay for 7 nights. Nice room with good maid service. Location ideal for theme parks. Ate out most of the time however coffee shop, bistro and restaurants available if required. Appeared to be used for many conventions so always busy. Only complaint was having to use car parking facilities with added costs of roughly 14 dollars a day.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is awesome”
Reviews.Author: DSwen3
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of visting this hotel while visiting friends staying there. This hotel was so clean, very friendly staff and the lazy river was too cool, plus the kids get to eat for free. Food prices are about the same as everywhere and it was convenient to have the food at the bar. I noticed the security guards around the area which was great. There was a lifeguard or employee named Danielle that was great with the kids. She was mainly at the slide, but she showed the kids how to make towel oragami. The kids went crazy over that. This is something usually done at Disney and it was great to see this being done elsewhere. She was awesome with the kids and very attentive with them. If I had small children I would definitely stay here, well I would stay even without the kids. It was so clean. They made it very easy to visit my friends there. Oh, and the weight room is great too!

Reviews.Title: “A very special place to holiday!”
Reviews.Author: Danc0102
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks - and what an amazing holiday we had. The service the staff provide is unbelievable, we were treated like royalty for 2 weeks. When we first arrived we asked if there was ant chance of an upgrade, which the receptionist did with ease, complimentary, we were upgraded to a Disney view and you can see the fireworks around 10pm from Disney. The room was spacious with daily maid service and clean towels everyday. We had breakfast in the harvest bistro most mornings but at 19 dollars per person it is an expensive start to your day, however there was lots of choice. This hotel is great for families who spend a lot of time at Disney due to the free shuttles, however my partner and I spent a lot of time at universal which meant we had to get a taxi, do not get the black cabs that the hotel provide, the journey will cost double the price, just ask one of the outside attendants to order you a yellow cab, and they arrive within 10 minutes. It cost us around 30 dollars to get to universal, around 20 dollars to the outlets, and around 15 dollars to some nearby resturants. I think if this hotel offered free shuttles to universal as well as Disney, it would increase this hotels appeal. The outside 'beech' snack bar was brilliant for a few drinks or a bite to eat, they offered free refills on soft drinks and sodas which was a bonus. We ate at La Luce, one of the restaurants inside the hotel, it was lovely but expensive. The lazy river was an added bonus and the kids seem to throughly enjoy the night time film that was played on a big screen by the pool. We had to pay for use of the wifi in our room, however we found that if you walked down to the lobby to connect, you could keep your signal in your room for 24 hours, so we just did this to avoid paying! I think the wifi charge is silly in a hotel of such stature, and maybe a free wifi service would be another benefit. Overall hid hotel exceeded my expectations, amazing staff, superb holiday and for us an okay location. Would return. Anyday!

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel, great service, close to all parks”
Reviews.Author: thomsonambra
Reviews.Content: what an amazing hotel. stayed with my husbands and 2 kids. from the start the service was outstanding. the decor is fantastic, the beds are so comfortable. the food lovely. we only ate in the harvest rest as kids were free and the quality was very good. the pool is great for children, very safe and fun. the staff there were very friendly. the transport to disney was every half an hour in a luxury coach. would definetly return

Reviews.Title: “Best Hilton Property in the U.S.”
Reviews.Author: Leadbelly98
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just finished a week-long stay at Hilton Bonnet Creek with our 2 kids (6 and 3 year olds) for our Disney vacation. All of us loved this property! I have stayed over 100 Hilton chain hotels in the U.S. and this one is on top of the list. Below are the many great things about this hotel and its staff. 1. Terrific service from the front desk to the concierge and from the restaurant staff to the pool workers. 2. Very quiet room with extremely comfortable beds...after a long day at Disney =) 3. The entire hotel is kept very clean and organized 4. Both the fitness center and the pool are very large and well-maintained 5. Very good bus transportation to Disney parks 6. Concierge manager was very helpful in resolving the only issue we had during the week.

Reviews.Title: “It was a fabulous hotel with good Disney transportation”
Reviews.Author: honestreviews31
Reviews.Content: If you do not need the every 15 minute bus transportation to Disney this is a fabulous alternative. I stayed with my 8 year old daughter and she was in heaven at the pool. Good poolside service! Just buy a float if you are there for more than a couple of days. The buses run every 30 minutes or for places like Downtown Disney every hour or even two hours so you do have to plan accordingly. We took cabs and just paid the money. Cost us about $15 no matter where we went - Disney, Downtown Disney - different hotels. The hotel is large and it can be a lot of walking to your room, but it's not that bad. I requested a room by the elevator and got it. Rooms are very nice. The restaurant downstairs was nice but did not have a lot of options for meals. Food was good just not many options. Good kid options! Nice snack bar that is open late so you can get snacks if the restaurant is closed when you get back from a long day at Disney. We will be staying here again in October. Can't go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roo028
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hilton Bonnet Creek for 14 nights (May/June) and we were very impressed by this hotel, visually itâ€™s stunning, and has all the amenities that you could want. The bedrooms are spacious, comfortable and everything is pristine. The staff are helpful and friendly and the pool area is one of the best I have ever seen! We loved the â€œdive in moviesâ€� and weekend barbeques by the pool! The food in the hotel was the best we ate while on holidays in Orlando but be warned it doesnâ€™t come cheap. The Italian restaurant La Luce is beautiful and the food and service very good, the bull and bear steakhouse in the adjoining Walfdorf Astoria was nothing short of amazing! The Muse CafÃ© in the lobby was great if you just wanted to grab a quick coffee and cake! We ate breakfast in the harvest bistro each morning which was good, they offer free breakfast for children with a paying adult but we did feel that $19 per person for the buffet breakfast was a bit extreme, having said that the food was good and there was a good selection available. We donâ€™t drive so couldnâ€™t rent a car while on holiday in Orlando so the free transportation to the Disney parks that the hotel offers was brilliant for us, reliable, comfortable and convenient. We did feel at times though that we were a bit isolated. We obviously wanted to go to the other attractions Orlando has to offer and the only way for us to do this was by taxi, unfortunately there were no taxis only town cars outside the hotel so our trips to Sea world, Universal, International drive, outlets etc were stylish but expensive. Overall I would recommend this hotel, and we will definitely return â€“ next time we will rent a car though! : )

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel on Disney property”
Reviews.Author: tonyemilyc
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here recently at the beginning of a trip to Disney World. We stayed 2 nights, then transferred to a moderate Disney Resort Hotel. This hotel was cheaper than the Disney hotel and basically nicer in every way. The pool was fantastic and they had scheduled stuff for the kids by the pool. Movies, blow up slides, etc. There were extra charges that were a little frustrating like parking and for tubes for pool but really was only negative. Loved the hotel and will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Top of the line for comfort and fun!”
Reviews.Author: venicemonkey
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at this hotel for 4 days and felt like I was living in luxury! I am very picky, but can't really think of anything to criticize. The decor is upscale with expensive touches, like mother of pearl lamp sconces in the hallways and a cool geode wall in the elevator lobby. Check out the cobalt blue stained glass panels behind the concierge desk! My room was spacious with a comfy bed, a big flat screen, an in-room fridge and soft sheets and fluffy towels. There was instant hot water in the bath day and night. I paid for in-room wifi, but it's free in the lobby. The pools are beautiful and well-maintained and the lazy river is fun for all ages. Hanging out at the pool was really fun! The poolside food service was good. When I wanted a quieter, more adult pool after the conference day, I just walked over to the Waldorf, the partner hotel next door. The hotel provides free shuttle busses to the Disney parks so there was no fighting the traffic or paying the huge Disney parking fees (much more than the hotel's $13 a day) for friends who brought spouses and kids. The staff was friendly and the food, although expensive, was delicious. I highly recommend this hotel for business mixed with pleasure. Please don't tell my company what a great time I had on my "business" trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great fun for the kids!”
Reviews.Author: SGJ1013
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel! Checked in early without any problem; front desk asked if we wanted high or low floor; of course my grandson said a high floor, so we were on the 18th (top) floor. The room was immaculate and roomy, with a pull-out table and two chairs: great for playing cards with the grandkids. The "lazy river" pool was great fun for the kids and for me, too. This pool is really a lot of fun! Drink service poolside was a little slow, at times nonexistent, but the bar was close by. Restaurant service was excellent, and kids ate free in the bistro for breakfast and dinner. The food was good. The staff was extremely good, and friendly. This hotel is virtually next door to Disney. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Downside: There is not free internet in the rooms and parking is an extra $13 per day

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay there!”
Reviews.Author: lottiib
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Bonnet Creek in Orlando for 7 nights and couldnâ€™t fault it. The hotel is lovely and in a great location not more than 20 minutes drive from most of the major attractions. The rooms were lovely and the staff were friendly. The big plus for us was the pool and in the evening they show a Disney film for the children by the pool. We would definitely visit again!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: cpcu97
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a wonderful stay at the Hilton Bonnet Creek. The service, accommodations, amenities and dining are top notch. It truly is a magical experience. You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: DCannon2588
Reviews.Content: I went down to Orlando with my best friend, and this hotel surpassed every expectation we had. From the time we pulled up to the front door, we felt completely comfortable and welcome. We were greeted by every single employee at the hotel. The entire staff was very accommodating. We went to La Luce the first night and sat in a drafty area, next thing we knew Kin, the manager, brought my friend a cover so she wouldn't be cold anymore. The Beech Bar is an awesome place to just hang out and have lunch or just a couple of drinks. We had so much fun at both Zeta Bar and Sena Bar as well. The bartenders there are awesome!! We had a FANTASTIC time down there and cannot wait to go back down to Orlando, just to stay at this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property and Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: loveisbliss
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights after our cruise. This hotel was absolutely fantastic. Because we had just gotten off of the ship at 7am, we were at the hotel by 9am. I expected to have to wait to check in and just use the pool in the interim. They actually upgraded us to Disney view room and let us in at 9am!! The entire property is beautiful. The service from every employee was phenominal. The pool was relaxing and the service to and from Disney was exceptional. I never want to ride those uncomfortable, crowded Disney buses again. This hotel exceeded my expectations and I would definately recommend it to anybody staying in the Orlando area!

Reviews.Title: “Kevin in front office exemplifies Great Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: goldpanjac
Reviews.Content: Thank you to Kevin in the front office for helping myself and my family out of a situation that might have cost me a good deal of money and perhaps my marriage! Kevin was very understanding and compassionate, and able to quickly alleviate our situation. I appreciate Hiltons ability to attract such high quality individuals that have the capacity to think "out of the box." Sorry I can't eloborate, but they were really, really helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Jakeal82
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights, found it very relaxing, new & chic, spacious yet easy to find your barings. The pool is simply the best, floating round on the lazy river is so relaxing. No problems with sunbeds at all. The pool service is second to none and in general all staff are very friendly and helpful. Plenty of choice for eating all day long, and several bars to choose from of an evening. Very close to Downtown Disney if you want that yet far enough away if you don't.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: csderosa
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Disney resorts for the past 10 years . This Hilton Hotel has them all beat hands down. This place is on their toes at all times and is spotless. the staff is over friendly and will help you with all your needs. The pools is the best. It is right near downtown disney and the hotel has transportation to all the parks.the only down side is the 13 dollar parking per day

Reviews.Title: “Pool Service was Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: CulverCity23
Reviews.Content: We visited the pool area on a very busy Sunday, Memorial Day Weekend. We got there around 2pm and were distraught to see there were no chairs available and the place was packed. We made it to the bar and Brittany (manager) saw we were still carrying all of our stuff and took us under her wing. She was WONDERFUL!!! She found us chairs, tubes, a server (Matt) and checked on us numerous times throughout the afternoon. Matt made sure our drinks didn't go empty and we didn't even have to get out of the tube! We travel all the time and we've never received such wonderful service as Brittany and Matt gave us, they truly made us feel like cherished guests! Not only did they go above and beyond but they were just plain FUN!! I wish we encountered people like this every time we travel, they are the BEST! Not only does this hotel have fabulous team members but it's beautiful, awesome location and the food is great!!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: spepe20
Reviews.Content: The Hilton at Bonnet Creek is a beautiful resort. I would recommend it to anyone. The staff is courteous and very helpful. The pool is amazing. There is nothing like floating around the lazy river. I can't wait until my son is old enough to enjoy it. The pool bar makes amazing drinks. It is an overall great place to stay and get away from the hustle of every day life.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: dberni2000
Reviews.Content: We had a thoroughly enjoyable stay. Food and amenities were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “When can we come back?”
Reviews.Author: RyanJSather
Reviews.Content: We had heard many stories (mostly horror) of coming home from a Disney vacation and being in need of another vacation because of physical exhaustion. Well, I can share from personal experience that a 10 day vacation to Disney has left us refreshed, rested and excited to go back. And we are quite sure the reason for this is the Hilton Bonnet Creek and the amazing staff at the facility! To say I am a "picky" traveler would be an understatement. For me there are a few things that make or break a vacation and to be honest Hilton Bonnet Creek surpassed our every expectation in every way possible!!! *Clean: amazingly clean room, bathroom, facility overall, we were amazingly impressed and for me this is the #1 thing I care about...is a clean hotel and the hotel staff, housekeeping, restaurant folks, etc...kept the facility immaculate *Friendly: the restaurant staff new our names and our kids, they new what type of drinks we wanted as we came for breakfast and always had a YES WE SURE COULD DO THAT attitude *Value: the breakfast was amazing and very worthwhile, the dinners were also great! the best part though is kids eat free and this was a huge value! *Relaxing: the entire hotel had a "relax and let us take care of it attitude" and we were NEVER disappointed at the service and quality of whatever it was we were doing or asking for *Shuttles to DW: the shuttles were awesome, our young boys loved the movies they could watch and the service was great and dependable to all the parks! All in all I would highly recommend this hotel. We are already hoping to book and go back again in February. There is literally not one bad thing we can say about Hilton Bonnet Creek. If you are looking for a place to go that allows you to visit disney world AND still RELAX and unwind look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Great alternative if you don't want to pay for Disney Resort Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MLQuock
Reviews.Content: This is a great alternative to paying a high price to stay at an official Disney resort. PROS: POOL - with a lazy river, pool slide (for kids and adults!) and a pool bar + dining, we didn't want to leave! the pool size is pretty massive as far as hotel pools go...lots of chairs and plenty of umbrellas for shade. The water temp is not to warm, not too cold. Also had two jacuzzis but it was too warm for anyone to use. great place to relax and unwind before/after visiting the parks SERVICE - everyone was great and helpful. When you call the front desk, they address you by name. The bartending staff inside and outside were great - the drinks were nothing to complain about! ELEVATORS - these are some of the faster elevators I have ever experienced! If you are impatient, you will love these ROOMS - very clean; programmable thermostat; spacious bathroom SHUTTLE - free shuttle to the main Disney Parks, lots of pickup times (mostly) - nice big clean bus with A/C and TV screens PRICE - great value - got a package deal through Costco Travel for hotel + park tickets - MUCH cheaper than staying at a Disney resort AMENITIES- free wi-fi in the public areas (lobby bar is nice place to hang out with a laptop); nice on-site restaurant for hot breakfast buffet, similarly priced as the other hotel breakfasts in the area; nice fitness center and jogging path around the property (Hilton + Waldorf complex) CONS: SHUTTLE - no shuttle to the Disney Water Parks or Boardwalk; shuttle times for Downtown Disney were fewer (maybe there are more in the peak season?); there's generally only one shuttle, so if you are going to Hollywood Studios, you have to ride along and make the dropoff/pickups at Epcot and Magic Kingdown first; this adds at least an extra half hour to 45 min to your travel time - same goes for the return trip. ROOM LOCATION - the corridors are a bit long so if you like your room closer to the elevator, make sure to ask for it when you check in CABS - the cabs on-site are the livery cabs, so they always charge more than the yellow cabs you can catch coming back from the park

Reviews.Title: “Staffs are very accommodating and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Lyn123NewJersey
Reviews.Content: Great kids pool, good food ( brunch), Staffs are very accommodating and nice.

Reviews.Title: “The Best!”
Reviews.Author: chicitylady
Reviews.Content: Love the service at this hotel. Chelsea was the best hostess ever and remembered me each time I saw her which made me feel at home! Everyone went above and beyond. My work had a conference here and I will recommend coming back. Also Kia was a great manager who went out of his way to make sure we were taken care of!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel on Disney Property”
Reviews.Author: TampaBayBucs99
Reviews.Content: My family and 3 other families spent the weekend here so that our kids could swim in the pool for a few days also to play some golf. This is our 4th or 5th time staying here and we have never had a bad experience. The hotel is located right by Epcot so it is a short ride to any of the Disney parks. All of the staff we have ever dealt with there have been especially friendly and welcoming. During our past visit Krystal at the front desk went out of her way to accommodate us with the type of rooms that we had requested. She did it with a smile on her face the entire time, even as my two little boys were repeatedly asking how long until they could go to the pool. I live in Orlando and always recommend this hotel to friends who are coming to Disney for vacations. I feel that it is a better value as well as a nicer, cleaner hotel than some of the Disney resorts. Also, the food options at the hotel are of better quality and more reasonably priced than the Disney hotels I have stayed in. (Kids eat free at the hotel restaurant!) Lastly, the pool with the lazy river and water slide at the hotel is great for children.

Reviews.Title: “Treated Like Royalty - Anticipated Every Needs - 5 Star Service”
Reviews.Author: RGD3
Reviews.Content: This was the best family (me, wife, son 8 and daughter 5) vacation we have ever taken - from the moment you walk in the door the staff let you know that you are #1 and that carries throughout the stay. No question is too small and you are never rushed. They know who you are and remember your name. Kids continue to talk about it and rave about it to anyone that will listen. Bonnet Creek is now going to be an annual event for the family. I highly recommend it without any hesitation. They make things easy, they make things fun, they keep things safe and they make it about you.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and grounds. Came home with Bed Bug bites”
Reviews.Author: angelahortega
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at the Bonnet Creek Inn. Midweek I noticed I had some bites and thought that they were mosquito bites, unfortuanatly after returning home I was still itching and looked to the web, which shows that these were bed bug bites. We had 2 beds and all of us were bit.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad not great”
Reviews.Author: needavacation03
Reviews.Content: Overall this Hilton is ok at best. I have stayed as various different hotels and this was just ok. The staff were not too friendly (except at harvest bistro) just think they are too young and or too new. Would def not return here as I think there are far better options in the area.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in the hell that is Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: superwrong
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton for a week over Easter 2011. The reception area is large and bright and the overall feel of the hotel reminded me of a Vegas style accommodation - perhaps it's because of the large conference wing attached to the hotel. Our room was nice, with a lovely view over the pool and golf course. Maid service wasn't as good as I've experienced in other 4/5 star hotels - whilst the room was left clean, I got the impression they just 'tickled' round and there were no nice touches like the folding of night wear or tidying of shoes that you usually get. We ate breakfast in the buffet restaurant some days and it was lovely - huge choice and lots of it! It did come to about $60 per day for 2 of us though, so can soon add up if you go everyday. An alternative is the coffee bar just off reception where you can buy very tasty pastries and coffee for about $15 for 2 people. The pool area is gorgeous with a nice lazy river. Inflatables for the lazy river are $5 per day. Pool staff are on hand to serve drinks and snacks from the poolside bar area. Each evening at 8 they show a 'dive in' movie - usually a Disney and it's a lovely touch. You definitely need a car if you stay here and valet parking is $20 per day or self park $13. Bring your own water etc for poolside as hotel prices were high $4 for small bottle of water. We didn't like Orlando itself, and were so pleased we chose this hotel as it really did feel like an oasis. I'd definitely stay there again if we returned. Should also mention shuttle buses to Disney - very frequent and run from early morning until late.

Reviews.Title: “Institutional treatment, decor, food. What a dissapointment.”
Reviews.Author: pfirishme
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a week in April with family, expecting to relax and rejuvinate. I've stayed at a lot of places and have pretty good experience to compare to for a 300-400 a night hotel. Oh my god - from the minute you walk in there you know you are 1 animal in their very large, day after day, cattle drive. The front desk has lots of people...but you can tell they are burnt out from problems. They think nothing of punting promises. If you call down with a request for help, they take it, hang up, then punt and run. You end up sitting there waiting for something only to find out the ball was dropped. Forget getting your packages delivered. Forget seeing your room service arrive right. If the place is full, many of the TVs can't work due to lack of bandwidth to handle the load. The food service - several restaurants with skimpy menus lacking fresh ingredients. No fruit plate for example. Seriously....doesnt one expect something healthy and well done in this type of place? After one day....you're thinking "and I have to do a week of this?" The pool is nice but not spectacular....and they close it down to rent out to parties. So you might not even get to use it in the evening after a long day at the parks. There is no "Disney" view in any room of the actual castle...only distant fireworks and a view that points toward Disney -- where you're looking at some sort of bowling pin type structures at one of the Disney annexes. Also the walls are thin....so again, if the place if full, you will hear all the party goers coming back to play late at night. Out in front of the hotel are a line of coaches to take you anywhere. Downtown Orlando for example...65.00. Take a regular cab back....40.00. I have stayed at "in Disney" resorts before and frankly, they are better deal. If you expect a superior operation, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good Disney Area Resort Hotel”
Reviews.Author: daytonaeagle
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Bonnet Creek is relatively new, both the Waldorf and Hitlon opened approximately 2 years ago so it still has that "new" feel to it. We stayed in a Disney View Room, with the Breakfast package be advised though the view is really of the Pop Century Resort, Disney's Hollywood Studios and if you stretch your neck enough and are in the right room you can JUST make out EPCOT. I think advertising Disney View is a little misleading, because while you are technically looking "at" Disney property - I doubt it's what most people would be expecting. My version of Disney view is like the Swan or Dolphin resorts. All that said, the lazy river pool is great for the kids. It has a zero depth section and then a river section that runs in a loop with a current that will carry you around in about 5 minutes or so. The breakfast package was worth it, we were with two young children and kids eat free for breakfast and dinner at the hotel. The breakfast is a pretty good buffet with just about anything you could want. Dining service was "OK", it seemed like the servers just take for granted you are getting the buffet so they don't put alot of effort into it. Bell Stand staff was just ok, not terribly attentive to your needs as a guest more on keeping traffic flowing in front of the entrance. No resort fee here but parking is $13/day but it is in an enclosed garage. As with most resorts, hotel pool drinks or food are a step away from highway robbery.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel; Caters More Toward Convention Attendees than Families Going to Disney”
Reviews.Author: sparklynails
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed 8 nights at a rate of $95 from Lastminute Travel. I've heard of others getting rates of $80, but I was happy to get the $95 (plus the $13 for parking). I wouldn't pay over $150 for a room here, but I would go back for the same price. Even though they are in the Disney area, you don't get the perks, like free parking at the parks or Extra Magic Hours. The room was your typical hotel room and very clean. Sheets were changed often, if not everyday, and carpets were swept daily. You don't get that at every hotel, anymore, especially not the Disney hotels. One day, housekeeping didn't clean until about 9 p.m., after our third request for cleaning, but the other days were normal. The pool is great! The lazy river is nice, and there were dive-in movies every night for spring break. Busses are decked out with movie screens and comfy seats, if you have the time to take them. Dinner at Harvest Bistro was not very tasty, but the waiter was entertaining and made napkin sculptures. The hotel staff in general were very nice, especially one of the ladies at the coffee shop. One thing that really annoyed me as not being very family-friendly was that smokers were everywhere. There is a nice deck outside of the lobby, but it's overrun with smokers. No place is available to have your coffee and danish outside in the morning without sitting in a smoking area. Also, be careful with your kids in the parking lot, especially in the moring. Workers and meeting attendees were driving dangerously and far too fast, mostly around shift changes. All in all, it's a nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: tricky182
Reviews.Content: Overall I have to say the hotel is good and if you are visiting Orlando I would recommend it. It is well laid out, clean, spacious, and the staff are great. The kids loved the pool and the views from our room were impressive. It is on the door step of Disney (Epcott etc) so if you are going to those parks it is ideal. My family chose the Universal parks and it still only took 20 minutes to drive there. On the downside the wardrobe space in a room which has two double beds really is not enough. It is just one small wardrobe which for a family of 4 on a 10 night stay is tight. I really did not enjoy the breakfast buffet at all - but in fairness I did not much enjoy the food in the States anywhere so maybe that can be put down to my taste. Like one of the other reports noted there must be a problem with the drauinage as our toilet backed up. The problem was sorted very quickly by the staff though. Oh and the pay per view tv service had to be fixed as well. i wa stold there are not enough feeds for the whole hotel so some rooms dont get a proper servce, but they remedy quickly when asked. The hotel is linked to the Waldorf and I recommend you stop by there especially if you dont have kids. it looked to have a nicer pool and pool side but was not as children orientated. We also ate at the Bull and bear at the Waldorf which was about the best meal we had on the trip. However even there my wife made enquiries about the crab they were serving. She asked what type of crab they used only to be told it was tinned crab - not a great thing to hear when the plate is being sold at $58! If you cant get fresh crab for $58 what hope is there? Also food and service at the Hiltons pool side beech Bar is not bad at all. My wife assures me the spa is excellent if that is of interest to you. Little things like over priced wifi and parking are an irritation but hey you know that when you book the place. Like I said the staff are really very good and if you are going to Orlando you should consider this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't hesitate. just book this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: everyonesmile
Reviews.Content: Just back from an amazing two week stay at the Hilton Bonnet Creek. The hotel is fabulous. The rooms are large and very clean. Request a Disney View at check in. we were on the eleventh floor and looked out over the pool and golf course with Disney in the distance. We could see the Tower of Terror and Mickeys Hat at Hollywood Studios and the the big Epcot Ball was over to the right. The fireworks could be seen at night. Ask for a discount on the parking if you are staying for a while. They charged us a rate of $10 a day instead of the $14. My husband also had a Hilton gold card which expired a couple of months ago, yet we were still treated like gold card members and were given free breakfast at the Harvest Bistro for the duration of our stay. Saving us over $500 dollars on breakfast! Always worth a try! The pool area was amazing, the kids loved it. Late night movies in the pool were fun. Never had a problem finding a sunbed even when it was busy. The buses to disney were on time but we found them slow. Fine for the Magic Kingdom which was the first stop but it took over an hour to get to Hollywood Studios. We took the car next time and were there in less than 10 mins. I'd rather pay $15 dollars to park than waste an hour sat on a bus. We had a problem with the toilet backing up the first day and again in the second week, each time it was sorted within half hour. Excellent service. Take a walk over to the Waldorf just to be even more wowed! A fantastic stay. I wouldn't hesitate to go back tomorrow : )

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort at WDW”
Reviews.Author: e2ckidney
Reviews.Content: Just came back from weekend stay at the Hilton Bonnet Creek. The resort is new, clean, bright, and perfect for families. My wife and I were impressed by the hotel. Our room was spacious and the staff was friendly and helpful. The pool complex is large, well laid out, and with plenty of lounge chairs. Zero entry pool, lazy river, several spas ... our daughter had a blast. Food is average only, but would definitely recommend and plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Simply put, outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: 34Meeechigan
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check-out, I thoroughly enjoyed this place. The parking garage will cost you, but it's one of the nicest and most secure garages I've seen. I enjoyed everything I ate, even if a few prices were high. The restaurant service was spot-on. The lazy river pool was very relaxing and there was something for everyone there. The kids, adults, solo travelers, and families all seemed to have a wonderful time. The room was plush, quiet, and very much up-to-date. I don't watch TV much anymore but the TVs were perfect for the room and they have one of the best LodgeNet systems I've seen (parental controls and all). The fitness center had just about everything a traveler could want. In case it doesn't have what you want, it'll be easy to adapt your routine anyway. Overall, my favorite hotel stay this year! Thank you, Hilton Bonnet Creek, for such a relaxing time!!!

Reviews.Title: “Yes, Yes, Yes, Yes!!”
Reviews.Author: whiteshadow
Reviews.Content: It's not surprising that this hotel is rated soooo high for Orlando hotels. Normally when one thinks of Orlando hotels the thought is of Disney properties. Yes, there is something to be said for Disney ( both good and, sorry, bad ), but when considering Orlando hotels please, please, take a look at the Hilton Bonnet Creek for your next stay. Our trip included my wife and I, our son and daughter-in-law ( both in their 30's ) and our 4 grandchildren ages 8, 6, 5 and 3. A wide spectrum of ages and let it be known we all graded the Hilton Bonnett Creek with an A plus. The Hilton is a very large hotel but from every person on the staff you are treated as an important guest.. Smiles everywhere. Ask anything of the staff and you are met with a quick "yes." The hotel is spotless; after all, it is less than a year old so there is no wear and tear, but it is kept very clean. Rooms are fresh and they are kept that way. Rooms with a Disney view give the kids a great view of the wonderful pool complex with the lazy river and a distant view of Hollywood Studios and corner views of Epcot where at 9:00 in the evening one can see the Epcot fireworks in the sky. By all means, get in the pool after a busy Disney day. The lazy river with evening movies on a large screen is a treat for the children. Well, yes, the hotel does charge $5.00 to rent an intertube but it's $$$$ well spent.The hotel's bus is very specific on departure and pick-up times both to and from Disney parks. Usually every half-hour. The bus is 1st class, and movies for the kids. No need to pay the $14.00 per day for parking at Disney lots...save the $$$ for food. For hotel food the Bistro's food was good; the breakfasts were excellent. Earlier I mentioned the special service but I want to give a 5 star to Amber in guest relations who exhibited spectacular assistance. Also, the young man, Kyle, who assisted us with baggage both at arrival and on departure was "real" if you know what I mean. No phoney smiles...just a pleasure to deal with!! You can get your "fill" of Disney between 9 and 5 ( or later ), but if you are looking for a wonderful and restful respite at the end of the day then take a look at the Hilton Bonnet Creek.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with kids!”
Reviews.Author: ah8898
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in March with our six year old son. He loved the pool area with the lazy river and waterslide so much we could barely get him to leave and go to the parks! All of the employees were great and very helpful. My husband is a diamond member with Hilton and we got a 1 category upgrade to a Disney view. In other Hiltons we always get a suite. I'm not sure if this was because it was high season or if it is always the case. The Disney shuttles were very convenient. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely property, wonderful service and a most relaxing pool makes Hilton Bonnet Creeek a great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: lucyvp1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a week's stay at the Hilton Bonnet Creek in Orlando, Florida. Over the past twenty five years, we have stayed in many Hilton properties across the US and in Europe. We have always received very good service at these properties, but the Hilton Bonnet Creek was exceptional. They must have a great managment team there and a customer-friendly mission statement, because every staff member that we encountered gave the impression that they truly liked their jobs and that they were pleased to be working at the resort. We were treated with friendliness and concern from the greeting we received from the valet staff and the front desk representative to the staff at the pool ,in the retaurants and the housekeeping staff who took care of us during our stay. The property is well maintained with interesting decorative touches. The pool is amazing. It is a zero entry pool that is circled by a lazy river component. It was certainly the answer to de-stress two winter weary travellers from New York.Inner tubes and floats are available at a kiosk for those who want to float along the "river" There is a restaurant at the pool area,Beech,where the service was excellent. They also offer poolside wait service for drinks and lunch or snacks. The hotel is part of a complex that includes a convention center and a Waldorf Astoria property. All are connected by an outside walkway and an indoor extended lobby. The Waldorf Astoria has a golf course on the property. We look forward to a return stay next Februrary. We can't wait until then to relax at that great pool!

Reviews.Title: “Our whole family LOVED this hotel, including our 6 year old. It was very family friendly and Super NICE!!”
Reviews.Author: TodaysReviewForYou
Reviews.Content: You won't regret staying at this new hotel by Hilton. the location is awesome for a Disney vacation. Your in the middle of it all yet it's private too. I was wondering if I made a good choice to stay at this hotel or not, I didn't want my 6 year old to be bored (there are so mant Disney hotels that cater to kids). I decided with all the running we had planned in all the parks that it would be nice to have a hotel that was relaxing (with out kids and noise everywhere... ya know something for mom and dad too). My daughter LOVED it here and it was nice to relax after the chaos of the parks. They do kids movies by the pool every night and the pool is AWESOME. It was a nice family stay for sure!! The all you can eat breakfast buffet at Harvest Bistro in the morning was exceptional, so when you book it's worth every penny to upgrade to the breakfast option that way you get it for 1/2 price and kids under 12 get to eat for free!! The hotel sparkeled!! It was very clean!! My favorite moment was laying out by the pool in the hot flordia sun ... thinking I was about to die from the heat and loving every minuite of it, when just then I was offered a frozen towel =).... I mean really does it get better than that!! I also upgraded to an Epcot view room... there are no really good Epcot viewing rooms I later found out. I did get a GREAT viewing room of the pool!! I was VERY VERY happy with that!! I was told by the bell hop to always request an odd number room. Also at 9 p.m. if you go to the 16th floor on the odd number side to the end of the hallway facing Epcot you can see the Firework display for Illuminations!!

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel with some really good features.”
Reviews.Author: Ontario_Sun_lovers
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a six night stay at the Hilton. Two days were for a conference and we stayed on for a holiday. This is a very good hotel for a conference or for a family vacation but I would not recommend it for a couples trip. The rooms are in great shape still because the hotel is still very new. The rooms are very clean but sometimes garbage and room service trays accumulate in the hallways. The bed is comfortable and the furnishings are what you would expect. The rooms are on the smaller side and the bathroom is quite small too. The shower is awful with no water pressure at all. Our room overlooked the front of the building and because we were on the third floor we could only see the top of the entrance and garage. Construction noise in this area started at 5am every morning. Don't bother with you laptop. Internet service is not included and is expensive. The pool area is very nice with a really great pool which everyone seemed to be enjoying and regular drink and food service. It is somewhat difficult to get a chair in the afternoon because of lots of chair saving and people not moving their towels when they have left for the day. I think the pool was the best feature for families. The service was good to excellent. The staff at the front desk were not very knowledgeable which was a problem when the concierge was not available. We were trying to get directions to a Disney golf course and they did not know where it was or how to find out. The concierge service was very good. Other staff were friendly and helpful. The restaurants are good but pricey. We had a lunch at the bistro which was not bad but the service was slow considering that it was late and the place was very quiet. We ate at the Italian restaurant on site twice out on the balcony and it was very good food with excellent service. We played at the Waldorf Astoria golf course on site twice and it is a really nice course. It is expensive in the morning so we played at 2pm both times and it was quite reasonable and a nice course. Parking is extra here at $13 a night. It is conveniently located and easy to find a parking spot. Do be careful walking in the parking garage or backing out your car. Staff moving cars for valet parking drive at extreme speeds in the garage and we had near misses on a number of occasions. It is extremely difficult to find this resort on a GPS. Ours is only six months old and the hotel did not show up at all. You need to locate a nearby cross road to find the hotel. It is not near anything so you will have to drive if you don't want to eat every meal in the hotel. Overall we had a very pleasant stay but it was very crowded with families and conferences at all times. If you don't mind crowds and are in Orlando to go to Disney and like a nice pool this is a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bonnet Creek is a hidden gem with fabulous WDW views!”
Reviews.Author: AACN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bonnet Creek over the weekend. It is in many ways a smaller version of Orlando's JW Marriott resort (JW shares a lazy river pool with Ritz-Carlton, Hilton shares a lazy river pool with Waldorf-Astoria). However, we had a much better experience at the Hilton. Unlike JW's, the lazy river pool at the Hilton also features a water slide, and my children absolutely loved having both to choose from. Besides, the Bonnet Creek location gives it what is arguably the most amazing view of Disney property in Orlando. From our Disney View Room we enjoy magnificent views of Hollywood Studios and Epcot, including both parks' nightly fireworks shows. Daytime views were equally stunning, and included the lazy river pool and adjacent golf course. The hotel is less than a year old and still smells of new in many years. Great bars (including one for families, featuring karaoke), good restaurants, and great menu choices in the pool area. Excellent value in Orlando, and a true hidden gem.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely, positively exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: mardebra
Reviews.Content: Visited Orlando to play golf and found the most wonderful course right on this property that we liked so much we played it 3 days in a row! Golf, pool, sun and cocktails rounded this out to be such a fantastic girls golf get-a-way! Of special interest is this little Beech Restaurant and its manager, Kin Lai! We couldn't wait to get back to the property to have our happy hour and appetizers at Beech- We really felt special and appreciated as guests and visitors to Orlando, so much, in fact that we are planning on returning next year and making this an annual destination! Thanks to everyone at Hilton Orlando Bonnett Creek , from the front desk to the many restaurants staff--- from a very appreciative Diamond Member and friends!!

Reviews.Title: “We experienced the most outstanding customer service during our stay!”
Reviews.Author: eyeglassgirl1
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Bonnet Creek and I can't say enough about the employees. Kin, the Beech's bar manager made my husband's birthday so much fun. He seems to finds joy in his work and making the vacation experience special for his customers. The front desk staff help us with a glitch in the reservations so that we did'nt have to change rooms. ( I think her name was Laetitia...she was great! ) Unfortunalty, we came down with the flu bug when we there and when we finally came out of our room for some solid food, Omar in the Harvest Bistro had the chef whip up some vegtable soup for us! WOW! It tasted like filet migon to us!!! Also, the room service staff was awesome and so concerned that we were okay! The pool area was great and we enjoyed the lazy river. I would highly recommend this place !!

Reviews.Title: “Good experience from beginning to end”
Reviews.Author: knockingon40
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from 4 days at this Hilton hotel. Was there for a convention. The hotel served us cont. breakfast, lunch and dinner, and one night we ate on our own at Harvest Bistro. Everything we ate was mouth watering delicious. From the sausage, egg and cheese croissant to the melt in your mouth filet mignon. The golf course was well maintained. The pool area, with its lazy river, its slides and multiple pool/jacuzzis, offered something for everyone. The hotel staff, all very helpful and pleasant. Good experience from beginning to end. Just a note for GPS users, the hotel is so new it would not pick up on my Garmin.

Reviews.Title: “Innovative and Fantastic Orlando Stay”
Reviews.Author: cabo23
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property last month. It is an incredible, gigantic, modern hotel next to the Waldorf-Astoria. We arrived Friday afternoon, and there were a ton of front desk clerks waiting to help us. The room was excellent; much better than the traditional cookie-cutter Hilton rooms. We had a Disney view, which had great views of Epcot, Hollywood Studios, the Pop Century Resort, Caribbean Beach Resort, and even the Contemporary Resort. We also had a view of the pool from our room. The pool was incredible! It featured the zero-entry style entrance and had some 4 hot tubs and a water slide. The pool complex is one of the greatest pluses this property has. We want to stay here another time in the summer just to experience the pool scene. The staff would also shape towels into different letters by the pool to spell words like "relax" and "unwind" which was pretty cool. The fitness center is also very large, much larger than the usual 1-treadmill, 1-elliptical, 1-stationary bike Hilton fitness centers. The hotel had 3-4 restaurants. The first was a lobby coffee/pastry shop which looked pretty good. The second was a lobby lounge/bar type area. It had a very nice bar and pretty good food; I liked the caesar salad. The third was a buffet style restaurant below the lobby which had a great selection. The final restaurant was an Italian style restaurant that looked very trendy and yummy, but we could not eat here. Plus, there's a ton of other restaurants at the Waldorf-Astoria. The transportation system at this property is mediocre; it's not the best in the WDW area. The bus transports you to all four Disney parks every half hour. The bus also picks up guests from the Waldorf-Astoria which was a bit annoying. Then, the bus would leave you at the TTC (if going to Magic Kingdom), so you had to take the monorail to arrive at the park. In other words, there was no direct entrance "on the other side of the lagoon". When we left, we were also pleasantly surprised by the hotel. The valet attendants had left us a note in the car thanking us for staying at the hotel; this was a completely unexpected thing that I really liked. Overall, this hotel is great. The lobby, rooms, food, and pool are the pluses to the hotel. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven On Earth”
Reviews.Author: FalynsDaddy
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this resort with our young daughter and friends and their young children. First off the resort is pristine. The staff was warm and friendly. The room was over looking the pool, the golf course and part of Disney. The pool was relaxing for people of all ages, including a lazy river, kiddy pool, and two adult pools. When we return to Orlando, I will stay at no other hotel. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a luxurios retreat.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: BeachMama96
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about this hotel. Our young children (6 & 3) enjoyed the pool/lazy river very much and the movies that were shown by the pool at night were a nice touch. It was very enjoyable to come back to the hotel at night and relax by the pool while watching a fun movie. I do think, however that the hotel could have done a better job of keeping the pool area tidy. There were alot of dirty towels and trash sitting next to empy seats during the day. However, the guest rooms were very clean and nice. We paid up for the Disney View which I don't really think was worth it. You can see the tiny speck of Mickey's Hat at Hollywood Studios in the distance and if you craned your neck, you could see the golf ball at Epcot. As for the restaurants, we had breakfast and one dinner at Harvest Bistro. The breakfast buffet was mediocre and it was pricey. The kids ate for free but that didn't really matter because our meals were so expensive. Food and drinks by the pool were equally pricey. My husband ordered a medium steak for dinner at Harvest Bistro and it was raw (not rare but raw). Taking the shuttle bus was okay. We found ourselves taking a cab a few times because return trips were less frequent. Also, on our way to Hollywood Studios, we had to stop off at Magic Kingdom then Animal Kingdom first which was a little tedious. I think this hotel is decent but I think for the same price, you could stay at the much nicer JW Marriott. We really don't mind paying up for something if we think it is worth it. This was just not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Almost too nice”
Reviews.Author: ryanpmoore24
Reviews.Content: I stayed here April 4-11 with my wife and 4 year old daughter. We usually stay at a Disney resort for vacation, but decided to branch out a bit. This hotel is VERY nice, almost too nice. At times you feel uncomfortable walking around the lobby in shorts and a t-shirt because everyone else is dressed to impress...either for a conference going on at the hotel or for dinner at one of the fancy restaurants. I can't comment on the food because we never ate at one of the restaurants. I just couldn't justify spending that much money on food. The parking at the hotel is very easy, but expensive - $13 a day. I suggest parking on level two nearest to the hotel. You'll have the least distance to walk. The pool is fantastic. My 4 year old daughter loved it. While she can swim a bit, she's still learning so it was nice that the pool doesn't get any deeper than 3 1/2 feet. The slide was a hit as she probably went down at least 173 times. The rooms were very nice and spacious. I'll be a little picky and say that the bathrooms were a little small, but overall no complaints. The view of the pool, golf course, and Disney was great. You can see Epcot, Hollywood Studios, and (sort of) the Animal Kingdom from the room if you get the Disney view. However, you won't be able to see the Magic Kingdom. One thing we did miss was the Disney atmosphere. Although, I know others have commented how they liked not being bombarded with the whole Disney vibe. If you are going for a Disney vacation, you may want to stay at a Disney resort instead. The shuttle is okay, but you'll have to walk pretty far to the Magic Kingdom as they drop you off in the parking lot and not right in front of the entrance. I read others complain about the location of the hotel, but I couldn't ask for anything better. If you have a car, it's less than 5 min. to downtown disney and less than 3 min. to the Boardwalk. Overall, this is an excellent hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Top notch Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jake9910962
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Bonnet Creek with my wife for two nights attending a business conference. The hotel was beautiful and we were amazed by it's size when we arrived. The Hilton is connected to the Waldorf Astoria by the convention center so we had access to the restaurants and shops at that hotel too. The room was above average in size and really clean. The housekeeping staff must take real pride in their jobs. Restaurant quality was top notch. We ate at the Beach pool bar and would return to the Hilton just because of the service we received there. Omar, Kyle, and Andy took great care of us. My wife loves watermelon and so we asked for a frozen drink with that type of flavor. The manager and mixologist, Daniel, came to the rescue, creating a wonderful fresh watermelon margarita for us. He also recommended the bloody Mary mojito for us the next day. Those team members made us feel like we owned the hotel. The pool itself has a lazy river which is nice and nightly movies poolside. The only complaint I had was that tubes for the pool cost $5 to rent for the day. Overall, the hotel was fabulous and I would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property and highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: UnoRory
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this property for our vacation in March and it was absolutely wonderful. The hotel is new, so with that very clean and up to date. It is located in the Disney area but set in a cul-de-sac away from the other hotels, which made it feel more secluded - in a good way. The pool area is beautiful and a great place to relax and it was nice to watch the fireworks from the windows that overlooked the Disney Parks. When we arrived it was dark so I was unable to take in the view, however, in the morning I opened the curtains to a beautiful day and a great view of the pool, golf course and Disney Parks. I look forward to going back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice near Disney or for some relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: COhotelcritic
Reviews.Content: Wonderful. Less than $200/ night for a SPOTLESS, quiet, elegant room. Plus a gigantic pool kids would die to play in, a great gym for adults, dining for ALL, shuttles to Disney, beautiful bar... what more could you want? The hotel is attached to the Waldorf, though you can eat over there but not use their pool. The grounds of both hotels are monsterous. The Hilton's lobby was an elegant sight to see. We only stayed a night, but we saw a huge movie screen by the pool & all the kids sitting on floaties loving life: it was cute. The Italian restaurant was yummy (just a tad overpriced) & the sweet shop was divine. Parking is pricey & very far if you do self: suggest valet. The room was so spacious and really, truly CLEAN. Ah... what a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ponder1
Reviews.Content: A wonderful stay @ the Hilton! Our room was great, beautiful view over pool and golf course. In the distance, Disney! Everything very clean throughout hotel. Pool was amazing - we all loved it - especially the lazy river. Our two boys never tired of going around the river or going down the waterslide. Great pool side service, food and cocktails very yummy. We watched a disney movie poolside one night which was really fun. Buffet had plenty of choices at breakfast & dinner, kids eat free. We will stay again when visiting Disney!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and relaxing hotel”
Reviews.Author: brgrits
Reviews.Content: I was at the Hilton Bonnet Creek for a business conference. The hotel was impeccably clean and beautifully decorated. The bed was incredibly comfortable and the room was spacious and relaxing. I especially enjoyed the comfy bathrobe in the room. I was able to use the exercise room on two mornings and it afforded me the opportunity to work out with very new machines, quite a variety, and watch the morning news at the same time. The conference facilities were very nice. Each room was spacious and the staff who took care of us were so friendly and prompt. THough I did not get a chance to try the pool due to business meetings, I did enjoy walking on the grounds. Also, to my surprise, the hotel connected with the Waldorf Astoria down a long hall, so you could explore other areas if you had time. The shuttle to Disney comes right outside the entrance and though I did not have a car, parking seemed very convenient to the hotel. All in all, this hotel is a great spot for families and business meetings.

Reviews.Title: “There's no place like... Hilton (at Bonnet Creek)”
Reviews.Author: ScoobySally
Reviews.Content: Amidst the land of Disney and all the magic it has to offer, this hotel is a place you'll really enjoy staying even if you don't go to Disney! The facility is magnificent. It's clean with very high standards (I even noticed a staff member checking for dust on the top edge of a painting on the wall), and fun. The pool is awesome either for laying out or the lazy river, but you can also take a nice walk on the wonderful boardwalk (which is across the creek from the golf course). It's really a place you can totally relax after a day at the park, or not leave at all! The rooms are big and comfortable. I've stayed at many places in Orlando - you really need to try this place at least once. Great meeting rooms too.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding... Great Relaxing Atmosphere, Great Views & Great Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: stoshdc085
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. Minutes away from the Disney fun. The property was very clean. The lazy river was a big hit with the adults and kids. Our room was on the 16th floor with an outstanding view of the lazy river, the golf course and the Disney parks - It was great to see the fireworks from the room. My daughter says the bed and pillows were comfortable and fluffy. Great breakfast buffet and great food service pool side. The hotel staff were on their game - any questions or issues were quickly addressed to our complete satisfaction! We try to get to the Orlando area once a year and we always try to stay somewhere we have never stayed before. We will be back to Orlando next year but I think we are going to stay at the Hilton Bonnet Creek to insure we are not let down at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “High standards travelers would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: ANJ50
Reviews.Content: Not a single complaint---helpful and courteous staff, preferences for room location had been noted and accommodated, room was very clean, comfortable and quiet, view was great and the price was very reasonable compared to Disney properties like The Boardwalk, where we have stayed in the past. Yet, we could be at The Boardwalk in less than 5 minutes (by car). We were meeting friends who do have a time share at The Boardwalk, but the parking lot attendants never asked for proof of that and we parked in that visitors lot each day, giving us easy access to all of Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular hotel with every amenity present”
Reviews.Author: caribbeansailin
Reviews.Content: My family decided to book the Hilton Bonnet Creek after viewing their website and reading a few reviews on here. I must say that this hotel is everything that it shows in the photos. The rooms were ample and were decorated very contemporary. The pool was amazing! The lazy river was a blast and my 11month old loved floating around which made it enjoyable in the pool. Tip: Bring your own float/tube, the hotel charges $5 day to rent. We went to downtown disney for dinner a few days and when we got tired of that we decided to try La Luce at the hotel. Boy were we disappointed we did not go sooner, the food is perfection! It was so good we went two nights in a row. Besides that our stay there was great and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome-only one complaint”
Reviews.Author: badge19
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely amazing - from the interior of the hotel to the beautiful outdoors. The lazy river was a great way to spend the entire day as my husband golfed next door at the Waldorf Astoria. My only complaint was having to rent the tubes for the lazy river. It seemed that everything had an additional cost to it and that is such ashame because it sure is a "turn off" The hotel is beautiful and would consider staying there again - the fitness centre is AMAZING - best we have seen in a long time

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Property”
Reviews.Author: funbug05
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel for either business or vacation. Attended a conference and stayed on the 5th floor overlooking the front entrance. The room was standard size with king bed which was very comfy. Bathroom upgraded with glass door shower and granite counter tops. Overall, very clean and very quiet. Large pool area (2 sections) that I didn't get a chance to use, but would be nice for a family. With the conference, we received breakfast and a welcome dinner. All were done very nicely and the food quality was excellent. There is a little coffee shop on site that has wonderful almond croissants. Only negatives would be no free wireless, which was surprising. The front desk folks were a bit slow and gave me keys that didn't work, so I had to return and have them updated. Conference room layout and naming a bit confusing. Lastly, there wasn't a tub, but that wasn't important to me.

Reviews.Title: “We looked at other places, chose this, and were VERY pleased”
Reviews.Author: Elijahman
Reviews.Content: Any of the reviews you read here are right. We read them to decide on where to stay in Orlando and thank you everyone who stayed before. We were originally going to stay at the Lake Beuna Visa Hilton but Hilton employee on the other end of the phone when we made the reservation dropped a few hints - that this would be nicer, cleaner, quieter, more modern - and she was right. We listened to her and had a great day, great night stay with our young kids. It's really absolutely gorgeous and the pool area was great, especially for northerners like us who were trapped in the cold all winter. Still close to everything without the crazy crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the Heart of Disney World”
Reviews.Author: Marvelous_Travelers
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Orlando Bonnet Creek is located very close to all of the attractions of Disney World. What sets the Hilton apart is that you get to enjoy the Magic Kingdom and all the other parks with their free shuttle, but when you get back to the hotel you can relax and enjoy the fact that the day is over too. They have a very refined and well decorated interior. The rooms are well appointed and included a small mini fridge that you can fill with your drinks and refreshments, not some ridiculous mini bar. The pool is fantastic. The lazy river is not to be missed. I could have floated around that all day. It offered beach towels and a full service cabanna with floats, sunglasses, and lotion in case you forgot anything. It also has a pool bar and grill and the food was well priced and delicious. We even had staff stop by to offer to clean our sunglasses and give us frozen grapes. The gym is state of the art with nice elipitical trainers, treadmills, and free ear buds to listen to the tvs on each trainer. The staff at the hotel couldn't have been more helpful and it was a pleasure. We found the deal for the hotel on Sniqueaway.com (a tripadvisor subsidiary I think), and couldn't have been more impressed. It made my Dad's birthday a real success. I think he and my mom liked staying there as much as going to Disney!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: lhakenson
Reviews.Content: We began our stay 3/13/2011 and departed 3/19/2011. What a wonderful hotel. We traveled with our 9 year old boy who found the pool and water slide to be the best part of his vacation. Beech restaurant was my wife and I's highlight. Omar and Andy were great and the manager Kin Lai was fantastic as well. I can't say enough great things about the place. Try the nachos with chicken and the chesseburger is great as well. The only downfall we encountered was the lobby bar and sitting outside. Service was less than desireable. Many times we would be passed up by the lobby bar staff or even encountered one sitting where no staff ventured outside to see if there were any patrons. If we sat inside the service was better however much slower and less personable than Beech's. I spoke to Kin about that and he said he would address it with the manager of the lobby bar so I would assume things have changed. Outside of that the hotel is clean, the staff is great, the location is wonderful and the kids will love it and so will the parents as it is not overrun with kids. Great job Hilton staff

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: wilson315
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a night when we came to Orlando for Braves spring training (along with my dad and brother, who had an adjoining double room). Overall, the hotel was a pleasant surprise--much nicer than I expected for a large hotel in a family destination. Rooms - the rooms weren't huge but were adequate and clean, and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom was kind of awkward. First, there was no bathtub, just a shower. This was fine for my husband and me, but I can imagine would be inconvenient for a family with young children who require a bathtub (we had a King room; perhaps there are bathtubs in the double rooms). Also, the shower door seemed to open the wrong way (i.e., the hinge was on the wrong side), which made it harder for 2 people to be in the bathroom at once. Also, the A/C was noisier than we would have expected for a relatively new hotel...but at least worked well. Location - the location was great for us, only a 5-minute drive from ESPN Wide World of Sports. It was also very close to Downtown Disney. We didn't visit any of the parks from this hotel, so I'm not sure how convenient the hotel is to Epcot, Magic Kingdom, etc. Pool - the pool area was nicer than I expected. The pool itself is huge, and the beach entry, lazy river and water slide are nice touches. If you want an inner tube, they're $5 to rent. There is towel service, and attendants were readily available to help with chairs, bring food/drink and clean up towels. There was also a DJ, so the pool area was pretty noisy. Restaurants - we didn't eat at any of the main restaurants but did pick up breakfast at Muse, which is basically a bakery/coffee shop and an easy place to pick up a fast breakfast. Cost - we used Hilton Rewards points for our stay--I think otherwise the room rates were about $280 per night, which is probably a bit high for this hotel (though maybe the high rates were due to spring break). Misc. - Check-in and valet staff were consistently very helpful. Parking was $13 per night, plus tax, and included in-and-out with your room key. The parking lot is shared with the Waldorf on the other side of the property, so it's huge (write down where you parked--the spaces are numbered) and a bit of a hike from hotel check-in (so drop off your stuff at the front door before parking if you have a lot of luggage). They also offer valet, but I think it's $20 for overnight.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: NB099
Reviews.Content: I'm Hilton Diamond. So I'm comparing this to over 4 months of stays in various Hiltons each year. This is my first time at this property. 16 pieces of marketing literature are scattered throughout the room. The iron is broken and leaks. Ironing board is cheap and leaves marks on clothes due to thin cover. Iron deposits white flakes on clothes. 2 of the 4 lights in the bathroom don't work. Water is $5 a bottle (Embassy Suites, Hampton Inn, Homewood Suites give me free water). Internet speed: ping-132ms, Download - 2.47Mps, Upload .69Mbps. Clock can't been seen in the dark - not backlit, requiring lamp to be turned on to tell the time. Room itself is on the small side with only one desk chair, one chair for guests and a miniature table covered in marketing material. Lampshade is dented and dirty. Front desk staff are slightly apathetic, not bad, not great, just average. "Disney view" room is a joke. Sure, Disney is to the NorthWest of the hotel. Somewhere. The room has a nice view of a golf course and trees. But I wouldn't call it a "view" of Disney. Hotel parking is $13 a day. This is suburban Florida. Why is there any parking charge at all? The parking spots are about the smallest I've ever seen, except at the Embassy Suites Vanderbilt. On the plus side, the parking is in a garage, nice when it rains every afternoon here in the summer. This place was next to impossible to find. It is called "Bonnet Creek" but is NOT on Bonnet Creek Parkway. There's a nice LG tv in the room. But cable tv was pixelated and dropping out last night. Some of the channels could not be watched at all. This morning, I've seen fewer problems. The pool area here is pretty nice. But buy your own tubes at Wal-Mart before coming here. They have a small "lazy river" at the pool. Overall, all hotels have issues. I'd call this an above-average average Hilton. I've stayed in far worse. I've stayed in better. It's very convenient if you're going to Disney. There are LOTS of hotels in Orlando and lots on the Disney property. Staying here just isn't the same experience as a true Disney-owned hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay but pricey and hard to find”
Reviews.Author: jowelsh
Reviews.Content: I booked this room at a discount, which was a great value (more than 50% off). I'm not sure I would pay the going rate for staying here. Breakfast, parking, wifi are all extra and pricey (ie, $19 for breakfast buffet - though delicious and very extensive, this is more than I usually pay for lunch). Location is good if you want to be out of the way and surrounded by nature (although this "Bonnet Creek Resort" appears to be growing, with an existing Wyndham and other hotels & timeshares under construction here - it is not just the Hilton and Waldorf). Caution: location is completely wrong on GPS and Google Maps as the address is not on Bonnet Creek Pkwy but on a street called Chelonia off Buena Vista Drive. It is very close to the Disney Animal Kingdom and Downtown Disney. This also seems to be a site for conferences, as there were several going on during our two day stay. Pool and outdoor areas all beautiful, although the weather turned rainy/cool last week so we did not use any of the outdoor facilities other than walk around the short paved trail surrounding the two hotels. For those that like power showers, note that this was one of the "rain" type showerheads with very little pressure.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel Option near Disney”
Reviews.Author: XCR1961
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Orlando October 22-25, 2010. Check-in was prompt. The room was a nice size, modern, and the bed quite comfortable. The pool was great ... no problem getting chairs in the morning. The hotel and grounds are well maintained. Parking is in the parking deck adjoining the hotel. The cafe near the lobby is has a selection of fresh muffins, croissants, and coffee/cappuccino was good. The free shuttle service to Disney is reliable and the drivers are courteous. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Can not fault this hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonMurphy123
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel with clean, spacious rooms. Excellent staff who were extremely courteous and attentive. Food was excellent in particular the main restaurant, La Luce. Would recommend hiring a car if staying at the hotel as taxis to I-drive are c.$40 each way, that said I think a car is needed regardless of where you stay.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I've stayed at in a looong time!”
Reviews.Author: ranndella
Reviews.Content: We came to Orlando for our honeymoon and loved the location and price of this hotel. It was recommended by my dad who had stayed here for a conference and I must say we are happy we listened to him! The hotel was clean, comfortable, quiet, and the staff was great. We were checked in quickly, bellhop quickly brought our stuff, and champagne, chocolate covered strawberries, and a cupcake were brought to our room to celebrate our honeymoon at no cost with a handwritten note from the woman who checked us in when we first checked in! Very nice touch. She also upgraded us to a nicer view and insured we had a quiet view. We extended our stay at this hotel based on the great service, location, and comfort. They also have an hourly shuttle to the Disney Parks, which was a huge savings from paying gas and parking every day! Very happy and will definitely stay here every time we come back to Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staff, fun atmosphere, very clean!”
Reviews.Author: Lcoleman2011
