Reviews.Content: We chose the Hilton Bonnet Creek Orlando because of its proximaty to the Disney Half Marathon race we were running in. I can't say enough good things about our stay!! The staff was so professional, nice, and FUN, even when we went down to breakfast at 3:00a.m. Yes, they provided an entire setup of bagels, protein bars, etc -- everything we needed. The night before we had a fantastic carb dinner especially designed for runners. And upon our return after the race, a red carpet ballooned-filled reception celebrated our accomplishments. They simply didn't miss a detail (like getting tiaras when we checked in) and certainly made us feel like princesses :). We look forward to staying here next year!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel to get away from the Disney theme”
Reviews.Author: Ganfina
Reviews.Content: We have stayed for 3 days on the way to Miami and I'm glad that we booked it. Hilton and Waldorf Astoria are gems hidden in the Disney resort area. Our room was spacious and cosy, and we loved the complimentary internet. This is a venue suitable for conferences and weekend /week getaways with option for golfing or just getting in shape with the 24 hour gym. Loved the swimming pools.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Disney World Vacation”
Reviews.Author: rhawkinsSA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 2/26 - 3/1 and we had a great time. My husband had a business meeting at the hotel and we made it into a family trip(2 kids - 11 & 7 yr old). Very modern and clean hotel, great food at restaurants, convenient shuttle to Disney World, nice lounge/bar area in lobby, and great pool(kids loved the lazy river around the pool!) Service was great - staff is extremely friendly. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Really Quite Nice, Despite Exterior”
Reviews.Author: MTommy
Reviews.Content: Looking at it from the outside, you'd think it was built in the 70's. But the inside is great and staff very helpful. Resort style trapping, so not for a traditional budget traveler. Very pleased with the stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: FromTheD---MI
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the pool area and the close location to Disney

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Let The Bland Exterior Fool You!”
Reviews.Author: WWJD?LOVE
Reviews.Content: Though the outside of this Hilton Hotel looks like a very plain building~ perhaps even like a "Hospital", the inside is absolutely BEAUTIFUL! When I arrived, I was underwhelmed with the "OUTSIDE", HOWEVER, once in the Foyer~ WOW!!! Everyone who works at the hotel is very accomadating and super customer service. The rooms are comfortable and decorated nicely. The pool area is always clean and refreshing! My little girls LOVED the Lazy river! The Slide at the Pool was a lot of fun as well. The Harvest restaurant served delicious food and Breakfast Buffet was outstanding! It is a great value especially because children eat free breakfast and dinner! The BEST waiter is Bozidar (Rocky)!!!!! Loved him! We had a gorgeous pool view room and had a view of Disney fireworks at 9:00 every evening as well! AWESOME! LORD willing we will go back next year! Loved every minute of our stay! The ONLY negative is that you cannot get FREE wi-fi in your room, although it is available for FREE in the Lobby. :o) Parking is not free, however, if a *Hilton Honors Member*, they MAY comp you free parking! :o) Not guarenteed, but it doesn't hurt to ask! :o)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !!!”
Reviews.Author: teachertim
Reviews.Content: Amazing pool, great rooms, large and super clean. Fantastic staff, super breakfast - could not want for more !!! Don't think twice - book now !

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel. Everything ran smoothly. Pool area is very nice.”
Reviews.Author: masuret_baloun
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful 5-day stay here. Came in for a conference, but brought my 3 yr.old daughter along for some fun with her Florida based grandparents. The hotel was very nice. Beds are very comfortable, rooms clean and stylish. Everyone working there is helpful and friendly. I especially want to call out all the folks working at the front door (valet, bell hop...) They work hard and were very easy to engage to help with unloading luggage or directions - -whatever! There is a charge for parking which I thought wasn't justified, but the garage is well lit, clean and has ample space. The pool area is really fun. It is a large area so you can be close to the action or tucked away somewhere quiet. Food served by the pool is very good, try it.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Town”
Reviews.Author: pedroschmidt
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel, perfect in every way, from service to room size and quality. I found out about this hotel here in Trip Advisor, and read all of its reviews and could not believe that there were no complaints about it. But it is true, there is not a thing to complain here. No more Disney Resorts for me, especially because the shuttle service from the hotel is even better than the one at Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: inq1974
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at the Hilton Bonnet Creek this weekend. The staff was super friendly and the accommodations great. We had breakfast at their coffee shop on Saturday and can say that it is far better than your usual Starbucks. Please, try their cinnamon rolls if you stop there. In the evening, we had dinner at the Bull & Bear Restaurant (right next door at the Waldorf Astoria. Both hotels are connected). I can't even describe how good the food was. You have to experience it yourself. After we checked out on Sunday, we decided not to leave right away and had lunch poolside while the kids were in the pool. Everything we had there was great too. And the kids really enjoyed the lazy river and the big slides in the pool. We will definitely go back, probably next fall. Another good thing about this hotel is that it is really close to Downtown Disney, while at the same time secluded from the chaos. Best experience we've ever had in Orlando. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Great sanctuary close to Disney attractions”
Reviews.Author: DCbound56
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel that shares the site with the adjacent Waldorf-Astoria. Nicely appointed room with a beautiful view of the golf course. There was an initial hiccup when we were checked into a room still being cleaned by housekeeping. Staff was very apologetic and quickly remedied the situation - even included some free drink passes for the on-site restaurants. Excellent late night dinner at the hotel's Italian restaurant - first rate. Close to all the Disney action, yet feels worlds apart once at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel and grounds”
Reviews.Author: teddypip78
Reviews.Content: only stayed one night before returning home..wish it was more.Loved the swimming and lazy river. great location and room was fab

Reviews.Title: “IMPECCABLE!!!!!!! Newest and Best in Orlando...Clean and Serivce is Top Tier!!”
Reviews.Author: TXFinAdvisor
Reviews.Content: What can you say, this hotel and the hotel grounds are breathtaking. Clean, high quality everything, brand new, very classy and stylish, awesome bars and places to eat, located close to everything, including other places to eat, theme parks are right there, the staff is A+++++ 4 diamond quality, awesome pool!!!!!!!heated pool and lazy river year round. it's 57 degrees right now and the pool feels like a hot tub. Free hotel shuttle to teh theme parks. Beautiful grounds, high quality phones and tv's, very comfortable bed, huge walk in shower, roomy bathroom, great views, (request 18th floor/Disney view!) Sistered with the Waldorf for even more placed to eat, bars and a world class spa, and great golf!!!! Valet parking is a little pricey. 20 bucks per day, but to self park it's still 13 bucks per day. Great got business and family. Kids would love the pool and activities! Great fitness center, Great Business center, Great ballroom and exhibition areas. My wife joined me and she loved it!!!! We will be bringing the kids back and for sure staying here again!!!!!. If you like world class but without the world class prices, you can't miss out on this place. Hidden Jewel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Jewel- Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: 155019Nikki
Reviews.Content: I was in Orlando for a conference which was held in this great and newly built hotel. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. the pool was quite enjoyable. The bar, restaurant and convenience shop met all my needs. Shuttle to the resort was effortlessly accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Really excellent Hotel. Great for kids.”
Reviews.Author: DaSaint
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three days with my family. The rooms are comfortable and clean. The pool is fantastic. The bathroom was just average in size and the meals were above average. The decor and facilities make it very worthwhile. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at a beautiful resort hotel”
Reviews.Author: PrincessFiona61
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a stay at the Hilton Orlando Bonnet Creek Hotel. We found the hotel to be above our expectations and would very likely stay again when returning to the Orlando area. We traveled to Orlando to compete in the Walt Disneyworld Marathon and a half challenge and after the races were done stayed on for another couple of weeks to have our annual vacation. The hotel went all out to support all who were there to compete in the races on January 8&9. Each race day morning we were greeted downstairs by various staff members cheering us on.... doesn't sound like much but seeing as it was around 3:30 in the a.m...... yes it was a big deal. The hotel also provided snacks in the lobby both mornings before the shuttle buses arrived to transport us to the race start. When returning to the hotel a podium was set up so you could have your picture taken with all the bling hanging around your neck. The hotel staff were very polite and helpful at all times. The shuttle worked fine getting to and from the various parks at Disneyworld. I would not hesitate twice about booking this hotel again the next time we return to Orlando. Keep up the good work.....

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: freshair47724
Reviews.Content: This hotel made our trip. If you're looking to enjoy Orlando and Disney, and be able to return to a hotel that is peaceful and quiet, and NOT being over run with kids then stay here. My husband and I loved how clean, quiet and upscale this hotel was. During the week there was definitely a lot of coporate people milling around and enjoying the bar at night, but come Friday it was pretty empty. The grounds, golf course,and pool area were extremely nice and well maintained. Also, there was a bus that went to all the parks every half hour. We had no problem using this as our mode of transportation we just had to plan our day and night out carefully, and it worked out really well. Great location and we'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We're Picky and This Hotel is Great!”
Reviews.Author: Snowbreak31
Reviews.Content: We're a picky family so we don't give out "A's" easily - Hilton Bonnet Creek gets an A! The pool is fantastic for a family (2 kids ages 10 and 7) as well as mom and dad. The rooms are clean and nicely appointed. Food and service excellent. Bus service to Disney parks was good. We'll be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Just one word : Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: SunseekersMN
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 days for a conference. We used both the Hilton and the Waldorf-Astoria together with the Convention center in between the two hotels. Obviously money was no object when building this complex. Everything is beautiful inside and out. The quality of the food is amazing. The staff is very friendly and efficient. Just 5 minutes away from Disney. It will cost you about $60 for the cab ride from the Airport. You will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Remote, poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: HotwaterFrog
Reviews.Content: This new hotel is beautiful to look at and it has an awesome pool complex. The hotel is HUGE and you will find yourself walking long distances. After walking all day in the parks I did not enjopy the hike to the one set of elevator banks and then an even longer hike to the room. Yes the rooms were beautiful and the beds comfortable and clean. They are obviously having a problem with the parking garage. Vehicles are stuck there waiting clearance often. When you go to the front desk they act like this is a surprise and offer to reswipe your key. I was stuck one evening at the gate for almost 20 mintues before a surly employee showed up and explained that he was busy. It's a very remotre area to be stuck and as I was alone I was feeling very unsafe. This hotel is on a very isolated area. There is a Waldorf Astoria nearby but once here you are stuck and they know it. There are limited eating options and they are grossly overpriced. For me I much prefer the Hilton Downtown Disney. There are many options for meals, two sets of elevator banks, and outdoor parking area when you are not boxed in and their customer service is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: NYToTampaGirl
Reviews.Content: This was our second overnight stay at Hilton Bonnet Creek. The hotel remains our favorite in the Orlando area. Rooms comfortable and clean. Appetizers in the lobby bar were extremely good. We will not hesitate to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice!”
Reviews.Author: Picky1010
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on the reviews. So glad I did. Hotel is beautiful, staff friendly and helpful and the lazy river pool - really fun! Unfortunately, my daughter was only able to use the pool one day but she had a great time. Beds were comfy and room clean. Yes - I checked the mattresses and they looked brand new. We ordered room service and breakfast at the hotel cafe. The breakfast portions (from room service) were just right...pancakes are pretty big. We had one little issue when breakfast arrived -- one of the coffee mugs had lipstick on it but when we called room service they immediately brought another mug. The hotel provides transportation to the parks. They ran every half hour to every hour depending on the park. Good service. Takes about a half hour to get to park (includes a pick up from Waldorf Astoria). These were the little additionals the hotel charges: $13 for self parking per day; $10 in room internet access (per day); $5 inner tube for lazy river. Despite those additional charges and the distance (I wished we were closer) - I give the hotel 2 thumbs up! We didn't want to come home.

Reviews.Title: “Not my type of hotel”
Reviews.Author: Prodance
Reviews.Content: Gigantic, Enormous Hotel/Conference Center. Bring your running shoes because you will be adding miles to your exercise routine just walking around hotel. Everything is clean and new. You will be nickeled and dimed for everything. No free internet here. Hotel boasts the top Italian restaurant in the entire Orlando area. We did not try it though. Made the mistake of having Christmas dinner in the Harvest Bistro - Christmas Buffet for $50.00 a person and they served processed turkey breast. The food for the most part was like cafeteria food - worth at the most 19.99.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Experience”
Reviews.Author: abadilife
Reviews.Content: This is one of the newer hotels in the Orlando, FL area. My room was very clean and quite large. Each room also has an LCD HDTV (720P). Room service is 24 hours, and the food was good. Everyone that I came in contact with was very polite. There is a nice pool and a golf course right next to the hotel. If I find myself in Orlando again, I would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hilton Stay - Bellservice EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: JNJJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Bonnet Creek this past week (December 19 - 22) and, overall, had a great stay. This is a cousin hotel of the Waldorf Astoria (which I have raved about in two other reviews). It is connected to the Waldorf via the Convention Center which is in between the two hotels. There is a large parking garage, which we didn't use, because it is a long walk to the front doors, so we used the valet parking. The valet parking is needing a little bit of help, due to it seemed that they don't have their act together. As we pulled up and a valet attendent greeted us, he asked if we wanted valet service, which I answered "yes", and then he just waited there with me. I asked if there was Bell Service, and he looked around as if he was lost for words. This was disappointing considering that at the Waldorf, Valet is right there, and Bell Service steps right in (maybe I'm a bit spoiled by the Waldorf!). Bell Service did come up, and we were brought up to the room. Now Bell Service is excellent, and the man who help us was a true gentleman!!! If you ever stay here, ask for Brad. He will take care of you. He is and will be the reason why we would come back. We even seen him a few more times during our stay, and our kids got along with him. He would spend time point out where things were located around the area (malls, eateries, etc.). He's enough of a reason to keep coming back to this hotel. The hotel has a very strange layout, because the elevators are in the middle of the hotel, and the furthest room from the elevators could be quite a walk. If you don't pay attention to the EXIT signs, you could find yourself all the way down the hall to a staircase. But once you get used to the layout, it's not too bad. Our room was clean, and the beds were comfortable. Pillows were very comforting. There is a coffee maker in the room, but I would suggest going down to the coffee shop down stairs. We stayed on the 8th floor overlooking the pool area, and each morning you could look down and there would be a word spelled out of towels on the chairs near the pool. My kids couldn't wait to see the word for the day. Overall, I would rate this hotel a great stay. Valet kind of ruined a 5 star for Service because they were slow in getting the car once we called down. We would definetely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fantastic pool, Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: trippst79
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this review short and sweet. We stayed over the Thanksgiving weekend holiday and found both the Waldorf and the Hilton to be top shelf all the way. The only complaint I had was that the Hertz rental car service was spotty at best. They only had one guy working and he was never there. I do not fault the hotel for this, but it was an inconvenience. The pool with lazy river is great, one drawback, you have to rent the inner tubes for 5 dollars a day. If you go to La Luce for dinner, make sure to get the butterscotch pudding for desert, trust me, you won't regret it. Oh, and if you play golf, the Waldorf golf course is AMAZING! If you eat at the grill, try the Rachel sandwich and french fries.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: dan3knight
Reviews.Content: Read the positive reviews and gave this hotel a shot. We were not disappointed. The staff is very professional, attentive and friendly. Harvest Bistro downstairs was great for breakfast/dinner buffets. La Luce italian restauraunt was incredibly good. Transportation to and from disney parks was easy, and the hotel's location could not be better.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Bonnet Creek Resort & Waldorf Astoria Orlando, FL”
Reviews.Author: LynCat
Reviews.Content: Hey, I appreciate upscale as much as the next guy, but having a private tented cabana reserved poolside, waiter standing by, awaiting your arrival, complete with monogramed towels ...then not showing up...but having it all there just in case...now that is slick! As you would expect, the lobby was palatial. Lobby bar and all public rooms were stunning and the stonework very appealing. The Bull & Bear restaurant off the lobby of the Waldorf was probably the finest dining I have ever experienced; but, with a fully a la carte menu and entre prices starting at $50 each...well...let's just say it is best reserved for high rollers and special occasions. With Waldorf rooms reserved for the Hilton and Hilton brand owners conference, we actually were camped out at the connected sister hotel, the Hilton Bonnet Creek Resort. The Waldorf and Bonnet Creek properties are located side by side and share a series of convention venues linked with a common hallway. Although not sporting private cabanas like the Waldorf, I actually preferred the pool complex at the Hilton Bonnet Creek. It was larger, more kid friendly and had one of those Lazy River features that allow bathers to plop down on air mattresses and circumnavigate the complex every few minutes. Overall impression of the Hilton Waldorf / Bonnet Creek Resorts - Very upscale. A stone's throw from Disney. Excellent food and service. Pricey. Slick.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff and management wery helpful. Wanted to pay for upgrade as it was daughters 18th birthday but was upgraded for free. Had a 2 room suite. The girls had the bedroom and I the living room with sleep sofa. The sofa was so comfortable that I fell asleep on it without even opening it! The pool was great, slide was great. The only downside and it's a big downside is that yon need to pay for the tube rentals and with 5 people that's s lot. We had dinner@ La Luce which was excellent bit the service wasn't great.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel- and I am Picky”
Reviews.Author: weatherman70
Reviews.Content: Booked three nights originally. Had to cancel the morning of checkin because I got sick. The reservations manager cancelled meout No Problem! Nocancellation Penalty... Then he said to call tomorrow and he'd give me the same rate which I did the next day. We went to Disney Hollywood Studios then at 4 went over to the Hotel to get ready for Thanksgiving Buffet at Harvest Restaurant. Checkin was quick. A bellman took care of our luggage. Impressively- the staff uses different elevators for service. We never had to share the elevators with staff full of luggage or housekeeping carts. How Impressive!! Thanksgiving Bu8ffet Dinner was Fabulous! The room was average size. Clean. Two comfortable Queen beds. Flat-screen TV. WIFI costs extra, however. Extra $10 tp see towards Disney. We can see MGM-Hollywood Studios, and if we strained our necks to the right- we could see the Fireworks from Epcot which is Really close. The hotel is absolutely HUGE. Kids had a ball watching the evening movies at the Pool. Lazy river, etc. Every time we needed something in the room- be it more pullows, or a razor which my Wife forgot, they were up at our 10th floor room within Minutes!!! Oh- and the room was QUIET! Couldn't here the next rooms or above us At All! A GREAT STAY!

Reviews.Title: “Over exceedes in Service and Best hotel stay ever”
Reviews.Author: Rvalentin
Reviews.Content: I would like to start off by saying that this hotel is in a really nice area, far but yet so close. I stayed there with my family and we had no complaints. We are hilton honors members and we were treated like VIP. We received a free upgrade due to our status and honor points, the room was quite large and had a suite connected to it, very beautiful. It has plenty of resturants and bars, and the pool is amazing, the Waldorf Astoria is connected to this Hilton which you could use all their ammenities. Lets talk about the staff, all of the staff here goes out of their way to make this an enjoyable stay, from front desk to room service, to the pool attendents, even the security team here is exceptional. I fell while chasing my son in the hall and dislocated my shoulder and let me tell you these two gentlemen from security came up almost immediately, I donâ€™t remember one of the gentlemens names, but the other one gave me his buisness card, â€œ Michael Castilloâ€�, the supervisor. He really went out of his way to make me as comfortable as possible. These two guys really did it for me and made this Hotel my number one choice for when we come to Orlando. They treated me llike family. The kids loved to pool and it Lazy river, although the floats cost 5 dollars to rent. They even had a DJ playing great music and movie night, where you can relax in the water while enjoying a great kids movie.Overall a great place to stay while on vacation in Orlando. Great job to the Managers and Owners of this place on the training that they have implemented on their staff.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel experiences around ---- great for families, business people, and everyone in between”
Reviews.Author: themanderson21
Reviews.Content: One of the first things you'll notice about this Hilton is that it's classy enough for a business trip or a romantic getaway, yet very family-friendly with a lazy river and water slide. I came here for a business trip, but I brought my family along. Typically, it is not wise to mix business with pleasure, but the Hilton Bonnet Creek is perfect for both. I reserved a room for about $150, but upgraded to a 1200-foot suite on the 16th floor for only $80 per night more. I could not believe this room for the price --- 2 large, comfortable beds, an office, wet bar, large dining room with glass table, living room, 2 big-screen TVs, and 2 bathrooms. The beds are absolutely heavenly. The room is clean, the service is friendly and efficient, the food is great, and there are many options for dining and entertainment. This place is very clean and the staff is always working hard to keep it that way. The Harvest Bistro offers a great hot breakfast buffet for $20 per person (kids are free) with made-to-order omelettes and waffles along with many other items. Room service is fast, friendly, and offers a plentiful menu. The Harvest Bistro omelette is a must! I love the poolside beach-themed restaurant and bar where you can have frosty drinks and food delivered to your beach chair. At night there is a live DJ near the pool followed by a kids movie with popcorn. The location is about 4 miles from the Magic Kingdom and 2 miles from Downtown Disney. I've never been to a hotel that was perfect for business people and singles and families all at the same time. The hotel and staff are classy, but not stuffy. There are plenty of people walking around in business suits, and at the same time there are families in bathing gear heading for the pool. My only complaints (and very minor at that) are that you have to rent tubes for the kids ($5 per day) and wi-fi internet will set you back around $10 a day. Otherwise, if you're heading to Orlando for business or pleasure, you need to seriously consider this fabulous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience for the Price”
Reviews.Author: beepet
Reviews.Content: I was pleased to get a great rate from a third party website ($78) for our 4 night stay. The man who brought us our luggage was very friendly and gave us some great tips for restaurants and convenience stores. All of the help were friendly. The pool area is wonderful. The water was a little cold, but I believe they turned up the heat later in the day. Our room was adequate and the beds were very comfy. We used the shuttle service to the theme parks and found them to work quite well. The only downsides were the fee for the internet and parking, but at the rate I got for the room, I can't complain. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bulldog10
Reviews.Content: Just returned from one week at the Hilton Bonnet Creek Orlando and am looking to rebook for April 2011. Wonderful location and fantastic staff made this a great stay. The rooms are large and the views from Hotel are great. Great pool area that the kids would love and the "Beach" pool side restaurant is brilliant. A heaven of sophisticated peace amongst the madness of Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we had this hotel in our town”
Reviews.Author: makidayo
Reviews.Content: I love the pool facility. Excellent!! It was open Oct 2009 and looks brand new. It's very close to Disney and very quite location. But Internet and parking are not complementary.

Reviews.Title: “Nice site for a conventrion”
Reviews.Author: SunshineFL221
Reviews.Content: My husband and I attended a recent convention based at this facility. It was nice to be at an all inclusive location (even golf for those who stayed the extra day) and not have drive from hotel to convention site. The property is spread out. There is not a lot of signage but it is adequate. The lobby bar was obnoxiously noisy to the point where it was hard to communicate with the check-in staff and the next night I was actually sitting at the bar, talking to someone, but wanting a drink and could not get the wait staff's attention. We had trouble with access in and out of the self-parking garage. The room key that was supposed to work didn't - but we were billed for the two nights of parking. Internet was additional cost which is disappointing for a higher scale facility (we had our own air cards and did not pay for their service). The fitness center was very nice. The pool looked nice and felt warm but the air was a little chilly for a swim. The brouchure mentioned a lap lane but I didn't see one. The walking path could have been better marked. The convention was run smoothly. Food service, etc. all were typical and well run. The staff seemed to have their act together for re-doing rooms for various sessions, etc. All in all, it was a well suited venue for this group.

Reviews.Title: “Out of control”
Reviews.Author: pucgal
Reviews.Content: We arrived and found no place to park, and no bellman available at mid-day. Upon dragging all our luggage to the check-in desk we were told that the hotel was oversold and they had arranged for us to stay elsewhere. Not only did we have a confirmed reservation made several weeks in advance, but Hilton had charged $250 to our credit card for our first night. Since we had no choice we moved on to other lodging, however, the valet had already taken our car so far away it took nearly half an hour to retrieve our car. The valet told other arriving meeting attendees that there was no place to park and only guest who had checked-in would be allowed to park. We are Hilton Honors members and were taken back by the brusque treatment and the total out of control atmosphere at the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Slept great!”
Reviews.Author: hankjenny
Reviews.Content: The accomodations and staff were super. Slept great! Hotel restaurant food and serivce were very, very good. Only negative would be quality of toilet paper and distances to walk for conference workshops. Only one escalator/elevator and it is near entrance to convention area. None in sight in core of convention area. Would definately go back, but would wear sneakers everywhere. Kids looked like they were having fun in the nicely designed pool area. Some construction going on inside, but was well contained. Liked walking through convention area over to the Waldorf to piano bar & lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Hands Down The Best Value in Disney Area.”
Reviews.Author: deej696
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Bonnet Creek resort, with our first being a stay at the Waldorf Astoria. We expected a few notches down with the Hilton as compared to the Waldorf, but to be honest there were few if any. The hotel itself is gorgeous and clean, and the staff are all quite friendly. And considering it's priced equal to a Disney "Value" resort, it's hard to beat the bang for the buck that the Hilton presents. We look forward to returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Thrilled with our stay”
Reviews.Author: IzziGirlAbroad
Reviews.Content: After a lot of searching around, I settled on the Hilton Bonnet Creek, but I was worried it would be too resort-y and not worth the money. Instead, I was really, really pleased with just about everything. In fact, we enjoyed the hotel so much that we skipped a day at the theme parks so we could relax by the pool and enjoy the lazy river. The rooms were clean and the beds were ridiculously comfortable. The view was great. The bathroom was spacious and modern. The breakfast buffet, at $19, was fabulous-- it included made-to-order waffles, eggs, pancakes, and lots of other delicious goodies. The pool was really nice, and there were awesome extra touches, like staff coming around to offer frozen grapes or cold towels. The poolside bar served up generously-portioned beachy drinks, and all the staff were really accommodating and friendly. The resort itself is right by Disney, and offers a free shuttle to the park. It was about a 20 minute drive to Harry Potter World and Universal Studios. Parking was $13 for self park, $20 for valet, and the internet cost extra. Everything was cleverly priced to get you upgrade, but what can you do, it's Orlando. I couldn't get too angry because the service was so good-- and there were smart extras, like free computers and printers by the front desk specifically for printing out your boarding pass. The resort is nice and secluded, while still being in the middle of everything, and there were pretty walking paths. We were really happy with the Hilton. It felt luxurious without being stuffy. We went for dinner and drinks at the Waldorf next door, and it was really opulent (with much fewer children). Dinner was delicious at the steakhouse, but we were happy to return to the more relaxed vibe at the Hilton. The Waldorf's luxury felt almost like a caricature of New York-- it was out of place in Orlando. Anyways, the Hilton is highly recommended! I would absolutely stay there the next time I'm in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “First time to Disney”
Reviews.Author: becksok
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely new Hilton hotel. We were traveling with serveral families and were able to get all on the same floor. Very clean hotel and helpful staff. The only negative point was the service by the pool. The hotel was not busy at all but we got no attention sitting down at a table not far from the bar. Food is average for the breakfast buffet. Hotel italian restaurant was very nice but expensive. Hotel transport to Disney is great if you have the schedule memorized and the location of pickup. The pool was great for our kids (all under 5). Loved our time at hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort - extremely accommodating and friendly”
Reviews.Author: LA0613
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Orlando Bonnet Creek for a work conference and it was one of the best experiences I've ever had. The staff went above and beyond to ensure that we had everything we needed. They were all super-friendly and super-helpful. The restaurants were excellent, as was the lazy river (got to enjoy it during some down-time...very nice)! Even though this was a work-related trip, I would absolutely return to the Bonnet Creek for pleasure. Excellent resort.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than last visit!”
Reviews.Author: FLFrequentTraveller
Reviews.Content: Mrs. Frequent Traveler and I paid a return visit to the Hilton Bonnet Creek in October. Last time I dinged them for no fridge in the room; this time, there was a fridge! I don't have a lot more to say other than it's a wonderful hotel in a wonderful location. Mrs. Traveler asked why we'd ever stay anywhere else. Mind you, our kids are all college age and beyond, and therefore do not come to the parks with us that often. If we had tweens or teens, we'd probably end up at a Disney Hotel (like we did back then), but for solo trips the refined quiet is just what we appreciate after a day in the parks. I keep thinking we should spend more time around the hotel, but it is so close to the parks that we just head out as soon as we're up. The pool (which we've only admired from our room) is amazing looking... If you're thinking of coming to WDW as adults, this (and the Waldorf, of course) is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Orlando's BEST Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravelerXO
Reviews.Content: We just came back from staying at the Hilton Bonnet Creek. The Hotel was very clean, the restaurants were very good and the pool was great. The staff was all very friendly-especially Paula at the Front Desk. She was so kind, helpful and well mannered and made us feel very welcome upon our arrival. After meeting Paula as our first point of contact with the hotel, we just knew our stay would be fantastic! Our view from the room overlooked the pool, golf course, and Disney resorts in the background. You could even see some of the fireworks from the Disney parks at night. The rooms were nice and clean, and the beds were the most comfortable beds I ever encountered in a Hotel. The maid service came in every day and everything was spotless. They would even make a â€œflowerâ€� with the tissues where they came out of the box We had breakfast at the Harvest Bistro every day and the food was always good. They had such a great variety-you could never go hungry. The staff in the restaurant was very nice and attentive as well. One of the waiters even made a â€œhatâ€� out of one of the napkins amusing the kids. That was very nice to see. The pool was fantastic. There were plenty of chairs and towels available. The lazy river was a lot of fun, and they would show movies at night for the kids. You could rent floats for the lazy river, but we had just as much fun without them. The staff at the pool was equally as friendly as everyone else in this Hotel, and came around frequently to take food/drink orders. I could not say enough good things about this Hotel/Resort. This was by far the nicest hotel we ever stayed at! If you stay here, you will not be disappointed. I look forward to my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Best experience I've ever had in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: ILoveAZ
Reviews.Content: I was here for business, and everything from the moment I arrived to departure 3 days later was perfect. The staff is awesome, the grounds and facilities wonderful, and food fantastic! Highly recommend for business of pleasure, actually I hope to return to this hotel for leisure one day soon!

Reviews.Title: “Good for business of families”
Reviews.Author: BigDTraveler
Reviews.Content: Had a conference at the Gaylord and stayed at the Hilton becuase the Gaylord was booked. It is new and very nice. Traditional Hilton rooms and very modern lobby. Very nice pool for families. Only disappointment was very limited food selection at the bar as well as for room service. Would be a good place for a conference, but not walking distance to anything.

Reviews.Title: “Top Flight Convention Experience”
Reviews.Author: FORTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Bonnet Creek is a first rate convention hotel of the highest Disney quality. Outstanding architecture is evident upon arrival at the spacious porte cochere where numerous attendants greet you with a smile. The contemporary main lobby space includes high ceilings and is home to the hotel concierge, the main desk, a lobby bar and a lobby coffee bar/light food deli. Speedy elevators whisk you up to a spacious and very quiet room that is well appointed with stone vanity and plenty of room. I stayed near the end of one of the floors, so it was quite a walk to the elevator, but that's a minor comment. The fitness center is outstanding, featuring all Precor/Icarian products, as well as few others. I sampled the fare at the garden restaurant on the lower level, and, candidly, this was the least impressive part of the experience. The food was high priced ($14 for a pulled pork sandwich, i think) with very slow service and uncomfortable chairs. Still, the pool side bar/cafe was really nice and fairly priced. Employees were always very friendly and generally spoke before being spoken to offering greetings and nice comments. The pool looked awesome with a wonderful lazy river and very interesting layout, but i just didn't have time for that. The convention facilities were also first rate. Wide, spacious corridors made for easy walking and access and the rooms were very nice with first rate A/V equipment and sound-proofing. I'd recommend this hotel highly for any business/convention type experience.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Hotel & Excellent Disney Location”
Reviews.Author: Special99
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazing & I would definitely stay here again and again. Rooms come complete with flat screen tv with plenty of channels & options to buy current movies, coffee machine, hair dryer and iron. There is a cleaning service and spa. The hotel is a holiday in it's self, the lazy river pool is amazing - $5 to hire the inflatable or you could buy your own. We spent our last few days relaxing around the pool nibbling on complimentary frozen grapes. There is a pool area service as well as a place you can go and sit down to eat & drink if you prefer. Pool towels are also supplied FOC. If you are on holiday bear in mind that you will pay $13 per night for parking at the hotel (more for valet) and you will pay the same each day to park at Disney & Universal. Plenty of staff around the hotel who are always polite & smiling. Room service was great, the room was cleaned, tided and most importantly after a full day at the parks, the bed is made. The bed is so amazing I am in the process of receiving a quote to buy one and have it delivered to the UK. The hotel is easily located, just follow the signs for Downtown Disney and then head for Disney Caribbean. The hotel is actually inside the Disney resort. We could see Downtown Disney from our room and for $10 extra per night you could have a Disney park view, we saw this from the corridor window and could clearly make out Hollywood Tower of Terror and the tower in St.Marks Square, Italy in Epcot.

Reviews.Title: “A destination in itself!”
Reviews.Author: 1junior92
Reviews.Content: My wife and I attended a conference at the Hilton Bonett Creek last week, and never left the property. With the beautiful pools at both the Hilton and the adjoining Waldorf Astoria, we enjuoyed the Florida sun. We also had a wonderful dinner at the onsite La Luce and a great lunch at the other restaraunt in the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarolDundee_Scotland
Reviews.Content: We were actually outbooked to this hotel from Hilton Orlando. Although this hotel was not an ideal location for us it is a great hotel. The hotel is close to Disney Parks and when I go back to do Disney then I will definitely stay here. This year our holiday was more centred around Universal Studios and shopping which was the reason we booked the Hilton Orlando, and we don't drive when we are in Florida which I felt a car was needed. This hotel though was good. Great pool. Great, friendly staff apart from one incident when checking in that the person dealing with us was too busy with what someone else was doing and looking at them as opposed to us so didn't know who he was dealing with which I felt was a bit rude. We ate at the hotel alot too and couldn't fault the food at all, everything we had was delicious. The hotel also put on a free shuttle which takes you to Downtown Disney where you can catch the rest of the buses to get to the Disney Parks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: margaret098
Reviews.Content: My family and I had booked to stay at Hilton Orlando, but we were outbooked to Bonnet Creek. This is a fantastic hotel, all the staff were great from Brenda in the restaurant to the other lady who's name I have forgotten in the breakfast room. We had a 14 month child with us who as you know can make an awful mess but nothing was too much trouble for the staff here they all went out of their way to welcome us and spent agreat deal of time with my two gransons the other aged 14 years. The location was not ideal for us as we were doing mostly Universal on this visit, but if you are doing Disney its ideal.I would certainly recommend this hotel its fantastic. I would also like to mention the room assistant's who do a great job, one lady noticed that we had a baby with us and left us extra towels which was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Very upscale but too far from anything.”
Reviews.Author: butterfly64
Reviews.Content: Very new hotel with beautiful pool and a shuttle to downtown and DW. It shares its golf course with the Waldorf Astoria...so that gives you an idea of its character. However, the restaurants are very expensive and just getting a simple breakfast of coffee and breakfast bread can run between $7-$10.00. The breakfast buffet is $19.00 and there is nothing within walking distance for alternative food. There is a charge for parking and Internet use. We were there for business but not on a hefty travel budget. If you want a hotel of this ilk, you're probably better off at the Hilton Orlando which is closer to downtown and more accessible food alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is beautiful...”
Reviews.Author: Thallia3456
Reviews.Content: I had an amazing time here. I was debating between this hotel and a Disney hotel nearby but ultimately chose this because it was a complete steal. The place is beautiful, so luxurious and the room was huge. The only downside is the bus to the Disney parks are rather slow. They come often but compared to the Disney hotel transportation, this definitely doesn't compare. But all in all, I had a wonderful time and will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Gorgeous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ACSWDublin
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hilton Bonnet Creek at short notice. What a hotel! Let me start by saying that what we will remember most about this hotel is the lazy river. I had never before experienced a pool like it - the lazy river takes about ten minutes to carry you around the lovely pool area. It was great fun for big kids (meaning 40 somthings's). The pool is really easy to get in and out of with lots of entry points. Though this will be our lasting memory, overall this is a lovely hotel. It was one year old in October, 2010. It is a sharp well organised hotel - valet parking and luggage staff - excellent. Reception staff are helpful and interested. The rooms are well equipped. The bar is lovely for a drink or quick snack. We had a lovely meal at La Luce restaurant - great thoughtful food and terrific serving staff. However, you do need to book in plenty of time - which we did not realise and we were lucky to get in. The only alternative would have been the bar or the Harvest Bistro - and I was not sure that the Harvest Bistro would have had sufficient choices for dinner. Other useful points - there is a really handy 'Grab and Go' as you enter the Harvest Bistro - coffee, snacks etc. There is a great coffee shop (Muse) in the lobby which serves coffee and ice-cream. The pool area is well served with a good pool bar. The service around the pool is a little hit and miss - it could be improved upon. Having said that the food and the drinks, including virgin cocktails, were good and the staff were friendly, helpful and really terrific. I am slow to enthuse about hotels but this is a gem. The spa for the hotel is at the Waldorf which is right beside the Hilton. However, treatments, as in most American hotels, are expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations exceeded”
Reviews.Author: jbtjr264
Reviews.Content: We drove to Orlando for a quick day away from the kids and shopping. Hotel is on Disney property but well tucked away. Beautiful pool with lazy river. Great food and restaurant options. Great gym. Adjacent to Waldorf with more amenities available there.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT PLACE - NEAR DISNEY, BUT NO MOUSE EARS!!!”
Reviews.Author: Minoiminoi
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely property VERY close to Disney, but you are not "moused" every time you turn around. Everyone, from the front desk to the housekeepers, AV staff, food service - all of them couldn't have been nicer. Our greatest surprise was that we didn't have a bathtub in our room. We thought it was great - a walk-in shower! (I was told that rooms with two queen beds had bath/showers and those with king beds had walk-in showers - no bath. The pool has plenty of places to lay around in both the sun and shade and the lazy river is really nice. The Harvest Cafe restaurant has what may be the best salad (chicken with a light buttermilk dressing) that I have ever had. Very light, with suble herb flavors that were just great. All around a great property - good for conferences, sunning and with shuttles to all the Disney and other properties. The only negative, for me, was the lack of shops. If you're at a meeting and never get off property, there is really no place to buy a t-shirt, etc. until you get back to the airport. They're missing out on a great revenue stream.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and New but not as convenient as on-property”
Reviews.Author: jackii
Reviews.Content: I debated between staying on property or trying out the new Hilton Bonnet Creek. This hotel is very pretty, great beds, great pool and quite close to Disney. I went with the Bonnet Creek to try something new, I have stayed on-property for most of my trips to Disney. The shuttle is not as convenient as staying on property, however it is not as crowded either. The bus is a luxury bus with cushioned seating and we were never crowded or had anyone standing. However, the bus only runs every hour and it stops at all the parks. For the Magic Kingdom, it drops you off at the bus transportation parking lot vs taking you to the Magic Kingdom parking lot. You have to walk to either the monorail or the boat to take you over to the Magic Kingdom. We found it very time consuming. If your main reason for vacationing in Florida is not to visit WDW each day, then this is a perfect hotel. The pool is fun, and it was never crowded. The weekend dive-in movies were interesting, they give you free popcorn (with goodies to add to it, like marshmallows, m&ms, etc) and you can either watch it from the pool or lounging on a pool-side chair. You can even order dinner while watching the movie. The rooms are about the same size as the moderate rooms at Disney, a tad bit smaller than the luxury at Disney. I am a Hilton honors member so I received 2 coupons for each day for a continental breakfast in the restaurant downstairs. We could pay $6 to upgrade the coupon to the full breakfast buffet. The buffet was wonderful! Everything you could want. The continental included everything cold in the buffet, so even the continental breakfast was wonderful! Can't go wrong there. All in all, the only issue we had was the shuttle service. There is no shuttle to/from the airport so you will have to pay for a Mears Shuttle or a cab/towncar. And to/from the parks is a little more time-consuming and they drop you off and pick you up further away that the regular Disney busses. We never could find the correct pickup spot at Downtown Disney. But...the hotel itself is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “This is the Place to Stay! EXCELLENT!!”
Reviews.Author: Spann612
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Bonnet Creek was excellent in every way. The facility is new and expertly designed for convenience and splendor. The rooms were quiet, cool, comfortable and extremely relaxing. No detail was overlooked. From check-in to check-out the staff was friendly, helpful, engaging, and always smiling. They made us feel welcome and at-home. The restaurants are a bit pricely, but to be expected at this venue. All of the food was exquisitely prepared and served. I would highly, highly recommend this beautiful, luxurious hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: Atlanta_GAORNurse
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bonnet Creek Hilton for a week in September while our children were on break from school. I can't say enough good things about the hotel. It's our 3rd time there and it has been better each time we have gone. Laura, at the front desk, had cookies and milk in the room upon our arrival as she noticed we were repeat guests. John, in the Harvest Bistro, made animals out of the boys' napkins at every breakfast and was attentive to our needs. Jonte made sure we knew where everything was in the hotel after he brought our bags to the room--got ice for the bucket, showed us the fire exits, etc. We had a slight mishap with housekeeping (very minor) and Bogdan came to the room, apologized and made sure we had no problems with the room being cleaned properly after that. It's a short ride to any of the WDW parks (which is why we were there). I have stayed at almost every deluxe property in Disney and they can't touch the service and amenities they have at this Hilton. Harvest Bistro has good food (kids under 12 eat free); they have an excellent pool with a lazy river--pool bar/restaurant has very good food and it's also reasonable. It's right next door to the Waldorf Astoria if you want to eat there or upgrade your stay! It's a very lovely hotel with wonderful staff! Oh, forgot to mention, a very nice fitness room with good equipment!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: gravedigger_1
Reviews.Content: Most everything at this hotel is top notch. I wish that I would have had more time to enjoy the amentities but it was a business trip. It appears to be a great place for a family but I didn't see too many children during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Wonderful pool and amenities. Great restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: maddogx4
Reviews.Content: We visited our sister who was staying at the hotel with her kids. The kids (4-10yrs) loved the pool, lazy river and water slide. There was something for everyone. Later we ate at La Duce and loved it! The food was awesome. The staff was wonderfully accommodating with the children, preparing their pastas to their specific requirements! We will definitely be returning to Hilton Bonnet Creek!

Reviews.Title: “I'm Still Here, and I Hate That Tomorrow I Must Check Out”
Reviews.Author: Rob676
Reviews.Content: I have been here for several business meetings for the past four days and this has been a wonderful stay. I am sorry that I must leave tomorrow. While I have the time I wanted to provide my review. The hotel will be open one year in a few days. New hotels, even after a year, often don't have their act together. Not this one. I am rather facscinated by this place for how wonderful it feels and how well designed and organized it is. The hotel is part of the Bonnet Creek Resort, which is a 70-acre area located in the southeast corner of Walt Disney World. It is not owned by Disney, but is bordered on three sides by Disney owned land. The entrance is located just east of the entrance to Disney's Caribbean Beach Resort. The concept was to set up a cluster of luxury hotels. The hotel is next to the Astoria Hotel. In between these two is a conglomerate of convention space for any meeting, small or massive. Surrounding the hotels are beautiful grounds, pools, a gold course, lakes, water fountains, jogging track. It's architechtural marvelous but not pompous nor stark. The room is plush and large, with such comfortable beds, Serta Model Hilton Suite Dreams, which does not require a box spring. It is similar to the Conrad Chicgo - I bought from Seta directly the same bed. There is an empty refrigerator which can easily hold a case of beer. The water is instantly hot, the bathroom very nice. The room was so silent I could hear the digital clock ticking! Food was provided by the meeytings, which as prepared by Hilton. Very nice food. We ate one night at La Luce, whcih was excellent, but I don't know the cost. But tonight I just had the superb pork chop at the Harvest cafe restaurant. Yummy! Staff were fine, and always jumped to please. Internet is price reasonably, there are 1 - 7 day price ranges. But it is free in the lobby if you need it for a short period of time and do not wish to pay in your room. Prices are reasonable at this level of hotel. They don't gouge you here. Hotel parking is $13 a day. Try paying $20 and up elsewhere. Wow, even the garage is gorgeous!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay! Courteous and...”
Reviews.Author: sethis1
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay! Courteous and accommodating staff. Hotel grounds were well maintained. Clean rooms and comfy beds This is a new hotel which has gone through it's infancy stage and is up and running smoothly. The only complaint I had which is one you'll find at any hotel of this type is tipped to death- everyone was so gracious and helpful but sometime ya gotta draw a line - by the last day we were tipped out. Would I stay here again- you betcha!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we ever stayed at and an amazing start of our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: JvanEst
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Orlando, FL for our honeymoon and after doing a lot of research on hotels nearby the Disneyparks, I came to the conclusion I liked the Hilton Bonnet Creek the best. The hotel is very new and already has a very good name out there, so we decided to book it and we definitly did not regret it at all. We've stayed here the first 5 days of our honeymoon and had an amazing expierence staying there. Upon arrival we were welcomed very nicely and because it was our honeymoon they gave us a 50 dollar giftcard to eat at La Luce, a very high class Italian place located in the hotel. They also gave us free parking for the full 5 days, while parking is normally 13 dollar per day. Last but not least they also let us pick a room with a pretty view and when we found out the room didnt have a bathtub, they immediately gave us another nice room with Disney view that did had a bathtub. Yes, de service was absolutely amazing and everyone there was so nice, welcoming and polite. The lady from guestservices gave us vouchers so we could get discounts at the nearby malls and the lady from their local coffee place, gave us a free krispy and kreme donut on the day we left. The rooms were very neath and the bed was so comfortable, I actually never slept better in my life! The housekeeping was also excellent, they really pay notice to what you want. The shuttle service to the Disneyparks was also excellent and the busdrivers were very nice. The hotel is located nearby a lot of attractions, malls and restaurants. It IS difficult to find at first because its not on the map or gps (cause its so new) but once finally have found it, you learn its actually not that hard to find, just keep your eyes open on Buena Vista Lake for the little Hilton Bonnet Creek resort sign at the side of the road, when you miss the sign, you'll drive in circles for an hour ;) The hotel's facilities are also outstanding, its a beautiful resort with lots to do, we didnt even have enough time to explore the entire hotel! Overall, this was the best hotel we ever stayed at and we will definitly come back here when we visit Orlando again! I hope the Hilton Bonnet Creek keeps up the good work and their excellent service, if it does, this hotel will definitly stand out from the rest!

Reviews.Title: “Great guest service and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: palaciose
Reviews.Content: We just stayed 2 days at this resort, I just love it. The corcierges were awesome, they were always taking care of our stuff, the car rental, the dinner reservations, they gave us good suggestions. And we were surprised that at the restaurant we went for dinner (RoyÂ´s), they gave us a VIP service because the concierge from this hotel called to the restaurant asking them to take care of us! That was nice from them! They have a shuttle to disney parks, they were on time and nice, and the pool and view from our room were awesome. I think Bonnet Creek street has just 3 or 4 big hotels. I would reccomend to rent a car, due that we spent a lot of money in taxis. The room was good and clean. Love the Hilton bathrobes! Definitely will go back to this Hilton! The buffet breakfast was good and the restaurant was cozy.

Reviews.Title: “Beatiful Hotel in Disney Area”
Reviews.Author: Surrillo
Reviews.Content: We stayed for labor wekend and is was inexpensive.This hotel is modern,beautiful and have a lazy river.You dont need to go aquatica in orlando,because you have a lot of fun in the lazy river that the hotel have.At night we saw the fireworks of Disney.The hotel share the pools with the Astoria Hotel that is a 5 star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: Reet
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 5 night stay for a national conference which filled the Hilton, the attached Waldorf, and still did not hold us all. My agency had advance reservations, so we had no issues at check in. In fact, everyone in my group was upgraded to AMAZING suites! First time that ever happened, and it was awesome! My suite was an "Executive Suite." and had huge windows overlooking Hollywood Studios, Pop Century, and even part of Epcot. I saw some other rooms that were not suites, and these were also quite nice, each with a fridge which is always a plus. The staff treated us wonderfully the entire time. The conference area was adjacent to the hotel (actually between/connecting the Hilton and Waldorf) so it was a bit of a hike, but offered plenty of meeting space. Used the pool one afternoon - it was huge and had a great slide and lazy river. Poolside food was okay, ordered it to go one evening and ate in the suite. The downsides - charges for every little thing, but not unusual for this type of hotel. Parking $13/day. WiFi in room $4.95 for 2 hours. Soda in the gift shop was $3 for a 16oz bottle. Plan accordingly! And - the bus transportation was not Disney quality. The bus ran on time for their schedule, but it was just not frequent enough; every other hour to Downtown Disney, for example, starting in the afternoon. This became an issue a couple of times when a group of us wanted to go out to dinner. There is nothing AT ALL within walking distance so you have to leave for meals or eat in the hotel restaurants every meal. Just make sure to get a bus schedule so you know how to make plans. Or you will need a $25 town car (one way) to get anywhere....and they are parked out front like vultures waiting on you - hoping you will be too hungry to wait for the bus! All in all, great, beautiful place with just a couple of minor issues om getting around. I would totally stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Stop telling people how good it is. They'll only want to stay there.”
Reviews.Author: JuveLovers
Reviews.Content: We visited Orlando in August with our 2 children, aged 3 and 5. We loved this hotel. We had a minor incident (queue jumping!) at check-in, which the reception staff recovered nicely by upgrading our room to a Disney view at no cost. So, what's not to like. Pool - great. Pool -side movies - great. Staff - great. Rooms - great. Courtesy buses - great. Maid service - great. La Luce restaurant - super-great. Proximity to fabulous Bull & Bear - great. We just simply had a fantastic staying here and we can't wait to go back. Oh, and the great fridge debate is over: they have them in all rooms. In the words of the Krankies, fandabidozi!

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: rbiddy
Reviews.Content: We decided to have a mini vacation during the Labor day weekend. We found a great rate at the Hitlon Bonnet Creek on Disney property. From the minute we pulled up, the service was fantastic and not aggressive. Our bellman spent just the right amount of time helping us get settled and gave us some tip to the property. He even checked in on us the next day. The pool is amazing. The kids spent the entire day on the lazy river and then watching the dive in movie both nights. Free popcorn too. I was able to enjoy watching the football games at the Beech Bar by the pool. The poolside service was very attentive and had timely service. The prices were fair as well. Kids under 12 eat free and with some of the packages, so did the parents. The Harvest Bistro buffett was perfect for the family. We met a lot of people around the pool and discovered that families were visiting from Miami, Tampa and Jacksonville because they thought it was a great value. I would highly reccomend this jewel of a property right in the heart of Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Best 'off property' location for a Disney Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: SUMB44
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Bonnet Creek is ideally located for anyone going to any of the WDW parks, particularly Epcot. My wife and I recently traveled to Orlando for a Disney Pin Trading event at Epcot. We stayed at the Hilton Bonnet Creek for four nights Thurs through Monday. From our initial arrival to departure the staff was friendly, courteous, and eager to please. The hotel, public spaces and rooms, is very clean, modern, comfortable, and upscale. The breakfast is on the expensive side, but it's a hotel... though unlike breakfasting at Disney, you won't need a second mortgage. My wife and I, after three rather grueling days of standing in line, walking, and more standing in line, decided to relax poolside after a nice lunch at their poolside restaurant. The food and drinks were excellent. The pool and sun deck area are quite expansive, the pool also feature a 'lazy river' which is nice to just float around in. This hotel is adjacent (shares a common convention center facility) to the Waldorf Astoria resort and guests in each can use the facilities of the other. (though we did not) Cab fare to/from the airport was about $60. Cab fare to Downtown Disney $15. Cab fare to the 'Prime' Outlet Mall and Universal area about $40. Cab fare to Disney/Epcot was about $15 as well. The only 'cabs' at the hotel are town cars so expect a little markup in fare, but nothing outrageous.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: marley35
Reviews.Content: We were there for a baseball tournament at Wide World of Sports. The location was excellent for access to Disney but then you come home to a relaxing, quiet place to stay. We have stayed at every resort in the area and this resort has everything you could ask for. The service was excellent, while we were swimming a staff member delivered fresh towels to our seats. The hotel is absolutely beautiful. The whole hotel is very clean. The pool and lazy river are great. We were given a complimentary late check out

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel/Resort”
Reviews.Author: reachmejessica
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Bonnet Creek was awesome. I stayed there with my husband and 8 year old son and we had a blast. It was a nice perk to your mini vacation/birthday celebration over labor day weekend. After spending the day at SeaWorld, it was nice to come back and relax at the pool that night. We ordered some food poolside and our 8year had a blast watching a movie while floating on a tube. The Hilton staff made our stay with them very special. I would recommend this resort, very close to Disney and SeaWorld but you felt worlds away from everything. The only disappointment is paying for self parking and the price of the tube rentals. If you are staying there go someplace and buy your own floaty for the pool.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful oasis!”
Reviews.Author: Cynnull
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a ten night stay at the Hilton Bonnet Creek, on our first visit to Orlando and we definitely picked the right hotel! Great service, great beds and rooms= blissful sleep, and, of course, the beautiful pool. Free, and frequent, transport to Disney parks and Downtown Disney was great. A few tips if you're watching the pennies: 1. If you're going to the Parks, fill up on the $19 buffet breakfast - it will keep you going all day long. 2. Use the Muse cafe if you fancy a smaller breakfast or lunch - about $8 for a bagel and cappuccino, which you can eat on the balcony or at the poolside. 3. The only downside is that you're reliant on taxis/shuttles if you haven't got your own car - the black Towncars that operate from the hotel re about $5 more expensive than the yellow Mears cabs. Take a Towncar to your destination, but take a yellow cab back (there's plenty of them everywhere). 4. Beware drink prices!!! $6 for a small beer, $12 for a glass of wine. Tip- make use of your fridge and take a taxi to Walmart ($15-20 one way) to stock up on drinks. 5. The hotel doesn't provide transport to Universal or other non-Disney parks (including Disney waterparks). Cheapest way to get to Universal is to book at the hotel and it costs $18 per person for a round trip. We tried to use our initiative and find a cheaper way by taking a taxi to the Orlando Premium Outlet ($21), then catch the I-Trolley to the top of International Drive ($1.25 per person). The downsides of this is that its a long journey but ok if you want the experience of the Trolley. But by the time we'd used the Trolley there and back, and two taxi journeys, it actually cost us more than the normal shuttle, and was more tiresome. Other than that, enjoy this brilliant hotel! Staff were very friendly, food was good - overall an outstanding stay. As I said, an oasis of calm away from the Parks. ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, professional friendly staff, really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Ann5521
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend at this hotel with 3 other couples and we all brough our kids. We had a wonderful stay. This hotel is new and so beautiful! I love the way it is decorated. The staff was very professional and friendly. They have a lazy river and slide at their pool so the kids were in 7th heaven. We all floated on the lazy river in a big group, it was so much fun! I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base - close enough to do Disney but far enough away to escape!”
Reviews.Author: Tannerz
Reviews.Content: Excellent quality hotel. New, clean, modern with lots of facilities. You need to be aware that this is a conference hotel. When we were there many conferences were on, so when we were in our swim wear there were loads of people suited and booted! That can be a little uncomfortable and detracts from the holiday mood. Staff in all restaurants are exceptionally friendly and helpful. We loved Brandon and Brenda. The pool is open until midnight and from 9pm they show Disney films which you can watch whilst you swim. There is a Hertz car hire based there so I would advise people to book with them. However, book online as we got it much cheaper. The woman said that we had got our week for the price of two days hire. It was our first trip to Florida to do Disney. Some musts - do a schedule before you go and stick to it, don't do the big parks on the first day, do a water park so that it is a shorter day and you can ease in to the time difference, pace yourselves, it is impossible to go for the parks opening and staying till they close. We did and nearly finished off our 7 year old! too hot for that amount of activity in one day. I'd go back for the fireworks on a day when you've done less. All in all an excellent holiday.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel - Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: Pamaha
Reviews.Content: I actually had to start reading the "poor" reviews first - because I couldn't imagine how anyone could give the Hilton Orlando Bonnet Creek poor reviews. SigO and I were there for a conference (at another hotel). The hotel is 10 months old, fresh and beautiful. The rooms were spacious, the bed was very comfortable. I guess we were lucky - based on other reviews on the matter - because we had a small refrigerator in the room. My key card didn't work - but SIgO's did, so no biggie. Paula at the front desk was so friendly, so helpful. She put us in a Disney view room at no additional charge (we were already on the Florida resident rate!). Every single employee we encountered at the hotel went above and beyond - and was incredibly friendly. The only exception was the gal bartender at the pool - she wasn't really rude, she just wasn't really friendly, either, and it was pretty clear she didn't want to be a work that day. She stood out given how nice and helpful everyone else was. For example, SigO is a big snorer and I had forgotten my earplugs. It was late (around midnight) and I asked the front desk if they might have any available. They checked around the hotel in various spots but couldn't find anything - so they offered to have a driver drive me to Walgreens. Wow. And the driver was a sweetheart too. Also, we walked over to the Waldorf (through the convention center) to see what it looked like one night. Unfortunately, our feet were hurting after a long day at the convention and I guess we must have mentioned it - because they said, heck, jump in the golf cart, we'll take you back. Wow. I know these are little things - but in a time when we are bombarded with bad service everywhere - these little things really stand out. We didn't get a chance to spend too much time in the pool area - a few hours - but it was beautiful and the lazy river was fun. Water temp, perfect, warm but still refreshing. We caught the end of a movie that they set up at night in the pool area - family oriented stuff. Cute. Didn't use it - but I noticed they had a very impressive fitness room - big with loads of new equipment. Someone complained about the buffet breakfast being too expensive (come to think of it - our waitor was incredibly nice, too...anyway - ) but I've grown accustomed to $17 breakfasts at hotels and the selection was very good. Nothing new there. All in all, a VERY nice experience, beautiful hotel, good location to the parks, EXTREMELY friendly service, and I would highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous resort. Great for families”
Reviews.Author: maryfshort
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to the WA/Hilton resort. We cannot say enough good things abou this resort. Beautiful to look at, rooms are lovely. Staff is so helpful and friendly. My children did not want to leave the pool and lazy river. We enjoyed the "Dive In" movies. Harvest Restaurant is great for families and the "kids eat free" is a bonus at breakfast and dinner. We plan on returning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay. Love the lazy river”
Reviews.Author: Papucha
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the hotel. Also stayed at the JW Marriott Grande Lakes. This hotel had a nice pool atmosphere -- enjoyed the dj/music at the pool. Lazy river had a great current that our teens enjoyed. Would recommend. Between the JW and this -- JW had more trees surrounding the pool -- more lobby -- seemed more active. But I would also return to the Hilton. Both were great -- plus beats the prices of the disney resorts. They have a great transportation to Disney also!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel with fabulous amenities--a must stay while visiting Disney World”
Reviews.Author: theresaw
Reviews.Content: Booked our Disney World vacation and decided to stay "off" property. Noticed that the Bonnet Creek Hilton was the closest hotel to the 4 Disney World parks, so we researched it. Some nice reviews, a great pool, so we booked it. Once we arrived, we were blown away by how gorgeous this hotel is. Only 8 months old with the best pool/lazy river/water slide that we've ever experienced. Staff was very attentive and our room was spacious with a great view of the Disney parks. The hotel also had a great gym, beautiful bar and a couple of very nice restaurants. A bonus for us was that it sits right next to the new Waldorf Astoria that has an incredible golf course that runs along both properties. We found ourselves with some free time and played--an amazing experience. We were sorry to leave and although don't feel the need to visit Disney World anytime soon, we'd love to go back to the Hilton and lay around the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful - We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler123418
Reviews.Content: My husband, two pre-teen children, and I spent three nights at this hidden gem. We loved the lazy river and the evening movies at the pool, the breakfast buffet at the Harvest Bistro, the bus to the Disney parks, the view from our room (we could watch the golfers), and the exceptional staff! We were amazed at the value. Everything is new and plush and the grounds are very well designed and maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: LovetotravelSt.Louis
Reviews.Content: We normally stay at the Omni Championsgate, but wanted to try this new Hilton. We were not disappointed! This hotel is in an excellent location (connected to the Waldorf and near Disney Carribean Beach)...Just walking in the lobby - the hotel has a great feel about it...love the balcony area with tables and chairs overlooking the pool. Pools, lazy river and pool restaurant/bar are awesome. New hotel, very clean and near Disney...cannot wait to come back! They do charge for parking, but now the Omni is charging as well...We got a great rate of $90 thru AAA....

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is suffering an identity crisis...”
Reviews.Author: Qlstravels
Reviews.Content: First, since this is a new hotel, it is very nice and well maintained. The grounds look just like they do in the pictures. BUT... My husband and I just checked out on Saturday (Aug 7th) and I have to agree with most of the reviewers. Yes we were "nickel & dimed" with the extra charges for parking ($13), internet ($19.95), lazy river floatees ($5 per day), and way overpriced food ($14 hamburger at the pool, $31 for a pizza and 2 soft drinks). We also had issues with the shower heads (or morning sprinkle). Had we spent more for the room ($119 p/n), I would have really taken issue with all of the extra charges. The other weird thing was the authorizing an extra $100 per/night (on top of room charges) for those using bank visa/mc debit card. It wasn't a problem for us, but for familes on a budget, if you don't know that ahead of time, this could really ruin some vacations. We are both well traveled, but this was our main observation...because you have both resort guests and business guests (there was a large sales convention), the whole experience wound up being impersonal and weird. It was odd to walk thru the extra large lobby in a bathing suit and our newly purchased floatee while dozens of conventioneers were drinking in business suits. That's where the identity issue comes into play. We did get the Disney view room with the pool view which was very nice. We also booked a package which included rounds of golf at the Waldorf Astoria. The course is amazing and the golf club staff was great...but there seemed to be a miscommunication between the Hilton and the golf club because the pro shop knew nothing about the Hilton package. However, it was a fun course to play. The golf club charges are on average with other places of that caliber ($30 pp TaylorMade club rental), ($7 for a beer on the course). Unless they reduce some of the fees, I wouldn't stay here for a leisure vacation. A business trip...maybe. Orlando has PLENTY of options where there aren't so many extra charges. With all of the food and other fees, it actually cost us $200 per night and we didn't even eat breakfast at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Resort”
Reviews.Author: texascouple21
Reviews.Content: Couldn't ask for a better place to stay for the resort traveler in Orlando--elegant but comfortable, expansive but not expensive. The highlight of the property is their pool area; a LARGE lazy river surrounding and filtering into a pool that one can wade in or swim in with a seperate slide area. But the real surprise was that there was enough lounge chairs (and shade umbrellas) for everyone--no need tohunt or fight for a place to put down your towels. Very well thought out and executed.
