I happened to meet the Assistant Director of Front Office Operations, Youlio Beracierto, upon check in; he went out of his way to make sure that I knew that he can be contacted if I needed any help with any problems should any arise---that's service!! The poolside restaurant had freshly prepared sandwiches, salads, etc and we found our waiter, Ken, to be knowledgable about the menu; we followed his suggestions and was not disappointed at all. The property was exceptionally well maintained. The large lobby had a bar area with more than enough seating, a coffee shop with the usual--bagels, muffins, etc and a patio over looking the pool. Our room was large and well appointed, befitting the resort and the location. Overall, a wonderful, relaxing place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “All that I'd hoped it would be.”
Reviews.Author: mommarocks4
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort with lots of fun for the kids. My kids loved the Lazy River. I was a little shocked but they didn't seem to care about the slide. Maybe because almost every place we stay has a slide so it's lost it's luster. Also they made my six year old wear a life vest. He was not happy about that and he ended up NOT going back on the slide. I guess he didn't meet the height requirement. Poor guy. He's an awesome swimmer and he didn't need the vest. Oh well !!! My kids loved craft time and movie night in the pool. I guess I would like to share that the pool service was lacking and when we did get help it came with a bad attitude. I will say in fairness to the server that he was the only guy working the pool so I'm sure it was very hard on him. Other than that the rooms are nice and clean. The grounds are kept beautifully and the food was pretty good. I will warn you it's a nickle and dime you place. Don't expect to save much money. We did get an awesome room rate but that was pretty much it. The food, parking and drinks are $$$$$. I paid $18 for 2 - 16oz beers. The bus transportation over to the Magic Kingdom is nice. The kids loved riding the bus. They can't wait to go back so they can ride the bus. I totally recommend this place and if you go don't forget to bring your own floats for the Lazy River. They'll even blow them up for you at no cost. If you don't than you'll have to pay a daily rate per float. Trust me it's worth it to bring your own. Have fun!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing & Relaxing!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cubybear15
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I live in the heart of Orlando. On a nightly basis we literally can sit in our backyard and watch fireworks from Disney, Universal, and Seaworld. We have a clear view of the light-up slingshot from FunSpot, and while pumping gas at our nearest gas station, we watch screaming tourists loop upsidedown on The Hulk, feet above our heads. My fiance deals with vacationing and tourism on a daily basis, as he sells Timeshare for a local company. The LAST thing we ever want to spend our free time doing is what most ALL people come to Orlando for! We try extra hard to steer clear of any "touristy" spots, and avoid I-Drive at all costs. We recently had a few days off together but not enough to travel anywhere outside of Orlando. We decided to stay at the Hilton Bonnet Creek because we had heard wonderful things about it. I was abit reluctant to stay at Bonnet Creek because I really wanted to avoid being on Disney property. I assumed it would be full of kids and Mickey Mouse and tourists wearing fanny-packs and flowered T-Shirts. Needless to say...it was ANYTHING but. Upon entering the hotel lobby I was taken back. It felt extremely sophisticated and upscale, modern and clean. We were greeted warmly by everyone, from the Valet guys, to the group of men and women behind the check-in desk. We were quickly given our keys, breakfast vouchers, and upon discovering we were newly engaged, the hotel staff, especially Yulio Beracierto, made extra effort to ensure we were well taken care of. Our room was beautiful, clean, upgraded, and had an amazing view of the golf course. We explored everything the hotel had to offer and were impressed with everything! We lounged by the pool and enjoyed the lazy river. We had a delicious dinner at the restaurant inside the hotel, La Luce, and enjoyed our dessert and wine on the balcony watching the Disney fireworks. We enjoyed breakfast everyday at Harvet Bistro and were BLOWN AWAY!!!! The custom-made omlets really got me...I felt like royalty!! We strolled over the the Waldorf Astoria one night using the connecting walkway between hotels. We stopped along the way at a night club, explored their restaurants, and had cocktails at the Peacock lounge where there was live music and dancing. I could go on forever about the wonderful experience we had at Bonnet Creek, but then no one would read this... :) To sum it all up, however, we truly had an experience that was relaxing and enjoyable. We frequently forgot we were staying a few miles away from our house...

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: HNAC
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a conference at the Hilton Bonnet Creek. I found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. My room was nicely decorated, the bed was extremely comfortable, and no Mickey ears anywhere to be found! :-) Like on cruise ships, they add little touches like folding washcloths into swans, roses, etc. After attending the conference all day, we would spend the evening at the pool swimming the lazy river. They have poolside food and drink service, a bar, and show "dive-in movies" at around 9:00 every night. The only downside of our stay was that the hotel was also hosting a youth church conference for 4,000 teens plus chaperones and family. Once they arrived, the serenity of the beautiful lobby took on a whole different feel. One morning, their praise & worship music was so loud that our meeting had to be moved to a different room at the adjoining Waldorf. The hotel was apologetic and provided complimentary lunch from our inconvenience. Overall, I loved the hotel. I would highly recommend it to others and would gladly book a stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “You won't want to get out of the lazy river!”
Reviews.Author: salesrepIndiana
Reviews.Content: Hotel is new, open around 6 months. The rooms are great, comfortable beds, but who wants to stay in their room when it is only 6 miles to all the parks. The resort has 2 pools that connect thru the lazy river. I usually never get in the pools but this is a don't miss. The water gently floats you thru the river and both pools. Rental for an intertube is $5/day or $7 to buy. Limited dining options, but they have a great coffee shop and nightclub. They show a Disney movie everynight poolside, so you can float in the pool and watch the movie. Premium Outlet Mall is within 5 miles, Permier Outlet Mall within 7 miles. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Restaurants”
Reviews.Author: valentinapelfort
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Employees are wonderfull, the service was Excellent. Loved the Lazy River, Loved the Italian restaurant. Clean Rooms, Attentive Staff. I will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “EXCEPTIONALE EXP. FOR ADULTS & CHILDREN”
Reviews.Author: AMEinpa
Reviews.Content: From the moment we were greeted by the friendly & knowledgable staff, we were in for an extraordinary time. The breakfast buffet met all our needs plus the children eat free. The lazy river was perfect for all (bring floats-hotel charges) & the waterslide kept my grandchildren busy. The staff was at your beck & call. (I loved the cold eucalyptus towels & frozen grapes given to refresh us by the pool). The convenience of poolside food service by the pool was great to feed the kids lunch--we didn't want to miss 1 min. by the pool. The rooms were comfy, bus service to Disney parks ran every 1/2 hr.. Bring rain gear-weather is unpredictable. I'd go here without having a Disneyworld visit.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful resort with amazing pool area”
Reviews.Author: randallfamily8
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the 4th of July weekend and had a great time. We had read previous reviews, so we brought along adequate snacks for the kids and our own floats for the pool. We brought a small lunch box cooler down to the pool, and on the 2nd day a staff member told us there were no coolers allowed, so I just kept it out of sight after that in a larger beach bag with no problems. We did buy drinks from the pool bar, BEECH, and I will say the frozen mango mojito is now one of my favorite drinks! The poolside movies are great fun, and they serve free popcorn. I would compare this hotel to the Omni @ champions gate, but with a lot more dining options. It would also compare to one of Disney's deluxe resorts, but for a much lower price tag!! We checked out the adjoining Waldorf Astoria resort, which is beautiful and would be a perfect choice for a couple's getaway...maybe next time!! We had the dinner buffet @ Harvest Bistro, where kids eat free, and we also had the breakfast buffet one morning. The food was always quite good, definitely better than your standard "buffet fare". The hotel had their own fireworks display on July 3rd, and then on the 4th we watched the fireworks @ Hollywood Studios and Epcot right from our room!! (tip: if you are a Hilton Honors member, when you book a standard view room, it will give you the option of a "stand by" upgrade to a disney view room for $5 more! take it, it's definitely worth it) I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone, just know that like anything in Orlando, the prices are a bit high for essentials once you get there, so try to come prepared, or hit the local supermarket on your first day there!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for Disney vacation!”
Reviews.Author: kashismom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hilton from July 2- July 5, 2010. We requested an early check in and the hotel gave us a room when we checked in at 10:30 am. Initially I thought the view wasn't so great (we overlooked the front of the hotel driveway and were able to watch the cars pull in and out of the hotel) but when we were able to watch the fireworks from our bed at night, I quickly appreciated our view! We spent 2 days at Universal and 2 days at Disney. While the hotel provides transportation to DIsney, it does not to Universal. When we tried to get the hotel to call us a cab (which is cheaper - $30 one way) they insisted we take on of their Mears private town cars (more expensive - $45 one way ) to Universal. They insisted that taxi cabs are "unethical" and when I asked how so, they weren't able to provide me an answer. Anyway, we scheduled the Mears shuttle ($18 per person ROUNDTRIP) the following day and didn't have a problem. The actual hotel has a great lazy river and pool area to be enjoyed from 6 am to 12 am. We were able to soak in the hot tubs before we'd go out for our long days at the park. The morning buffet was pretty good for $19 per person. The only cons I would say this hotel has is that they don't have taxis readily available to take you places and really push their private towncars; the showers also have very little water pressure. Other than that, we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lauren_gPuntaGorda
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 days... The staff were extremely pleasant and helpful! The rooms were beautiful and very clean. Great restaurants and pool... Upon booking I though this hotel was a little pricey but now I know it was absolutly worth it. Can't wait to go back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great place close to epcot”
Reviews.Author: RJ24R2
Reviews.Content: Got talked into staying here by friends - usually when going to disney - stay at a disney hotel.... As I usually trust hilton family hotels I said what the heck - glad I did - hotel was beautiful - though they did charge for parking. Clean - great - affordable rates for the closeness and quality - would stay again any time

Reviews.Title: “Professional Hotel with qwirks”
Reviews.Author: HotelDetectiveGuy
Reviews.Content: This new Hilton property is located with in the Disney property and will be great for those who another Disney character will have them going over the edge. The staff from valets to check in staff are very professional, not very war and welcoming but professional. You are reminded that this is very much a convention hotel as people with name tags galore are every were, but nothing that makes this not work for a family with older kids or a couples weekend. The rooms are very nice with modern touches and extremely comfortable beds and wounderful baths, featuring a clean functional countertop and my room featured a glass shower. The pool is also a nice feature but is very busy through out the day. Altogether this is a nice resort for the Disney area, the only things to look out for is conventions, a lack of warmth from the staff and fees that can creep up on you.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I've stayed in 16 years to Orlando.”
Reviews.Author: Ped19
Reviews.Content: First of all. I'd like to say. Forget about what all those idiots who complain about tiny things like the maid leaving their shoes next to their bed instead of moving them to the front door. Those people will never be satisfied by anything and always have a bad word to say. They really p*ss me off. This hotel is AMAZING. Immaculate and everything feels FRESH. Take MY advice. I've been to Florida 16 times since I was a kid, with my family. This was my first year without them and I travelled with my girlfriend. We are both students but we decided to seriously splash out because to us, holiday means luxury! We booked with florida4less. The coach transfer company, American Coach were rude and didn't have a clue what they were doing. They took us to the Wyndham,not realizing that we were at the Hilton and because of this error they picked us up late on our way back from the hotel to the airport.. So now.. To the hotel. The lobby is immaculate, the staff were all friendly although sometimes I felt like that was just because you held the cash and sometimes not genuine. They really couldn't do enough to make our stay more enjoyable! We got room service a few times and the Waiter whose name is 'Jose' was amazing. Really friendly guy he even brought us up some complimentary chocolate strawberries. The quality of the food in the room service is great. We ordered 2 pizzas not realizing that were HUGE and couldn't even finish half of each. I'd avoid their buffalo wings, they are awful. The toilet in our room was not holding pressure very well, which we'd noticed at the start of the holiday. It didn't bother us because it was just noise but on the last couple of days we phoned and asked for someone to take a look at it. They sat for about half an hour trying to fix it and as a result gave us a free movie on our second last night to enjoy! They didn't bother us at all. The rooms are spacious, the beds are AMAZING. Out of all the beds (I've stayed at disney resorts to marriot world centre, villas etc) these were the best. Matresses Not too soft but not too hard either. Now, a few tips: In all honesty, anyone going to Florida for disney or the parks NEEDS a fridge. It's essential. If you want to keep milk for cereal etc which we always do as it's cheaper to have our own breakfast then this is the only way. Same with bottled water. Infact we froze our water in the fridge so that it lasted through the heat of the day.Unfortunately, the hotel only has fridges on the top 2 floors, a MASSIVE flaw. What kind of 5 star hotel doesn't have fridges in all the rooms?! I arranged in advanced to have a fridge in my room for 'Medical' reasons and received this at no extra charge. As a result we got a room on the 17th floor, 2nd from the top. The view was superb, we could see all of downtown disney from our window. Another tip. I'm a computer geek, and I hate having to pay the ridiculous internet fees that hotels charge just so that I can check an e-mail or two. I believe that we're in an age where internet should be complimentary or at least dirt cheap. I connected to the Lobby wi-fi (complimentary) and tested the range of the router by walking back up to my room once I'd connected with the laptop still on. . They charge like 9 bucks a day. Anyway, once I got to the room I was happy to see that if you connect to the complimentary lobby service then you can enjoy the net for free in your room at no extra charge. It'll last for 24 hours but if you go and connect again once the time period is up, you can keep doing it. So we basically had free internet for 2 weeks. Great. Another amazing feature about the hotel was the pool. Beautiful pool! Nice and cool with a lovely poolside bar called 'Beech'. They served lovely food (espec the seasoned french fries mm!) I'm turning 20 this month but still managed to get a couple of cocktails served at the bar without Identification. They were LOVELY. The alcohol age is stupidly high in America. The only thing I could say about the pool is that it was too shallow (3ft in most parts) with the water underneath the two bridges being 4ft. OH AND the pool is open till midnight!! Which is GREAT. More hotels should do this. It gave us something to do in the evenings. The harvest bistro was lovely a nice place to pick up a pastry or something if you are in a rush before the parks. If you are going there for breakfast then ALWAYS get the buffet its 19 bucks but everything that's on the menu is in the buffet! + orange juice. Yeah it's a little bit overpriced but so are most places in Disney world. We didn't have a car. So we used the mears cabs mostly (those are the best to get, so many gypsy cabs about). You can order them at no cost from the concierge. This is the first year i've been to America without a car. It was a little bit more restricted but definitely manageable! The town cars are a complete rip-off. 47 bucks for a cab where someone sucks up to you. I recommend just getting the mears cabs to and fro if you need to. Cheap and cheerful. For the time of year the hotel was quite quiet. There weren't a lot of Annoying English guests boasting about the world cup, which was nice. Mostly Americans. When you're a British tourist surrounded by Americans in a hotel then it's usually a sign that the hotel is great. They know their service! Speaking of transport. The shuttle bus they had to the parks was excellent and was always on time if not a little early. All of the drivers with the exception of one were very nice and good to speak to. They put movies on the bus as well to travel from each point which was a nice touch. One of our drivers called 'Neville' was very rude. He never reciprocated a welcome. I don't think it was anything to do with a language barrier. More the fact that the guy was a moron. My reasoning behind this was that on our 3rd last night, we got the shuttle and it had to make a stop at epcot. Gradually, our air con turned off, then lights,then the whole engine of the bus. It was like something out of a scary movie. We had asked i the driver was okay but got no response. He never told the passengers what was wrong at all. One of the guests told him to stop restarting the engine (I think she was an engineer) because it could be very dangerous but he wouldn't listen. We sat there, with NO blinkers on so that other cars could see that we'd broken down. Luckily someone from the waldorf phoned the hotel immediately to fix the situation. The driver never apologised or said a word to the passengers right until the next bus had arrived to pick us up. The same guest who was offering him advice about the engine had asked for a stroller for her child which was under the bus. He wasn't even courteous enough to collect it for her after what she had done. We spoke to concierge and they had assured us that they would take care of the situation. To summarize the hotel was absolutely amazing, I think my family will go next year with me to this hotel if not then maybe the waldorf. Which by the way is amazing but the hiltons pool is much better. Guests are free to use both pools. I hope this has helped make up your mind! If you find a flaw that isn't a personal issue then you're an idiot. P.S forget all the 'This is a business hotel' garbage. It is equally suited for business and leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: glossykeen
Reviews.Content: Terrible service! I booked my room two months in advance. The day I was suppose to check in they wouldn't allow early check in so I came back around 1:00, when they told me to come back, they told me my room still wasn't ready to come back at 3. I came back at 3 and was told they were overbooked and they were sending me to another hotel. The young workers behind the counter clearly had no idea how to talk to a very a angry customer. They were rude and look at me like I had a problem( which I did I didn't have a room) and they did nothing to make it better. I had to call back for a receipt a month later to confirm a refund was done to my CC and the worker (Jeremy) who answered the phone was rude, rude, rude. I would NEVER recommend anyone stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - very family friendly”
Reviews.Author: TrishBoc
Reviews.Content: This was a great Hilton property. Clean, spacious, and friendly staff. The guy at the slide at the pool took the time to learn every kid's name. He knew what language they spoke = and i wanted him speak Spanish and English - who knows what other languages he knew. The had a great dive in movie and gave out free popcorm. Really a great stay overall. I would have liked better food choices in the deli - but other than that it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury with the Greatest Value”
Reviews.Author: WP1825
Reviews.Content: I donâ€™t know where to begin. I donâ€™t usually write a review unless Iâ€™ve received really bad service somewhere. On the contrary, I was compelled to write a review about the Hilton Orlando Bonnet Creek. This hotel was absolutely perfect. From our initial check in the staff were friendly, efficient and very accommodating. Over the Memorial Day weekend they had several activities at the pool. This hotel was a great compliment to the Disney theme parks. The beauty and location of the property were perfect. The prompt shuttle service was great and convenient to the main Disney Parks. Hilton Bonnet Creek is rated at 4Â½ stars out of a 5 star scale. I would definitely suggest purchasing the breakfast buffet with your room stay. This was our first time at Disney and Orlando, and I know hands down this will be the only hotel we stay at on our future visits. If you like luxury, convenience and the greatest value near Disney youâ€™ll love the Hilton Bonnet Creek as me and my family did.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Restaurant Staff Lacking”
Reviews.Author: pointcollector
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Bonnet Creek for 6 nights. We were attending a conference at the hotel but decided to tack on a couple of days of relaxation by the pool. The facility was fantastic. It helps that it is new (October 2009 I believe) but it was clear that they were focusing on keeping it maintained and spotless. Their conference facilities are fantastic and the food was excellent. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. I can't say the same about the staff at their restaurants or poolside though. Many times it took 15-20 minutes just to be acknowledged that we were customers that wanted to order something and they weren't even that busy. The bar in the lobby was a complete disaster. First, it took 25 minutes to get a beer and a White Russian. Second, the White Russian was terrible (all cream). Plus, our total bill for those two drinks was $20. Like many resort properties their restaurant prices are high. Cocktails are around $10 each, so plan accordingly if you want to drink at all. We had our towncar stop by the grocery store so we could pick up some beverages and snacks. Just ask for a complimentary fridge when you check in. The pool was by far the highlight. We spent two full days just lounging. You have access to the Waldorf and the Hilton pools, but the Hilton pool was better. It has a great lazy river! If you're planning on using tubes for the lazy river more than one day, I would purchase your tube for $7-$10. Otherwise, it's $5 per day to rent a tube. If the wait staff and bar staff could get it together I would give this property a perfect 10.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: rbyer
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a 5 night stay at this hotel. While the room was very nice (and came with a small refrigerator) and the pool was fantastic - the food choices were terrible. The pool and bistro menus are very limited - my husband does a substantial amount of conference travel and he said that this was one of the worst hotels for food that he has stayed at. One night it took one hour to get our food -- they gave it to us for free - which was nice but the food wasn't even good. At 9:15 a.m. their Starbuck's-like coffee shop was virtually out of muffins and bagels. Their pasta/pizza restaurant doesn't open until 5 p.m. If you stay here -- just understand that if you do not have a car you are at the hotel's mercy for food. Luckily we had a car and bought muffins for breakfast etc. Given all the choices of hotels in Orlando - I would not recommend this hotel unless you like spending a lot of money on mediocre food-make sure to get on their website and check their menus before you decide to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for mini family reunion”
Reviews.Author: sarated13
Reviews.Content: Perfect setting for entire family. We stayed for weekend and didn't have to leave the site for entire family enjoyment. Great pools for all and food and bars were great!!!!!!! Entire staff wonderful esp Evette at front desk. Highly recommend for Orlando retreat. Disney, Epcot etc are right there!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for couples, families, and buisness people alike”
Reviews.Author: enstormblue
Reviews.Content: This hotel was found as a fluke while trying to find a place to stay during a disney marathon. This hotel is new, clean, bright and quiet. Its attached to the Waldorf so that hotel guest have access to both of the hotel's restruants and bars (there are something like 12 total open at different times). We always enjoy using the main lobby bar or Zeta bar when we get back from the park all day. Both places offer a good selection of drinks and also include food service till pretty late at night. Harvest down on the first floor puts on a nice breakfast and have a nice store for that late snack or quick breakfast bite. The poolside eatery offers good lunch menu and is open late if weather permits. Parking is the best, and honestly for the first time I have no issue being asked to pay for parking. Parking is in a well light, wide garage with a short covered walk to the hotel. The pool here is just amazing, a lazy river with zero entry pool and two hotubs is kid friendly but enjoyable for the older crowd. We often take just a day to use the pool and order lunch on the deck before going to a late dinner in downtown disney. Bus service is offered and its not bad, we elect to not use it on most cases as it is easier for us to drive to the parks and then dinner etc. But it is there, and included in the price, schedule is a tad inconvinent for us but thats to be expected at the non-disney resorts. The hotel does well to cater to families with movie nights in the pool and other activities during the day its really nice to see a resort actually be a resort for a change and plan activities etc. It is a buisness hotel but hilton has done well capturing both the buisness people and making this a family destination as well. Make note as with most hilton's internet is a paid service as well as parking. Some kids activities require a small fee (chargeable to the room) but alot of them are free as well. Pool floats are rentable $10 a day but if your there a few days just buy one from the pool hut its cheaper and easier.

Reviews.Title: “Will be staying at this hotel again!!”
Reviews.Author: Macart164
Reviews.Content: We have always stayed at Disney hotels but were tired of paying the huge pricetag for so so "Deluxe" hotels and for the theming that we don't absolutely have to have. My husband is a Hilton Honors member so we decided to try it after reading the impressive reviews on here. We were able to get a great rate online at the Hilton Bonnet Creek website which sealed the deal for us. We wavered between the Waldorf and Hilton but chose Hilton due to the lazy river, pool,etc. (We are planning to try the Waldorf soon too) We had a beautiful Disney /pool view room that was very clean and nice. I had requested extra towels and they were in the room! Great Crabtree and Evelyn toiletries. It was great to be able to see the fireworks from the room. The staff was exceptional and so friendly! The breakfast buffet was very good with a large variety of foods. We ate free since my husband is Hilton Honors Gold and the kids ate free which was great! Loved the pool, dive in movies, pool games and the food at the pool was very good although a little pricey. ( had read this in other reviews so we were prepared!) The motor coaches were so comfortable and played videos so we didn't even care that we had 2 stops to the parks. Our driver was very informative and helpful as well. This hotel is a destination itself and we didn't even make it to the parks until our 3rd day since we were having so much fun at the hotel and pool! Great fitness Center too! This is a great hotel and I almost hated to write a review because the secret will be out about how wonderful this place is!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: l0ve2sh0p4me
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here and had a great time. The kids loved the lazy river and waterslide. They recently changed their height requirement to 40" requiring a life jacket and it saved our trip. If we had gotten there and found out now slide for our kids, we would have had sad children as we hyped up this trip based on the pool and waterslide. The shuttle to Disney was great and really convenient. We weren't even going to use it, but on our way to the car one morning we saw it sitting there and though, why not? Glad we did, saved paying for parking at the parks! All of the service we received was excellent. Really nice, friendly staff. My advice is to bring your own inner tubes as they charge $5/day to use theirs. Also know that parking is about $14/day. We will be staying here again as this was one of our best family trips ever.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is fabulos”
Reviews.Author: bigwill1974
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. You will love the service. When we arrived we were greated at the car, our bags were taken and delevired to our room. Check in was smooth ,our room was ready, we were gave all the park times printed out along with shuttle service. We had a disney view room. Our room overlooked the beautiful pool and golf course. nice bathrooms, very clean .Flat sceen tv's, digital thermostat for air. Nice comfy queen size beds We ate at harvest bistro, kids 12 and under eat free with a adult. The buffet on fri-sun is great just about what ever you would like to eat. The pool has a huge lazy river that my daughter loved, float rentals, lounge, bar, and a super slide. In the lobby you have free wireless internet service. A great lounge area with a bar but is also kid friendly. My wife enjoyed a day at the spa. You are wisked over to the waldorf astoria where you can relax at the spa. 1hr massage and comes with unlimt use of steam room, sauna, whirlpool, and showers till closing. You could go to spa that morning and return that afternoon. Disney transportation is great, all the disney parks are included you will ride a charter bus that runs every 30m from 8am-1150pm. and use of disney transportaion is free also like the monorail. Carlos is the best bus driver at disney, he knows everything about disney. jenen and shirley are great also. The golf course is beautiful. It is rated in the top 10 for new courses. the service is remakable. You ride the shuttle cart to the waldorf. You will never have to touch your clubs until you play. your cart has a 12*6 gps , a cooler that is loaded with ice and water,damp towles to clean your clubs on the cart, tees divot tool. Your clubs ae cleaned for you at the end of the round.If you like playing in the eve. it is the cheapest about 45eve and 75 morn. and that includes a great range with pyrmid balls stacked. taylormade. huge putting green. When you use the waldorf astoria services you will only travel maybe a 100yds they are both own by the same company.If you have kids stay at the hilton. it's more kid friendly. (IMO) They also have a conference floor. I printed out my return flight tickets .Thats great. This hotel is the best hotel for the money and right in the middle of disney world!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carmie07
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints. My #1 priority staying at a hotel especially with babies, that there is a place open 24 hours to have access to milk/snacks which would be the Harvest Bistro, not to mention their excellent food and saving $$ for food which kids eat free. The hotel is huge so there is a lot of walking but there is nothing else you need and room service is excellent, very fast and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: bonaire11
Reviews.Content: We decided to include one day at Disney's Magic Kingdom while visiting my parents in Lady Lake, FL. We cashed in our Hilton points for a one night stay and upon arriving, we immediately booked for a second night. The hotel and grounds are beautiful, the staff is very professional and accommodating. They sent us two complimentary fruit baskets as a "thank you" as my husband is a frequent Hilton customer, nice touch. The location is great! We used their shuttle service to Magic Kingdom, very efficient service and professional. When we were tired of Disney, we had many shuttle time options to choose from and by 2:20 we were on our way back to the hotel. Side note: the shuttle is direct to Magic Kingdom from the hotel, on the return, expect 3 other stops, one being Epcot. We felt as though we were as close to Disney without paying the higher costs of the Disney Resort hotels. The pool was wonderful, both lazy river and the water slide was used by all of us. We had a wonderful top room with a view of the fireworks show that Hilton put on. All in all a great experience. We plan to stay here again in the near future, my mother would love to play a round of golf at the neighboring Waldorf resort.

Reviews.Title: “Over the top customer service”
Reviews.Author: kfunsun
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a night just for a quick "get away" and we were treated to outstanding customer service from the time we checked in at the front desk until we left late the next afternoon. The staff was quick to offer anything and everything available to make our stay more enjoyable at no extra cost to us. The hotel was beautiful and clean and our room was outstanding. The on site retaurants featured gourmet selections from all price ranges. The pool area uncluding the lazy river made the afternoon relaxing and it was fun to watch the outdoor pool movie from a lounge chair or pool raft. What really made this trip memprable was the over the top customer service offered by the entire staff.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a great hotel, but could be better.”
Reviews.Author: Quagm1re
Reviews.Content: I booked a two night stay in a Disney view room for my family and me. We arrived early at check in and were told there were no rooms available - fair enough. The desk clerk took my number and said they would call me, which they did, although not until 16:30 which was slightly disappointing. The hotel is very new and as you would expect everything is in great shape. The rooms are fairly spacious, well decorated, and have nice modern bathrooms and a large flatscreen TV. However, as I mentioned, we booked this room (and paid extra) for the Disney fireworks view. You can technically see the fireworks from the room, but the room faces southwest, and the fireworks were in a northwest direction so they could only really be seen by pressing the side of our faces against the window and looking to the extreme right. This will be the same for pretty much everyone booking a similar room, as the ones on the other side of the building have no Disney view at all. That said, on the whole the view was good, overlooking the golf course and pool complex. Broadly speaking the location is excellent, right in the middle of Disney country and almost opposite Downtown Disney. There are shuttles to the parks and many other dining and entertainment options nearby. The biggest asset to this hotel is probably the pool. There is a zero entry "beach" style section, and a great lazy river. There is also a waterslide in a seperate pool. You can also take the walkway adjacent to the golf course to the sister property, the Waldorf Astoria. There are a few options for drinking and dining, from a coffee shop to a couple of more upmarket bars and restaurants. We ate buffet breakfast at the restaurant, which was great. An expansive collection of choices, all well prepared and presented. Overall, this is a good hotel. I really wanted to love it, and it has all the ingredients to be great, but there are a few minor issues that bothered me. Firstly, the parking was $12 per day - almost the same as parking in Disney. Once again, this seems like an easy way/excuse to generate some adidtional revenue out of being near to Disney. Internet access was not free - I know thats the case with most full service hotels but that doesn't make it right. If Hampton Inn and the like are giving free internet then why aren't Hilton? I was also a little disappointed by the front desk staff. This is purely a personal complaint but as a Hilton Honors Gold member this is the first hotel where I have really had to fight to get the amenities I was entitled to, and my enquiry about the availability of an upgrade was met with a shrug. This isn't a bad hotel. It's actually a good one, but I was left feeling that it really should be better...

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: hymeragal
Reviews.Content: Because we had such a great experience, I'm taking time to write a review. First of all, the place is HUGE but when you walk in, you're immediately greeted and made to feel at home. Although we arrived a bit early, our room was ready for us. We had spent a hot day at one of the theme parks and arrived a bit worse for the wear. Our room (and in fact, the entire hotel complex) is absolutely spotless. Honestly, we looked for flaws and couldn't find any! The bed was comfy and cozy. My spouse has back problems and was amazed to awake in the morning without pain. The food in the restaurants is a tad bit pricey but it is absolutely WONDERFUL! They have a hamburger in the Harvest Restaurant that's do die for and the fries aren't shabby either. In the evening we enjoyed sitting at the poolside bar. Speaking of the pool, wow. That's another story. It's the best hotel pool we've ever seen. There are two pools, one of which is made somewhat like a lagoon (I guess it's called zero entry). It would be great for little kids and old folks alike. There were a couple of hot tubs and a "lazy river" (current and all) that runs around the entire pool complex. There is also a large water slide on the property which empties into the little river. This hotel is a destination all on its own. If you're looking for a place to go and kick back between theme parks, this is your spot! There are nature walks and if you golf, a beautiful golf course. A family could easily spend a couple of days staying right on the property and never run out of activities. We came home and immediately headed to the calendar to find a date to go back. The only negative thing that I can find to say is who the heck picked the green paisley brocade jackets the front desk clerks must surely be forced to wear (sorry ladies, I hope I'm doing you a favor here)? They are hideous. Yes, that's the only thing that I could find to complain about!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, thoroughly enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: loumcf
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay at the Hilton Bonnet creek, the hotel is new, clean, modern and the staff were extremely helpful, thanks to Joe and Rachel at the concierge and too many more to mention. We were stranded due to the volcano and nothing was too much trouble. The breakfast was excellent with lots of variety and La Luce the Italian was superb. Its in a great location very close to Disney and they provide a free shuttle if needed. Pool was great with lazy river around the perimeter and more friendly attentive staff. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!!”
Reviews.Author: crystalvoorhees
Reviews.Content: When we first walked in to this hotel we were a little embarrassed. We had just been to a water park all day and my girls were still in their bathing suits and there was a convention going on with people in business suits everywhere. We felt a little out of place. The hotel and service were amazing. We met some really nice people down at their amazing lazy river pool. We could have stayed there the whole time, it was paradise. Did not eat at any of the dining available due to prices. Location was great! Right by Downtown Disney. If you are looking for a Disney experience this is probably not the right hotel. It is a little bit more for adults but did have a great pool area for kids. I was upset that internet was not free and parking was expensive but all in all a great hotel. We would like to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hilton I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: swfc3045
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this hotel for a conference that was happening just down the road. The staff where the best I have ever seen. Nothing was too much trouble. The room I had was a king size room. Nice an roomy, nice sized desk so I had loads of sapce to work. The internet\wifi is not free but is not too expensive. I ate breakfast in the hotel every morning and had dinner there twise. The breakfast is a buffet and was always well stocked, hot and very well cocked. The room was always cleaned to a very high standard. I found nothing at all that I cold complain about. If you are going to Disney, I would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Wish we stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: TravelmomJerseyShore
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate off priceline for $99 per night. Paid the additional $13 for self parking which I knew about based on reviews. I felt the parking fee was fair since the hotel does not charge an additional resort fee. I am a Hilton Honor member but did not get breakfast vouchers because I am only a blue level member. My husband and I paid the $20 pp breakfast fee since all 3 kids were able to eat free and thought the buffet was very good with omelettes/fried eggs made to order, bagels and smoked salmon, fresh fruit, fresh pastry etc. The kids loved the lazy river and we happened to be there the day that children between 40-48 inches are finally allowed on the waterslide with a life vest so all 3 kids got to use the slide. I even used it! Margaritas at the pool bar were delicious. We went on to staying at the Disney Boardwalk since they had the extra magical hours but were not too impressed with the hotel. Wish we stayed longer at the Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business and family holidays”
Reviews.Author: dvdstv
Reviews.Content: I travelled to the Hilton on business in May for some meetings and a conference Overall its a brand new hotel and it shows - everything seemed clean and in good order + with a 1000 rooms its certainly big enough. This was purely a working trip for me and was frankly unimpressed with our choice of Orlando as a venue. With all the great cities & places in America we had to choose this place - the flight from London Gatwick did little to convince me otherwise. However the Hotel itself was a pleasant surprise and I thought it was very well run.Certainly there are a couple of good bars - such as Zeta - and I had a very good Dinner in Luce. I only regret that I did'nt get the chance to eat there again. Our Conference business was well handled too. Make time for a trip to the Waldorf too next door for Dinner - its only a short walk The location of course is very good for all the theme parks - not that I went - but I could see them from the window of my room on the 18th floor ! So if you are going to Orlando but still want a Hotel thats a bit more upscale you could certainly do worse than here. If you really have to have your business meeting in Orlando then its a great choice

Reviews.Title: “One of the BEST hotels I've ever stayed at!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SuzieQtee
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin...so many great things to say about this place...First and most importantly the bed and pillows...AMAZING..one of the best night's sleep while on vacation. The room was spotless. The pool was huge and never crowded and super clean. Great value and great location. I don't recommend spending the extra money for the Disney view from your room, nothing spectacular and not worth the money. Overall, this hotel exceeded our expectations and would definitely come back when in the area

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Faciities and Amenities”
Reviews.Author: lakemurrayscfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights beginning Easter night. My husband and son enjoyed the golf course (a great course by the way - pristine condition) while I enjoyed the pool - the biggest complaint was the lack of space around the pool - the chairs were so jammed together that it was hard to get in and out if you weren't a young skinny thing! I was worried that the lazy river would be overrun with kids but really it was very pleasant even over the crowded Easter weekend. We ate twice at the wonderful Italian restaurant - fabulous service, great food and pretty good wine list. Only downside are the pillows associated with some of the seating- kind of awkward if too many wind up where you're sitting and the seats beside you are full -- you have no place to push the other pillows. Minor problem. Finally, the rooms - with our 6'2" teenager we opted for the parlor suite and we would do this again in a heartbeat - my son had the parlor with it's own bath, a big plaxma tv, and a king sized pullout sofa that had the most unbelievable mattress - not the fold out couches of old! Our adjoining king was well appointed and a very comfortable bed for us as well. Instead of using the free buses to get to Disney (which were mobbed and seemed to be scheduled to stop at every park) we opted to use the car service available out front to take us to and from Epcot and to and from Downtown Disney that night for the Cirque show. SO much better than the bus and really very reasonable - in just minutes we were at our destination. We had our dirvers cell number and when we were ready to go back to the hotel all we had to do was call - Definitely the way to go! My only complaint is that I had to pay for internet access - if I had stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn across the interstate my internet would have been free. No hotel should charge separately for internet access in this day and age - I don't expect to pay separately for tv or telephone access so why do I have to pay for internet access? They should just build in the cost into the room rate and be done with it. Sorry - just a big pet peeve of mine. I want to go back to Bonnet Creek tomorrow - I want to try the spa at the Waldorf on my next trip!

Reviews.Title: “You Can Do Much Better For The Money!”
Reviews.Author: Beancute4u
Reviews.Content: Over priced rooms, 2 beds a desk, TV and a bathroom for $280.00 No fridge, No microwave. (They told me to heat the baby bottle in the coffee pot) Oh yes, we did have a 2 cup coffee maker. Nothing spectacular for that much money. Window overlooked the pool area. Never seen any fireworks from the hotel. Pool was nice but not $280.00 dollars a nite nice. When we returned home, there were unauthorized charges to our credit card Talked to the management, they admitted to the error and removed the charges. The next day the charges were back on the credit card again. They refuse to speak to us about it and we had to file a claim with our credit Co. This is still unresolved after 4 weeks. The management is poor and very inexperienced. Never will we come back to this Hilton again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property..a few quirks”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen Rene
Reviews.Content: I was able to attend a business conference with my husband at this property. It's absolutely lovely! The grounds were well maintained as was the pool area. We had a very pleasant maid and everyone working at this property was helpful, friendly and accommodating. The food was wonderful...and we attended two banquets on the property. For serving a couple of hundred people at a time, both times the food was tasty, hot and presented nicely..so kudos to the banquet and kitchen staff. I DID have an issue with our room. Granted, we arrived when most of our *group* had probably already checked in (it was busy at the reception desk, but we had a very short wait time ..this was addressed by another reviewer) and my husband wanted a room with a king sze bed. The only one left was a *handicapped accessible* room. After making SURE no one else *needed* that room ( we would have given it up without complaint if someone else needed that accommodation for their condition)..we were given that room. I was AMAZED the room we were given was SOSOSO far from the elevator!!! There WAS another handicapped accessible room closer to the elevator, to their credit...but the room we were given appeared to be more of an afterthought! I'm sure they have to have an accountable number of handicapped rooms, but I was appalled that they would put this room in the location it was in. We were 170 steps from the elevator (yes, I counted)...and if someone were on crutches, it would take them FOREVER to get to this room! Plus, there was NO view unless you were standing. It didn't bother my husband so much since he travels a lot, but if I (personally) were paying the amount they charge for a room, I would be almost in tears just overlooking the roof of the convention center! You could see some scenery in the far ground, but on a scale of 1-10, our view would have been about a 1 1/2. The room itself, I'm sure was decorated just as the others, and it was a nice room (and I realize when you are on vacation, you don't just go to stay in the room itself). Because of the status of the room, the bathroom had extra moving around space and extra balance bars. The flat screen tv was nice to have also. We had breakfast at the "Harvest Bistro"...$19 for breakfast buffet. OUCH! We didn't eat at any of the other hotel restaurants. We did pay for the internet, which bugs my husband to no end, since the rooms are pricey. We had rented a car also, so we did the self parking, which was another expense. (As per other reviews, we didn't have any GPS problems finding the hotel...it may have been updated since other reviewers had written their reviews). We took advantage of the pool and lazy river during some down time, and it was very relaxing, so that was a definite plus...our kids would have loved it. All in all, we had a great time..but got worn out walking to our room. If you can afford to stay here, do so for the lazy river and pool area and enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “Good not great. Bad service”
Reviews.Author: jgvnschck
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 days for a conference and had high expectations going in, but none of them were matched. The rooms were standard hotel rooms, nothing special. The service was all around mediocre. The restaurants were slow, the food was not great for the price, the valet lost my ticket, so I spent 20 minutes with them convincing them the car was mine. Parking was expensive, as was internet. I am sure there are better hotels in the area, so please don't waste your time and money with this one.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Loved Loved the Hilton Orlando Bonnet Creek”
Reviews.Author: NYToTampaGirl
Reviews.Content: What more can be said about this hotel? It was absolutely amazing. My daughter and I were there for only 1 night but whenever I'm in Orlando, this is where I will stay. The hotel is close to everything if Disney is what you're looking for(we attended a sporting event at the Milk House at Wide World of Sports) but yet far enough away to be quiet and relaxing. I have mixed feelings about the $13 parking fee but if you're only there for 1 night, no big deal. Any longer than that, it's a problem. I understand this is a resort but charging for parking when there is nothing else in the immediate vicinity is a little ridiculous. Hotel lobby was beautiful and we didn't have any issue checking in. Walked right up to the desk. As previous posters have mentioned, the pool area is beautiful and unfortunately, we didn't have time to take advantage of it. The rooms are very clean. The only issue I had was the lamp shade on the floor lamp. It was stained(maybe water from the air conditioning vent in the wall). No big deal but I thought is was strange since the hotel is only 7 months or so old. Only 1 time did I hear running water from someone elses shower but other than that, the room was great. We never had an issue with the shower, in fact, it was on of the most relaxings showers I've had in a hotel room. Now to the beds...Probably the most amazing sleep I've had in years and I've stayed in many hotels. Plush bedding, pillows and down comforters. Loved it! The rooms had top notch ammenities(Crabtree & Evelyn) and an in-room coffee maker with all the condiments(even liquid creamers)! The new flatscreen TV was also a plus. All in all, a wonderful stay and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Surroundings, Top-Notch Staff, and Value come together at Hilton Orlando Bonnet Creek.”
Reviews.Author: CLefevre
Reviews.Content: If someone were to ask me or my child to describe paradise, it would be easier for us to just give them directions to the Hilton Orlando Bonnet Creek. The hotel begins speaking for itself as you approach, and view its pristine landscape. You catch a glimpse of the pool area and as if by cue, your companions begin fantansizing with the notion of lounging in the sun with a cool beverage and the sound the lazy river gently carressing their minds. Your journey would take you first to the grand entrance lobby after you have been greeted by a myriad of helpful bell staff prior to going in. Once inside, you will immediately decide that if by some quirk of fate, you would live here forever. The front desk personnel greet you as if they had known you since birth. They provide all the information that you may need for your stay, thus eliminating your need to make any decision other than what bathing suit you plan to put on first, before finding that perfect spot poolside. Ahhh, poolside...now here is maybe the only dilemma that you may face during your stay. Should I choose a place near the beverage and snack bar or should I be over near the zero entry point for the lazy river? Regardless, wherever you find yourself, that is where you will want to be. The efficient pool area wait-staff will go above and beyond your expectations in making your place in the sun, the paradise you imagined. Now if you happen to be lucky enough to have your children with you, a word of caution. You may not be able to get them out of the lazy river, ever! My daughter went in at 3:15 PM one Saturday afternoon, and it wasn't until 10:30 PM that evening that I was able to convince her that she needed to get out. If you have a water-baby like I do, then be prepared. The variety of food choices at the pool area bar can satisfy all tastes for adults and children, so there really is never a need to leave until bedtime anyway. There also are plenty of activities planned to keep your children occupied throughout the day, so a day of pure relaxation for mom and dad is definitely within their grasp. They had a "Dive-In" movie in the evening that was very entertaining for my daughter and me. When it was finally time to retire for the evening, (after an incredible amount of coaxing on my part), it was clear to see that no expense was spared to provide you with a sleeping experience that would recharge your batteries for yet another day by the pool or visiting any one of the nearby theme parks, none of which were more than 20 minutes away. (We're talking Disney World and Downtown Disney, Sea World, and Universal Studios.) My room was well appointed with all the conveniences you would expect from a Hilton property, from a state-of-the-art television to computer hook-up with high-speed internet access. And the bed!!!! Definitely no expense spared in that department. The staff you encounter in all aspects of the hotel go out of their way to make your stay as wonderful of an experience as possible. You can definitely tell that the management team leads by example, and you get the feeling they hope to see you again real soon. If it were up to my daughter, we would be there again right now!

Reviews.Title: “Good experience overall but still have issues to work out as a new hotel.”
Reviews.Author: crkuyken
Reviews.Content: We had a good experience overall however, check in and check out were a problem as the associate checking us in did not have experience with the hotel's system and the types of package we had. When checking out we noticed that the package credit had not been applied and this created a big, lengthy problem for the associate checking us out. Her language was less than professional when asked with a response of 'don't freak out' although I only inquired as to why the credit had not been applied. After waiting for her to figure it out for approximately 15 minutes, I asked another associate to please help her so that we could bring this to resolution and leave. Additional training is needed for the front desk staff. The room refrigerator was not operational. They had an great outdoor area for the kids where they showed a movie and passed out popcorn. The only drawback was is that there was not enough popcorn for about 50% of the kids so it created a lot of disappointment. The pool staff was indifferent to how this made the kids feel--poor guest service. The hotel had plenty of restaurant choices, and the rooms were clean and comfortable. The lazy river was a hit with the kids although the charge to rent a tube isn't necessary. Just let the guests use them with a deposit for non -return, no need to nickle and dime the guests of this lovely hotel. The business center staff (only 1 person on) was overwhelmed and needs additional customer service training on how to speak to guests-- Food was good~ room service was outstanding. The server we had come to the room 'gets it' ! He was extremely professional and made the kids feel special. He made sure all our dining needs were met. Would go back but need to give hotel time to get their internal processes and guest service up to speed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but they nickel and dime you too much”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Fiend_007
Reviews.Content: The Good: Beautiful hotel, very clean and it is a resort, so they have plenty to do in the area. Nice bar downstairs and the Italian restaurant was great. The Bad: Bizarre thing to complain about, but the shower is terrible. The shower head does not allow enough water to come out and the water just trickles out. Also, my wife said there is no bench to make shaving even remotely possible. My gripe was that the place is SO big, there does not seem to be any organization to the lobby. We had to wait 10-15 minutes to check-in and check-out at the front desk. The Ugly: How can this place actually charge for internet? This is not 1998! I didn't pay full retail price for this place, but come on. Who is their right mind thinks this is a good idea? Also, $5 for an inner-tube for the lazy river? And the worst. $15 a night for parking. The verdict: Too many nice places in Orlando to stay at to ever have to take this type of abuse from a hotel chain. Very beautiful place, but not worth all of the extra add-ons.

Reviews.Title: “OPENING NIGHT ZETA LOUNGE - 5 STAR”
Reviews.Author: BigWhale
Reviews.Content: It was a great evening, wonderful atmosphere, terrific drinks/Hors d Oeuvres & Music w Tammy G & Johnny Mag Sax....... we appreciate the invite & hospitality! Thanks Hilton & ZETA Lounge! Gary Mezo & Juliane Beck, Vizcaya/Dr. Phillips-ORLANDO Resdients

Reviews.Title: “Poor poor service”
Reviews.Author: youngworldtravelers
Reviews.Content: I've traveled a lot over the last few years and I have to say this hotel offered some of the worst customer service I have encountered, especially for a Hilton. Lets start with the good aspects of the hotel - its absolutely beautiful, the rooms are spacious, very clean, the staff is friendly, the conference rooms are stunning and the pool is by far the best feature. The pool offers two hot tubs, a lazy river and even a slide for the kids. Now for the bad part - I mentioned the staff is very friendly but its also important for the staff to get certain things accomplished. For example, we had some food that needed to be refrigerated so we ordered a fridge up to our room. We waited for about 5 hours and were told repeated amount of times that it was on its way. Well the fridge never came and we found out we were 12th on the list to receive a fridge. It would be nice to know that ahead of time so we could make other arrangements! Transportation & restaurants - since we worked late on night we thought it would be a good idea to stay in the hotel for dinner, unfortunately the wait to get seated was two hours. A little frustrated we decided to ask the concierge what our options for dinner were - we waited for a good 5 minutes before she acknowledge us only to find out that she didn't know much about the area. She suggested downtown Disney but couldn't made any of the restaurants. We decided to give it a shot but we had issues with the transportation because we didn't have a car on the property. She suggested we take the town car into Disney and call the number of the hotel after dinner to arrange pickup. Well than we waited another 30 min for a town car to show up. After dinner we called the number provided only to find out it was a wrong number, we called the hotel, they told us the town cars are privately run and won't be able to pick us up for another 30-1 hour. (We were told it would take 10 min) I could go on and on about this but basically the information we were given was very poor, total miscommunication on the hotels part. The last part (and I can't even believe I am frustrated about this but I think it was just topping on the cake) I decided to put "do not disturb" on my door because I didn't want my room cleaned. I left a lot of personal items out and since we were only staying there two nights I didn't need the room service. I came back from my all day conference to find my room cleaned and my personal items organized. If I would have known or wanted my room cleaned I would have said so and put away all my valuables. Overall, the hotel is expensive and the service that was provided was very poor. I would not recommend this hotel. Yes, its beautiful but not worth it. Like I said the staff was very friendly but the miscommunication issues were very frustrating. The bottom line is that this hotel is a Hilton and there is a certain standard that needs to be kept - this one failed on the service aspect.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel as long as you know the charges”
Reviews.Author: Tripper786
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 2 weeks. Got a great deal with Alpharooms and we were delighted with the hotel. Paid for room only so costs which we were aware of up front include $20 per adult for buffet breakfast, but 2 kids under 12 eat free with each paying adult. Self Parking was only 2 min walk away at $14 per day. In total it worked out Â£100 a night including breakfast and parking. Rooms were large with 2 queen beds easily accomodating 2 adults and 2 kids. Hotel is only 6 months old so everything is brand new. Shuttle service was efficient with 2 buses an hour to Magic Kingdom. The shuttle also services the other Disney Parks but not Universal. It does not cover the water parks so we took the car. The hotel can get busy and people arriving after 9.30 had to wait an hour for breakfast. Best to get up and go put your name down on the breakfast queue. You can then come back later. Probably best to grab a sunlounger early as there aren't enough umbrellas. Couldn't understand why they didn't have enough umbrellas as they haven't spared any expense elsewhere in this hotel. The gym was more than adequate with plent of CV equipment. Swimming Pool was ok with a lazy river around the outside and a slide for kids. They charge $5 a day to hire an inflatable ring. If you want you can buy a ring from one of the gift stores for $5. Drinks, lunch and dinner is pricey at the hotel but there are plenty of options to eat out if you have a car. The hotel is located close to all the Disney parks. If you go prepared this is great hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “7 STAR HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: jersy64
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the most luxiorious hotel i've ever been to ,fantastic hotel with great shuttle service to disney theme parks and downtown disney always on time and they even increased the no. of shuttles cause it was easter holidays,they gave us complimentry breakfast ,the room cleaness was very pleasent don't belive any poor or terrible reviews i recommmended to all people

Reviews.Title: “Going Back to Enjoy the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MTATL
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located in the Disney "city" despite not being a Disney property. Great place to hangout on the days you're taking a break from the theme parks. Food is a little pricey, but under 12's eat free. Also, provides access to restaurants at Waldorf Astoria next door.

Reviews.Title: “Bonnet Creek Water Slide”
Reviews.Author: babyelf
Reviews.Content: Beware....the waterslide has a minimum height of 47". My daughter was ONE inch short and they would not allow her access. Didn't see this height requirement in any of their advertising. My 15 year old opted not to use the slide because she felt guilty that my 5 year old couldn't use it. And there it was all weekend and we had to keep saying "Sorry" to our 5 year old. Otherwise, great hotel. Hard to find, hotel address did not appear on our navigation system

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay if Mickey Mouse Creeps You Out”
Reviews.Author: traveltycoon82
Reviews.Content: I've been to Orlando several times for business, and with my family and friends. Now, if you're like me, and hearing Mickey Mouse's voice on the buses and in the stores really makes your skin crawl, then staying at the Hilton Bonnet Creek is a great alternative to staying on Disney property. The location is great, because you feel like you're on Disney property, but you're not actually part of it. The only thing that gives that away are the shuttles - they are timed, and not official Disney shuttles, which as I mentioned earlier - I can really do without. My stay was part business, and part vacation, so in terms of business and leisure hotel, this property is great. The room was large and comfortable, and they had a great deal for in room internet (3 days at $19.99), which I think any business traveler can appreciate. You also had a choice of wireless or plugging in the ethernet cable like the old days. While, I did not have a view of the property or Disney, I was very comfortable, and ordered room service two nights while I stayed in my room to work. The food was exceptional, and the room service staff was helpful and friendly. I also made it to the gym on property two of the 3 nights I stayed there, and found the gym very adequate, and enjoyable since it was very sunny, and all of the equipment was brand new. There is also a running trail that i took advantage of one evening that takes you around to their sister property, The Waldorf Astoria. Unfortunately, I didn't get any time by the pool, but I could see that everyone was enjoying themselves either in the lazy river, or at the pool bar. All of the kids seemed like they enjoyed themselves as well. The weather was amazing the week I was there, so overall this Orlando experience was top notch. The only drawback I had was with the valet parking. It was $21 dollars a day, and it was $14 for self park. The self parking area was nowhere to be found, so you really didn't want to self park - some signage would have been nice giving guests an option. The parking staff seemed inconsistent, and it took over 10 minutes to bring my car around on a few occasions. I also saw a few people arguing with the valet staff two out of the three days, because they were not aware of the price difference for valet parking. They should really have some signage, or require the parking agents to hand each guest a piece of paper that they can initial, so that they know exactly what the difference is. I would stay at this property again. I would also recommend it to people who don't really want all of the Disney "brainwashing" for their entire stay. Keep in mind that Universal is a great time, and there are other attractions to be seen in Orlando for kids and adults alike.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL, CLEAN, BUT OFF THE BEATEN PATH”
Reviews.Author: SHADYBURGER
Reviews.Content: The architecture and decor are beautiful! All of the ammenities are easily accessed. Front desk, concierge, valet, and housekeeping services were outstanding. They've really outdone themselves with the swimming pool area. My kids had a blast. The room was big and charmingly decorated. COMPLAINTS: -They wanted a $700 ADDITIONAL ($100 PER DAY, 7 DAY STAY) deposit for room charges that we MIGHT make! THAT WAS ABSURD TO ME! -Because the hotel is somewhat off the beaten path, they take advantage and all restraunt charges are OUTRAGEOUS! (an order of nachos, and 2 kids meals at the pool bar was $40, plus tip) -Pool bar service is terrible. It takes forever to get service, then takes forever to get the food you did finally order. -Not enough seating available at the pool area. I witnessed several arguments between other guests ( we weren't involved ) over pool/lounge chairs. Overall, we had a great stay, and shuttle service to the Disney parks was a fantastic service. Next time, we'll bring our own groceries.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic resort”
Reviews.Author: honest36
Reviews.Content: This is a great mid price hotel in a fantastic location, no more than a 10 min drive to any of the Disney World parks and downtown Disney. Whole hotel is shiny and new, lovely staff, great pool and a lovely atmosphere all round! I never do reviews but had such difficulty choosing a hotel that i felt obliged to write one on this hotel.....it is a great all rounder and don't hesitate to book it !

Reviews.Title: “Such a great find in Walt Disney World”
Reviews.Author: lilitrav88
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for six nights over Spring Break and enjoyed every minute of it. The front desk staff and concierge were super friendly and helpful from the moment we checked in until the moment we left. The kids LOVED the pool with water slide and lazy river, and asked every night after we got back from the parks to go swimming. We at both breakfast and dinner at The Harvest Bistro. It had great selection and delicous food, plus it was a good value since the kids ate free. The rooms were very nice and comfortable. We relied on the hotel shuttle service to get us to and from the parks. It was very reliable and the drivers were quite courteous and professional. If you only plan on visiting Disney parks, you REALLY do not need a car. Trust me, once you arrive at the hotel, you will not want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT !!!”
Reviews.Author: nadda114
Reviews.Content: - Great family hotel - located INSIDE Disney - free shuttles to all parks, staff was very nice helping with the buses and schedules . free coffee and drinks while you wait!! - rooms are new and very clean - 2 big pools connected to lazy rivers, pools are not deep 3 1/2ft - kiddie pool - parking $13 a day - staff was great, very helpful at all times - kids eat free at thier buffets - connect to the waldorf,, beautiful - great resturants if you like fine dinning ( la luce , bull and bear steak house) - nice gym _ very pleased , would stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “First Class all the way!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaFitnessPro
Reviews.Content: The hotel was spacious, close to all the amenities the theme parks had to offer, yet a beautiful oasis amidst all the hustle and bustle of the area. The restaurants were fabulous, the staff impeccable and I must say the beds were so comfortable, I had some of the best sleep in ages! The huge pool had a beautiful lazy river and the children and parents alike were having a ball.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Downtown Disney”
Reviews.Author: ratnrol
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton for two nights. - Check-in was fast and efficient. - Self parking was convenient - Rooms were good size. We had two queen beds - Pool was closed the night we were going to go in for private function. They did shuttle us to the Waldorf to use their pool. - Food was overpriced. Due to this we chose to eat off-site. - A Coach bus would drive and pick-up from Downtown Disney and all Disney parks. This was great! Only negative of our entire stay was when we used an outside laundry service recommended by the hotel. Once of our coloured hoodies came back with bleach in two places on one of the sleeves. It is quite noticeable. When my wife called "She Loves To Do Laundry" from the concierge the person who answered was extremely unprofessional and rude. Based on our experience, we would never use this company again.

Reviews.Title: “Five star property with one star service”
Reviews.Author: castmember
Reviews.Content: First of all ... location, location, location. Smack in the middle of the Disney resort without all of the Disney commotion. Great spot. (Not the most convenient bus schedule to the parks though. I would suggest you just drive yourself.) The property itself was gorgeous, exactly what you would expect from a brand new Hilton. Lovely lobby, comfortable bar area, fantastic outdoor seating overlooking the pool. Loved the multi-era pop music that was always playing in the background. Really nice atmosphere. The pool is perfect for families with kids of all ages. Nice kiddie pool, huge zero depth entry pool and a great lazy river with fun water spouts all around. Plenty of chairs and a fantastic one hour only hold policy on pool chairs. The room was fine. The mini fridge froze all of the food and drinks, but we didn't bother to ask for a new one (there was no adjustment dial). I can only assume they would have fixed it if we had asked. A small annoyance was the makeup/shaving mirror in the bathroom It was on the counter so you either had to hunch over it to use it or bring a chair in and sit at the counter. It should be on a shelf or mounted on the wall. Awesome view of the Disney parks, fireworks and sunset if you get a Disney view room. I loved the recycle bins everywhere, including in the rooms ... way to go Hilton! While the staff was very friendly it was painfully obvious this hotel is completely understaffed when it's at high occupancy. The service was really terrible. The first few days we were there it was quiet and service was just ok, but then the spring break crowd hit and service became non-existant. I won't go into every little detail, but I will say it really diminished what would have been a great stay. Getting drinks or food poolside was impossible. There was ONE server waiting on the entire pool area! And while he was friendly and doing his best to accommodate, he was clearly inexperienced and in way over his head. We ended up walking to the bar to order our own drinks and food. Not only didn't we feel pampered (as we were hoping), but we felt like we were at home. Annoying and disappointing. The wait for the (one) breakfast restaurant was up to an hour and forty five minutes by Sunday morning. There were empty tables all over, but no staff to re-set them. (Kudos to the kitchen staff though ... the buffet was always well-stocked and clean.) The lobby bar seemed to only have one server also and she REALLY didn't have any experience. She didn't know the wines or basic cocktails and got that deer in the headlights look when I asked her about the menu. I had to ask her back to the table three times before she got our (two drinks) order correct. The bartenders seemed to be very inexperienced also. I actually saw one of the bartenders pouring the wines together into one bottle to make more room on the shelf. So unprofessional. Another annoyance was the "nickel and diming". The parking rates were just ridiculous. I know this is becoming the norm at most hotels, but really ... we weren't in Manhattan. Also, five dollars a day per tube for the lazy river?? Is that really necessary? We requested a late check out and were quoted twenty five dollars an hour for it. All of the little charges just began to grate on my nerves. To end on a positive note I will say LaLuce was the best restaurant we went to the entire week. While the old Disney standards (California Grill, Citricos and The Flying Fish Cafe) were absolutely not as good as they used to be this place was perfection. Our server (Stephanie) tolerated and accomodated our two tired children with absolute professionalism. She was extremely knowledgeable about the menu and (the great)wine list. The food was outstanding!. Hands down the best restaurant we've been to, on vacation or otherwise, in a long time. I would recommend this hotel only in the off season and even then I would tell you not to expect great service.

Reviews.Title: “Very classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: msn58
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a short conference, at the height of spring-break season, which meant the hotel was very busy. In fact, at times it was a little crazy with kids and families everywhere. But I think that Hilton has done a good job creating this property as a mix of top-notch conference facilities with family vacation attractions. As noted by others, its location to Disney makes it easy for a family to stay here while mom or dad are attending a meeting. The hotel property is very nice, with an adjacent golf course and areas to get out and walk or run safely. The Hilton's pool is large and attractive, 3 separate swimming areas are all connected by a "river" that you can float down; there is actually a small current to propel you. It is busy and noisy though, at least in season. If you want a quieter experience, walk on over to the adjacent Waldorf property instead, where the pool area is slightly more formal, and more adult oriented. The service I encountered was all uniformly excellent. A short line at check-in was improved with the presence of a staff person greeting each guest and carrying on a short conversation while you waited -- nice touch. The rooms are somewhat small, particularly the bathroom, but offer standard amenities.
