The walk-in shower was very nice but a challenge to get into due to the tight fit between the shower door and toilet. My room on the 3rd floor didn't offer much for views, but was quiet except for hearing hallway conversations. Wireless internet was fast and reliable ($). Furnishings and work desk were comfortable. I ate most of my meals at conference functions, but did have dinner one night in the upscale Luce restaurant. I had a pizza from their brick oven that was excellent. Room service is available 24/7. In summary, this hotel provides an top notch though not luxury experience, ideally suited to families who want to combine business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: technologymom
Reviews.Content: This property has it all - great location, complimentary shuttle to Disney, fabulous grounds and twelve restaurants. What more can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “New Large Convention Hotel - Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: NewHampshireDad
Reviews.Content: This is a new, beautiful hotel designed around a very large convention center. The staff is very friendly and overall service was excellent. I was traveling on HHonors points so I did not mine all the extra fees. The room was clean but was on the small side. The pool is great for small children but for adults it is uncomfortable being only 3 ft deep. The lazy river was a hit with my 4.5 yr old. The water slide is nice as well but they have a very strict 48" height requirement. The location is great as you are close to Epcot and Downtown Disney. Previous reviews were correct. When larger conventions are taking place, you get lost in the crowd. We were there seven days and the place was completely different on the two days with no conventions.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent brand new resort with all the details”
Reviews.Author: chilty
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my husband while he was there on business. This resort is beautiful. They did a fantastic job with making the grounds look magnificent. All of the details were there, from the design of the bathroom, to the wonderful shower, to a nice tub... it was all there! The restaurants were lovely, the spa was fantastic- I really enjoyed myself. They did not skimp on the fitness center, either, it was well equipped and the water bottles at each machine was a nice touch. Loved it. We have stayed at the Waldorf in NYC, and didn't know what to expect here. Just beautiful! Only suggestion might be a coffee shop or some place you could grab a snack- without having to have a whole meal. Perhaps this is in the works, I don't know. Staff was wonderful as well. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Just About Cuts the Mustard”
Reviews.Author: Max Ray
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Bonnet Creek for five night whilst on business with colleagues. We were participating in a convention with over 800 delegates. The convention was held at the Conference Centre located between both the Hilton and the adjoining Waldorf Astoria. Firstly, I'd like to say that the location of the resort is fantastic. It is located with two miles of most Disney attractions; many of which could be viewed from my 15th floor hotel bedroom window. This is a real bonus if you're travelling with your family. The resort is brand spanking new and the outdoor pool looks good and well maintained. The rooms were modern and well equipped. There is no spa at the hotel (you'll need to walk to the Waldorf to indulge yourself) but the gym is well-equipped and modern. The outdoor "running track" is no more than a path that runs between this and the Waldorf. I found the neverending 'muzak' that is pumped through speakers along the path to be a little irritating. What is wrong with a little peace and quiet?! The golf course looks fantastic but I didn't get the opportunity to play it. There is adequate parking in the multi-storey facility adjacent to the hotel. Between the Hilton and the Waldorf there is a fine selection of restaurants and bars. The lobby bar at the Hilton was where we congregated most. The Hilton Italian restaurant is very good, as was the 'Bull and Bear' in the Waldorf. Most, if not all, purchases can be charged back to your room from either hotel so it makes shopping and eating relatively painful. The only disappointing thing we found was the organisation at breakfast when there is a convention or conventions (as in our case) going on at the hotel. Breakfast is held in a restaurant on the Ground Floor and the choice of food is great. Service could be a little slow but the waiting times could be horrendous. I would suggest booking a table for breakfast if you find that there is a conference going on at the hotel during your stay. Many of my colleagues were not getting seated, due to the waiting times, until 0945-1000am! That is more than a little unacceptable. And that really sums up the hotel and its facilities. It's all very shiny and new, but it doesn't do anything particularly spectacularly. It does just enough, whilst the Walforf next door seems to add that little bit more glitz and style. Saying that though, the Hilton is better suited to families, not least for its great swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience, beautiful property!”
Reviews.Author: FLChick
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here over our anniversary for 2 nights and had a wonderful time! Check-in was a breeze and the rooms were lovely...clean, spacious, and just plain comfortable. The hotel grounds were beautiful and well maintained. The pool area was also a nice surprise with its slide and lazy river. We only wish that we'd had more time to enjoy them!! We dined at La Luce while we were there and thoroughly enjoyed our meal. I would recommend the mushroom and asparagus pasta dish hands down! Yum!! As others have mentioned, there is no wi-fi in the rooms and they do charge a $13 parking fee per day that your there for self-parking, but what can you do besides just pay it? I certainly wouldn't let that deter me from staying here again...the room was great, as was the staff. I will return again.

Reviews.Title: “An Absolute Gem”
Reviews.Author: richiej
Reviews.Content: What an immaculate hotel this is. Exudes class at every turn. Was upgraded at check-in and provided with free breakfast coupons using my HHonors card (worth applying for one folks just for these kind of perks when you travel). Despite it being a business-centric hotel, there were a number of conferences happening, it still retained the feel of a relaxed and leisurely easy-going place with many families with children there also. The shuttle service to the Disney Parks, though not as frequent as offered by some of the other hotels in the Disney area, is still way better because of the dedicated and extremely personable service of the drivers. My family loved the pool area - it's expansive, with lovely recliners and towels. The lazy river was a huge hit with young and old alike, and felt amazing to swim circuits with the current behind you. Go for a stroll or jog around the entire Hilton/Waldorf resort and golf course, very relaxing. Restaurants in the hotel(s) are a little on the pricey side, but food is good quality. A few moans on these reviews about the price of the breakfasts but for me, when comparing to other hotels we stayed at on this trip, were good value, especially considering the quality and choice of the buffet. Huge shout-out to the lads on concierge desk outside, they go out of their way to service and help you - we rented a car from Hertz in the hotel and this fella just sprinted down the street to the parking lot to bring it to the front door. Saw them do this all the time. Nice touch, rather than pass on the responsibility to someone else, they took care of it themselves. All-in-all a thoroughly enjoyable 3 nights there, would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A near perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: BoltonDan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our trip to Walt Disney World. The hotel is just a couple miles from the parks and runs a regular, convenient and very clean full size shuttle bus which made it easy. "Wow", was all we could say when we walked into this brand new (5 months at our stay) hotel. Especially when we were only paying $130/ night. I was worried the rate was too good to be true, but this hotel and its property is as nice as some $250 + hotels. Being new, needless to say, cleanliness was superb. Brand new carpet, brand new beds, brand new HD television in room, brand new pool-what else could you want? And staff was enthusiastic to please. I find it hard to describe how lovely the hotel and property were. Stunning. Any glossy web photos you see of it are 100% accurate. If here just for Disney, you do not need a rental car. If doing it again, I would skip the rental, taxi from the airport (or maybe the hotel has a shuttle-didn't check since we rented a car), and use the savings on car rental and the $13 hotel parking to eat at the hotel restaurants, which are very good, if a fair bit more than eating off site. And off-site is quite a distance, as there is really nothing between this hotel and Disney except other hotels, which was its' only downside, and I even hate to call it that. This hotel has a gorgeous, magazine-photo quality pool. This Hilton is also attached to the Waldorf Astoria by way of a conference centre, so taking an indoor stroll makes you feel like royalty as you walk past Barbara Barry inspired furniture and decor. The halls seem to go on for miles, so we never really felt the need to leave the property, except to get our money's worth from the car rental. In truth, as fun as Disney was, we couldn't wait to get back to this beautiful hotel at the end of the day. You must take your family here! A couple trendy lounges also make for a nice adult stay as well. If thinking of spending over $200 or more somewhere else, I really can't imagine doing as well as you could at this hotel, and for less money. I've stayed at Caesars Palace in Vegas, and this hotel and property had a similar feel of grandeur and scale, without the over-the-top opulence. We won't even look at another hotel if going back to Orlando again.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Find”
Reviews.Author: girlinpa78
Reviews.Content: I decided to take a long weekend vacation to Florida for some sun and some Spring Training baseball. I did the same thing last year, so I checked out last year's hotel and their current rates. While it wasn't bad, I figured that I'd look around and see if anything was new or if I could do any better for the money. After a brief search, I discovered the Hilton at Bonnet Creek. I liked the website, so I checked out the rates. I couldn't believe how reasonable they were. This hotel is very new and large, so I'm thinking that's why the rates are so good. Upon pulling up to valet, my family and I were promptly greeted. They had sufficient valet service at all times ($20 a day) and bellmen to help with the luggage. Upon entering the hotel, it was pleasant. There were kiosks to check yourself in or you could check in at the front desk. The hotel was extremely large, but the map given at check in helped. If you have trouble walking or children that don't enjoy walking, I'd suggest asking for a room close to the elevators. We requested a room on a high floor with a Disney view, which was nice. It overlooked the pool, golf course, and had a view of Disney. We could actually see the fireworks at night from our room. The only downside was that the room was far away from the elevators. The room itself was spotless. Everything looked fresh and new. The sheets were bright white. The beds were comfortable and new. The towels were also bright white and soft. There was plenty of lighting, etc. The restaurant choices in the hotel were interesting. The casual cafe was very good. It served breakfast and lunch. We ate the breakfast buffet ($20 per person). They had a nice assortment of food and made to order foods such as an omelet station and a waffle station. The Italian restaurant was opened for lunch and dinner. It always seemed crowded there, so I'd suggest making a reservation ahead of time. Personally, my family and I found it odd that such a large hotel would have such limited restaurant choices. The hotel suggests that you go next door (about a 1/2 mile away) and eat at one of the Waldorf's restaurants. None of us brought clothes that we felt were appropriate for the Waldorf. Plus, we didn't want to spend too much time eating at either hotel. While there was an in room dining menu, it was very limited. We noticed that some people ordered take out food and had it delivered to the lobby. While the hotel was located off the main path, it 's beautiful and peaceful. The pool was spectacular with the lazy river. It was enjoyable for adults as well as children. My family and I really enjoyed our stay. As long as you have a rental car, you can commute to almost any Disney attraction or local restaurant within about 5-10 miles. It was a great deal for the money. Check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Where you feel like a Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: TheGenoveses
Reviews.Content: View my photos (files too big to upload) here: http://www.flickr.com/photos/17571504@N00/sets/72157623432445107/ This is my second trip to Bonnet Creek. I had the pleasure of going there the second month it opened through priceline (name your own price). Most hotels treat you differently when you book with a third party, they did not here. All my requests were met with big smiles. That said, my second time around I decided to secure that I would stay at Bonnet Creek and booked directly with the hotel. We got the winter escape package that had free breakfast at Harvest Bistro. Seriously, it's soo good and we ate so much and stayed full all day! We didn't eat again until dinner time where we had apps and cocktails at the Peacock Lounge in neighboring hotel Waldorf Astoria. This looks like a great hotel and they even had cucumber water. Something that reminded me of our honeymoon to Jamaica. It was a very nice touch. The walks between the hotel can be inside or out. Since the weather was bad, we walked past giant ballrooms and warm decor. This hotel is made for weddings and events too, but in between hotels so guests not involved will not be bothered. Our room was very comfortable with lots of space. Little fact, there is a table that rolls out from under your desk. We used this when we got room service and takeout. There is still no refrigerators, but being new I assume that they're probably still working on that. We didn't really miss it. The gem of this hotel is the pool which overlooks the beautiful golf course. Who needs a water park when you have a lazy river and slide?! I am 26, but played like I was 12!! It did rain the whole weekend except for Sunday (of course), but when I requested a late checkout so that we could use the pool the staff completely understood and let us. It was a perfect ending to our vacation and we will definitely come back again and again. Overall, Hilton Bonnet Creek is highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Now here is a find indeed in Disney...”
Reviews.Author: VisitedNewPlaces
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at Orlando hotels since Disney opened the Magic Kingdom in 1974. Prices have risen drastically since then at most on property resorts, sending us off the mainstream in efforts to keep visits affordable. Thus it was refreshing to find this new sparkling (and I mean brand spanking new) resort in Disney by Hilton at the Bonnet Creek area. Nestled near the Caribbean Beach and Typhoon Lagoon, it is a simple drive away from Downtown Disney or any theme park, or using the hotels free transportation. Everything about the property is new, and what a refreshing feeling that is. The room's beds are ultra comfortable, and room quiet to boot. The bathroom had a large stand up shower, and the large flat screen TV across from the bed was fantastic. Two downsides were A. the parking charge. Disney resorts do not, yet Hilton does, so figure that into the cost 'savings' of the room. B. Crowding at the breakfast restaurant. I had to wait about 15 - 20 minutes for a seat, and they were indeed moving tables. I had a free continental breakfast coupon, which the server saw and collected, however then attempted to charge me for a full breakfast anyways. It was corrected upon request, however a service recovery would be to skip the charge all together (about 6$ to upgrade from continental to hot brekkie). Summary - you cannot lose staying at this hilton at this time, but as with all disney resorts, watch your wallet as the cash leaves it easily :-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GuidoOswald
Reviews.Content: Nice Facilities / pool, friendly staff, pretty new. We stayed there for our Sales Kick-Off and had a good time. There is not much around, but the Hotel has enough to offer itself and is close to the theme parks. Recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent value, but only at less than advertised rates”
Reviews.Author: sorengo99
Reviews.Content: This brand-new property excels in most of the ways that you would expect from a just-opened 4* resort: large rooms, tasteful if not groundbreaking decor, excellent pools, fine dining, convenient shuttles to Disney, and a good fitness center. It falls short on the little things that turn an adequate stay into an above-average one. Others have commented on the nickel-and-diming, which only struck me as egregious when I paid $1/minute for brief internet access. The spa is in the adjoining Waldorf. While we rolled with its 5* prices, I think many guests would gag. The 24hr "snack bar" stocks only drinks and pastries, so if you get home late or want a midnight snack, you have no choice but to order room service. The bars close or stop serving food well before 12:00. Many reviewers have mentioned the surprising lack of a refrigerator, which means that you can't even plan ahead. My biggest thumbs down goes to the admittedly personable concierge. After a lengthy discussion of area restaurants, he assured us that Christini's was the place to go for a money-no-object meal. Shame on us for not checking here. If we had, we'd know that a)you shouldn't go to Christini's; and b)the business card he asked us to give to the maitre d' likely served no purpose other than to supplement the former's pay. I hate to make that accusation, but the service, food, and wine were all atrocious for the price. We later learned of several restaurants that are far, far superior. So why do I still rate it a 4/5? We paid $100/night via Priceline. At that rate, these faults are more than tolerable. In fact, it felt like a steal. But at $220+/night, man...I would not return for the night. Though I'd gladly go back to Bull & Bear.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel that could be better....”
Reviews.Author: frenchberry
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a 3 day stay here end Feb to visit the parks with our kids. Good location, but be aware you cannot walk anywhere, so unless you want to get back in the car after a busy day, you are kind of held hostage to the very expensive 2 restaurants. Harvesters was poor - expensive and lacklustre service. We did not try La Luce. Nice room, well decorated and comfortable but small bathroom that felt a bit low rent for this standard of hotel. No fridge - asked but did not get. Good TV. We got a 'non-view' room, but it was still pleasant enough - high up looking onto woods. Great pool area, and just about warm enough despite cool weather - lazy river a hit, but why charge 5$ to borrow a tube? (5$ to buy in a supermarket). 13$ parking charge was only mentioned to us at checkout, and seems like a bit of a money maker. Hotel decor a bit hit and miss, but generally good. Housekeeping excellent. Room service ridiculously expensive. Overall very good, but didn't quite hit the spot for us.

Reviews.Title: “Overall - Thumbs Up for Hilton Bonnet Creek”
Reviews.Author: G8RED
Reviews.Content: All the other reviews before mine do such a nice job of summing up the inns and outs of the hotel and service so instead of adding to that let me give you our personal perspective in comparison to staying at an actual Disney Hotel. Lets compare it to a stay at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. ..... On the night we were at the hotel it was REALLY cold and we decided to NOT use the bus service and go to a Disney Park. Now if we were at the Animal Kingdom Lodge there would of been a lot more things to do with the kids (animal viewing to structured kids activities at the hotel). We could of made it a cool experience for the kids even without leaving the hotel. At the Hilton we were really limited to the pool (it was heated on the Hilton side and the kids did go into it and liked it....I dont think the Animal Kingdom's pool is heated so give a check mark to the Hilton). If you look at the normal rates for a family of four then you can easily say that the Hilton can save your family some cash while still staying at a very nice and new hotel that happens to have transportation directly to the Disney Parks. Overall I would recommend this hotel and just wanted to add a note to tripadvisor readers in regards to kids and kid activities at the resort = comparison of Disney Hotels vs Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL AT DISNEY RESORT!!!”
Reviews.Author: Magdalenafe
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many disney's hotels, and this is just the best!! the rooms are wonderful, the service of every employe is excellent, my kids were fascinated with the pool and the slide and the lazy river!!! and THE breakfast was delicius!!! shuttles are an incredible service of the hotel they even have Disney movies!!, and kids eat free at the Harvest restaurant that is really cheep!! I couldnÂ´t believe that was a Hilton, the bonnet creek is best choise traveling with family in Orlando!!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend upgrade excellent”
Reviews.Author: jstravelers07
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over a very busy Presiden't Day weekend and the resort was apparantly booked to capacity. We were staying on Hilton Honors points and my husband is a Gold VIP member. We had a king bed room booked. Upon arrival we were told that the king beds were not available but they upgraded us to a suite to compensate. We were pleasantly suprised at our accomodations. Two rooms, two bathrooms, dining room table for 8, a living room, wet bar and study area and a view of Disney in which we watched the Illumination fireworks at Epcot from our window. Although we did have 2 queen beds, they were extraordinarily comfortable and we slept soundly. Only critique of these amazing accomodations were that there was NO refrigerator, not even in the wet bar area. A sink, two coffe makers, but no fridge. The pool looked amazing, but as the weather was in the 30's, we did not use it. The staff however did fold some towels in the shape of I LOVE YOU XOXO out on the lawn chairs on Valentines day and handed out individually wrapped heart shaped cookies in the lobby. Nice touch. Actually did not mind paying the fee for the parking garage. We expected it coming in, so were not suprised by it. However we did not like the fact that the parking garage was only accessible via an outside covered walkway. This made for a cold dash to the hotel with our suitcases. On our first night, instead of paying room service to deliver, we went to La Luce and tried to order our meal take out. They would only allow us to order pizza to go as they said that much of their food would not travel well and the presentation was important. We did order two personal sized pizzas and went to the coffee shop for a salad and two sodas. This cost us $70. We also ate breakfast in the Harvest Bistro on two occassions. The first was excellent. The second was not. After a 30 minute wait (we were told 10 min), there was a coffee pot at entrance, we asked to get a cup while we waited and were told that it was just for refills for people leaving the restaurant. A manager finally brought out 5 plastic cups for about 30 people in the lobby waiting to be seated. Upon being seated we ordered our drinks and went to the buffet for breakfast. Although our breakfast was complimentary with HHonors, we upgraded for $6 each to the full hot buffet. Of the four hot items on the buffet, three of them were empty, so after 15 more minutes the french toast was refilled. At this point there was a line waiting for it. (it was very good once we got it) But upon arrival back at the table, our waiter had still not brought us coffee. We were finished eating and paying the check when he brought out a carafe of coffee. This was a Sunday around 9:45am, so although a peak time for breakfast, the service could have been better. No excuses for a hotel of this caliber. Overall, we would return here and definitely bring our kids next time to try out that amazing looking lazy river.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Resort, but you'll need some ca$h!”
Reviews.Author: Tarsu
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at this Hilton Resort with my wife and 19 year old daughter. The hotel is very nice. This is a new hotel so I'm going to cut them a little slack on a few things. THINGS WE REALLY LIKED ABOUT THIS HOTEL: There are two elevator bays; one bay for lower floors and one bay for upper floors. We stayed on the 14th floor and never had to stop for the lower rooms on the way down, which is really smart of some engineer/designer. GOOD JOB HILTON! The rooms are comfortable, and so are the beds. The showers are nice with Kohler fixtures which gives a nice gentle shower. Our room was correctly temperature controlled and has a safe in the nightstand (a must have). There is a coffee maker in the room, which is nice, but to be honest, the brand of coffee used does not make the best coffee I've ever had (or even close for that matter). Very nice wide-screen television. SECURITY: O.K. I'm a security professional so I may be a bit tougher than some in my review of this area. The clothed security members were a dark blazer and look very good. They were visibly present during the day and evening, although I did not see any security at 4:00 am on the day we left the hotel. I did see security in the hallway of the 14th floor on two occasions, which is very good because the hallways are long and there do not appear to be any type of video monitoring in these areas. Very nice pool area and two nice hot tubs. There is a snackbar at the poolside. The elevators go all the way to the pool and fitness club level so you don't have to walk through the lobby in your swimwear (nice planning). Nice large towels at the pool, and the chairs by the pool are very nice (yes, they are good for large people too!) The fitness club is nice with state of the art machines, towels, water, etc. My wife used the fitness club and enjoyed it. THINGS WE DID NOT LIKE ABOUT THIS HOTEL: THE BIGGER AREA OF SECURITY CONCERNS FOR ANYBODY STAYING AT THIS HOTEL IS THE PARKING GARAGE/RAMP. OTHER THAN THE CAMERAS WHICH ARE AT THE VEHICLE ENTRY, THERE DO NOT APPEAR TO BE ANY CAMERAS IN THE PARKING GARAGE. WE NEVER SAW ANY SECURITY PEOPLE IN THIS AREA. I WOULD RECOMMEND USING THE HOTEL VALET SERVICE IF YOU ARE TRAVELING ALONE. The Hilton security staff need to improve on this area of this fine hotel. The parking garage gates did not always work with our room key/card. There was a button on the key box that we pushed and we were immediately assisted via speakerphone. Parking will cost you $13.00 per day plus tax, which totals $13.85/day. This charge is in addition to your room charge. The hotel will sell you a USA TODAY newspaper for $.75/day. The hotel will automatically deliver this to your door and charge you for it unless you call and cancel the paper delivery. The prices for food are crazy unreasonable. Want room service for breakfast? Here's what you'll pay: Continental Breakfast - $ 19.00 + 22% Gratuity and service charge +State & Local tax + $3.00 in-room dining charge. 2 eggs, bacon, ham & potatoes - $ 17.00 + 22% Gratuity and service charge +State & Local tax + $3.00 in-room dining charge. O.J., Granola-yogurt parfait, raisin bran muffin, coffee or tea - $ 18.00 + 22% Gratuity and service charge +State & Local tax + $3.00 in-room dining charge. Coffee - $ 6.00 + 22% Gratuity and service charge +State & Local tax + $3.00 in-room dining charge. Juice - $ 5.00 + 22% Gratuity and service charge +State & Local tax + $3.00 in-room dining charge. If my employee came back with a receipt like this I'd fire him/her for stupidity! The lobby area is dimly lit at night. Too dim. Free WIFI in the lobby area of the hotel, otherwise you'll pay for the service in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Very Good”
Reviews.Author: HabsFan21
Reviews.Content: If you are using a Garmin gps to find this hotel, enter Chelonia Pwky. The Hilton is new might not come up on your gps. Hotel is very new. Incredible heated pools and lazy river. Great parking. Don't pay extra for the "Disneyview" if you are looking to see fireworks. You can't really see them from this hotel. Save your money. Staff were great! We would definitely go back. The best hotel fitness centre I've ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Found a great hotel really close to Disney, but just far enough away to be able to unwind!”
Reviews.Author: ToAndFroTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband, two sons (ages 15 and 8) and I stayed for 6 nights at this hotel and found it to be just right for us. We ate at some of the restaurants and spent time at the lobby bar. Our boys enjoyed swimming in the pool/lazy river. We parked in the adjacent garage which was convenient and used the complimentary bus service to the Disney parks. During our stay we found all of the hotel staff to be extremely accommodating and friendly. In the past we have stayed at many hotels on Disney property as well as nearby, but in the future we will only stay at the Bonnet Creek Hilton or neighboring Waldorf ASstoria when visiting the Disney area.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend, can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: TImetraveler20
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful Hilton. The staff is highy professional and provide great service. The facility is magnificent from start to finish Our conference setting was very comfortable. I would return to this hotel for business or family vacation. The grounds/ pool are exquisite and sparkle !

Reviews.Title: “Great stay over Christmas holidays”
Reviews.Author: margiemhu
Reviews.Content: My husband, 4 year son and I booked 4 nights over the Christmas holidays. We were very impressed with the hotel, in particular the beautiful pool area. Our room was clean and tastefully decorated - very comfortable. The shuttles to the parks were on time with frequent stops. We never had to wait more than 5 minutes. We did think the parking was high - I think it was $15 - but I guess the price is typical of WDW area hotels. We would stay again and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “OKAY STAY”
Reviews.Author: justadude1986
Reviews.Content: I travel frequent to Orlando (and other cities). The number one thing I make sure and do before I stay in a hotel is to do my research for value, amenities and past reviews. With that said... my stay at the new Hilton Bonnet Creek was not among my best experience with hotels. I've NEVER had a bad experience with any of my hotel stays anywhere (and I've been to plenty of places, especially in Orlando). I reserved and put a deposit down for a King Disney View room. Upon check in they did not have any Disney King Views open just a Queen Disney View and with little thought I agreed to it. I went into the room and shortly after realized that a queen bed is not what we wanted. We call guest services and requested another King room with a view of the golf course or conservation (we obviously booked a Disney view because we wanted a view of something nice vs. a parking lot). The guest services representative moved our room to a room with a view of a wall (top wall of their convention center) LITERALLY JUST A WALL. So I called again and kept my cool and requested another room with ample apologies we were promised a golf course view room and were put in a view of the front parking lot on the 4th floor. WOW! C'mon so we called again this time a bit angry and explained the situation and we were passed on to a manager who at first was defensive but later eased up to our concern. She had a bellman come to our room and move our stuff to the appropriate room and delivered our room keys. This room was a pool view (again not a golf course view as she even told us we would get) but their pool is pretty and is better than the previous failed attempts. By the way I was willing to pay for the view and even though about just having her transfer my reservation to the Waldorf next door if they messed up again. No call to follow up and make sure all was okay. So we took the room happily after a 2 hour mess of trying to get a room without the view of a wall. The amenities were nice. It was too cold for the pool but I bet if it were warmer out it would of been nice. The location is great. However, I would not stay again. It's sad to officially say I had my first horrible hotel experience at a hotel that I would of never guessed gave this kind of service. The rest of the stay was enjoyable and we enjoyed the room and such. Being in the customer service industry I think a simple follow up call and at least acting concerned would of made me feel better. I still rate it average because had we not had the mess I think it would of been decent.

Reviews.Title: “If you want Disney glitz and noise and crowds, this resort is NOT for you.”
Reviews.Author: Chugginaway
Reviews.Content: But if you are looking for a stunning resort where you can truly unwind at the end of a busy Orlando day, this is your Shangri La. It is located so close to Disney that you can easily take in all that Disney has to offer and then, when you've had your fill, leave it behind for contemporary elegance and serenity. We have never been disappointed with any of the hotel staff either (we have stayed there twice). They were all pleasant and efficient employees who appeared to be very well trained in the Hilton way of service. When a difficult request was made by us, there was a "Let me see what I can do." And, Voila, it was done! At this hotel, you are treated like a valued guest and not just a paying customer. BIG difference! I highly recommend the Hilton Bonnet Creek knowing that you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and beautiful hotel, pool and service!”
Reviews.Author: hunt2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed the second night the hotel was open for guests. The hotel is beautiful and the pool area is amazing! Our three kids loved the lazy river, zero entrance pool and the water slide! Cold towels offered to you at the pool, felt so refreshing! Customer service was wonderful! We are hoping to return for spring break! You can't beat this hotel for the price and so close to Disney!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Outstanding Pool.. $$$food.. Great Location to Disney Parks”
Reviews.Author: kdudeage
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of a great Bed & Breakfast room rate. Outstanding property. Given the new construction, the rooms were as expected: updated and comfortable. Great pool layout. I was disappointed that the pool was not heated (I know Florida!! but the Winter breezes are not very enjoyable. Proximity to the Disney parks is great. Buses run on a decent schedule. However, this is not a Disney property so don't expect every 15-20 minutes. Food is quite pricey and glad we had a B&B deal. I echo a couple other posts. Check your folio upon check-out as they did not comp. my breakfasts. Even after the correction, there was still an issue. Sad to see such incompetence at a nice property.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding time at the Hilton at Bonnet Creek!!”
Reviews.Author: Pumpkin57
Reviews.Content: I could not be more surprised at how fantastic this new property is! The staff is very well trained, the restaurant La Luce is delicious, and the amenities of the resort are hard to beat. I have stayed there twice in the last month and am very pleased with both stays. This property is changing how Hilton properties should look and feel. It is attached to a new Waldorf-Astoria, so all of the amenities are shared! They have a peaceful spa, luxurious pool cabanas, and a new Golf course right on site. It is notches above any hotel that I have stayed in in the Orlando area. This meets and beats expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the BEST! Better than all the rest...”
Reviews.Author: bush242
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the first week of January which is historically a quiet week. I am amazed at how nice this place is. The hotel is only 2 months old, and its grandness is incredible. I been to most hotels in Las Vegas, and I had never seen a lobby so grand as Hilton Bonnet Creek. The property at HBC is immaculate. The rooms are clean ((new) and has a great shower. We took a walk to the Waldorf-Astoria one nite and ate at the Bull & Bear. What an incredible experience. The Harvest was nice, and we would get scrmabled eggs to go. They made everything fresh to order. Nice staff. The HBC is about as good as it gets. I don't see how anyone can say anything negative. If they do, there is no hotel that will ever satify them. Please check out this hotel. The hilton bonnet creek is an experience.

Reviews.Title: “Forget everything that you expect from a Hilton property”
Reviews.Author: choosytraveler_10
Reviews.Content: I have traveled extensively for both business and pleasure, having stayed in countless Hilton Hotel properties. I expect a high quality experience and get it. This hotel sets a new standard for Hilton. From the moment you arrive, you know that this is not "your father's" Hilton. The lobby is spectacular but warm and inviting, which is unusual, to say the least. My room was stylish, contemporary and yet very, very comfortable. We dined at La Luce and the ambience, service and food were all exceptional at a reasonable price. Lastly, the location is incredible. In the middle of Walt Disney World but serene and unhurried . I felt like I was truly in a nature preserve.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Experience - Went for business - Plan to go back with family!”
Reviews.Author: BocaRatonSnob
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hilton Orlando Bonnet Creek. First thing to mention is its proximity to everything Disney. The main hotel road connects to Epcot drive, where if you go left you at one park go right you at another. Amazing location! The hotel was relaxing and had a very comfortable atmosphere. I was amazed at the personalized attention during my stay, no matter where we went in the hotel, I was greeted by a "hello" or "can I assist you. The service throughout the hotel was impeccable. The well appointed room was very spacious and had plenty desk and table space to spread out and get some work accomplished. Unfortunately, my view was of the hotel entrance. Next time I will ask for a view of the pool and golf course. The restaurant, La Luce, was a perfect dining experience after a long day. The food and service were excellent. My only complaint is the food could have had better presentation. The lobby bar was a great place to unwind. It was filled with guests and had just the right amount of energy. The bartenders had all of the patrons enjoying themselves...as I mentioned earlier, great service. Since I was there for business I didn't have a chance to visit the pool, however it looked very large. I'm sure my son and wife would have enjoyed the lazy river. I would definitely recommend this hotel and I'm sure I will be bringing my family next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for business and leisure travel”
Reviews.Author: jlm456
Reviews.Content: My associates and I had a great experience at the resort and conference center. The rooms were comfortable, well lit, and spacious. The bathroom had wonderful Crabtree & Evelyn products and great water pressure, even a magnifying mirror. The workout room and pool had everything you could desire, great cardio equipment and weights - and the lazy river and slide were a real hit with the kids. This hotel even had great food with good prices and a nice bar scene for networking with clients. The prices were reasonable considering its close proximity to Disney. Restaurant choices were numerous because of its distance to the attractions and Sand Lake Rd. Finally, the staff was great and the overall decor of the hotel was current and elegant.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Hyatt Grand Cypress”
Reviews.Author: ravinesmiddleburg
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations after reading the reviews on this hotel. While the rooms were comfortable they were not that elaborate. We could not get our in room coffee pot to work and when we went to the front desk to tell them about it they asked if we wanted a new one sent up. We never got one. Also, when I booked the room I really thought I was getting a room with a view and would be able to see the fireworks from Disney and or Epcot. The first night we kept looking out the window and did not see any. After inquiring at the front desk, they told me that there were no guarantees that we would be able to see the fireworks from the room that they chose to put us in. That must have been in fine print somewhere. I did not find the hotel staff to be very friendly. The breakfast buffet was okay but a little pricey. We only did that one morning. We looked around to see other tables had cofffe pots left on the table by the server, however we had to ask for more coffee from our server as she just poured our first cup and did not leave us a pot of coffee. For the money, next time I will stay at the Hyatt Grand Cypress as we have done many times in the past and were never disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “I haven't enjoyed a hotel room this much in years!”
Reviews.Author: LillMa
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two-night stay at Hilton Bonnet Creek. We booked the hotel using Travelocity, and to be honest, we booked it based on its location to the Disney resort and free transportation to the parks. But I cannot remember the last time I enjoyed a hotel so much for the hotel itself. We were on the 17th floor, and the room was wonderfully quiet, completely clean and tastefully decorated. We enjoyed it so much that we altered our plans and hung out at the hotel on our third day rather than visit Universal Studios.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest Hilton's in the US! I will go back.”
Reviews.Author: ElCache65
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate of $84.00, becasue we stayed on a Sunday evening. This Hotel is huge for Hilton standard's. To self park is $14.00 dollars (I thought is expensive), and valet is $20.00. Since Iam a gold member, I got the automatic upgrade with a Disney view, and also got the buffet breakfast for $6.00 each for my wife and myself. The pool area is amazing, and if you want to swim lap's you can go to the Waldrof Astoria, and it is not as crowded. There gym is one of the most complete I have seen for Hilton. Definitely I am going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jdunkie
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the new Hilton Bonnet Creek in Orlando over the Christmas holidays. The hotel had a great rate, friendly staff and the food in the restaurants was very good. The bus service (on the hour) to the Disney parks was very efficient and convenient. The room and decor was pleasing. The pool looked very inviting though it was too cool for swimming for us. The breakfast buffet was excellent. The lobby bar and grill was an excellent place to unwind. Our only downer was the expensive parking. We will stay at this property again if back in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Food and beverage prices out of line”
Reviews.Author: teacher015
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel and the staff treats all guests well. HOWEVER!, if you eat anything or drink anything at the hotel, you will feel as if you have been held up! $14.00 for a cheeseburger, 7.50 for a bottle of beer, 4.00 for a cup of coffee. Room taxes, parking charges, taxes on parking charges and the food an beverage overcharges ruin what could be a great resort. I loved the hotel but would never go back just because of the added costs to staying there.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust Family
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel is the best buy in town. It was upscale and absolutely beautiful. The pool is huge and has lots to do for young children including a gradual entry pool, lazy river, slide, etc.. In the Harvest Bistro, for every paying adult, two children eat for free. For dinner one night I had the Mexican Buffet, but I wouldn't get that again. It was very overpriced for average food. Other than that, everything else seemed perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a Disney Visit. Best breakfast buffet @ Harvest Bistro!”
Reviews.Author: dpndka
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Bonnet Creek Hilton for 3 nights in December. We selected this hotel due to its bus service to disney parks as we didn't want to rent a car. We had a disney view room with 2 queen beds. The room was spacious. very comfortable beds. nice plasma tv. a coffee maker but no fridge or microwave. The bathroom was very clean. Considering the hotel is only a few months old it was expected. We ate breakfast at the hotel's Harvest Bistro every morning. It was BEST breakfast buffet ever! We're a vegetarian family so they had alot of choices for us. Hot Oatmeal with toppings, fresh fruit, yogurt parfaits, mini smoothies, cheeses, breakfast breads, some other hot items such as breakfast burritos, potatoes etc. We had dinner only once and its was good. We also had room service one day and my kids loved the room service pizza. We also got some french fries which were certainly not the average fried potatoes. They were seasoned with rosemary. Delicious. Since our kids were with us we didn't venture into the more formal restaurants on property. The kids loved the pool. There is kiddie pool, a waterslide, lazy river and couple of hot tubs. we didn't use the the hot tubs but the kiddie pool and lazy river were nice. The bus service is very good, atleast for Magic Kingdom which is the only park we visited. Its a "luxury" bus with plush seats. Very comfortable ride. The bus runs are scheduled with last pickup being 50 mins after park closing. We took a taxi back to hotel on one night and it was $20 including tip. Overall it was a great stay. My kids loved the hotel. The lobby and outer areas are inviting. The staff always greeted us warmly and was generally appeared to eager to please. Actually, in comparison to our Oct 2008 stay at Disney's Grand Floridian, I felt we recieved better service at Hilton BC. Even my kids commented on that. Also, they liked the pool better. So we will definitely return for our next disney trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but poor management”
Reviews.Author: Prasad_Atlantis
Reviews.Content: Dont believe if they say you can see the Disney Fireworks.... If you are on Bed & Breakfast check/recheck/recheck/recheck your bill even after you settle everything with the Front Desk - it may still appear on your credit card statement. And guess what, its your responsibility to check and inform them if you want your money. I spoke to few of them only one was even willing to apologize for the issue.... Rest of them dont care..... I am really disappointed that such a reputed hotel has not got the trade procedures setup properly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, wonderful stay -- family vacation”
Reviews.Author: nytraveler45
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week's stay at the HBC. Me and my family were very pleased. We booked a King suite and a connecting room so we had plenty of space. the rooms were new, clean, nicely appointed, well maintained and serviced and cleaned daily in top fashion. Make no mistake, the quality of our room in particular made a big difference. The public areas of the hotel are grand yet warm. the pool is amazing for the kids and the restaurants are some of the finest we had during our visit (first as a family) to Orlando. Speaking of restaurants: "harvest" had a truly outstanding breakfast buffet with omlets made to order by an accomodating and well trained cook. Wait staff was friendly, attentive and cordial. Kids under 12 ate free and we simply loved the breakfasts there (good thing the gym was also good!). The Italian restaurant La Luce is exceptional on any scale: Food (selection and preparation): great. Decor: super: service: exceptional. We ate there two nights out of our seven. They have some of the best pizza we've eaten (from NYC or New Haven!). Even the BEECH (that's not a dog, BTW) had great food and service. Room service was terrific and everyone at the hotel was really helpful and friendly. I'm not usally so glowing abou hotels but someone has given this place a lot of thought and they have done an excellent job of giving good service at what was for us a very reasonable price.. Transportation to Disney: we dd not rent a car and were fine. The shuttle service is very well managed. I was amazed that they were able to serve this hotel and the Waldorf with one bus but they do (again: good planning was evident here). On one occasio we found ourselves at Disney's Boardwalk for dinnerand had to take a taxi back to the hotel -- it was only $9.00 plus a tip. Negatives: there are no 'extra hours' for disney but perhaps Iwasn't paying attention. All in all: great hotel. don't hesitate if you're getting a suite.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: endicott1
Reviews.Content: Loved this new hotel. At first I wasn't sure about it because of some of the reviews, but we really had no complaints. The hotel is beautiful, with a breath-taking shared pool with the Waldorf. The room was spacious with updated amenties. The only improvement I would recommend is to add the refrigerators. The rooms have a space for one, but there wasn't one there. We would have liked to keep our beverages cool during our stay. The location is convenient to the Airport, shopping and all of the Disney Parks. I've come to expect outrageous fees for parking/valet when travelling, so while I wish it were cheaper, it wasn't a deal-breaker for us. The staff was friendly and helpful and even though the hotel appeared to be very busy, all of our requests were accomodated quickly. We will definitely stay again as long as they maintain the hotel and the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Convention Hotel and NEW as of October 2009”
Reviews.Author: ImN2Fun2
Reviews.Content: While it might be a tad bit difficult to find because the address isn't in a GPS yet, The Bonnet Creek HIlton is a wonderful NEW Convention Hotel (Opened Oct 2009). Attached to a Waldorf Astoria, the Bonnet Creek Hilton is brand spanking new. The room doors keep noise to a minimum in the halls and are the heaviest doors I have ever experienced at a Hilton hotel. I understand there are about 1000 rooms & suites in the hotel. This is a very nice Hilton. Bonnet Creek has a very open and inviting lobby. While it is a convention hotel, I was not there for a convention so I can write about the hotel as a private guest who experienced the hotel and yet got to see others holding their convention there. The concierce is located right in the heart of the lobby as is one of the hotel bars. This HIlton has an amazing pool area which looks like a winding lazy river complete with waterfalls and water tubes for the kids. It is a zero entry type pool complete with inner tubes should you want to float on one. A hot tub also is onsite in the expansive pool area. This is sunbathers heaven in season I imagine. There is also a very nice work out area and a pricey spa. Bonnet Creek also has a most intriguing series of restaraunts. The Italian restaraunt La Luce is amazingly good and features world class chef Donna Scala. In total, there are 12 restaraunts and bars. Self Parking is about $14 with valet being $20. You will pay for Internet in your room If a convention bring you to this hotel, note there is a indoor and outdoor supervised Kid's Club on site to keep the little ones entertained. Epcot is the closest park at about 1/2 mile away but this hotel is really kind of in it's own area. Being the newest hotel, it is in the best shape of the other hotels near by (Doubletree, Hilton Orlando). You can't go wrong staying at this hotel or holding a convention at it which is clearly the hotel's primary design and mission.

Reviews.Title: “Great time, great pool”
Reviews.Author: maggioml
Reviews.Content: I just finished up a stay here before Christmas on a very good Visa signature rate. I thought the pool was fantastic and as a diamond I received a slight upgrade to a Disney view room. Although I had arranged for a crib at check-in, when I got back from the parks very late at night, the crib was still not there. A phonecall resolved the situation, but the operator followed up 30 minutes afterward after we had all fallen asleep to see if it had been resolved. Not something to do at almost midnight with little kids. We all got up late the next day and was kinda bummed about the 11am checkout time. I explained the situation from the previous night to the desk and they agreed to let me stay until 1pm. This is really a beautiful hotel with nice rooms, bedding, and bathrooms. I never ventured over to the Waldorf as I thought the hilton had everything we needed. The breakfast buffett was great as we upgraded to the full hot buffett. The shuttles run every 30 minutes or so from the hotel, but it is very confusing on the schedule on when they pickup from the parks. It all depends on the park's normal closing time. Overall I would stay here again as the rate was good and the pool was nice, but I might be concerned in the summer with there not being many places for shade around the pool.

Reviews.Title: “not perfect but i was still pretty satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: cpapa84
Reviews.Content: First, I should note that I got a fabulous rate through Travelzoo (I think it was $99/night). For $99/night, this place is fantastic. The hotel is obviously brand new and very modern, a huge variety of restaurants (with good food) and a great pool area. The rooms were nicely decorated and we had a fantastic view of Disney - we could see the fireworks at night. The gym was also excellent. I also liked how it was on Disney property- I didn't really realize that before we stayed here- they had a free shuttle to the parks and it was an easy $8 cab ride when we grabbed a cab back after a late movie in Downtown Disney. You also get to use all of the Waldorf's amenities - for me, this was the big draw - but honestly, once I got here, I was very happy with the Hilton's amenities and only wandered over to the Waldorf once. I can tell you that this is a MUCH MUCH MUCH nicer hotel than the other Hilton on Disney property. Not even comparable, really. The concierge was also really nice and helpful. The negatives: -Housekeeping staff was not great. They kept knocking lightly and then walking right in with their key cards. Once they came in while my mother was sleeping. Granted, we didn't have do not disturb signs on the door, but it would have been nice if they had made more of an effort to make sure no one was in the room before walking in, especially after it had already happened a few times. The really annoying part was when I felt like staying back at the hotel for the day to relax but wanted the room cleaned. After my mother had been barged in on two hours earlier, I called down to ask if they could come back to clean while I went out to the pool. The operator assured me they'd be right up. I came back after an hour and the room had not been touched. I had to call down again and go back down again for 45 minutes while they came back to clean. If the weather was better it would have been a non issue, but it wasn't a ton of fun to hang out at the pool in 60 degree weather. -My mother really wanted to know who the artist was who painted the paintings in the lobby. She asked the front desk staff on three different occasions and everyone kept passing the buck around and telling her to ask other people. It was kind of annoying. -Tried to eat lunch at the pool and tons of birds kept trying to eat my food. Not the hotel's fault, but it would have been nice for the server to give me a heads up before I ordered. I had to eventually abandon my lunch because it was so annoying. The server also got my order wrong twice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: brd9816
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel with very good interior and very friendly staff. There are a couple of minor glitches that makes it less than perfect. 1) Bathrooms are not as good as rest of the hotel - specially shower. they are not bad, just not up to the par w/ rest of facilities 2) Elevators are in one corner of the long building instead of being in center. Elevators took half of the fun out for us in staying here. our room was next to the Parking deck side of the long building. Elevators are on the other side.. so we needed to walk all the way to the other end of the building, get elevator, and than walk again to the other end once we get to the floor. also, the three parts of the building are not long straight, but a bit offset in the middle, so the walk gets confusing too! This isn't too bad unless you need to go in and often. If you don't mind taking stairs going down, the parking garage end has stairs which might make this a bit easier if no luggage. 3) Parking is 13 bucks per day. May be more during busy time?? Overall, I recommend it and will stay here again without any hesitation. Just make sure you ask for a room thats close to Elevator!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, clean, upscale”
Reviews.Author: sanibel61
Reviews.Content: As a Florida resident, we travel to Disney quite often. This is my new favorite non-Disney hotel. We stayed just one night, but would be happy to return for a longer trip. The hotel is very spacious, clean, and modern. It has an awesome pool and lazy river area plus hot tubs. We had a view of the golf course and could see the theme parks. One minus is that the parking is a bit far away in a garage and is $13 per day. They have a shuttle to the parks but we did not take it. The beds were soft and had crisp clean linens. The bathroom was roomy, new, and clean with very nice towels and a makeup mirror. The room had a flat-screen TV and plenty of drawers and a desk area. Our room was very quiet - made it easy to sleep in and not hear other guests getting ready.

HotelInfo.Name: Hilton Orlando Bonnet Creek
HotelInfo.Address: 14100 Bonnet Creek Resort Lane, Orlando, FL 32821
